He has the same passion behind the bar as a painter with a canvas, except his paint is liquor and his canvas, a glass.  With his jigger as a brush, he creates a drinkable Jackson Pollock

My steak was perfectly prepared and my time at the bar was most enjoyable.  It was a perfect finish to a long work week in Vegas.  I can't wait to go back.

Overall: A great place for steaks and a nice place to take someone special. 

Food: We had the king crab legs as a starter. It was OK. The crab legs were cut in half for you so it's easy to eat. The crabs were not as sweet this time. If seafood is your main course I would recommend Aquanox. 

We had the wagyu ribeye for our main. It came with roasted grape tomatoes and maitake mushrooms. The ribeye was delicious. Very high fat content so I would recommend cooking it medium. It helps the fat meld with the meat. 

For dessert we had the duck egg creme brle. It was decadent and not too sweet. 

Since it was a special birthday. The birthday girl received a complimentary mango sherbet with a lit candle and happy birthday written in chocolate. 

Service: The service was good. Mark, Tyke, and Dan took care of us while we were there. Dan also wished the birthday girl happy 21st. While it was her ninth 21st birthday. =)

I've been to Delmonico a couple times, and it has been good both times. 
Everything was pretty tasty, but I can't say there was anything in particular that wowed me. Actually, I take that back... there is a banana dessert that is absolutely spectacular. But that's not really enough to make me excited about returning here.
The service is consistently very good. I think I'm just not a fan of the decor and ambiance here. It's great for a business lunch, but I would never choose Delmonico for a romantic dinner or night out with friends. The interior is just really boring.

Food was excellent!  Obviously pricey, but I knew that in advance. 
Service was a little slow getting started, seemed like waitress had too many tables, but then got better. 
Loved everything.  Potato au gratin was a bit overly garlicky, and I love garlic.  I couldnt really eat them.
Had a fabulous Malbec, Loca Linda.  

no fears about going again!

This place is amazing!! This is our second time to visit Delmonico and we were equally as delighted as our first time. We really did it up...

For apps, we got the BBQ shrimp (awesome) and the oysters. Both are highly recommended.

My husband got the lobster bisque and I got the heirloom tomato salad.. the tomato salad was $18. Was that ridiculous? Yes. Was it worth it? Also yes. 

I got the filet medium done, and my husband got the bone-in rib eye medium rare. My steak was perfection.. my husbands was too medium.. The staff were quick to correct the error and apologetically brought him a new steak. Talk about wonderful service! 

We shared grits (so yummy and I am NOT a grits girl), and the asparagus. 

For dessert we sampled the banana cream pie.. like everything else we had, it was really special :)

Overall, this is a wonderful place to splurge! The service is accommodating and helpful.. the food is well worth the money, and the ambiance is great :)

In Vegas a few nights seeking a great steak dinner. The petit filet mignon was yummy! Also a great individual portion, anything else simply too large. Dinner rolls the best !! Also the truffle pasta appetizer is a must try! Waiters provided good service too.

Naomi and I went here on our date night.  

We shared a 16oz bone-in prime rib.  It was excellent, cooked to perfection. The steak is large enough for two.

We also had the Lobster Bisque and Traditional New Orleans Gumbo. We liked both, but my favorite was the gumbo. Naomi's favorite was the lobster bisque. Both were awesome and would order them again.

The Roasted Fingerling Potatoes and Whole Garlic with Fresh Herbs were good, but not memorable.

I didn't care for the Truffle Parmesan Potato Chips.

The atmosphere and service were both excellent.

We shall return!

Been here 4 times now. Was in the process of making this place one of those restaurants you gotta visit every time you come into town. Well, I don't feel that way so much any more after our last two visits
Service is outstanding.  No complaints when you're pampered.  But there are tons of staff which may explain the prices here. Looked to me like a 3 person team was assigned to 3 tables. Doesn't include the guy bringing the food or the floaters moving about 
The quality of the food is merely average. 3 of us went, total bill was $360, no drinks.  The BBQ salmon was good, but the overpowering BBQ sauce hid the salmon flavor. My better half had the rack of lamb which she sent back for more cooking because it was raw in the middle. It came back hotter but nearly as raw. She gave up 1/2 through because of all the fat and the rawness. I tried a rib and found it average.  Costco has rack of lamb. Not as meaty but more flavorful than Delmonico.  But that depends on the chef. I had the bone in rib eye, asked for it med rare but it was mostly raw. The tail end was all fat. The flavor was average. For me, part of the cooking process is to turn a steak into a masterpiece. It starts with a prime cut of beef. Apparently, they were out of prime quality steers. This steak had no marbling, just huge fatty areas and lots of tough connective tissue. The tenderness and the tastiness you find in the outer rim of a rib eye wasn't there.  I had to saw through every piece of this steak. Maybe I had a crappy knife.  We had the cream corn and smashed potatoes, both were average. 
Everything here I could have made at home with better quality and with way more flavor for 1/4 the price. So I'll leave with Foodie's Helpful hints:
Start with better quality ingredients. Learn what blue, rare, medium rare and so on are. Learn the point when to remove fish from the heat so it retains its natural flavors and moistness. Don't drown anything in sauce.  Spend some time in the kitchen outside working hours, experimenting, getting the broil and grill times right. Add alittle spice to the popovers might make them really stand out. Allow those steaks to sit outside the refrigerator to warm up before plopping them on a grill. It makes a huge difference  Add fresh corn to the creamed corn. Maybe that will add a little crunch instead of leaving a baby food texture. Liven up your tired old spuds. Liven up all your food.
Overall the food quality is 2 stars. The service adds another star.   From now on, we will come here only for the $12 slice of Banana Cream Pie, which is to die for unless the quality starts slipping.

Date: July 8, 2005
Location: The Venetian Resort Hotel & Casino, Las Vegas
Corkage: $25/bottle
Cost: $450 - party of four (including tax, tip & corkage)
Reservation: 702.414.3737
Website: www.emerils.com

To my surprise, got a last minute reservation through opentable.com just a couple of days before the trip to Vegas. So instead of Fleming's, Capital Grille, or BOA, the three other places I had thought about to kick off my friend's bachelor party weekend, this is where we end up for dinner on the Friday night.

The four of us arrived about 15 minutes early and were promptly seated, busy but not completely packed.

The service was above average, but not warm, mechanical is the best word to describe. I asked for the three bottles of wine I brought to be decanted, which was no problem at all. No Riedels, but nice enough stemware to pass.

We ordered an antipasto for the table to get started. I had the Classic Steak Tartare as the appetizer and had the dry-aged Bone In Rib Steak as the entree.

The Classic Steak Tartare is the best presentation of such I've seen. Tartare in the center with individual garnishes fanned out, completed with baguette toast points. Flavor was good, but missing the bam element I expected.

The Rib Steak I ordered was suppose to be medium-rare, but was closer to a medium, which was fine by me, as I tend to like it somewhere in between the two. Word of caution here, all four steaks we had at our table, the temperature were missed by close to one notch, rare = medium rare, medium-rare = medium...etc.
Good piece of raw material, but the kitchen failed to make it stand-out. Again, seasoning was lacking, salt and pepper can definitely be used more liberally.

Ordered three desserts to pass around the table to finish the dinner, nothing interesting here to write home about.

The total including tax, tip and corkage came out to be $450 for the four of us, not a bad price tag especially considering we are in Vegas.

With this outing, I think I am completely done with top name destination Vegas restaurants. Aureole, Bradley Ogden, 
Picasso and now this, none has given me a desire to visit for a second time.

I had better expectations for this place based on the reviews.  I ordered the bone in ribeye, which was touted as their "signature dish".  The meat was not well marbled and was quite gristly for the price.  The quality of meat was comparable to an Outback or Black Angus.

We had scheduled our wedding dinner reception here. The whole process with them seemed difficult from the start.  Eventually we needed to start our dinner 30 minutes later than we first anticipated. We knew this at least a month before the event, but they could not accommodate us and make the change, which seemed ridiculous ... a half hour later, come on?

We ended up having the dinner reception at Postrio instead. It couldn't have turned out better and they were very easy to work with. 

I've dined at both locations on separate occasions, and I have to say my food was better at Postrio both times.

I went to Vegas most recently having made reservations at Delmonico ahead of time.  This is my 6th Emeril restaurant to visit. The French style of serving is charming, as always, and the management at this location were eager to please.  We felt a bit rushed at the beginning when our salads arrived seemingly almost immediately after we ordered, but they slowed the pace at our request so that we could savor the experience.  Neither of us were disappointed in our food, and the dessert was quite good.  The barbeque shrimp, if you've never had it, is definitely worth ordering.  But nothing left us talking about it afterword...  
While Delmonico is not going to leave you hungry, it may not leave you marveling, either.

I could describe many above average facets of the meal I had at Delmonico, but the only one that really matters is that I walked out of this restaurant saying that this was the best steak I have ever had.

The Kansas City cut (bone-in NY Strip) here is just so unbelievably perfect.  It is seared on the outside with a beautiful medium rare on the inside.  The texture is perfect.  The juiciness of the meat is perfect.  The salty flavor addition from the bone is perfect.  And what really made it for me was the seasoning on the steak itself.  Every bite had a little peppery bite that was the perfect combination of dancing around the edges of your tongue without being overbearing.

Yes.  A confluence of the perfection of all the individual elements that matter yields the distinction of Best Steak I Have Ever Had.
Didn't eat.  Sat at bar and had wine.  Pretty reasonably priced considering it's vegas.  Wine by glass list well above average.  Very competent bartender.  Would return.

Yum.Yum.Yum

Came here 4th of July weekend to celebrate my gf bday.
We made reservations for a party of 8. However, we arrived an hour late but they still seated us immediately. Thumbs up.

I really wasn't paying attention to what everyone else was ordering so I'll just list what we got..

Crab Cakes
Rib Eye Steak 
Shrimp Fettucinni with Sausages
Steamed Broccoli ($10 for a small bowl.. I really wanted to go to the Frozen isle and buy one for $1.50) haha
Orange Zest Cheesecake (My Fav)

Everything came out to $180 but this included tax and gratuity.
The food was delicious, especially the steak. Not overcooked
or too much seasoning. It was just right.
For the pasta they serve large portions of the shrimp. Not the baby shrimp you have to go digging for.
Ah ha and the crab cake was very good! I don't deal with that imitation crab. Yuck! It was not a huge portion but enough to make me happy.
I heart the Cheesecake! It's a must! You can definately taste the Orange zest, which makes it original for your typical strawberry..etc..etc

The service was great. Why 4 stars instead of 5? Because they wouldn't allow us to sing Happy Birthday in the restaurant.
Geeze are there any exceptions?

Overall, I would highly recommend this place. Scrumdelumcious!

This is our 2nd time eating here and we simply love it. The food is delicate, the atmosphere is classy, and the service is excellent. They have a way of making you feel special. We ordered the summer trio that came with three courses. My husband had the NY strip steak cooked to perfection and I had the halibut. Our neighboring table ordered the seafood tower, which looked fabulous. Next time, I'll have the seafood tower for $130! It will be worth the experience.

Last time I ate at this fine establishment, I uttered the words, "This is the best meal of my life."  I got this Linguine with pesto, chicken and pine nuts (yes I know, I ordered pasta at a steakhouse), but it was well worth it!  Emeril knows what he's doing no matter what the dish you order.  

Their tartar is absolutely fantastic as well. 

Service is unlike nothing I've ever experienced.  Even though it's pricey and fancy, even if you can get here just once in your life, it's worth it!!!

PS - Good beers and wines!

One of my top 5 Steak house favorites in Las Vegas. The service is always great and the steaks are even better. I recommend getting the Rib Eye bone in if you can handle the incredible flavor of a Juicy aged steak. I like the steak so much I won't stop eating it until it's all gone. 

Save room for dessert or you'll miss out on something wonderful.

Not good for lunch.  Atmosphere is too austre and quiet-like trying to dine in church.  they dont even pipe any music in.  the lobster sliders were filled with about a tablespoon of lobster and at least that much mayonnaise.  Fries had been sitting too long and gotten hard.  Good service and good wine list but overall not worth the $70 pricetag for lunch.

Yum! I loved this place! Order the Louisiana version of the Lemon drop! That is really good! The food was great! The mashed potatoes were awesome and my steak was great. It didn't get cooked the way I asked for it to be but it was good nonetheless. Our server was great and because it was my birthday, she gave me a chocolate martini on the house that was so good!!! I would definitely go again!

Great service! The staff was professional, attentive, and friendly.  The popovers were very light and delicious. We ordered the wedge salad and lobster bisque as our appetizers. Both were delicious and we were really impressed with the bisque.

We ordered the bone in rib eye and lobster stuffed with crab. There was nothing impressive about these two dishes. My husband liked to lobster but said the crab mixture had too much mayo (?). My ribeye cut was too fatty and didn't need the butter. I felt like I was eating a rib eye from Paula Dean's kitchen. 

For, dessert, we ordered the macadamia nut bread pudding. Uh, meh, nothing spectacular.  The italian espresso was very good.

I'm giving this place four stars because the service was really good and I believe the dishes we choose weren't bad, they just didn't please our taste buds.  I would like to give this place another try.

My experience is from dining at the bar. I never discount the bar as an option for a wonderful evening. It honestly is the best way for a single diner or even two people to enjoy a nice evening without the pretense of an uppity experience.

My friend and I came to Delmonico, dressed in tank tops and jeans, so we found an open spot up front. The bartenders are friendly and just as polished as any server. The recommendations for red pairing with our bone in ribeye to the port at the end was perfection. We started our meal off with the steak tartare. It has to be the second best in the city. I wished they would use a quail egg to dress it instead of a chicken's. Moving on to our entree, we split the ribeye and it was more than enough for the both of us. Add a side of the haricot vert with sauteed shallots and it is the perfect meal. Being in an Emeril restaurant we we had to finish with one of his specialty desserts. I tend to not be a big pie fan, so we went with the bread pudding. It is decadent and comes in a generous portion. No one person should be able to polish one off on their own. 

This is one of those restaurants were I would not even bother with getting a table and would prefer to eat out at the bar.

Back to Delmonico three more times for great Louisiana Caviar atop sumptuous Deviled Eggs; light and airy Popovers; mellow Lobster Bisque; traditional black New Orleans Gumbo; fine French Onion Soup; Caesar Salad prepared tableside; buttery medium rare Creekstone Prime Grade Filet Mignon paired with perfectly seasoned Duck Fat Fingerling Potatoes; a nice mix of Garlic Sauteed Mushrooms; coffee prepared with Jamaican coffee beans; amazingly delicious Emeril's Banana Cream Pie with Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, and Whipped Cream; very memorable Pecan Pie with Oatmeal Shortbread Crust, Vanilla Ice Cream, and Caramel Sauce; and most recently for lunch during Restaurant Week a humongous 15-ounce Prime Grade medium rare Bacon Cheeseburger on a Sesame-Seeded Brioche Bun dressed with tomato slices, lettuce, White Onions, ketchup, and mayo topped by a juicy pickle segment accompanied by very tasty homemade lightly browned French Fries glistening with a sheen of Duck Fat.  

Once Diane did not receive her Maitre-D Butter, and her steak arrived with some char and pepper after her specific request not to.  But otherwise food preparation and service were impeccable and working in tandem like a well-oiled machine.  When an apparent miscommunication resulted in receipt of Sauteed Spinach instead of Creamed Spinach, a side of Creamed Spinach was voluntarily and quickly brought to the table as well, without charge.  Both dishes were outstanding.

Our Restaurant Week lunch culminated in a fine finish with a rich Banana Cream Pie Parfait with Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, Whipped Cream and Graham Crumbs for me; and traditional Bread Pudding with lip-smacking warm Caramel Pecan Sauce for Diane.  For us, based on past experiences, there is every reason to return again for more epicurean delights.

Great Steakhouse. I was delighted to come and try this place. I haven't heard too much about what the steak was like hear but I heard all good things about it. 

As we sat down we were great by two men who were going to be our servers and our waiters for the day. I ended up ordering a Bone In rib Steak. I think it was the most expensive steak on the menu. I wasn't too sure about the size but my friends that came before said that it was a good size and that some of them couldn't finish it. 

When I finally got the steak. It had a little piece of butter on the top and it looked good. I usually have my steak medium and it was perfect. I loved it. We also ordered some sides of grits, spinach and mushrooms. Those were ok to me. I loved the steak though. I wasn't able to eat the last 3 oz or so. I think it was well over 16 oz steak with the bone. I think everyone finished theirs except for me. I did notice that my friend said the my steak looked bigger. I couldn't complain at all. All in all we spend about $80 for dinner. I didn't order anything besides the steak and splitting the appetizers. 

It was well worth it. I have spent more at other places and not even felt like I was eating enough. This takes the cake. 

I liked how the servers were prompt with filling up my water and attentive to our needs. They would even fold your dinner napkin if you left the table. Awesome. I felt somewhat cramped on our circular table, but what do you expect from a large group of 9 guys.

Everything was delicious, and the service was exceptional! There were 3 waiters serving us all of whom were very nice. The food was exceptional we had the following items: BBQ Shrimp appetizer, Caesar Salad - prepared at your table, Seared Tenderloin & Sea Scallops with Bacon Potato, Toasted Walnuts and Blue Cheese and aged Beef Tenderloin. I like the ambiance of the place, classy but not stuffy.

I'll start this review off for you skimmers out there that don't read long reviews. The bone-in rib-eye is the greatest steak experience you will ever have, hands down. Just eat it. Go. Do it.

Now for you that are still with me, here's my full-on, cash money, baller review...for what it's worth:

Delmonico must have a good database manager behind the scenes, because it had been a long time since my last dinner there (prob 5-6 years), yet they immediately greeted me and remembered my patronage (2 visits prior).  What a great feeling (and rather impressive to my gf) that the host and hostess and wait-staff greet you like you're a goddamn king touring the countryside. 

This trip to Las Vegas was during a getaway weekend and to see long time friends, but we had a little dinner the night before some festivities for just us. I wanted to visit Delmonico again, because I had remembered such a positive experience with food and service the times before.

So we are greeted by the sommelier and our lead waiter, who throw out a few drinks and possible pairings, review the specials, roll over some changes in the menu (all from memory mind you). We knew we were eating steaks and heartier dishes, so we opted for a bottle of a good Sonoma Cab Sauv we recognized.  

The chef paid his compliments with an amuse bouche' of a olive oiled crustini with duck fat and a mushroom.  It was a delicious little oily, fatty, salty bite that told the taste buds "hey bitches...I'm comin' for you...get ready!"

We were treated to some hot brioche popovers and full-fat butter, and I had to oblige at least one...cannot say no...(it's completely un-American to pass up on such things).

We decided to start the evening by sharing an heirloom tomato and burrata cheese salad (faux caprese), and a table-side Lobster bisque. The salad was graciously split onto two plates for us, and was perfectly portioned with greens, veg, cheese, and a light dressing (that was not overpowering). The bisque was poured at our table with huge chunks of lobster, and a smooth velvet-like texture. Flavors were perfect and the temp was outstanding. I had mine and finished my gf's (she always worries about getting to full before the main meal comes).

I had ordered the bone-in rib-eye au poivre and my lady chose the Filet Medallions. I must impress upon you again that the Bone-in Rib-eye IS the way to go. It is perfectly broiled at high temp, with amazing peppercorn seasoning and having it with the mushrooms sauce and onions is the bomb-sauce. There is nothing like it. It is a HUGE cut of meat, with great crusting outside, perfect marbling, and the bone-in flavor. The hot-reddish/pink medium to medium-rare center makes for a tender, juicy, and magnificent steak.  I honestly didn't even partake of her medallions much, because I didn't need to, and wouldn't cheat on my rib-eye.  I let the lady try some of mine and she immediately agreed its the best steak, anywhere, ever. We had a side of asparagus as well, which I felt very bad for because I gave it very little love. I hate leaving soldiers on the battlefield but I wanted to win the war with that steak and had a long night ahead of me of shows and clubs and didn't want terrible meat sweats...so I had to be courteous of tummy room.

Now that we've effectively covered food, let me give a swag at the service. Top notch. All the way around. Polite, informed, friendly, attentive enough without being intrusive. Well-trained veteran folks throughout...no schmucks looking to hump tables as a side gig, these are true to form, real career servers who take pride in their appearance, their posture, plating, timing, knowledge, and truly love their career...these folks work years before graduating to a place like Delmonico or Craftsteak, etc. These guys get huge tips and get to work with fine chefs in multi-million dollar restaurants...they're the cream of the wait staff crop.

Total wine, apps, dinner (no dessert, saved room for later on) was what I expected at ~$300. Well worth it to treat ourselves and enjoy a top-notch meal.  

Look folks, even if you're not an Emeril fan (yes he owns the Delmonico name), you can still love this place. A) he's no longer the executive chef of either location, B) the experience is always good here and the place stands alone on its merits, and C) that damned rib-eye is scheduled for my last meal on planet Earth (someday). 

Trust me folks...when in Vegas...eat like a damned king. Treat yourself to amazing service, amazing food, and good times...ENJOY!!

Oh. My. God.

Took hubby here for our 1 yr. anniversary/my hubby's b-day.  I wasn't hungry (late lunch) so I had a (delicious) salad and wine, and he got a bourbon, the filet with creamed spinach and au gratin potatoes.  From the second we got there till we left they treated us like royaly.  Ross, the manager, came and chatted with us at our table, offering an appetizer on the house because of our big day.  They even plated my year-old wedding cake top tier, frozen for a year and in a bag for 6 hours on a plane from NY, and presented it to us with candles on a small table with plates and forks.  The filet, by the way, almost brought me to orgasm with a single bite.  Seriously.... no, seriously.  It was prob the best single bite of beef I've ever experienced.
What else.... the year-old cake was surprisingly good! (I baked it myself) :)
Of course it's a killer bill at meal's end ($135 for everything I mentioned above and nothing more) but worth every penny, y'all.
The first time I was here, the steak was great.  We came back today, and the steak was a bit overcooked thought it was still real good.  The garlic mushroom side order is a must.

On our stay at the Venetian, we decided to try this steak house one night.
I had the ribeye and my wife went for the filet mignon. Both steaks were absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection. The server was extremely knowledgeable about the menu .
For the desert we opted to share the bread pudding,and I have to say it is one of the best I have ever eaten.
Very good experience overall!

Wonderful experience! Classic service, friendly wait staff, perfectly mixed cocktails, and flavorful food. Our salads were absolutely perfect, the dressings on both were incredible. Our steaks were juicy and cooked to perfection - both of us got the rib-eye and all its flavorful goodness was all over the plate. I was however, surprised at the lack of ambiance in this place. It's got really nothing going for it but tables and good service and good food. I guess you don't need much more than that, but it's Vegas for goodness' sakes. Liven up the decor a bit! But go, please. You won't regret it.

To be honest it really quit aweful. First the host was uninviting. Sure not rude however I felt like I just walked into Denny's at 2:30 am for some pancakes. The wait staff was prompt however I would have rather been served by Denny's. They not nice and unattentive. They made us feel like it was best if we just hurried finished our meal. Of course we occommidated them becuase once started eating the food was certainly good quality but way over salted. It was very pasty. Odds are unless someone else insists I wont be visting again. Why when there are so many other great choices. One more thing. The restaurant really had no theme.  White walls coupled with the staff it felt like an expensive hospital cafeteria.

I love fine dining and this place exceeds expectations. Went for my birthday, the guest I had and I had the truffle potato chips, amazing. Could have ate like 5 orders of them they were so good. I ordered wagyu fillet. Best steak I have. Flavor amazing, melted in your mouth and was just insanely good. Guest got the strip I think...? Or ribeye haha don't remember but whatever it was it was great too. We had twice baked potatoes, great. And the duck egg crme brle, great except the sugar was a little too hard and tasted a little burnt in spots but that's the only complaint. The service was beyond amazing too. So attentive and very nice. Will be coming back here often

Steak Lover's motto: A steak cooked beyond medium rare is fit only for dogs.

Like many a Vegas Steakhouse, I feel like the excitement and constant crowds provide easy business to this high-end restaurant and that easy patronage has caused them to rest a little on their laurels. 

The service I received was adequate but not commensurate with the price level of this restaurant. The side dishes were very good. The steak was also very good, but at this price, it should have been exceptional. 

The ribeye was very tasty. It obviously came from a happy, well-fed and fatty bovine donor. The unusual cajun seasoned rub was also a unique and complimentary twist. It was cooked to the requested temperature (rare), and it tasted great. My beef with their beef is simple: it could have been served with a hotter searing, on a hotter plate, and in a larger portion size. For the price, I expect a larger steak than this, and for that reason, I would probably go to Mastro's next time. 

The meal was good enough that I would still go here again for another try if I get dragged along by other friends. We'll see how that goes. Till then, bon appetit!

-The Beef Baron

I had the pleasure of dining at this restaurant while I was visiting Vegas with my fiance. We were staying at the Venetian and this location is conveniently located within the beautiful hotel so it was an easy choice for dinner. It is definitely nice not having to step outside of the AC when the average temperature outside is 115! 

I got the caesar salad to start and filet mignon for the main dish. Some of the side items we got were spinach, asparagus, wild mushrooms, and creamed corn gratinee. The main dishes do not come with sides so they are extra but the portions are large enough to share. 

I asked for my filet mignon to be medium rare and it was done perfectly. The steak was so tender and delicious! It was definitely one of the best steaks I have had. The sides complimented the meat nicely and everything single one of them were delicious. I wish I could comment on their deserts but we were both so full by the end of the meal that we decided to skip desert. This restaurant is a must if you are in Vegas!
I got the filet mignon with seared foigras and it was phenomenal! The service as others have already mentioned was great as well. For dessert, i got the creme brle which was ok

I was very pleased with this restaurant.   
We were celebrating an anniversary and both maitre D and wait staff greeted us with "Happy Anniversary".
The restaurant itself was lovely, comfortable, and busy, but not noisy. We certainly had privacy at our table. 
The staff was helpful and considerate. The food was excellent and plentiful. Lots of variety and the staff was respectful of allergies/dietary restrictions. It was pricey, but we spent far less than we anticipated. 
My only regret is that we didn't have enough room for one of their fabulous desserts. 
I would not hesitate to dine there again.

We love Delmonico and eat here every time in Vegas. However, our meal was disappointing. The highlight of the meal was our appetizer & desert. We started with the truffle chips, which was a good portion. We both then ordered steaks, NY strip and bone in ribeye and shared the twice baked potato. My steak was over cooked, as I requested medium rare and it was over cooked.  We finished our meal with the pecan pie for desert. We will be probably be back, just hope for better next time.

Omg if you want a really big, soft, juicy steak seasoned and cooked perfectly you have got to come here! My gf and I both got what they are known for which is their bone in rib eye. Just a heads up though, only get this is you are starving because this piece of meat is HUGE! I swear it must've been a 12oz! I almost forgot to mention that we also had the lobster bisque and this was also delicious! Words cannot describe how good the food is here, even the service is awesome! If you are starving and craving for some really good food you HAVE to try this place! The only downfall is their chairs don't have wheels on them so you can't be rolled out!

We were told by colleagues this was the best steakhouse in Vegas and were looking forward to a great meal. Well, neither the meal not the service were particularly great.

First, even though we had a reservation, they had us wait for 20 min in the lounge. Fine, we had some drinks. My cosmopolitan was not impressive at all: I had two sips and didn't finish the rest. 

Then the food itself. Good news is, everything came very fast. Bad news is, it tasted OK but not great: steak was either too chewy or had too much spice (and we had the famed bone-in ribeye and a chateaubriand (spelling?)), truffled chips were fried very brown.

Tableware was uninspired, especially the tea cups got to me: I think I've seen better ones at a Motel 6 for breakfast.

Last, the service. Overall it was OK, but then, when I was in the middle of a story, the waiter comes to ask how we are doing and goes on for 10 minutes about this and that and how the convention is different this year, etc. Really? By the time he is done, nobody remembers what we were talking about, and I am MAD.

Find a better place to spend your money.

I've been here for a total of 3 times.. I think.. This was my FIRST ever formal ass restaurant.. 

My family and I got the special treatment, the taste test.. It was a 6 course meal and it was just too good. First they came out with the chips, something good to pick at until more food came out.. Soup, a refreshing trio platter that consist of fruit, crab meat, and a small salad. Then a piece of salmon topped with a thinly, crunchy slice of potato on top w/ veggies and a to die for sauce.. Then lamb with risotto. The risotto wasn't cooked to my liking but I was super full to even finish this..

I was finally excited for the dessert platter. It was a FULL plate of all the desserts they offered.. Pecan pie, bread pudding, a chocolate cake, cheesecake, and banana cake. My personal fave was their bread pudding and pecan pie.. Mmmmm

If my brother wasn't one of the chefs here we wouldve paid ridiculous amounts of money.. I havent been here in a hot sec and I really want to go back..

Very trendy and chic restaurant in the lovely Venetian hotel.. Service is  EXCEPTIONAL. If you have the money - its a MUST try and judge for yourself..

Food quality disappointing. Not the best steak in Vegas.

Three of us enjoyed two ribeyes ($52) and one filet ($46). Waiter told us their ribeye is the best steak in Vegas, but don't believe it. They were cooked correctly. The rub was rather bland and the crusting on the filet was hard. On a scale of one to ten, my ribeye overall was a 7. I've had 10's before in Vegas, so the competition is tough! But just claiming you have the best steak doesn't make it so.

The sides ($9 each) were disappointing. We ordered four. Creamed spinach, always a favorite of mine and recommended by the waiter, was just odd and bland - didn't taste interesting or flavorful at all. The best side was the asparagus, but honestly, how hard is it to steam asparagus?

Desert, as it often is at these kind of places where desert is an afterthought, was disappointing and ended the overall experience on a "blah" note.

Wine list was excellent.

With so many great places in Vegas, you can do much better. Everything else was top notch, but the food is the core of the experience and Delmonicos is just average, unfortunately.

While on an extended stay at the Palazzo we decided to try Delmonico. I made a reservation through Open Table. We were seated promptly but at a table that was less than desirable where the waiter had to stand behind me while serving us. He was quite pushy and brusque. My wife ordered the half duck as she loves duck. Right after we were served the waiter returned and asked if everything was OK, My wife had taken one bite from the duck leg and she said that things were OK. But as she continued to work on the rest of the duck it seemed to become very tough like it had been over microwaived. She signaled the waiter over and rather than handling it professionally he asked in a rather accusing manner why she had said the duck was OK when first asked. This made us feel very uncomfortable. The waiter did remove the duck and did not charge us for it. However, we just wanted some excellent food. I'll never return to any of Emeril's restaurants based on this encounter. If you want a good meal while at the Venetian / Palazzo go to Bouchon where you'll be treated well and the food is great. Just to be balanced I will say that the rib eye that I had was good.

Last year for my 21st birthday we went to Vegas and after hearing my boyfriend rave about this restraunt for two years, I knew I had to take him here! 
Oh he was so very right, it was AMAZING; definitely a well $200.00 spent! I would HIGHLY reccomend this restaurant.
PS: You have to try the calamari!

Had a business lunch here with a few folks - very important meeting and they took great care of us. Like most places in the big hotels on the Strip, the service was impeccable. I had the fried chicken and black eye peas, very tasty. Not sure I'd go here if it wasn't a business meal, but overall I was impressed.

This place is a solid four star restaurant.  The decor was modern and minimalist.  Our server helpful and attentive.  The food was great.  We started off with Emeril's cajun BBQ shrimp.  They were just enough to hold us over, a little overcooked, but seasoned to perfection.  My girlfriend had a fillet of halibut over a sweet potato risotto and I had the 22 oz bone in steak rib eye.  I had a taste of the sweet potato risotto, and I thought it was delicately sweet with an interesting flavor.  The halibut  was, well, halibut.  My steak, on the other hand, was a real treat.  The bone does weigh the steak down a bit, but it was still thick and juicy.  It also came with three dipping sauces, which were tasty, but also masked the flavor of the beef.  I'd say use them sparingly.  Another complaint about the actual bone was that it kept the steak from being cooked evenly, one side was noticeably bloodier than the other.  In all, our dinner came out to about $150.  I think for a hearty meal with clean presentation accompanied by wine, not a bad deal, but not a home run either.

Excellent dining experience!  The food was just wonderful as well as the service.
We ordered:
Shrimp cocktail 
Tuna and salmon tartare
French onion soup
Wilted spinach salad
Shared bone in rib eye
Twice baked potato
Mushrooms
Pecan pie
The standouts were the spinach salad the poached egg made is awesome and the tartare superb.  For the sides highly recommend the twice baked potato, so cheesy, yum! The crust on the pecan pie was so flaky and light and delicious, I would order it every time! 
The restaurant is beautiful and I would definitely return again.

I chose this restaurant to celebrate my birthday. The welcoming staff was very friendly and we were seated right away. Our wait staff was also friendly, but for some reason the warmth and good feeling I'm used to getting at steakhouses of this caliber was missing. Despite great reviews, I was moderately impressed. The wine list was extensive and had great choices. As an appetizer we were offered a mushroom dumpling that tasted fantastic. The downside was, it was a bit cold on the inside. The popovers also had lots of raving reviews but again, I wasn't impressed and they were also a bit cold. A tableside Caesar salad was our choice of vegetable. It was tasty, but about one notch above mediocre. We both ordered the filet mignon, medium rare, and were very happy with that cut. The flavor was spectacular and cooked to perfection. The grits with cheese and bacon, I was supremely unhappy with. My better half enjoyed them but I just did not care for the way they tasted. Too much like corn and they were not smooth at all. As a birthday treat, I was presented with a scoop of pumpkin ice cream that tasted very..... pumpkin-y. It wasn't bad but I couldn't finish it. The saving grace of the meal, besides the steak, was the caramel butter cake. Oh my word I couldn't eat it fast enough. I am not even a caramel fan but THAT was a warm and delicious dessert. I would return just for that alone. All in all, this wasn't a bad restaurant. It just doesn't creep to the top of the list of eateries I'd frequent if I'm searching out a steakhouse.

The food was very good here. Very-overpriced and the ambience left a little to be desired. We were seated and served promptly and professionally at this restaurant. However, there was a screaming child immediately next to us. This child was so loud the other diners gasped in disbelief. The maitre 'd did not offer any apologies other than to say "we are serving them quickly so they will leave".  He did not seem overly concerned with our satisfaction.
The food was good but not worth the expense. There are many other restaurants in Las Vegas. This one was not worth it. We're not going back.

Very good steak house.  

Good service and food was well prepared.

Good location if you are going to a Venetian show.

The only reason it did not get 5 stars is the price.  I have eaten at other steak houses in Vegas with equivilant or better steaks for less price.

Will go back if I am staying at the Venetian for sure.  Especially if someone else is paying.

Dined their this past Friday, great experience. Service was terrific, food was 
Superb.  Started with the signature barbecue shrimp which were tasty.   Good wedge salad. Streaks were outstanding.  My wife's came out a little rare and they immediately corrected. 

On the must eat list for Vegas.

I recently stayed two nights in Vegas. I went to B&B one night and Delmonico the second. The food was excellent quality at both places. But the service and the atmosphere fell very short at Delmonico's. I was dining alone so maybe the server didn't think he needed to attend to me but the night before I had amazing service at B&B so I had an expectation of what a $100 dining experience should be like. 

I told the server I would like a glass of red wine when my steak was delivered. I waited ten minutes before it was brought out. I used to wait tables... for a decade. I'm a reasonable patron. I think fine dining demands something above diner level service.

So despite a delicious steak and a tasty martini, the rowdy classless crowd and the crappy service will keep me from coming back.

I hear about all these places that is voted number one for this reason or that reason. Some have titles as "the best steak house on the north end of town". Any time a variable is add to the title I usually questions it. But when I found we had seats at This place I went to google. 

"Best steakhouse in Vegas" I read with no extra words to misled the public. Now I'm ready. 

First thing i noticed is the low lighting and Elegant atmosphere. First glance you would think this place is strictly for high rollers with a private jet parked across the street. However it wasn't a strict dress code.  I saw customers with  tailored suits as we'll as shorts and polo shirts. My suggestion would be to step it up a little bit simply because you are in Vegas. 

I will not talk about the price of the meal because when I used Yelp to checking I got a high rollers badge. That means his place is very expensive. Let's just say it was 12 of us and the bill was over $1200 dollars. 

I ordered a drink called "THE BRONTE SISTERS" that came to the table in a mid Evil looking copper glass. Then I order another and another. Best drink I've ever had. Beware there isn't any prices on the drink menu but these babies run about 16 bucks. Yikes (disclaimer: I had a good day at the crap tables so I could splurge a bit) 

For started I ordered an Emeril Lagasse BBQ Shrimp with fresh baked Rosemary biscuit. The biscuits was very small but so freaking tasteful. After all the shrimp was devoured I was left with this amazing sauce on the bottom of the plate. If I didn't care if people looked at me like a homeless man with his first meal I would've licked the plate. No lie it was that good.  When the waiter took my plate with all that sauce left I felt like i violated a crime in flavor town. 

Now the real reason I'm writing this review THE BONE IN DRY AGED RIBEYE. lord have mercy on my taste buds. Best steak ever.  All that needs to be said.  This is the drop the mic moment and walk off stage.

HOLY hell. This place was yummy

Awesome thing, no split plate charges. My gfs and I were not yearning to eat a 22 oz steak, so it was nice to be able to split the entrees. We ordered the bone-in rib eye. YOU MUST ORDER that, especially if you're a steak eater. Medium rare, and that's how steak should always be. We also tried the Grilled Filet Mignon Medallions, which we overdone, Medium Rare my a$$, it was more like medium well-well done. but it did have a good taste. I don't believe in returning food.

The creamed corn was the shiznit. It was soooooo good. And the asparagus was good too, tender and perfectly buttered. 

Of course I can't skip dessert, had the creme brulee, which as ok. A bit too much sugar on top, but overall not bad. We had a bday and was given banana sorbet - gross. :P But the brioche bread pudding w/ bourbon and ice cream. was to die for. SOOOOO delish. :D

I will return for the truffle potato chips. :D and rib eye!
One of the best steaks I have ever had.  Everyone at the table thoroughly enjoyed themselves.  This is what life is all about.

I feel like Twitter is pretty useless so far; I have an ok amount of followers I guess, but I feel like they're all following so many people that anything I say gets lost in the mess of their feed. I could tweet all day and get very little response to anything aside from a couple loyal folks on there. And it was one such reader that led me to Delmonico recently for what he claimed to be an excellent burger. He's a food writer in town so he should know what he's talking about, right?

Delmonico is located in the small restaurant row of the Venetian right by another great burger spot, although most people would not come here for their burger. The interior is nothing too fancy in either the bar area or more traditional area in the back. I did notice while sitting at the bar that they have an amazing bourbon selection, but since I was there during a lunch break I'll have to go back some time when I'm not on the clock. The lunch and dinner menus are a bit different, with the lunch menu featuring more sandwiches and things, so maybe the comment I just made about people not coming for a burger is wrong. Either way, this restaurant is pretty fancy and features quite a number of great sounding items aside from what I came there for.

The Delmonico Prime Hamburger comes on a toasted brioche roll with fries, cheddar cheese and bacon. The meat had excellent flavor from the first bite, but I noticed right away that it was way overcooked and dry. It started off extremely juicy but that faded way too fast and by the end it was very dry. The cheese was melted and had great flavor, but the bun was a tiny bit dry as well and a little too thick. The heirloom tomatoes were fantastic, but maybe a bit off-putting at first due to their green color. The bacon also had good flavor, but was a tiny bit undercooked and soggy in parts. Overall it was still decent, but could have been well beyond that if the meat had been cooked properly.

Luckily the fries were great. Some of them were almost a bit too hard and crunchy, but they were very tasty and a welcome change to the 'typical' fries I often get around town. Something I found to be quite funny was when I asked for ketchup I was brought an insanely large bowl of it, more than probably a table full of people could have used.

The online menu lists the burger at $15, so I was a little surprised to see the $18 listed on the menu when I made my order. I think if it was cooked properly I would still be ok with this price given the chef, the location, etc, but because of this price I seriously frown on the fact that they couldn't cook my burger properly. If you're willing to risk this inconsistency and are ok with the cost, I think it's a good burger to check out, and has the potential to be really great, but if you're at the Venetian and are craving a guaranteed good burger for a similar cost I suggest you go next door.

Seeing that there are so many 4 and 5 stars, I will give Delmonico in Vegas the benefit of the doubt and just say my friends and I just ordered "the wrong things". I'm writing this review half a year after eating here so I don't remember specifics, but I do remember my scallops were very salty (but tender, and huge). What wasn't huge were certain cuts of steak, which basically came in a little cube. Service was amazing though, and the decor in clean, white, and perfect lighting. The inner dining area was better looking but empty at the time, I think they were trying to seat everyone to the outer sides of the restaurants first. Overall, I had a pleasant time but wasn't wow'ed by the flavors or bill. I'll still give Delmonico here in NYC a try though.

My husband and I dined here for my 40th birthday. We were treated like royalty and loved every minute. He had the chateaubriand and I had the salmon. Both were incredible. I can't wait to visit Vegas again just to eat here!

Came the night before the big Rock and Roll marathon and we had a great dinner.  Service was great.  Steak was juicy and cooked perfectly.  The BBQ shrimp appetizer was great, the sauce was amazing.  The only let down were the potatoes that weren't cooked throughly.  Oh well.

So my buddies wanted to go to a legit steakhouse in Vegas and we decided to try Delmonico.  We shared the seafood platter for an appetizer and how can you go wrong with king crab, oysters, and lobster.  I ordered the gumbo and it was delicious and full of depth and flavor.  The star of this dinner was the bone in Ribeye!  Perfectly charred on the outside and so tender and moist in the inside.  Best piece of steak I have had in my life, so far. Lol  I'm not a fan of fat on steak but the fat on this steak melted in my mouth and was as close to steak butter as there is.  My friends ordered sides but the steak was so big I didn't have room for anything else.  I think we ordered to much food and we had lots of leftovers. I could have shared the steak and I would have felt perfect.  This place is expensive but worth every penny.  If you feel like treating yourself this is a great place to eat.

Best. Steak. Ever. 
You pay for it, but that's expected at a high class restaurant. 
Service is exceptional... Food is off the chart!!
Would definitely return when I'm back in town.

This place is top notch. We didn't order any appetizers as we wanted to make sure we had enough room to finish our steak. I mean that's the most important part of a steak house right? 

Although their cuts are bigger enough to split if you wanted to order a few apps and room but for us it was all steak type of night. Let's start with the ambiance it's self: like any other high end steak house very roomy and intimate setting. Lights are dim.  

The device was top notch we we greeted immediate as we sat, water came out, and wine list brought to us. It was my wife's bday so we were definitely having a glass. Their drink menu had several options of wine, cocktails, etc.  

The croissant that they bring out was fluffy and buttery. The knock is they bring you just one. I could have eaten 20. I'm sure if asked I could have had another. 

I ordered the bone in New York strip and I have to say it was by far the best strip I've ever had. My wife ordered the ribeye and I did try a bite. While tender and tasted well. It was slightly warmer on temp than she liked. My strip was better. But by no means was her's bad. The twice baked potato tasted awesome and we shared an order. The steak being so large we could barely eat the side. 

Price point is similar to all other 4 star and up type of steak houses. It is definitely one I'd go back next time in Vegas.

Delmonico has become our default steakhouse in Las Vegas. We've never had less than exemplary service and amazing food here, for either lunch or dinner. The staff is on-point, with notes made as to our personal preferences as to table location, etc. The waitstaff is friendly, knowledgeable, efficient and reliable. The food is superb. Quality ingredients prepared in quality ways. I definitely recommend the steak tartare as an appetizer. The only "heads-up" I'd give new patrons is that the sides are rather large. Ordering three or four sides with dinner is contra-indicated unless you are with a large group or dining with teenagers.

Excellent bar and bartenders as well. Ask for the whisky menu and just revel in the selection.

This place was recommended by a friend and I was so excited to try it. I was highly disappointed. At their price point, I expect a certain level of service and food quality. Both were lacking. After getting seated, I had to request a black napkin, which is usually automatic. Not a big deal. After waiting for 5-10 mins, perusing the menu on our own, I had to ask a busboy to find the waiter so I could order drinks. He finally came over and asked if I had any questions and proceeded to recommend the entire menu. Not helpful. We ordered the organic green salad which was excellent. Also got the bone in ribeye. I liked the way it was charred on the outside but it was not well seasoned and the meat quality wasn't top notch like other steakhouses I've been to. The manager came by to do their customary check and I told him the steak was 'pretty good'. He didn't bother asking me why I wasn't satisfied, smiled and walked away.

Overall, this place doesn't command the price they're charging. Need to clean up their service and food quality. If the salad was the best thing we ate at a steakhouse, that's definitely a problem.

Really good service and food.  I loved the mozzarella bruschetta we had, it had amazingly good flavor (garlic, shallots, tomatoes) drizzled lightly with either a balsamic reduction or really well aged balsamic vinegar, and on a toast point that wasn't hard and crusty.  Their soup special was pumpkin soup, creamy and seasoned nicely.  My husband I both got salads, I got the spinach salad with bacon and he got the fresh baby greens.  Both were good.  Too bad we came to a steakhouse and only ordered vegetarian dishes, we were just overwhelmed by all the heavy food we've been eating since we arrived in Vegas.  Next time, we'll try their seafood or meat dishes.  We finished off our meal with dessert, the fruit cobbler topped with caramel ice cream was YUM!

Had dinner reservations at 6:30pm and we were seated right away.

I looked at their menu prior to stepping foot into the restaurant so I kind of had an idea of what I would like to order.

For our appetizer, we ordered two Parmesan and Garlic potato chips. I'm a chip queen....obsessed and in love with chips but this....this didn't taste that great. =/ The first five chips were good...but after awhile...it tasted WAY TOO GREASY. You know that over greased taste? Yeah...that's what I was starting to taste. It felt like they drenched the entire thing in oil and left it there for days. My party finished the first plate of that but we just couldn't finish the second plate. I definitely would NOT order this again. 

NEW ORLEANS GUMBO: This gumbo had rice, chicken, sausage and veggies. Pretty good sized portion for a bowl of soup. Small eaters would be half full from this. Seriously...lol. I thought to myself...damn...I hope I have enough room in my stomach for my entree!!!

CAESAR SALAD: Typical normal Caesar. It's big enough to share with your entire party.

BONELESS RIB-EYE: You have your choice on the menu for bone-in OR boneless rib eye. I was with a fancy date and his party of four other high rollers so I didn't wanna make a mess, that's why I opted for boneless. I've got to admit...it was good...but to be technical, I would rate it at a solid B grade. My rib eye was cooked to my liking, the flavoring was delicious BUT......there were more fatty parts that I would like. =/ eh...not a big fan. But it didn't take away from the complete meal. Great rib eye...big enough for leftovers the next day.

NOTE: Three out of the six steak entrees my party ordered was over cooked. Someone wanted medium rare but her steak came out medium. My date ordered medium and it pretty much came out medium well.

For our side dishes we ordered potatoes au gratin, asparagus, mashed potatoes, and another veggie dish.

Can't go wrong with Delmonicos. Def give it a try! Be sure to make reservations.

Located in the restaurant/shopping area between the Venetian and Palazzo, this is a great steak place.  Went with a group of friends and we all had 1 thing on our mind.  Steak.  

We didn't order any alcohol since we were kind of recovering a bit from the night before.  

For appetizers, I had the tuna and salmon tartare which was good.  Bunch of my friends had lobster bisque which was rich but very good as well.  The rolls came with a small amount of butter on them and would taste great in the bisque, I'm sure.

For steaks, everyone went with either the New York or Filet.  I had the filet topped with seared foie gras.  The combination of the two was excellent and very flavorful.  I sadly had to leave some foie gras left over because it was too much.  I tried the New York and that was great as well.  

For sides we had the potatoes au gratin asparagus.  I didn't have any of the sides, but everyone seemed pretty pleased with them.

Unfortunately, no dessert really jumped out at me.  Everyone split the banana cream pie, but I passed on that since I'm not a fan of bananas.

Service was great.  It was pretty loud though, so I couldn't really hear 2 of my friends who were across the table.

Overall though, excellent meal.

I went in with high expectations.  
The service was what I had expected, they were very attentive and were on top of our needs throughout our meal.  Our waiters were great!  We sat down, water was brought over very quickly, as did the little "wonton" topped with kalamata olives and proscuitto thing.  I wasn't very impressed by it, I guzzled my water.  By the time I looked up again, my water had been refilled.  WOW!  The waiter brought our bread and explained the menu.  Then she let us be to ponder upon her words.  I chose the scallops with creamed corn sauce.  They scallops were cooked perfectly and the corn chower had lobster in it!  It was 7 minutes in HEAVEN!  The mister and I both opted for steak.  He has the filet mignon and I had the bone-in NY strip.  We decided to share a twice baked potato with cheese and bacon.  His filet was just a filet.  My NY was HUGE!  If I had known it was going to be so large, I would have gotten a filet too.  I was only able to eat half of mine and was not able to have any potato.  The mister finished his steak and all the potato plus his bread which I didn't touch.  The steaks were cooked med-rare perfectly and seasoned.  I could have done without any seasoning on it but hey, that's how they came.  It wasn't ovewhemling in spices but enough that I didn't need any sauces besides the delicious butter just melting so erotically on the plate.  I was stuffed full of steak but I needed to satiate my sweet tooth.  We shared a pecan pie which came with a mound of ice cream.  The crust was absolutely fantastic and the pecans were not burnt.  We had no wine because we were just too dehydrated from the heat, water was all we needed.  I think the mister was slightly disappointed that his filet mignon wasn't as tender as the kobe steaks he is used to.  OH WELL!  I enjoyed my steak and I enjoyed being tended to like a princess.  I had a great night, it would have been better if the darn tables weren't' so close together.  I would have given it 5 stars, I just didn't like being able to hear what the people next to me were whispering about.  The prices were fairly reasonable for Vegas, we've spent double at Yamashiro's and Redondo Beach pier, plenty of times.

Don't let the dress code fool you too much.  There were so many people in there wearing jeans and shorts, I felt a bit over dressed in a cocktail dress and he was wearing a dress shirt and slacks.  The restaurant looked semi-formal, the people there were looking mighty touristy so the ambiance was slightly off.

What a great find! I had eaten here once before for a corporate event, but this time it was for a nice meal with my wife.

The wine list is amazing (almost overwhelming)! Service was some of the best we've ever had! Our drinks never got below half empty and the food was outstanding! The Filet was a little (very little) tough, but the flavor was outstanding! You really cannot go wrong with this place!

BAM!

I have been on the lookout for the perfect filet for some time now.  My search has put this place on the top of my list.  After years of waiting I finally  was able to dine at the famed Delmonico Steakhouse in Vegas.  I was promised by steak loving friends that the filet was so perfect you didn't need a knife to cut it.

My wife and I arrived a bit early so we could check out their bar.  The ambiance while very nice, was not what I had expected.  It was also not very busy which also threw me off a bit.  Anyway, we sat at the bar and I ordered up my usual (Goose martini with 3 blue cheese olives) and my wife ordered a glass of wine.  We chatted up the friendly bar tender, finished our drinks then headed into the main dining area to be seated.

First we were given a ginormous wine list that took us 10 minutes to go through and another 10 minutes to decided what we wanted.  We settled on a very reasonably priced bottle and our waiter was not at all pissed that we didn't drop $100's on a bottle.

First they bring you a small dinner roll/bread thing that was very unremarkable.  I liked it that they brought you a single roll so I couldn't eat 4 of them and ruin my dinner, but it just wasn't that good so I really didn't want more than one.  Probably for the best though.

For an appetizer we shared the gulf shrimp cocktail which was excellent.  The shrimp were boiled in some creole stuff which gave them a very nice flavor.  They give you 4 large shrimp which is perfect for sharing although I could have eaten them all myself.  If you like super hot cocktail sauce then be sure to ask for a side of horseradish to heat it up some more.

Then we had the Caesar  salad which is prepared tableside and is a 2 person portion.  While the salad was pretty good, I wouldn't order it again.  They add some spices to it that I just don't think belong in a salad and gave it an odd flavor.

As per our steakhouse usual, my wife and I split the filet and we both thought it was excellent.  It wasn't perfect, but probably one of the best I have ever had.  It was cooked perfectly, had excellent flavor and the rub they used wasn't too overpowering.  The steak was very tender but not the cut-with-your-fork kind of tender I am looking for.  At 9oz it was a perfect size to split and not feel overly full after our meal.

For sides we ordered the veggie of the day (broccoli) and the fingerling potatoes.  I guess they were pretty good but I should have ordered a few of their less healthy options like creamed spinach or mashed potatoes.  My wife was in charge of the sides this time but next time I'm ordering something good.

My wife and I are both suckers for desserts made in house so we had to try their pecan pie.  It was ok but I would try sometime else next time like the cheese cake.  I wasn't a fan of the crust but I was a fan of the size; it wasn't huge and was perfect for 2 people to share.

After dinner my wife ordered a decaf coffee and for some reason I had absinthe.  The after dinner drink menu caught my eye because it had like 5 different selections of absinthe which is very unique.  I asked if I could do a sampler of them all but they said no.  Instead, I settled on one and it was very good.  I am not a very experienced absinthe drinker so I really couldn't tell you if it was any better than any other one but it was quite good......and strong.  I still have no idea why the heck I ordered it.

My entire Delmonico experience was excellent.  Our entire waitstaff crew (there had to be 4 people waiting on us) were fast, friendly and helpful.  The price for the steak was reasonable and comparable to other steakhouses, but everything else was pretty high.  Anyway, I would definitely dine here again and honestly cannot wait to return.

First impressions......Unfortunately, Delmonico Steakhouse made a huge mistake when they seated my party of three at the table right in front of the kitchen door with a restaurant that was less than half full.  Offensive and unacceptable.  The hostess ran in one direction and a staff member told us we would have to make our way back up to the front to deal with this issue when we told them that this would not work for us.  After a word with someone who claimed to be the manager at the front, we were reseated and promptly given complimentary truffle chips (that can solve any bad first impression).  The truffle chips are not to be missed.  

Service-  Our server eventually warmed up and was pleasant.   He was so caught up in his speeches about different parts of the menu and recommendations, that it took some time to see his true personality.  He was also rushed, which was odd, as we had some menu questions.  

Food-  The filet was magical.  This is the primary reason that the restaurant got 4 stars.  The creole seasoning and dab of BUTTER on the steak were an amazing and sinful treat.  Really delicious.

The cheese grits were delicious.  I was a bit less impressed with the creamed spinach.  The waiter said that it was better than CUT's version.  NO WAY!  Underwhelming.

So Mr Food Network himself Emeril has his own steak house. 
One thing I know - is my steaks. Mmmmm Dry aged bone in rib eye....here just waiting to enter my watering mouth and be consumed by my emotional grinding of my mandibles.
How can I forget - Truffle oil potato chips.  Popping my truffle oil cherry....Yum
Ok I've never had fancy schmancy gumbo. But here it was very pleasant and chic. I mean come on - GUMBO - I WANT PIECES OF MEAT AND SEAFOOD AND OKRA.....
Bone in RIB EYE - no more done than medium rare. Doesn't need any extra spices or sauces give me my meat plain. If I wanted it coated with jism. Well I can do it myself :)
Steamed or grilled asparagus with hollandaise...Mmmmm
I ate a lot...So I didn't have dessert like everyone else did. If I could I would have sucked on the bones. But that would have been a culinary faux paus. Bad Myke No sucking.....So How do they make the thick steak so dark and perfectly medium rare? Hmm...It's gotta be Keebler Elves performing magic.
The service is impeccable. I went to the bathroom and put my napkin on my chair - just to find it folded neatly on my table.  Can we say Fancy Feast?

I think this is the first time I went to a higher end restaurant in Las Vegas and walked out thinking...it's worth the price.  

Our server was pretty awesome in my mind. Took great care of us and explain the specials thoroughly.  Also helped gave us the idea that the last person at the table should take care of the tab. =)

Their whole menu sounds tasty....good selection of meats and a lot of sides/appetizers to accommodate your needs.

I ordered the Truffle Oil & Parmesan Potato Chips for my appetizer.
OMG....it tasted so good.  Best chips I've ever had!!!  It's crunchy...tasty...and best of all...it's cheesy!

For my entree....I stucked with their Bone-in Rib Eye with a side of corn. I always like my steak medium rare and they cooked it to perfection.  Steak was super tender and juicy.  Dash some horse-radish on the side and I'm happy.

My buddy Eugene ordered their "Tomahawk" which is basically a 32 oz. Ribeye with a big ass rib to boot.  He topped it off....of course....with some foie gras.  

Most of the table ordered their own rib eye steak....and ordered a lot of different sides to mix it up.  I'll say my favorite was the Wild Mushrooms and the Grits.

Overall, pretty good...will definitely come back to give this place a second spin.

Once again Emeril's Delmonico has lived up to its world class reputation! We took our friend and her husband here last night for her 40th birthday and the night couldn't have been more perfect! 

Staff/Service - exceptional! I think every person on the staff we interacted with wished her a happy birthday and even brought out a small dessert at the end of dinner. The sommelier stopped by our table several times and selected a great bottle for the table. He even came back at the end of dinner to talk about what Texas wines we recommend. Truly exceptional service. 

Drinks - you have to try one of their Sazeracs. 

Food- blows me away how exceptional the food is here. Ribeye was cooked absolutely perfect medium rare. Charred on outside. Perfect seasoning.  Duck fat fingering potatoes were also delicious. 

Couldn't have been happier to visit Delmonico and can't wait to go back!

A lovely date spot but otherwise I'd worry it feels slightly too formal/buttoned up for my ideal night out in Vegas - food was pleasant, wait staff was really pro and the banana cream pie is the best I have ever had by a mile

I've been to Ruth's, Mastro's, The Palm, & Morton's and I will have to say that the Rib-Eye (not bone-in) I had here was the BEST I have ever had (not that the others were bad). 

I may be partial to the spice "rub"/"crust" they put on it which is not traditional for high end steak places which favor only salting their meat, but honestly I wish other places seasoned their meats a little more. It was truly delicious. My brother ordered the NY and my aunt ordered the Filet and they were both in agreement I had the best tasting steak.

The service was exactly what you would expect and demand from a place in this price range and all the sides and appetizers were definitely good (but not great).

Their wine list is literally an encyclopedia of wine so it was a little intimidating and I opted for a glass of Scotch instead. 

In comparison to some of the newer & flashier spots like SW & CUT the ambiance is a little muted but its still classy. Like I stated, go here and order the regular Rib Eye.. I highly doubt you will be disappointed.

Delmonico Steakhouse was pretty good, but definitely not the best I've had nor without flaws.

The food and drink choices seem to be where they really excel, as there were a number of options that my girlfriend and I found to be mouth-watering, from the bone-in ribeye, the fillet, the chicken, salmon, etc.  They had my favorite beer (Chimay Blue) and she enjoyed her wine (she had the Chardonnay and Riesling).  What we wanted when going here was a nice, fancy dinner as a tribute to our vacation together.  It wasn't a special occasion or anything but we like to have a quality dinner from time to time.  I'd say the food part of Emeril's more or less did the trick with regards to that.

The service was OK.  While they were relatively prompt the matre'd was the person who seemed to be serving us and he was just a little too over-the-top for me, not to mention he seemed a little condescending and careless.  Perhaps I just read into it wrong, but I didn't feel as comfortable as I have at other restaurants.  Our waiters made sure the waters and bread kept coming, which I appreciated.  The matre'd didn't really do anything rude per-say, but I did notice that at one point when he came by to check on everything he spoke with the tables on our left and right but not with us.  

The smaller tables are a little too big IMO, my girlfriend and I felt a mile away from each other and eventually I just moved my place settings next to her and sat with her so we could talk easier.  This is probably not an issue if you have a big group, but for a romantic evening it wasn't fantastic.  Speaking of romance, there were no candles, the lightning was bright, and the restaurant was devoid of decor. 

I don't mean to rip Delmonico's so much but I just want to stress that this restaurant really doesn't deserve 5 stars despite the food being pretty tasty.  Our stakes came out medium rare as requested, they were juicy and delicious, and the side "double-baked potato" + "Asparagus" was fantastic.

I realized going here and glancing at the menu online that the prices were going to be steep but I guess my wallet received a shock even so.  I had initially been hoping that our bill would come to about $115-130, but in the end it was $200 because you have to buy sides for your meal separately and the wine / beer was very expensive.  The problem with this is that in Vegas there is a lot of competition and I've had food that was on par with this for under half the price of what I paid.  For instance Mon Ami Gabi (outside of Paris, Paris) and Trevi (Ceasar's Palace Forum Shops) both run in the $60-100 range (for two) and are just as tasty IMO.

Lastly, there were a nat or two flying around toward the end of our meal, something which is unacceptable in a restaurant of this caliber.  

I enjoyed the overall experience but I would not dine here again.

Bone-in ribeye was the bomb.

They cook the steaks as precise as you could get for medium and medium rare lovers out there.  No need to temperature down when being asked in anticipation of the kitchen cooking the crap out of your steak, what you ask for is what you get.

I was here was some buddies for a random Vegas trip and we decided to do it big at Delmonico.  The experience was great.  The ambiance is a little bit more on the "date night" side of the spectrum, but the service is awesome and the steaks and sides are delicious.  

Make reservations and don't stress about the price, it's a special occasion.  Even if it's not a special occasion, it will be when you steak comes at exactly the right temperature.

I dined at Delmonico's yesterday for lunch.  There was a total of four in the party.  I informed the hostess and server that we were on a time crunch.  That certainly did not matter to the restaurant.  The server was delayed in taking our order, the food took so long that my colleague had to ask the server to check on the status, and then just getting our bill was extremely difficult.  I am not driven to return.  The food was nothing over the top incredible...  especially with the high price tag on the items (Lunch for 4 people was $120+ including tip).

I'm almost always skeptical of anything with a celebrity chef's name because they're almost always underwhelming. Those types of establishments require that celebrity chef to attach their name to drive new customers. In this business (which I'm far from expert, but know what I like), it's word of mouth that should ultimately drive good cuisine.

My father told me to come here while I was in town and I'm so glad that I did. Vegas is full of traps and this one was not a trap at all, and if it was a trap I wandered in willingly.

The "Book of Whisky" is MASSIVE. Largest whisky/single malt/irish/worldwide whiskey list I've ever seen. I partook in a nice Yamazaki 12 (world renowned shit) and felt adventurous and tried an Amrut from India which was delectable and spicy as well. 

The STEAK. I put it up there with Toro Toro as #1/#2 of all time. Flavorful, crunchy char, a nice butter sauce that only Emeril himself can probably cook up, and the service to match.

I sat at the bar and my server was knowledgeable, attentive, and would come around the bar to take care of me which was unnecessary, but appreciated. Great ambience as well, very low key for Vegas, and elegant.

My new MUST DINE spot in Vegas. Will be back forever.

This has been the first time I've been disappointed going to a steakhouse in Vegas. We had a reservation for 8 and Delmonicos and everyone almost hated their steak or fish. I myself had a halibut, but also shared the ribeye. I also had a taste of the lobster bisque. the bisque was very good and could recommend that. but as for the halibut and steak, they were very salty. our whole table said the same thing about the steak and fish. we were very surprised that we were disappointed at an emeril restaurant. maybe the chef in the back had a bad day. in the end, you wont see me here again.
Incredible meal and dining experience. In addition to a fantastic steak, the lobster bisque and twice baked potato are a must try!

Delmonico's is an interesting venue for dining. 
My first impression was that the decor was very understated for a "quality dining"experience.
As we waited a short time for our table to be prepared, we were invited to the lounge and bar - it was not impressive.
The table selection, at first seemed unimpressive, but after a short while we began to appreciate our location.
We were seated near the entrance to the dining room, but were hoping for a table deep into the interior.
Asthe evening proceeded, we found that we could have a very fine conversation, while those dining well into the room had to raise the level of their conversation just to be heard over the din coming from  the remainder of the room.  
The first component of the five star trating came with the extensive wine list.
The wine list will amaze anyone. A selection for every taste .....  
The service is also five star. Any need you have will be well attended at Delmonico's.
I have a hard time believing that I went to one of the very best steakhouses in Las Vegas and ordered Salmon.
I thought if Emeril Lagasse is associated with this steakhouse then the fish selections would be first rate.
I was not wrong !
I enjoyed the crabcake appetizer -  it was just supurb.
The BBQ Salmon was astoundingly good and cooked to perfection. 
A wealth of flavor in every bite. 
The steaks ordered by the rest of the table were huge and exceedingly good.
The table shared a chocolate blackberry cake for desert and it was the perfect pair for a fine selection of tawny Port.
Once again, the service provided by the staff was excellent throughout the meal. 
Simply an amazing dining experience.
First class all the way ...........

I had such high expectations for Delmonico's because I love Emeril and because of him my culinary skills are on point but sadly I couldn't give this restaurant the 5 stars I wanted too. The staff was extremely friendly and nice. They gave excellect table service and I didn't have to ask for anything. 

We started our meal with some drinks. I ordered the Brooklyn Yard and my god this gin and juice concoction was so amazing I had two which is alot for this lightweight. We also ordered the BBQ Shrimp and Crispy Fried Oysters and as expected it was heavenly and I savored every bite. 

For dinner I ordered off the Summer Trio menu and chose the New Orleans Gumbo, the Sirloin Strip Steak with Asparagus and the Caramel Butter Cake with Vanilla Cream. The gumbo was just alright. It was good but I felt the roux was too rich and over powered the other ingredients.
