They are great, I have been here a number of times and they always made my car look brand new. I once tore the whole side of my car out backing into a fire hydrant. Mr. Eazor did a fabulous job. Their work is impeccable. I would recommend them to everyone. Eazor's Auto Salon is FANTASTIC.

Ted Eazor is one of the most honest people I have met in this business. He bends over backwards to accomodate our 1-car family! Ted stands behind his work and will make sure you are happy with what they've done. 

I drive an extra 20 minutes to take my car to him, but it is SO worth it.

The people at this shop are amazing! They got my car done so quickly it was like it was never gone. My rental car for the duration of the repairs was taken care of and ready for me when I arrived! So stress free!They even stayed late to accommodate my work schedule and offered easy late drop off with a key box. The texting of updates made it so easy to do business with them! Best auto shop in Pittsburgh! I've worked with many other shops and this one is the most honest, fair, and helpful of them all! :)

I was a new person in the city, and I had an accident. I did not know who to call, and found this place a little too far for my comfort. It had great reviews so I used it anyway and had my car towed this location. I have had such a pleasant experience. My car was fixed within a week, they were flexible with pick up times and even sent me emails with photo updates on how my car is doing!! I highly recommend Ted and his employees. They treat you like family.

Eazor's Auto Salon did just a great job on my car. They repaired a bunch of dings and scratches, had it done when  they promised, stuck to the estimate and gave it back to me in excellent condition.  In particular, the car has a type of paint that can be difficult to "blend in" and they were able to make the car look like new again.  Very impressed with their work and I would definitely use them again.

I wanted to like this place I really did. I went there around 9pm on a Friday. I went to the bar on the upper level and had 2 bartenders stare at me for a good 10min before I was finally served. He asked what I wanted and I said a vodka/water made with absolute, the bartender looks at me and just says "titos" apparently he was making mine with titos vodka. I was a little annoyed but went with it. Came to find out my not strong at all vodka/water made with cheap vodka at that was $8!! I get vodka/waters with top shelf vodka at other bars for $5. 

As for the dualing piano part. It was fun but u have to be in the mood for it. There were a few bachelorette parties there who seemed to be having fun. 

My suggestion, get nice and drunk before u go because the drinks are WEAK and EXPENSIVE

I'm used to the howl at the moon in Philadelphia. The music is loud, the sound is BALANCED, and the musicians have energy in there act. Came to howl at the moon in Pittsburgh with that expectation and was let down.  Some of the musicians are great (specially the guy with the shaved head... Give him a raise please). The big downer had nothing to do with the musicians... It was with the sound. The low end didn't exist. Either the sound guy was off or (s)he doesn't have ears. Sound was incredible unbalanced. Sounded like the drummer was in the bar next door and they were trying to play along. I played in a touring act for several year so maybe I have a construed opinion.  Again, I'm comparing to Philly. Night and day difference. I hope the next visit is an improvement... Hope to update this review with something more upbeat in the near future
Cultural district bar.  Nice before a show.  But a bit beyond my notion of a pre-show event.  Not for me.

If you're looking for a fun place to hear shitty versions of smash mouth and/or hootie and the blowfish then look no further than howl at the moon!

They'll play all your favorites from the likes of creed fuel and the goo goo dolls!

Trust me save your $5 at the door and take it to Charlie Murdochs or Sing Sing cause this place sucks ass!

I came here because a friend "won" a happy hour. I also entered the drawing and "won" a happy hour, so I don't think winning is that hard. However, the happy hour is a great deal! You get two $1 drink tickets, which are good for a couple of beers on tap, a glass of wine, a simple mixed drink, or a glass of cider. The selection is limited, but hey, it's one dollar! They also had a free buffet with veggies and dip, pulled pork sandwiches, and chips and dip. Nothing special, but again, I can't complain because it's free. 

During the happy hour, we also had live music entertainment. Basically there are some very talented folks that play a variety of instruments and can play songs that audience members request. The music was typical bar music. For me, the music was a bit too loud. Makes me sound like a grandma, but I felt like I was yelling the whole time, in order to have conversations with people.

I wouldn't necessarily go here if there wasn't a happy hour, but it's a great deal if you do go there during a happy hour! Good vibes, decent food/drinks, and some musical entertainment!
Good music but very weak drinks.  Suggest you get a good buzz before going so you can actually howl at the moon.

After spending a Saturday afternoon downtown at a Pens game and having dinner, a few of us stopped in here to check out the dueling pianos and entertainment. At least I thought Howl at the Moon was a dueling piano chain? Perhaps on other nights of the week there are dueling pianos and you get that actual "piano bar" feel, but this Saturday it was one piano, drums, some guitarists and quite a few singers. I think I counted five singers in all during our couple of hours there. Honestly, although it was not a terrible experience by any means, I would not go back. 

They charged a $5 cover, which I felt was completely reasonable given the live entertainment. Drinks are fairly priced, too. They just really pack people into this place like sardines. We spent more time shimmying past others to get back to the bar or get through the thick of crowds to the restroom than we did all together in a group dancing and enjoying the music. Countless times you are being run into by people drunker than you are, or making sure your toes do not get stepped on ... again. It was really just a glorified club. Too bad since Howl at the Moon (at least in other cities) used to be known for hosting a downright awesome dueling piano show. I see now that the description on Yelp is "Dance Clubs, Bars", so I should have known to expect that I suppose.

The band did a great job playing crowd-pleasing cover songs, and there were a few Bachelorette parties up on the stage having a great time. The bartenders were friendly and served us quickly every time one of us managed to squeeze on up to the bar, and the bathrooms were kept very clean by the attendant. I would not discourage someone looking for a fun night of dancing from going here, but I do recommend going a bit earlier in the evening (we went at 8:30p) so that you can grab a table a bit further away from the dance floor. Maybe over by the front windows would be a good spot. You can people-watch from there but still be close enough to the bar and the music to enjoy the experience just as much as those on the dance floor.

My friend won a free party when she was here for her sister's bachelorette party a few months ago. When we first got there the bouncers were really friendly and inviting. Our waiter was really phenomenal and very attentive. Even when the place got really busy he was constantly checking on us to see if we needed anything. Everyone was extremely friendly - they even have bathroom attendants that have anything you could possibly need in case of an emergency (ex: candy, Advil, towels, etc.) The bathroom attendant in the women's room was extremely friendly and funny! We loved her.

You get a lot of chances to win a free party. They are constantly handing out little forms you can fill out and a winner is picked at random. If you win a free party then you and your friends get in free and you also receive vouchers for free drinks. 

** There is a live band the entire night. They are extremely talented and entertaining. They do not have a set list and play requests all night. It is pretty impressive how talented the band is. However, if you prefer a club with a DJ, this place may not be for you. However, we knew ahead of time what to expect and it was a lot of fun.

I won a Happy Hour that I used for Labor Day weekend. My group got there around 10pm, and we were given drink tickets for $1 drinks. When we went to use them, the bartender told us that the special was over, and that they drinks were full price. When I expressed my confusion, she got the manager. The manager (a blonde female) came barreling through the bar to YELL at me. She said the special was over, and I'm not using the tickets. She then took the tickets, ripped them and threw them out, and just said ok? The bartender (who was really sweet) apologized for the manager's terrible customer service. Even though this was a fun bar, this interacted left a really bad taste in my mouth, and me and all of my friends do not plan on returning. This place really needs to get new management!

Someone with my company won a happy hour here, so a bunch of us headed over for some drinks last Friday night. The happy hour included two drinks for $1 each, which is a pretty good deal. It included a couple of beer options and some basic mixed drinks. 

I can't say I've ever been to a "dueling piano bar" before so this was an interesting experience. I don't know that "dueling" is really the right term, as it seemed like they were playing together for most of the time. There was a huge range of music played and the musicians were definitely very talented. But it was also very loud and hard to hold a conversation. 

The space was just really odd to me. There is some seating up front, and then a giant bar right in the middle of the place, and a small stage in the corner that seemed almost like an afterthought. I'm not sure what I was expecting, but it seems like it would make more sense to have the stage in a more central location than the back corner.

My group was standing near some high top tables around the bar, assuming we would be taken care of by the bar staff. Someone did come over to take our drink orders (and she returned several more times when our group needed another round). When I went to close my tab, I was informed that only person who took the orders could close it. This was kind of inconvenient because I had to wander around the bar until I found the girl who had helped us. It's nothing against her--she was nice and provided really quick service, I just found this system to be odd and annoying.

The happy hour was a good deal (because of my coworker), but I don't know if I would come back here on my own choice. Maybe it's just not my thing, but it was a very mediocre experience.

The performers are decent here. Some get really into it but others don't bring that much energy which can be draining. This piano bar has one of the larger dance floors I've seen and encourage people to dance on stage as well. Expect lots of bachelorettes to be there. It's fun if you go with a large group. Before 10pm it'll be basically empty but gets more rowdy and fun deeper into the night.

A few friends and I met up here for a birthday get together. The place was fun and interesting and I would go back to give it another try. We went on a Saturday night and the place was packed! There was a $5 cover charge which I thought was a bit unnecessary, but considering the location, I'm not surprised. They had a live band playing covers and they kept switching out singers, drummers, piano players, it really kept it fresh. Sometimes all the music blends together, but with the changing from female to male singers, it was easy to distinguish between the music. Unfortunately, after being there for a few hours, some of my friends noticed they were playing some of the songs over again. I mean, I'm not that mad, it's live music. 

The crowd was a nice mix of early 30 somethings and older. There weren't a lot of young, "new to drinking", babies. Which is a nice change of pace. There is a nice dance floor and 2 bar areas. If you are hanging out at the top bar, I recommend not leaning or standing near the railing because the wait staff goes through there to get their customer's drinks and I got stepped on a few times, and beer spilled on my freshly dyed hair. It was annoying and a bit unorganized but the staff were apologetic to all of us. 

They have drinks which I referred to as a "Death bucket" they are huge drinks with so much liquor that once you drink it all, you get to keep the bucket for the car ride home, to throw up in. They also have yard drinks, you know the Kennywood style slushy cups... my friend had a Fruit Roll Up flavored one but it was a little too sweet for my taste. I stuck with beer and they had a nice selection on tap!

Only reason I'm bothering to write this is because a couple of times now the bartenders seem to intentionally give incorrect change (that is off by 5 dollars or more), and are pretty rude. Also they charge a cover here(which is understandable because of the music), but they charge the same cover they charge at 10pm at 1 am

So, I came here because my friends told me it was so cool, but when I got here it was a very (almost impossibly) crowded place! The drinks were very expensive and the bartender was very rude! The piano guys otherwise were awesome! That saved the night!
I didn't like the band choice for Halloween night, but I did like the atmosphere. It was full without being overly crowded.

My least favorite bar in Pittsburgh.  The live music is not good and it's so loud it's painful. Never really gets too crowded which is nice and it's a really big place so you can move around. Drinks are okay, nothing special. 

I wouldn't recommend but if you absolutely love live music, I would say check it out because you might like it!

Another bar with the pyramid scheme of someone you know "winning" a party for 100 guests. This party includes a free buffet (bbq bone-in chicken, macaroni salad, cheese cubes, nachos and salsa, and a veggie tray), cheap well drinks for a few hours, and two $1 well drinks or cheap beer. 

You come in, say you're with the said winner, and then sign your name down with your contact info. You'll probably all be winners of a party next week. 

There's a live band in the corner playing old throwbacks to top hits. The throwbacks sound much better, which is probably because it's more comfortable to perform. 

I don't like the openness of the space. It's like a large square, without anything special. The tall but small tables line the walls, with a bar sort of in the center. I think I prefer places that I could explore, with an upstairs, downstairs, decorations to look at, or things to do while drinking. There are TV's at least. 

There's not anything special about Howl at the Moon.

The service is nice. Friendly wait staff and the hosts are accommodating.

I'm updating my review as I've had time to 'digest' the whole night (and also read the other reviews)...

First off- I think this bar is in the perfect location to capitalize on the younger at heart theatre going crowd that isn't into the soft & quiet bars & restaurants of the theatre district.  Sure- must of the 'show going' crowd are looking for something soothing & calming but the shows my wife & I like to go to have energy & excitement and knowing that Howl is right down the block- we'll be leaving the theatre on an 'up-beat' instead of a down.  

Yes- it's set up as a dueling piano's bar but the opening night featured a band that played pretty much everything and even if you go on a 'piano night' you're going to have fun.  We especially liked the front bar that sat up a little higher than the other bar & dance floor so we could watch the crowd.  The bartenders were ultra friendly and offered to refill drinks as soon as they were empty.  

The crowd for the soft opening night was more subdued in the beginning but as friends told us that stayed all night- it really heated up closer to midnight.  

Thank you Howl for giving us an excellent option for when we want to break away from our regular places and 'hit the town'...!

Howl at the moon is fun! The lively atmosphere and the dueling pianos roaring at the crowd all night is great. It's fun to either just sit and watch or dance with the crowd.. There is a cover charge to get in. They make fun specialty drinks in cups or buckets that you can even take home with you. The service is very prompt and fast and I've never really had to wait for a drink.

I think a 3 star review is about right for Howl Pittsburgh.

I've been to Howl at the Moon before in Charlotte, and had an amazing time.  I am a huge fan of the Dueling Piano concept, so when I was in Pittsburgh this weekend, I was excited to head to Howl for one night as part of a Bachelor Party.  I hyped up the group of 11 I was with, and even ponied up for cover for the group ($5 cover on a Friday).  

We all had a good time, but I expected more from the dueling piano concept.  I requested 3 different songs, and each time sent up a $5 bill with the request, and had a grand total of 0 played.  One was a "call-down" song for the bachelor, which I can understand if they hadn't heard.  The second was a current radio song, which they seemed to know a bunch of.  The final request was for anything from Bruce Springsteen.  We were there for about 3 hours total, and I found it hard to believe that they couldn't play one request.  For the last hour or so, it seemed they didn't even look towards any request slips, and some that were played didn't even send up a tip.  Most dueling piano bars will let you know if they can't play it, and ask if you want to hear something else, or offer your money back.  I talked to some of the players at the end of the night, and while they did offer the money back (which I would never take), they said they didn't know how to play any of my requests (REALLY?  you don't know a single Springsteen song??).  In their defense, we did stop by the next night for last call, and they did learn to play Cheap Thrills, so kudos on that.

Otherwise, drinks were fairly priced for downtown, and they had a good selection of beers as well.  The band was very talented, and everyone had a good time.  Dueling pianos always leads to a good night, but I think that this particular location could add a little bit of banter in between songs to interact with the crowd.  That's the best part of a dueling piano bar!

This spot is pretty to new the Pittsburgh scene, although it is a franchise and there are others in major cities across the U.S. They have great happy hours with a free buffet. The place is very clean and hip. They have buckets of drinks to share that are very fruity. I noticed many bachelorette parties when I was here and it seemed as though they were having fun. The drinks are average price for a nice spot downtown. It gets extremely busy on Saturday nights. I try to stay away from it then. It is perfect on a Friday night. I have noticed they play many of the same songs every weekend, although I do not mind. They have a full band and switch spots. Guitars, drums, and other small instruments. Overall always a good experience. The singers all have something different to offer.

Fun times. Great atmosphere and some talented musicians. Everyone seems to have a great time here. Only suggestion is there is one pianist that has a very high voice and isn't the best singer (the balding guy). Some songs he does well in, but most of the songs he sings, it makes me want to leave just because it hurts my ears. I recommend for sure! Very different than anything else in Pittsburg.

Hey, this place is fun! Really needed to hear some live music and get a drink in Pittsburgh while in town for a convention...this was the place! Good libations, friendly staff, fun band. Even though I felt like I was old enough to be everyone's dad in the place I still had a good time. (I've decided there's no graceful way for a middle aged guy to drink alone in a bar) Also..I've always thought the whole idea of bathroom attendants was kinda weird..but this guy was cool, and clearly enjoys his job of helping to make your peeing experience a pleasant one :) Toss him a buck or two, he appreciates it!

Great experience...will be back, and older, in about a year!

Place is Ok. The band had some really painful miscues, apparent to even the non-musicians in our group. Some songs were good, others were unlistenable.  It was clear some of the players were very unnatural at some of the instruments.

Always had a great time until recently.  One of the blonde male musicians ended up having my friends purse which was missing for a few hours. Whether he was trying to steal it or not, that's your decision, our group has ours. After he was confronted while the bar was shutting down, he was incredibly rude.  Wouldn't you think if you found a purse, you'd give it to the security guard when you were finished performing, knowing very well people would be looking for it and asking other employees of it? Well this kid didn't, he kept it for a few hours until the bar was shutting down, even when people were being kicked out for being there too late he still had it.  If we wouldn't have noticed him wearing the purse, who knows what would've happened to it.  Clearly his intentions were anything but good. If these are the individuals you hire at your place of business...  good luck.

Great place, hilarious fun...awesome performances. Make sure you hang out later so you can see Shawna hit the stage and tear it up. Drinks are a little expensive, especially because it's a place you want to keep drinking and watching the show, but other than that it's a great addition to the downtown nightlife scene.

I went here for a bachelorette party on a Friday night. I pre-purchased a table for $80 that included two drink tickets per guest, a shot for the bachelorette, and $40 toward your bar tab. We got tables close to the stage. Our server and the stage security guard absolutely made our experience! They were so kind and accommodating and the security guard entertained us all night! He sang, participated, kept the creepers away, voluntarily took pictures for our group. The music was great! We had an absolute blast. I will say the drinks left a lot to be desired--syrupy, sugary grossness. But they didn't mess up my dirty grey goose martini, so I was a happy gal. Also it is important to note that we were a mixed age group--our party ranged from 22-50. Absolute great time!

Rum runner was delicious. The place was a little dead, but I suspect it's because it's a new location. The band was great and the girls' vocal skills were amazing. My friend was celebrating her Birthday and enjoyed a drink bucket.

I was really excited to hear that a new Piano bar was coming to PIttsburgh, so me and my Happy Hour group of people were very happy to have been invited to attend their soft opening this past Thursday. 

Let me start out to say the space automatically send out a pleasant and inviting vibe, the space is open with two separate bar areas: the first facing the street and the second in the main space of the bar. 

The stage has room for two Pianos and and a band, with talented artists playing music from Sweet Home Caroline and Piano Man to "Get Low - by Flo Rida". I appreciate the concept of allowing local artists to perform as well, my friend's neighbor Annie was delightful with her spectacular singing voice. I love places that encourage local talent and impromptu performances. When the groove start going, you are welcome to jump out on the dance floor and if you're lucky you can shake it up on stage. I look forward to some rowdy and wonderful nights in the future.

At the Bar, they have a good selection of mixed drinks, all very fruity and summery; in multiple different sizes depending on your party. You range from your individual drink to a bucket, something that I forgot was a thing until Howl at the Moon reminded me that Pittsburgher's like to get drunk in hordes. My favorite drink of the Night was called the "X-boyfriend" appropriate for me, as I had to deal my ever lasting pain in the neck on this evening. [Sheesh] On the upside, the drink is beyond yummy. The bartender are quick and efficient as they dealt with the hordes of people slurping up the free drinks, I can't wait to see how efficient they are when they are paid. 

For food, they had delightful spread of skewers floating around, my favorite being the caprese skewers quickly followed by the satays and the stuffed portabella mushrooms!! How I do love my shroom caps!

All in all I had no complaints of anything in night, save the bathroom attendants who should assume the responsibility of stopping my pest of the night [and the other patrons] from overdowsing themselves in cologne. I believe that is what finally pushed me out the door.

Bravo to a great soft opening I look forward to more great nights downtown!!!

I went for a happy hour party that a friend "won". Some $1 drink tickets and a happy hour buffet. The place was packed and loud but I was pleased to see that it was a very diverse crowd. 

The drinks were good with a nice selection of beers and huge specialty drinks. It's pricey but no more so than any bar in that area.

The buffet was nothing special BBQ pork sliders, potato salad, cheese tray, salad and chips. You can get outside food delivered if you want.

It was fun! So much fun. The dueling piano was awesome. They take request. The tip is wrap your request in a Buck if you want it played. 

I will be back.

I went to Howl at the Moon Pittsburgh many times since it opened, and I had a great time every time.  I used to be on their frequent flyer list, which meant that I could book their Happy Hours (which normally you have to win) at will.  I now live in central Pennsylvania, but it is well worth the travel costs to travel to Pittsburgh just to patronize this establishment.

Howl at the Moon is really fun if you're already drunk. I probably would not want to come here if I was all the way sober. It basically seems to cater to white people in their late 20s-early 30s, judging from the music they play. I tried to request a few songs by black artists and the band said they didn't know those songs, which was kind of awkward (you're telling me you don't know ANYTHING by Beyonc?) but they play some fun Top 40 stuff and throwbacks, and they do a really good job of keeping the energy levels high. Be careful ordering drinks because the prices are not on the menu so if you're already drunk you might end up spending more than you are expecting! Also, love their jello shots.

Like others on Yelp, I attended a happy hour that was "won" by a friend.  That means a free (limited) buffet and dollar drinks (for specific drinks).  The live music was fun, and it was a pretty good deal...and everything was okay.  

Something's a little off...not sure if I can put my finger on it.  But this is a good place to go with your friends, not sure if I would go back on my own.
Swindled of a $5 cover per head the doorman saw cash in my wallet. Let a person without cash in. Poor service inside

The tale of two nights.     

I love live music.    I don't care if it is Karaoke, Cover, or Original music. The first time was on a Friday Night after a baseball game.    The place was packed.   The band - yes they have upgraded from the dueling piano (it is still there) to a full band.    The dance floor was packed - it was a great time.   

The next time was a Wednesday.     There was not a soul in the bar.   There was no baseball game or sporting event.   The door man mentioned that if we go to the bar, the band will start playing.     The musicians went to the stage and started playing (Dueling Pianos and Drums).    They were good but lacked energy.

I am not sure if I will go back during the week.  The doorman mentioned that 45+ people walked in / out because the band was not playing.     I hope they survive because when they are on - they are really cool.   When they are not on... well it is a different story.

Both nights the bartenders were awesome.
Awesome place. A must go. Better than any other dueling piano bar in town. 9-11 on Saturdays, 1 dollar drinks. Can't beat it.

I had been to Howl at the Moon in Charlotte and was so excited to learn that they were opening in Pittsburgh! Friends won a happy hour here several weeks ago, and we just had to attend. I had a great time. The entertainers are fantastic and very talented. The drinks were good, and one of the bartenders even created a drink for me (that I loved) based on what we told her that I liked. However, I was disappointed that more people weren't hanging out here on a Thursday night. I hope that they quickly get the word out and build up their clientele!

Howl at the Moon did reach out and send me free passes for 4 and a gift card to come back and try the place again. Neither of these was requested and were offered out of kindness and excellent promotion. 

To date I have not returned but I plan to in the near future.

I have been to other Howl at the Moons, and when I went to this one, it just wasn't what I expected. It wasn't a dueling piano bar? I had a great time nevertheless ! But if that's what you're looking for, keep that in mind. It was more like live music. 

The other thing that I thought was strange was their food situation. They have an appetizer buffet from 6-8, and that's it. You can't order anything off of a menu. Personally, I'm not a fan of buffets, especially when there are a bunch of drunk people around them... So my group ended up leaving to have something to eat. 

If you know what to expect, and arrive after you eat, you should have a great time !

Well, I had higher hopes for this place. But alas, it has absolutely ZERO character. As far as I can tell it's a dueling piano bar that's trying to be a dance club. What's the deal with the rotating spotlights and disco lights?

And why are you charging a cover? The band was raking in tips, and it's not like you had incredible drink prices. The band was decent, there was 5-6 piece with drums, bass, and lead guitar. Here's the problem, it's a dueling piano bar... Have some interaction with the audience.

They knew how to play all of the requests, but they all sound the same except for varying make or female vocals. 

They must have a sign every five feet about "winning" a happy hour like every lame bar in the North Shore. Wise up folks, you don't really win anything.

If you're looking for a combination sports/dance bar with pleasant background music - this is your place. If you want to have a fun time with a group I'd say stick to Sing Sing.

Bad experience from the gate, bald manager I believe Cory very unprofessional and claimed he had to move our tables for a fire hazard, shame we saw several other tables back to back. Next were there for a happy hours and told we had two complementary drink tickets, then we're charged a dollar a beer. Oh and they don't have food but are getting it someday. My advice go to sing sing they have their stuff together and this place won't be around to long. Another great example of poor service, lack of management and systems. What a joke definitely not coming back only stayed for a friends birthday and I feel bad he had to spend his 30th in this place.

My brother won a happy hour (I'm pretty sure everyone who puts their name in wins a happy hour), so we got a bunch of people together on a Friday night. The drink specials were very good, and the people who ordered from the non-special menu were happy too. The snacks were fine, simple, but there was something for people with different diets including vegetarian and low-carb. The energy was fun and people were dancing and having a good time, though it was SUPER loud.  The waitresses will over-serve so look out for your friends and make sure you have a plan for getting home safe!

Stopped in Howl at the Moon before a show a couple weekends ago.  This was a first time for me so not knowing what to expect I could tell quickly this was a dance club that sold a decent selection of beers but probably much more known for their over the top sweet boozing buckets that were stacked behind the bar.  

We were there early in the evening, maybe 6:15.  There was no other patrons at the time but they seemed to be getting set up for a night of piano playing and dancing.  I noticed some bouncers or something at the door that I assume would collect covers and card people but we were early and therefor were not asked for any money, which is good for them as I would have turned around and walked back out.  Sitting at the bar the bartenders seemed nice.  There were a lot of them standing around and talking to each other.  I'm guessing they are much more useful say around 10 PM or so, than at 6:15 with two guests.

After two drinks we took off for the show.  Not a bad place but I am guessing I won't be returning since it's undoubtedly loud and annoying, during their "peak hours" filled with drunk kids who are blasting buckets of cheap liquor and sweet mixers who will inevitably vomit hopefully in a toilet.  Not my bag baby.  But during the day, not a bad place.

It was okay. That about sums Howl at the Moon up. My friend won a "happy hour" here, however, for something that is meant to get people in the door, and woo them to want to come back, it left me wanting.  

For one, the happy hour consisted of two drink tickets, but you still had to pay $1 for drinks. Considering that the only drinks that you could purchase with the tickets were Miller Light, Coors Light or Angry Orchard, that kind of left a sour taste in my mouth. Even outside of the "free" drinks their on tap list was pretty limited. I'm fine paying for nicer stuff, but charging for what amounts to beer pong beer at a promotional event seems out of place. 

The piano play was okay. Again, nothing that blew me away; it was mostly just loud. I did like that the pianist/singer took request, and to their credit performed a Nicky Minaj song on the fly.

Had a super fun Saturday night at Howl at the Moon with my husband and mom! They played many of our requests and the musicians were really talented and entertaining. My only complaint was how expensive it is - we paid $100 to reserve a table because we were nervous about not getting a seat. Beers were not too expensive, but I did order a couple cocktails before realizing they're $10 each (it's not marked on the menu). It's probably worth while if you're celebrating with a group, but next time I'd probably take my chances and just go elsewhere if they're out of tables.

Howl at the moon was one of the best Pittsburgh experiences I've ever had. We went out for my wife's birthday and had a blast! The music was incredible and the talent in the band was unmatched. I loved how they switch instruments every couple songs since they can play them all! They also take requests. 

Now the drinks were awesome as well. We tried every flavor of bucket drink they had and every single one was delicious and just when we thought the drinking couldn't get any better, the girls brought around Jell-O shots in syringes and we bought a bunch of those as well. 

Drinks are very fairly priced and there's a wide variety at the bar. I would absolutely come here again without question.

I came here on a Saturday night to meet up with some friends. The cover charge was $5, so it wasn't too bad. Overall, it was very crowded, but fun! There was a band playing well-known covers, and they continually invited a member of the audience to come up and sing with them. There are two bars, the first at the top, and the second main one near the stage.

The crowd was a nice mix of late-20s/early-30s and older. I haven't seen too many younger people here. On the main floor, there were several tables and chairs, and plenty of seats at the main bar. Of course, they were all taken on this night.

The bartenders at the main bar were the real superstars that night. There were at least three bartenders attending to 10-20 people at any given time. I have never seen bartenders move so fast with accuracy and precision. I didn't even mind waiting 5-10 minutes to order my drinks because I knew they were working very hard. When I got my drinks, they were pretty good. I especially liked the St. Germain Lemonade, which is a cocktail containing Deep Eddy Lemon Vodka, St. Germain, strawberry puree. I saw several people getting buckets and tall bones of cocktails. I heard that people keep the buckets for them to throw up in on their ride home or at home...

The men's restroom was interesting. There were people clustering at the entrance to the restroom, so I thought it was packed and stood in line. After a minute, I realized that there wasn't an actual line; instead, people were watching a paper chess game. There was a chess game. In the men's restroom. I can't imagine how people could be lucid enough to play a game of chess after having had multiple drinks. After doing my business, I saw that there multiple gum packets free for us to take. There was even a "restroom attendant" passing out paper towels, chatting with us, and participating in the chess matches. I thought those were interesting touches to an otherwise bland bar/club restroom experience.

I'd probably visit this place again with friends. While I loved the crowd, I'd like to try this place when it's not as busy.
What a fun place to be! Yummy drinks, live music and happy people all around.
Great atmosphere. The place is full if energy and great adult cocktails. The staff was friendly and ready to pour your drinks. The band keep the music lively and entertaining.

Big thank you to Howl at the Moon for inviting me to attend their media preview with three of my best girl friends to celebrate their soft opening!

I had fairly high expectations going into the night, as I was really looking forward to a new nightlife activity downtown. The venue was a great size for our city and set up well, except that the stage was in a back corner and the bar was surrounded by tvs with sports channels on, giving it a sports bar vibe. The lighting was fun and night-clubby without being too flashy. 

Because this was a media preview night, I felt the crowd was not as appropriate for the vibe and music as it might (and hopefully will) be on a regular Friday or Saturday night. People weren't of the dancing mindset, except for a few individuals. I was most surprised by the music, as it was advertised as a piano bar, but instead delivered a full band that played high-energy pop songs all night. My peers and I had assumed it would be more of a dueling piano bar, especially because they had two pianos facing each other on the stage. The performances were well done and a lot of fun, but I would have liked a variety of genres and moods instead of all fast popular music. I would have preferred more audience interaction, since it just seemed like they were playing a set. Though they did take one of my requests, they did not have any dialogue in between songs, nor did it seem much like improv. This was a little confusing given that they had song request forms on every table.

The drinks were flowing and they were overall pretty delicious. They have a nice selection of drinks for both the beer drinker and those who'd rather enjoy some hard liquor. They give recommended size options depending on the size of your party--the largest being a giant 84 oz bucket. 

This seems like a great girls' night out option and something fun and different to do to switch up the typical happy hour hop around the outside neighborhoods. It's a nice change to the cultural district area and hopefully will evolve into something everyone can enjoy.
This is like Kennywood without kids. Ugliest crowd I've ever seen.  No hope for night life in Pittsburgh.

Cool place. Drinks are not too expensive... But then again Im from nj/ny so Im used to getting robbed ! Staff was attentive and cool. Drinks were always replenished in a timely manner. There wasn't a drink that I didn't enjoy.  We sat right at the bar away from the draft of the door...good fun. There was a live band, three different people
Playing all good! Very talented. Place got busy really quick but didnt feel crammed. There is a bathroom attendant remember to tip them. Also the crowd was just super nice! We had random people come up to us and start up conversations...first time in Pittsburgh but I am in love with every aspect so far

I've been coming here every 4 months for 3-4 years and love this place! They are kind of far from me, but worth it for 1) the service and 2) the price which is nearly half what Petco/Petsmart charge. They treat my dog with such patience. I've been meaning to write a review for years, but when I picked up my Bichon who's been having problems walking and saw they put her in a special sling to keep her comfortable and were handling with such great care, I had to take a second. My dog hates the car, but when she knows she's going to get groomed she gets excited because she knows she'll be pampered. She's scared of Petco after they clipped her several times and I had to have her in the "cone of shame" for over a month while she healed. So glad they cured her fear of the groomer!
This place rocks. Got my two dogs in and out in two hours with no appointment looking happy and beautiful for a reasonable price. Great spot for getting your raggedy dog looking great!

Love this place I drive from southern highlands to get my dog groomed here. She really takes her time and does a good job. She does not over charge and is super friendly. Also, not like other groomers that tend to change the price every time, she stays consistent with her price. Definitely worth the drive for us!

I'm having to change my rating and my review. I've been taking my dog here for a few years and I let the first time they cut him go, but not a second time. It's understandable that accidents happen, but they should at least let you know, so you can properly care for them and you can avoid big vet bills.

Called to get price quote for a shave/wash for my english bulldog. Lady I spoke with told me she needed to see my dog first to quote me, but finally was able to give me an estimate of $40. When I got there after explaining I needed a #4 reverse shave, which he's had for years, she told me it's not possible and she may possible CUT my dog in the process. I was flabbergasted!! I immediately left. If I could, I'd rate my experience with no stars!
Cleaned and treated my cat so special. did not have to wait long and they put cute scarf on him too

The owner and her family are incredibly friendly and accommodating. They always treat our dog, Lacey, like a princess and do a good job of grooming her. Highly recommend Lucky's to any dog owner in the area looking for a new groomer that is also a local business owner.

I was called other places to try to get my dog groomed but everyone was full and I was referred to this place by a friend it ended up being very nice! I really really liked how my dogs haircut came out! Sometimes whenever I take my shitzu mix to the groomers they always end up making him look like a girl :/ even putting on a pink bandanna sometimes ! but this time the lady even waited for me to come on in and ask me how she how I thought his ears looked like I told her that I didn't really like him like that and she went ahead and cut them for me just how I wanted them :) will definitely be coming back here with my dog again! Mayra was very nice! I also really want to buy one of those doggy strollers they have there! Lol

The place is a filthy pigsty. I can't imagine leaving my dog here. I bought dog food here only because the only other place to buy it is a long drive away.  As I was paying, I saw a dog shivering to death in the bath.  They only have one dog grooming station, and there was a dog getting cut on it. I told the young lady the dog was shivering, as it's freezing here today and she replied, that the dog was in warm water, which isn't relevant, cuz the dog was shaking. Cold or terrified, I'd never not comfort this dog.

Can't think of one bad part of our pet grooming experience here at Lucky's Pet. Called JC, made the appointment, drove down to their shop, JC is such a people person (and dogs) both dogs look and smell amazing. Thanks JC & crew... Mindy & Blu will be back to see you again.

We went to their second store located at 5643 West Charleston... Easy drive, easy to find.
I took my Maltese/poodle, she was extremely matted.they took great care of her, and left her really cute for a low price . Definitely will go back!

The phone number goes to a personal cell with no message if you happen to call at 9:35 am so don't believe the posted hours that it opens at 9 am. Call at 10 am and someone answers the phone. I asked for an estimate to bath and shave a 4 lb long hair chihuahua to look like a short hair chihuahua. Was told I'd have to bring the dog for an estimate. I've been here twice before so I assumed that it was a new person answering the phone. I paid $25 last July and October of 2015 for the same services. When I came in, I was quoted a price of $35 and I commented on how prices have increased. The woman cut me a deal and gave me a price of $30. I understand that small businesses must increase prices. The hair cut for my dog was not bad. He's had better cuts elsewhere, but this place happens to be in my neighborhood, is a fair price, and I try to support small business as much as possible. However, I won't be returning as they nicked my dog. See photo.

Don't take your cat here, they will charge you $90!!!
   I have 2 small dogs that have a lot of hair when shaved off and you want to charge me double for a just as hairy cat??
    My 2 neighbors who recommended this place also said they had a very obvious cut/nick on there Lapaopso mix and nothing by staff was said what so ever. They are never going back. Also checked with my vet and no call came in from them to check to see if shots have been up to date. That's illegal and unprofessional. They also do not keep records in any info of animals.
Love this place. Groomers are SO sweet to my pups. Good prices, good parking, decent hours. My dog guapo doesn't like it here though. He doesn't like people touching his paws.

Living downtown in a "transitional" neighborhood has its challenges. Last night I was walking my dog in Huntridge Circle Park (somewhat of a mecca for the homeless) and unwisely allowed him to run free -- and of course he immediately ran into the bushes and proceeded to roll around in a pile of poop. Now, I'd like to think that it was DOG poop...but the unpleasant reality is that homeless people have been caught on camera pooping in this park, even though there's a public restroom right there.

Either way, thankfully we have this AWESOME dog groomer right around the corner on Charleston & 15th, and I took him in for a bath first thing in the morning. I've been using Lucky's for a couple years, and they are a super-friendly, super affordable family-run business that always does a great job...for cheap!

I can't say enough good things about Lucky's! If you live downtown, check it out for sure. And also beware of homeless turds!

Took my dog to get washed, they throw in a nail clipping. Dog walked in fine and left with a LIMP!! Initially I thought the groomer cut one of his nails too short, now it seems as if my little guy lost a tug of war match of his arm with the groomer. He is VERY sensitive when I touch his back and shoulder.. yelping and such.

The lady could not and would not explain why..!!??

Added a pic of patches of hair now coming out as I brush him..

They did an excellent job on my golden retriever who is full of hair and energy. I'm sure she wasn't easy to do. She got a cute little kerchief and smelled like perfume. It was fantastic and all for only $40! Staff was easy to work with and helpful with a last minute grooming.

These people are terrible. I took my two poodles and Maltese dogs here and after I picked them up and took them home they were very scared and nervous and wouldn't move. My Maltese would let me pet him and finally I carried him to examine him and found that he was all cut up and there were blood stains on his butt and personal area. That can leave a dog traumatized. My other poodle got an ear infection the day after, I wonder how often they clean their supplies. His ear infection got worse and eventually he got very sick. My last poodle seemed to be fine but he did have small nicks. They shouldn't have been cut in the first place though, never going back. They never even bothered to let me know this. I will be sure to warn people about this place.

I found this place when I moved here from San Diego and I'm so happy I did! The lady that does the grooming is great with the animals not just mine but she is patient kind and understanding to the animals and very honest. One time she accidentally snipped my toy poodle because he is a very anxious dog and she didn't hesitate to tell me as soon as I walked in and didn't even blame it on my dog nor did she try to cover it up like I've had other groomers do in the passed. Also she does exactly as I ask her to which is very important to me with my babies. I definitely recommend this luckys grooming on charleston!!!!

My Daughter, grandsons and I were looking for something fast and healthy so I Yelped Restaurants in area we were in......the reviews were great so we went with them!! Soooo glad we did..............the service was outstanding and the food Delish..........She and I had the Kafta Combo and loved it!!

One of the boys had a cheese burger (go figure) and loved it too and the other ordered the Falafel (from watching Kickin it) but was not crazy about it (prob too young to appreciate different cultures yet) so Mom switched plates with him had his  Falafel, and he loved his Kafta ..............bringing Dad next time!!

Great food, and great prices.  The family and staff are informative and kind.  The food was very fresh (I watched the lady make my foule and I watched the guy make everything else right in front of me).  

As a caveat, I don't think I would classify this food as "Mediterranean" or "Greek."  I would call their food Middle Eastern and Arab, which is what I expected.  Regardless, it was good.  I think Yelp controls the classification.

Great Food! Good Service! Very friendly family owned business. I'll be back many times! I love the food. The chicken, the bread, rice, salad. Everything is great. Very fresh, quick service and wonderful.

This probably one of the better Middle Eastern restaurants I've eaten at in Northern Phoenix and they are a very nice family run restaurant. The food is great, the prices are very good and it's very fast ... you can't beat that!

What a wonderful surprise, this restaurant was. This is a family owned restaurant and they are all so nice and welcoming. I had the kafta plate which was more than enough food. They do a special trick with the rice which makes it taste like no other. You will have to give it a try.
fantastic to have a true Mediterranean restaurant where everything is fresh and tasty. try the yogurt drink...perfect!  chicken Sharwma was superb. my new favorite local restaurant
super fresh food..great prices. ala carte and entrees both.

Ordered takeout from the place and the food was great. We got the gyro salad, a side of falafel and also the gyro plate! Definitely will be coming back for more! Have been wanting to find a good mom and pops Mediterranean place nearby and this is it! Decent prices for a good amounts of food!

Love this place! Great tabouleh, falafel and kibbeh. Decor is a little antiseptic so best bet is takeout. Family run business which is great. We have generally went to Sabas but after trying Kabob house we haven't been back to Sabas once.

This place is FANTASTIC! Very generous portions for the amount of money your meal costs. Get the gyros!  So delicious. Everything is made fresh to order. Their hummus with the ground beef was very good. This place, while not fancy, definitely is comparable to The Persian Room at a fraction of the cost.

All the food is very fresh and incredibly delicious. I had the falafel plate, which included not only 6 falafel patties, but a salad and a generous helping of hummus and pita. Everything was prepared to order (not ahead of time) and spiced to perfection. The staff were very friendly, to boot.

I saw a sign for this place on our way to the movies this weekend. We stopped by for lunch after our movie.

Place is small and so so. Service was really good.
We had the humus with meat (great idea), hubby had a gyro sandwich (pita wrap) and he loved it. Fries were good too, tasty and crunchy.

I had ordered a cubideh sandwich (wrap) but ended up just eating the humus, and taking the wrap home.

Hubby thought humus was kind of bland, I thought it was OK.  The meat was like hamburger meat but with herbs and spices, I liked it very much. The portion was reasonable (~$8, it is an appetizer).

We want to come back to try the grape leaves, the baba ganoush, and the tabouleh.
My new favorite Mediterranean food restaurant! Great food at a great price. Wonderful customer service. The grape leaves and gyro are amazing

I was in the Kabab House for the first time on Sunday night and I simply loved it. Great family owned business that had fresh food & a great feel to it. I'll be going back and I would recommend it to anyone. Great experience.

So I was super excited when a new middle eastern restaurant opened up within walking distance. Unfortunately, I'm left pretty disappointed.

To the staff's credit they were incredibly polite and the service was great. Unfortunately the food was simply bland, especially the hummus. I'm pretty sure they just ground up some chickpeas and called it a day.  Also the food took way longer than it should have.  The cook must be pretty new to this whole restaurant thing because they only cooked one meal at a time. I had to watch them cook and serve the 2 other people who arrived before me one by one in order.  Given that pretty much everything served here is either already prepared or grilled, they should be able to prepare multiple orders at once.

I'll try them again in a couple months just to be fair, so I hope some garlic and spices finds it way in to their food.
Unhappy about the hours. Change the yelp ad. You guys are closed Sunday! I drove all the way out to get my favorite food to find you are closed.... Common now!!

I am always SUPER excited when an authentic ethnic eatery pops up in my hood. And Kabab House definitely did not disappoint!

It is right by our house and after passing it countless times we finally decided to pick up some takeout for a late lunch.

I ordered the falafel pita and my husband had the chicken schwarma pita. My husband picked it up and said the family that ran the place is so nice. The guy at the counter even gave my husband a free soda because he felt bad about the short wait for food.

He brought our food home and we were surprised when we opened our food boxes with the enormous serving of french fries that came with the pitas. They were piping hot and sprinkled with a unique seasoning. We were only able to eat about a third of the fries, since our pitas were huge as well. My falafel pita was awesome. Very flavorful. My husband loved his chicken pita and said the seasonings were perfect. They gave us sides of sriracha. That is a restaurant after my own heart.

I highly recommend Kabab House. Lots of delicious food for a reasonable price served by a very nice family.
The service was great and the variety on menu good. All food prepared up front visible to the customer which I like. The food was great, be prepared to leave full.

Our new favorite resturant for a weekday date night! We werent sure what to expect at first when walked in. Though we were happily surprised by both the great food and kindness of the employees! We ordered the Gyro plate and the Kabab Koobideh plate. They both came with a generous portion of rice and a wonderful half salad and at a decent price! It left us full but not overly stuffed. We'll definitely be back with friends and look forward to trying more of the unquie menu.

The best Middle Eastern food I've had in Phoenix!  I tried this for the first time last night.  I asked the gentlemen if they were family recipes and he said of course.  I will say, I am incredibly picky about my falafel.  I try it everywhere and outside of Saba's, am consistently disspointed, no matter how good the other dishes may be.  When I tried this falafel, I knew I had found a place for me!  Additionally, the meat was so tender and delicious!  The kabob mix, with chicken, beef and kefta was amazing!  The food is incredibly fresh an excellent quality.  I will agree that the hummus is not as flavorful as some I had, but it was still very fresh.  Since it's a family recipe, I just thought maybe their family didn't like as strong of a flavor to it?  Plus I find most people to think hummus is supposed to taste like the stuff from the market or Trader Joes.  That's not real hummus.

 It was a bit slow in preparation, but they haven't been in business that long, and making everything fresh does take more time.  It's not a nice, sit down dining environment.  Fine for a lunch or whatever, but just don't want anyone to be disspointed if you're doing here for a nice dinner, but the food cannot be beat, so perfect for takeout or a very casual dinner.

Very Cool Mom and Pop restaurant serving some delicious and very affordable middle eastern food. You can dine inside their cozy restaurant or have them fix you up for some tasty take out.

Believe or not we used to live right behind this restaurant before they built the SR51. Sure wish they were here back then. We could have easily walked right up or taken our bikes and had one of those stimulating Green Earth experiences.

Came in here the first time and went with the standard Gyro combo with fries and a drink. Caught an eye of the Baklava sitting nearby and had to also get one of those bad boys. Food was very tasty and I made sure to bring the wife back for a return visit.

The menu is pretty good sized and has all the popular favorites that you can imagine. Gyros, Kababs, Shawarmas, Falafel, Hummus and then some. I also really like the take out menu. It is nicely done and has several pictures of all the different items. Nice!

The owners are both super friendly and excited when you arrive. We even talked baklava recipes for a moment while we were settling up. They make theirs the same way we do using pistachios and a touch of cardamom and a hint of rose water in the syrup.

Right next to the large movie theater in the adjacent Rad Shack parking lot. See you there next time. KEEP IT LOCAL WHEN CAN!

4 STARS

Delicious. The salad is outstanding. The kebobs were outstanding. The humus is bland, bit well made. The iced tea is terrific. The staff are friendly. The prices are reasonable and the servings large. I had to try the beef egg roll; quite different and fun. We will definitely return.
This place is AMAZING and DELICIOUS!!!! The food is authentic and made to order. I would come here everyday if I lived closer. Don't miss this tasty and satisfying new restaurant!!!!!

These guys are great. 

Extremely friendly and nice service. Food is perfect, I wish they would dim their lights and make more cosy atmosphere. The food sure deserves it. 

Anyway, this restaurant well deserves full five stars. 

Food is great. 
Service is careful, accommodating and friendly. 

Everyone should try it out

I read some of the other reviews of Maibach's and I disagree.  I was not dressed up at all when I went in, in fact, I looked like a frump.  They were very helpful, to the degree that I was looking for furniture that was no longer "on the floor".  With that, I got what I wanted, on sale, with a leather protection package, for about $600 cheaper than the tag price!  Everyone was wonderful to us and I will shop there again!

Really great experience with Tammy here. She worked directly with a manufacturer to get me amazing fabric--and really went above and beyond to help me. Very timely, polite, and easy to work with. Highly recommend!

Nice furniture , but if u don't look like a million dollars they won't talk to you. Tried this place twice. The staff always talked to me like they were doing me a favor, that is If they talk to me. Also you should never have to hunt the sales ppl down . This place sucks, never again will I shop here.

I was sitting at my desk at work and a downy woodpecker hit my window.  We have static stickers on the window but it happens sometimes and usually they shake it off and go on about their day.  This little guy was not so lucky.  I watched him struggle and try to come to but after a while I knew he wasn't doing well.  I went out and helped him into a box and brought him in to my office, placed him in a dark, quiet place (drawer), but he was not coming around so I searched wildlife rehabilitation centers in Cleveland to find out if there was somewhere I could take him.  The Google directed me to the Lake Erie Nature and Science Center.  I called and they said to bring him right over.  I loaded the bird in the car and hauled over to Bay Village.  There, I was greeted by a very nice woman who asked if I had an animal and escorted me back into what looked like a completely outfitted doctor's examination room.  Shortly, in walks Dominic, a biologist I assume, maybe an ornithologist based on his knowledge of birds.  Sadly the bird died probably due to internal trauma.  Dominic held him and told me that they would donate his body to an ornithology program for their collection.  I am sad but I am heartened to know that there is a resource available in our community to help wild animals in distress.  Thank you, Dominic and The Lake Erie Nature and Science Center for trying to help this tiny, beautiful bird.  You are a true asset to our community.

I love this place! Such a great place to learn and appreciate wildlife! Great habitats for the wildlife, my only critiques would be the peregrine falcon and the venemous reptiles could use bigger exhibits, but maybe with more funding, they'll get upgrades. Great place for everyone.

Went with my 2.5 year old niece and old people. It's a really nice nature center, basically a zoo, nature center, and kids-oriented play house rolled together. 
So they have a bunch of displays and stuff set up inside, including a giant hollowed log kids can climb in, a bee hive (like an ant farm behind glass), and other cool stuff. Down the hall they have toys and a puppet stage set up. Also they have a bunch of pretty good reptile (turtles, snakes, iguana) and fish displays.
They have a lot of kid-oriented programs and activities. We went to a 15 minute show in the planetarium for 0-3 year olds based on the starry night. It was really good and fun, flashing animal pictures up on the ceiling (constellations) and making their animal noises and what not. Cost $2 - hard to go wrong.
Outside they had a number of animals, including raptors, a bald eagle, a vulture, fox, skunk, turkeys.
Also a nice little gift shop.
Really well done nature center. Can't go wrong for free.

The animal exhibits are interesting and more extensive than the center's modest exterior might suggest. There's an outdoor area featuring various types of birds such as owls, hawks and -- most notably -- a bald eagle. The indoor exhibits include a planetarium and numerous aquariums holding freshwater and saltwater species.

This is a good place for kids to spend their time. Organized activities include classes, day camps and after-school activities.

As other reviewers have noted, this place is a gem made all the better by its free admission and the gorgeous surroundings. The woods and creek are made for kids to explore.

Was very impressed with the information they provide regarding Ohio and the land, animals, insects, and the science behind it all. Was very impressed to learn there was a planetarium. Haven't had a chance to experience it yet but look forward to it. They have a TON of live animals to check out, and, the strangest I've ever seen, an indoor bee hive!!! I was so impressed. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of is its location: I was hoping to see hiking trails that were easily accessible by foot. I'm sure there are some within driving distance, and the lake IS right there, but this place is TOTALLY worth visiting. Especially if you have kids. They could spend hours checking out the different exhibits and they will for sure learn a lot about Ohio and the wildlife that inhabits it.

Fantastically free, fun little exhibits that will entertain little ones (and the young at heart) for hours. There's a room with all kinds of lizards, snakes, and marine life. There are rehabilitated birds and mammals outside; and little kids will love to touch the bunnies through the cage and watch the funny turkeys. 

The tot planetarium shows are wonderful for toddlers on up. There are awesome nature camps and programs for all ages that happen year-round. And, for adults, the planetarium program on Saturday nights followed by the telescope viewing out in the field makes for an interesting, charming date night.

This is one of my favorite places to visit! It's great for all ages. 
Their wildlife rehab center and staff are fantastic! Keep up the great work.

This is a great little science and nature center. Honestly I never knew it was here and it's 2 miles from my dad's house. We go to visit him 2-3 times a year. I happened upon by searching on yelp for things in the area to do. I'm really happy I did. 

The day we visited it was too cold to explore the trails, so we will definitely have to return again and do that. We were lucky enough to be there when they were releasing a hawk that had been there for several months of rehabilitation, so that was a definite bonus. 

The reptile collection is pretty impressive. I also enjoyed the fresh water fish exhibit. My son of course liked the play area with puppets and toys. I liked all the educational materials they provide for visitors, I think they're doing the community a great service here. And I love that it's free for visitors. They of course will graciously accept your donations :). They offer many educational programs here. And the gift shop is not to be missed! We stopped on the way out and picked up a few things. The woman working in there was very friendly and helpful. I'm looking forward to coming back in the summer and exploring those trails.

this is an unbelievably great place - very good for young children to experience animals and learn about their habitats
they also have classes for pre-schoolers - which are the best - they have the best teachers ever - in fact, there are waiting lists for their classes!! If your child wants to learn about the outside world - these are the best classes you could enroll him/her in. The teachers are patient & loving, and present the material in an age-appropriate fashion. They are the best pre-school teachers in the city.
Toddler show was great!  Animals were neat too. Great for wee ones!

A great place to go with young kids to see animals and learn about the environment. We love going here with our 1 year old. He's fascinated by animals and being able to see so many different kinds up close is a great morning for him. They also do some pretty fun activities (planetarium shows for 0-3 year old, classes for pre-school aged kids, easter egg hunt for kids a bit older).

Not big, but there is enough to see if you're in the area. Kids will love it and it's free. Brought some small injured wild baby animals in and they help me with them, they gave them a look over, gave me some great advise and they ended up doing fine and went on to living a full healthy life in the wild.

As a tourist to Cleveland this one is a gem, practically free x it's a non profit so you can donate (since i know what it's like in non profit we dropped 40). Lots of local animals to see....bald eagle and all! I think the coolest part was the bee hive, you can see inside of the hive. Thanks to the helpful staff for telling us what to do.
Underappreciated gem--even has special toddler planetarium times!
This place is fun for all ages.  From the exhibit inside to the menagerie of animals outside :-) it's fun to get up close and personal with the animals, and watch them do their thang :-)

This is one of those really cool mini-museums ("Centers" I guess is what they're calling them) where you can get freaked out by bugs, snakes, hawks, walking sticks, snapping turtles, and other crazy wildlife. I would love to try the planetarium sometime soon. They seem to have a lot of programs at very discounted prices.

Also, admission to the center itself is free! How cool. They also have places for little kids to play, books and toys, etc. 

Located in the Huntingon Reservation off of Wolf Road in Westlake. There's a little picnic area nearby with a huge field.

I freaking love the Metroparks!! It seems as though I'm always finding something new to do.

The Nature Center is great.  Luckily, we live close and can frequent often.  The building houses a planetarium and turtles at one end.  Down the hall is an amazing aquarium with a tide pool.  We love to search the tank for new fish.  Add a few LARGE Boa's, a couple of rattlesnakes and a huge iguana and everyone is happy.  The outside exhibits are beautiful.  The professional landscaping includes a pond with a bridge that the kids love to cross.  Eagle, owls, hawks, fox, bunnies to name a few.  
We always go on a little hike when we leave.  The woods are so beautiful.

**Free to public, but donations welcome!

Plenty of things to do both inside and out.  The programs and animals inside if its hot or rainy, and paths and outside attractions for when it is nice out.

The annual Rubber Ducky race in June is a great event for the whole family.  Jumphouses and carnival activities make for a fun time for everyone.

This center is surprisingly good especially for free. The first time I went here was to take them an injured squirrel from my yard. They take in small animals like this and try their best to rehab them. It gave me a chance to check out the facility though for the first time in the 4 years that I have lived in the area. Since that first visit I've been back several times. Every time they have had little animals out that you can pet like chinchillas, owls, skunks, etc. Stop in for a visit if you're looking for something fun to try -- especially with kids.

If I could give a rating of 0 stars I would. Came in to just my toes polished. First they asked what I needed. Then stated they didn't have time to complete a service so simple. When I told them. So then why ask? Is my question. If your establishment is not set to close for another hour and a half. Bad business and lack of professionalism in my opinion. Will never come back!
The owners are so nice and always take their time!! My favorite nail place in Charlotte. Make sure you make an appointment though because they only have a couple women that work there!

I love this place. Its always quiet and relaxing, no crowds, no making you feel rushed and hurried. The owners are so nice. Its dark on the outside (to block the sun) but inside is clean and calm with good massage chairs.
This place is amazing. Friendly staff, and great services! They take their time and really take pride in their work! I will continue to come here.
Great place to get a cut/style - my wife and I both started going - clean, professional and friendly and it seems like they have a lot of regular customers that are super happy with their hair
Great location, very easy to find! The salon is clean and beautiful! It is a bit pricey but was very happy with the cut and artist.
Was difficult to find parking. But the actual salon was professional not dramatic like most salons

I recommend this salon without hesitation! I haven't found anything close to the same enjoyable experience downtown. It is a beautiful space, everyone is friendly and I love my cuts. I get my hair cut by Amanda who is meticulous. I am also addicted to their hair bling.

There are many things I like about this place, but will try to boil it down in a few sentences.  

For starters, my wife is a customer.  Colours, highlights, blow dry, whatever it's called - she always comes out looking amazing.  

After enjoying her results.. I decided to give the place a try, and have quickly become a dedicated customer.  

I like the overall experience, high quality and assurance that I'll walk out looking much better then when I came in.  From a guy's perspective, you can't really ask for more.

Julia with SkinRN is amazing! She is highly educated but down to earth with a wonderful personality.  She truly cares about the results you want to achieve.  I used Derma Pen and laser for vein removal.  She is professional and honest about what you need and how often you need treatments.  Would recommend her to ANYONE!!

I had such a great experience with my laser hair removal with Julia! From my first consultation, she proved to be an expert in her field. It was really important for me to find an affordable treatment plan without compromising on quality of service.  Skin RN hits both of those marks. The treatments are effective and I am thrilled with the results. And Julia is extremely sweet and makes the whole process as comfortable as possible.  I would DEFINITELY recommend her business.  I have found her practice to be clean, safe and very professional.  My skin feels safe and better yet, hair free!

Julia from SkinRN has SAVED MY SKIN and bikini line. I started going to Julia for Laser Hair Removal on my bikini line and armpits. I have always been insecure about these areas and wanted to improve them. Julia has not only improved by bikini line and armpits, but has made it FLAWLESS in these areas. There are no more razor bumps, or shadows  I feel so confident in my own skin and I no longer need to hide under a sarong. I had such AMAZING results with the hair removal that I also trusted Julia with the Dermapen facial. My pores are nonexistent and it improved my acne scars and hyperpigmentation in one treatment. I will ONLY trust Julia with my skin.

Visited Vegas for my 30th birthday, first time there. Saw the groupon and decided to give a shot. Four guys on a Friday night. We went to Foundation Room, Light, Chateau, and you could take a limo to the strip club anytime. There were about 10 people in total. It was a blast. I was skeptical at first but Ceasar is the man! Really hooked us up! Got us into clubs with no waiting for free and they didn't even enforce the dress code on us and we had a member in gym shoes getting into these clubs were it looks like the dress code is strictly enforced. Drinks were strong and plentiful on the bus and he took us to the Las Vegas sign. 

The next day I get a text from Cesar letting me know that if we want he could send a limo to pick us up from anywhere we want to take us to a strip club with free entry. We were in old vegas and decided to give it a shot at about 11. The limo arrived at around 11:30 and took us to the strip club AND back to our hotel at about 3 am. Will definitely be using Nightlife tours next time I'm in Vegas.

Avoid this company! We bought a groupon and thought we would give this company a try.  We have been on a few other club hopping tours before and this was by far our worst experience.  We arrived at the house of blues Friday night, during spring break and expected to find a happening party.  What we found was that there was 14 people in our group, 3 of which were girls, 2 of those girls were with our group of four! After we arrived we struggled to find the host.  When we found Caesar he acted disinterested and was completely boring....No "let's party" vibe...he barley had a pulse.  Upon arrival we were told that we would be walking to 2 clubs and we wouldn't be taking a party bus until AFTER the first 2 clubs! Seriously?!?  After the first 2 clubs we met to get on the party bus only to be informed that it was running late....this was 1am!!!  Are you kidding me? We felt jerked around so much that we just left. The company advertised a party bus with "complimentary drinks"...what they failed to mention was that bus wouldn't show up until after 1am!!!  It is a complete waste!  I would not recommend this company to anyone!!!  Buyer BEWARE!!!

I took the tour a couple of month ago and had a great time. Unlike other tours we had a party bus which was a lot of fun. The bus had an open bar. At first I was skeptical because there were a lot of people out side of Light nightclub but the host got us in quickly. He really took good care of the group. When I come to Vegas next year I'll go again.

Found this company through groupon. Last time I was in Vegas, I did a similar tour with a different company and had a great time. I bought the groupon and called up the company to make my reservation for a Wednesday. The guy who answered the phone said I needed to email them to make a reservation and couldn't do it over the phone. I didn't have a problem making the reservation and received a confirmation "thanks" email the next day. The day of the party bus we got a text from Cesar who was our tour guide for the evening. It said he was outside the first bar, well my girlfriend and I were there 30 min prior and he didn't show up until 15 after the scheduled time. At which he informed us that there was only 1 other couple for a total of 4 people for the night and because of the small group wasn't able to get the party bus. My whole reason for booking this was to use the party bus and get the open bar because I don't care for nightclubs. Cesar was very kind and apologetic for the inconvenience. We understood it's not his fault that people didn't book it. He gave us 3 options:

1) He would take us to the first three venues and we would skip the  last venue and he would refund us the groupon amount.

2) allow us to join tomorrow's group

3) Go to all 4 venues and take a limo instead of a party bus and still include open bar on the limo.

We chose option 3. Our venues included house of blues at Mandalay bay, foundation room at Mandalay bay, LAX at Luxor, and chateau at Paris. 

We went to the first 2 venues and once we got to LAX they were closed even though they were suppose to be open that night. Cesar told us he would not charge us and refund the groupon but allow us to continue the rest of the tour. 

We got to the limo and it was older and the leather seats were ripped. There was a bottle of Smirnoff and Bacardi along with cranberry juice or Coke. No beer. We took a tour along the strip, stopped at the Vegas sign and the driver allowed us to make a quick pee stop at a hotel. We met back up with Cesar at chateau and were on our own from there. Cesar told us he would allow us to join the bus crawl tomorrow at no charge. 

Cesar was very polite and accommodating. He made sure we got into each venue without issue, he was apologetic for the night not turning out the way it was suppose too.
