Simple procedures have been infected requiring specialist referrals or multiple return visits to fix the problem.  We have opted to change dentists as we've never had this problem previously.  Enter at your own risk.

Once again, I have all high fives for the staff of Impressions Dental. I came to them with intense mouth pain and was seen right away. My husband even called one evening because the pain was so bad and Dr. Baker called in meds after hours. Katie was very compassionate while taking Xrays and assisting with the evaluation. Dr. Baker as always was kind and explained his procedure and conclusions clearly and answered all my questions. Trista at the front desk facilitated my referral to an endodontist and quickly responded to my call questioning whether I should have a second opinion. I may be missing a name here that facilitated my and my husband's calls so I thank all the staff! The result was a root canal and I thank Impressions Dental for promptly being concerned about my pain and moving the process along. When you are in pain, people who care make all the difference!

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.
So where do I start. My son went to impressions dental for check ups in  2014 and 2015.  Can they clean your teeth? yes. The office is clean and everyone was nice. .Now to the bad.  I had dental insurance at all the visits. Before I would have anything done I always asked  what it would cost me. I was told they checked my insurance and i was 100%  covered. The next visit I do not owe any money and everything they were doing  that day was covered by insurance.  Now 2 years later I am getting bills. My insurance says Do NOT PAY.   I was told by impressions dental that they had an office manager that did not know what she was doing at the time and did not submit insurance correctly.  My insurance says it's not my fought and I am not responsible for Impressions Dental not knowing what they are doing.  The dentist office had one year to get the paper work correct and they did not. So in conclusion. 1. When  Impressions Dental tell you it's all good and you are covered by your insurance at 100% don't take their word for it because it has to be turned in to the insurance in order for insurance to pay  2. When you go in six months later and they say you don't owe money and that your insurance took care of it.  Don't take their word. They will send you $ 402 bill for two cleanings and 4 teeth sealants that you were told were paid for by insurance and would have been if turned in. My insurance says the services would  have been paid for if they had got the paperwork within the one year deadline. My insurance did not pay after the year deadline and let impressions dental know they can not bill me because it was a non billable denial.  I would love to support local Dentist and gave it a chance but my family goes elsewhere now and we have not had any billing issues.

Dr Baker preformed 2 root canals for me, both came out horrendous. To which he did not fix or take responsibility for. The only recommendation he gave me was to get 4 new crowns put in! I went to another dentist and they fixed his mistake at zero charge.

OH hell!!
I wrote to the BBB about this place!
I went in and had my teeth cleaned and an old filling crowned. Not bad. Took my son in for his cleaning, and was told he had 4 cavities, and gingivitis??? I was so angry with him, not a good time for him. Took him back and had 4 fillings done, in about 10 min.......
Sent my daughter in to have her teeth cleaned, guess how many they said she had???  7 fillings and the teeth of an older person,from all of the grinding or clenching that she had been doing. NEVER has she had anything wrong!!
Asked for her X-rays, which they didn't send....went for a second opinion, and NOTHING!!!!!!!yes, nothing was wrong with any of her teeth!! No cavities no grinding, nothing!!
WHO does that?????????
Im SO pissed that I paid for and yelled at my son for the 4 cavities that he probably DID NOT have!!!
Totally unethical!!!!!!!!!!
Its sad we cannot trust a so called dentist....

From the moment you walk into the office you feel cared about. They have free water for you while you wait and free cookies as you leave. They even have a game area for the kiddos! The staff is super friendly and always greet you with a smile and a kind word as you enter. The hygienists are thorough, knowledgeable, and always nice. Dr. Baker is the best dentist I've ever been to (I've been seeing him for over 5 years now). I am a chicken when it comes to dental work and his is the only office I have ever felt comfortable at. He fixed all of the work that another dentist had done improperly and poorly (I had to have two crowns replaced and several fillings redone). I trust him 1000%. Every single crown he has done is beautiful and well placed to where I don't even notice it. He never does unnecessary work and I have NEVER had to return to have anything redone or corrected. Their office is state-of-the art with all the best equipment for keeping you as comfortable as possible during your procedures. He will be my dentist for life. I highly recommend this office!

I really like this office!

I have sleep apnea.  Some may know it is a pain to sleep with the special mask and especially difficult to travel with the breathing machine.  It is very bulky.  Impressions told me about a retainer type device that they can make which is designed to help with sleep apnea.  I was interested!

I just recently received the device and it works very well.  They were able to really fine tune the fit, it has made sleeping sooo much easier.  Not having to wear the mask that connects to the breathing machine is very nice.  Also, I'm looking forward to making my travel simpler and less bulky. :)

I had a couple cavities to fill and they took care of them quick and I was on my way.  Their staff are very friendly and professional.  I'm glad I found their office!

I'm truly disgusted by the way this dental office does business.

I came in for an emergency visit on a filling that had broken off. The tooth hadn't been bothering me at all, but I wanted to get it repaired immediately. I experienced no pain, no discomfort, nothing but a rough edge to the tooth -- until I went to this office. Here I thought a new patient coupon would save me money. That was the most costly coupon I've ever redeemed.

So, this tooth-- that hadn't been bothering me at all --needed an emergency root canal, and of course a crown. On top of that, the dentist found a "small cavity" that he put a rather large filling in, yet my second opinion dentist didn't see it on the x-rays after-the fact..The beauty is, the filling fell out just a few short months later. Fortunately, I went elsewhere, because I was fairly certain I'd be in for another root canal after the alarmist attitude Dr. Baker originally took with me.

And, of course, I needed the same kind of over-priced deep scaling cleaning that so many previous Yelpers have complained about. My second-opinion dentist scoffed at it and stated that I had no signs of gum disease and it was probably unnecessary.

I would NEVER recommend this office. And if you're currently undergoing treatment or this office is telling you you're going to need some costly work done, get a second opinion from a dentist you can trust.
Professional dentist and staff. I will continue using them. Very satisfied. Explained all issues and procedures in detail. .

Best Dental Office I have been too!! Dr. Baker and his staff are truly amazing!! The staff is professional and helps me feel at ease in the dental chair. Who likes going to a dentist-not many but I enjoy every visit!! They are extremely through and check your insurance coverage before any treatment, so I am aware how much the treatment will cost and they have always been 100% accurate!!  They offer massage dental chairs, pillows, blankets, water/coffee, TV and headphones while having your dental treatment done, so many amenities to help you relax. My family and I will be patients for life!!!!

I have had work done from some of the top dentists in the AZ valley and just moved to a new area in Chandler. I would never recommend this dental practice to any of my friends family or co-workers. The customer service was the worst I have ever seen. I spoke to the manager and she did nothing but send me away... They won't make it in this business when there are dental practices who care more about the patient than up charging and finding any way to make more money. Impressions  hygienists are incentivized to render unnecessary procedures and might be even getting commissions to pressure you into advanced cleanings "ethically we can't do this until we do this $$$$$$" careful they throw that word ethical around when they want you to cough up more cash. The only good thing about this business is the fish tank. They will waste your time or charge you the highest possible co-pay so they can max your insurance out and have you in a chair for three hours for procedures you didn't even need. 

9/23 After visiting my friendly dentist they told me I didn't  even need the advanced scaling and cleaning. Impressions Dental is a racket.

Should Have Medical Licenses Revoked! 

Don't be fooled by this glitzy and pristine doctors office. Impressions Dental has all the state of the art technology and amenities that dazzle any incoming new patient...but patients beware! This is 100% meant to distract you while the office staff and doctors con you into expensive procedures that are not necessarily needed or even medically accurate. 
I went to Impressions Dental for a chipped tooth. I had hope to receive a routine cleaning and a filling. Upon arriving at there offices, they took me for a tour of all the amenities and services before my examination. Then the hygienist began checking my gums for a deep scale evaluation. I'm 29 and have been very meticulous about dental care and fluoride treatments growing up. I knew that they were trying to sell me a cleaning I truly didn't need.
I could look past that, it was when they did the x-rays I had a knot in my stomach. I was told I had 7 cavities and would need 1 root canal if not 2 root canals right away and they made it sound like I was inches away from having all my teeth fall from my skull if I didn't get this deep scale cleaning. Then the doctor mentioned that when I go to the Endodontist for the root canal I should have him look at the other tooth to see if I needed the 2nd root canal. But he was pretty sure that both were a must fix.
So, I met with the financial consultant to work out how much this would all cost. I made it clear I was only interested in taking care of one root canal right away. She was a fast talker but told me that the root canal would be handled by the Endodontist they worked with and the cap would be done by Impressions Dental. I was fine with this but it seemed to me that the whole procedure would not be covered by insurance. I must have asked a dozen times if this was fully covered by my insurance. I even ask my Mom (who was in the waiting room) to come in and make sure that this all seemed correct. She also told my mother everything regarding the cap would be 100% covered by insurance. 
Well, I'm sure you have guessed by now that it wasn't until after the procedure the next day did they say I owed them 500 dollars. I was in shock. We asked to speak with the Doctor who tried to explain away the mistake as a miscommunication and that "he doesn't deal with the financial stuff." I called him out, who wants to go to a practice where the doctor is clueless about how his office obtains insurance money or charges its patients? It's careless and irresponsible not only as a doctor but a business owner.  All he could say was that this mistake was not his responsibility and that mistakes like that "never" happen. Well, apparently he doesn't know how to operate Google or Yelp because he clearly has not read any of the reviews where patients have also been through similar experiences at his office. Ask yourself; do you want someone with such little regard for how they conduct business working on your teeth?
But it doesn't stop there... When we got to the Endodontist office for the root canal. He looked at my other tooth and said it was fine and had a minor cavity but it was nothing I needed to worry about for the immediate future. I asked if he was sure I didn't need a root canal and he replied "oh gosh no." This got me thinking; maybe I should get a second opinion on my other teeth. If Impressions Dental couldn't tell if I needed a root canal, even with all his state of the art technology, what else could they have been wrong about?
Not to mention, after the root canal during the capping process, the doctor at Impressions Dental poked fun at me for having my mother present. I thought this was extremely rude. I wasn't about to tell the man with a drill in my mouth the only reason my mom was present was because I didn't trust his office or his medical recommendation and it was too late to turn back!  I had just come from an Endodontist office that refuted nearly everything I was told 24 hours prior by Impressions Dental. Like hell was I going to sit in a chair and have him and his staff try to sell me the moon and stars in their orbits, while I was on pain medication from the previous procedure. 
I fully intend on taking my complaint to the Federal Trade Commission, BBB, as well as the Arizona Department of Financial Institutions. Save yourself the grief and find an honest doctor, Impressions Dental is just another doctor pandering for cash instead of providing quality care to patients.

I know they're known for their sandwiches BUT.... Ya gotta try their white pizza!!!!
And Thursday's special is amazing!  
Pizza - salad - soda all for under $20!!!!

What can be said of Primanti Bros. (pronounced "Primanny's") that hasn't been said already in other locations?  This suburban location fills up fast on game nights, offering beer specials and dollar pizza slices.  Even during the day, you'll find it a welcoming place to sit down on the pew-like booth benches, order a sandwich with hot fries and cold tangy slaw inside the rich, substantial slices of bread, and wash it down with an Iron City draft.

For those who have never visited Primanti's before:

1. Don't ask for the fries on the side.  They might oblige, but you're missing out.

2. Don't ask for the slaw on the side.  See item 1 above.  (Though I love a $1.50 side of slaw; it's a light, vinegar-style slaw bursting with crunchy wisps of thread-thin cabbage.)

3. If you're wondering why the menu advertises a "#2 best seller" but doesn't mention the #1 best seller, have a beer and think about it.  They'll tell you if you ask, but it's more fun to figure it out on your own.

4. Don't ask for a plate.  Your sandwich will be delivered on wax paper in a paper basket.  If you want something fancier than that, you're in the wrong place.

We were the first ones to arrive on a Saturday morning at 11am. This was a perfect stop to shake off the cobwebs from a friends wedding the night before. 

I always enjoy the cheese combo. It's served with the best fries, coleslaw, and amazing French bread. For those visiting Pittsburgh and Ft Lauderdale, you must give it a try! After all, it is a Pittsburgh staple!!

Primanti's always provides a great experience.  Whether you go to watch a game with a group or just a dinner, you are sure to have good service and great food.  They offer some great specials as well.

The sandwiches are obviously what they are known for.  The cheesesteak, which is not really a cheesesteak, is my favorite.  The bread is so fresh, fries are fresh cut, and I love the oil based coleslaw.  It all just comes together to make the perfect sandwich.

For those who aren't into the primanti's sandwiches they have plenty of other good food for you.  The Buffalo chicken sandwich is another favorite of mine here.  The pizza is surprisingly very good as well.  You can't go wrong with just about anything on their menu.
Primantis is a must for a Pittsburgh born and raised at least once a month. Also the service is always fast and good. The beer is always cold and reasonable. Try the pastrami egg and cheese.

When first arrived in Pittsburgh, I heard rumors of this mythical "Primanti Bros" and of the brave men who had gone to slay the dragons that lurked therein, only to be dealt ignominious defeat by way of too much food for even the manliest of men to handle at once.  When I went, therefore, I approached the estabishment with mixed eagerness and trepidation.

My greatest fears and greatest hopes were confirmed: food, food, and more food.  Sandwiches as big as your head, filled with fresh-cut french fries, vinegary cole slaw, deli meat piled high, and at least 1000% of the daily recommendations for fat, sodium, and moral fiber.  I plowed ahead, entering uncharted culinary waters for the sake of glory -- and science.  And I staggered out a little bit wiser -- and probably much closer to death by myocardial infarct.  Glorious!

In sum, if you happen to belong to the (apparently very extensive) set of people who (a) value stupendously large sandwiches packed with more cholesterol than sense and (b) do not value their coronary arteries, then this is definitely the place for you.

Service was the best.pizza is delish Always get dble meat on sandwiches, my fav is the pastrami
Wait staff always do an excellent job

Got the Pittsburgh and I must say it was quite disgusting.  I wouldn't even feed it to my dog. For something thats there 2nd best seller i expected something amazing. Barely edible could not finish it. Other than that the staff was very friendly and polite. Just stay away from the pittsburger it's dog chew. Hopefully this helps.

Oh, what can I say about Primanti Bros. 
My husband and I ate there because we were told we had to try it as it's a Pittsburgh institution. 
The fried zucchini appetizer was alright. I did like that it was cut the long way.
The sandwiches were not appealing. I had the pittsburger. The meat had no taste and the fries in the sandwich did nothing but add starchy, film to the roof of my mouth. 
My husband had the Carolina pork, which was better, but only because of the BBQ sauce. 

We were seated promptly, but the server barely looked at us when she spoke and twice I had to ask her to repeat herself. (I do not have bad hearing.)

We ate the food. We didn't die, but it certainly was not worth our time.
Only good AFTER YOU go to the bar. Sober it sucks. Drunk it's great

Looking for a taste of Pittsburgh? Then this is the place for you. Primanti's is known for it's sandwiches which include coleslaw and fries. The back story is that the steelworkers needed a meal they could take with them but didnt need eating utensils and could even eat with one hand if necessary.  Hence the fully loaded sandwich.
I have eaten the Pastrami, the Corned Beef, the Italian, and a few others. They are all good. The coleslaw adds a nice crunch and the fries bring a saltiness. It is a great combination/bite of food. 
Their wings and their pizza are also good. Everyone in the family can find something on the menu.

My first time at Primanti's and I was not disappointed. I ordered the turkey and cheese and of course I could not finish it all. It was delicious though. They have their own coleslaw which has a sweet flavor to it...it's a little strange, but good! Their menu is reasonably priced; cheap if you ask me considering how big the dang sandwiches are! My husband had the Angus steak...double meat. He was thrilled. They even have personal pizzas at this one. It was a great experience. Will always stop at Primanti's when we're in Pittsburgh.

This location of Primanti's gets my vote because of their rocking happy hour (4-6 Monday through Friday).  1/2 off any alcoholic drink?   Cheap pizza by the slice?  Yes please!  I still am partial to the Kielbasa sandwich, which is more than enough for one person, but one day I am going to try that pizza.  For now, it's pretty awesome that I can get three Captain and Cokes plus the Kielbasa sandwich for $13 and some change.  Bar service is good, though it appears that they do a shift change around 5, so there is always a lot of shuffling around that time.
I travel for a living and Pittsburgh favorite of mine! I try to make sure to eat there when I'm in town.

A Pittsburgh tradition. Every time I have a friend that comes in from out of town it is a must stop. They are the innovators of the "sandwich". Its a local staple. The restaurant is clean and the atmosphere is great. The staff is also very friendly. I would recommend.

Ok I have been here twice. Both times were very poor. First time the server barely came by the table and we had unlimited wings. That was a waste of energy. This time the server entered our order wrong and it took over 45 minutes to get the wrong order. Then they remade it and took forever again. Finally the manager or who ever she was and offered to give us the wrong pizza which was not was brought to us the first time. WTF!!!!  I will not be back and would not recommend to anyone. To many excused from the server. I think the manager needs to train her staff.....

Mmmmm, mmmmm, mmmmm.  I heart Primantis! 

My favorite Primantis sandwich is certainly the Cajun chicken. It's a nice amount of spice on the chicken, and it's always cooked perfectly, not dried out or overcooked. The fries and coleslaw on the sandwich make it for me. The bread they use is always so soft and delicious! Their pecan pie is huge (1/4 of a pie!) and pretty amazingly tasty. My kids always enjoy their kids meals and the atmosphere is loud enough to accommodate kids nicely! 

They give moms free food on Mother's Day and dads free food on Father's Day, so it's become our new tradition for me for Mother's Day! Yay!

Primanti Bros. is never a bad choice. Great food and great place to watch sports. They always have good beer specials and recently added specials for after 9pm. The happy hour is always a plus, being half off all drinks. If you have never been to Primanti's before, you must try one of their famous sandwiches, piled high with whatever meat you want, French fries, cole slaw, and tomatoes. The Pittsburgher is their number two best seller, with their number one seller being Iron City beer. If you live in Pittsburgh and have never been to Primanti's before, you should go ASAP.  If you are a visitor, this should definitely be on your list to visit while you are in town!

They did have Dogstyle Head Ale 60 Minute IPA, so good job there.  I got the "Angus" steak sandwich with double meat and the meat was a f-ing dogchew.  Jack Link's would have been a step up.  This is NOT a Philly cheesesteak, it is a Pittsburgh dogchew.  The fried pickles were actually very good.  The cheese sauce must be powder, it is not good.  I don't think they salt their fries either.  Sad, I keep wanting to like this place (3rd visit, 3rd location) because of the history but man that sandwich dogchew meat was bad.  The people here are friendly and very nice.  The service was good.

I decided to give it another try.  I went to this one in Pleasant Hills versus the one I went to for the first time in the Strip. This environment was more appealing to the eye. The sandwiches were still ok. I'm willing to try one more time ..sometime in the future. I want to try the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. Hopefully it's not "just ok"..
You can't beat their happy hour! Great sandwiches! A popular stop for the after-work crew.
Good sandwiches. fries, pickled Cole slaw and tomato on the sandwich. Pastrami or corned beef are popular. Outside seating. Casual atmosphere

I normally stop in this location when out with my mom and sisters. It is easier to get in and out of than the one in Mt. Lebanon for us. But everything about this location just seems average.

It seems like we have more issues with the order or waiting for food here. The quality seems the same as other locations. But there just seems to be more concern here. It may be possible that it could be because my one sister complains more and I go to the other location by myself. But maybe not. I've definitely noticed the issues myself

I was excited to stop in once as they had been running a special I was REALLY ENJOYING. However as it turns out this location wasn't doing that same special as the Mt. Lebanon one was. Here I thought the specials would have been company wide as with any other normal company. but I guess they figured they could just do whatever they wanted regardless. Oh well.

So with the extra issues and not having the same specials this location gets a 3 rather than a 4 that the other one got.

A must if you're visiting Pittsburgh! The sandwiches are amazing, with fresh cut French fries and a vinegar-and-oil coleslaw. If that doesn't sound like your cup of tea, the Smallman Street fries and hand tossed pizzas are great too. 

The staff is great at every location I've been to. If you let them know you're from out of town, the sandwiches tend to be even bigger! I bring all of my guests when they come to visit. 

The only drawback to Primanti's (or maybe a plus) is when a Pittsburgh sports team is playing. The place gets really loud, and if you're not paying attention to the game it can be pretty startling when a team scores. 

Overall, a great place to get a great meal at a great price.
I've never had a problem with service or quality of food. The pizza is good, but not great. Fries are fresh cut, salads are ginormous and the sandwiches are primantilicious
We come here all the time food is always amazing they are kid friendly which as a mom is the best part an the staff is always happy to be there an just really nice people

U can't go wrong here!! There sandwiches are amazing. Fresh bread.. Its just great! Come for a Steelers game pens game or any other Pittsburgh sporting event they usually have $1 beers. AWESOME! $1.50 pizza slices that are huge and they run other specials during games too. There chili is to die for. Try there chili cheese French fries mmm!! My favorite is the Turkey sandwich with chili cheese French fries! You won't be disappointed!

Love the garlic parm wings and this location did not disappoint once again the food was excellent the service was good  EXCEPT...
if you have leftovers...
We had a table of 6 with an $80 bill needing a box for pizza, fries, and 1/2 of a sandwich...our server brought the box for the pizza and 2 pieces of paper for me to wrap a wet sandwich in. I asked what the paper was she said "that's for your take home sandwich" "ask my manager, that's what you get now"...
Disappointing if that's the case, they do have boxes available if you push back.
I go out to eat to keep things simple, last thing I want to do is origami my food container.
Fridays are good for happy hour and food is good too. It can be busy so be prepared to wait for a table once in a while. Or just sit on the back deck.

Great, attentive service with great local Pittsburgh decor - Go Steelers!  The food, traditional favorites that add slaw and fries to sandwiches or pizza, is delicious!  If you want a taste of "Pittsburgh" look no further!

Really disappointing after seeing their sandwiches on TV.
I had the Pastrami with cole slaw. The cole slaw tasted like old lettuce. Maybe it was the vinegar but it was a gross flavor and it overwhelmed the sandwich.

The chili was tasty but not hot enough.

The quality of the Wings was below average although they were tasty.

Our waitress was nice and very friendly.

This place was really good. We went based on a recommendation given to my sister. Since it was 6 of us we tried different things. John Michael was our waiter and he was amazing. He was very attentive. Now when it comes to the food we loved the queso, mozzarella squares, wings and Sangria. Neither one of us enjoyed the sandwiches. We all agreed the sandwiches were dry and more bread than meat. I wasn't a big fan of the fries on my burger but the coleslaw was really good. Happy hour was from 4-6 although the website says 5-7 but I still enjoyed the red Sangria. This was a great recommendation and I could see myself returning especially for the wings when in the area.
I used to love primanti's bros, but I wish the would use fresh pressed ground meat for their burgers instead of frozen patties. It would be SO much better. Just not a fan anymore

Ah, Primanti's.  This place is SO fucking good.  You get your whole meal in a sandwich.  I usually get the roast beef and cheese (with homemade cole slaw and homemade fries in the sandwich).  And it's so big that if you weren't starving when you walked in, you won't be able to finish it.

The fries and cole slaw are worth coming for on their own.  Both are fresh-made.  Beer is usually cheap.  Service is friendly.  Prices are fair.

Warning: There is one in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, but it is not the same experience.

I've been dying to try these guys out after I saw a different location featured on "Man vs Food". The sandwiches, while good, were not as good as I'd hoped. But they are definitely big and hearty portions and decent, just not the best I've had. I had the ham and cheese, overall it was a bit on the bland side. I did manage to eat the whole thing with just a few fries left over (and somehow was hungry again within the hour!).

Service was good, everyone was very nice. I would try them again because maybe it was an off-night when we went and food not as good as usual?

Sandwiches are obviously the best .  But this is about the pizza.  Possibly the worst pizza I've ever had.  The chef boyardee build at home kit is better.  The crust is not crusty, and the sauce is just bland crushed tomatoes.  It's flat out gross.

http://stevelerer.com

While in Pittsburgh for a family wedding we managed to swing by the original Primanti Bros which was a stop by Adam Richman on Man vs Food. This place is known for it's sandwiches stuffed with french fries and coleslaw just like the fat sandwiches from my college days. It is not known for it's ambiance, so let's get that out of the way and talk about the food. Primanti Bros has grown into a chain but I imagine all the stores look similar. It is a wood table and chair place with a nice old school looking bar. The menu is plastered all over the walls and you can only pay with cash. We grabbed a seat in the second section of the restaurant and waited to place our order.

After a few minutes our waiter came by and we ordered. I decided to check out their #2 best seller, the Pitts-Burgher Cheese Steak, and a cup of their almost famous chili. Everything came out together and ready to eat. The chili was a seriously tomato based with a smattering of beans and meat throughout. I love chili and I love tomato soup and in my opinion this was a very good tomato soup. Don't get me wrong, it was a good soup but in the end I am privy to the texas style chili with heavy amounts of spicy peppers and a lot more meat.

My sandwich was also pretty good, some serious after drinking food. The bread was nice and thick which held up pretty well to the wet slaw and cheese. So here is when I admit my failure to read menus carefully. I thought that this would be a real cheese steak but I neglected to recognized the play on words in the name Pitts-Burgher. Instead of thinly shaved meat I actually got a burger on this sandwich. I was not expecting that and honestly didn't want it so my review is a little skewed. While the sandwich tasted good I was thrown off by the burger texture with the cole slaw and the non bun bread. The burger was also cooked all the way through which is not to my liking, as I am a rare kind of guy. I found myself wishing I had read more carefully and ordered the pastrami because this sandwich was not for me. Next time we are back in town I will try it again and order the meat I really like and judge it more fairly. I will say though that I have and always will love adding cole slaw and french fries to my sandwiches!

In the end this was a good restaurant with a strong following and I can see why. Cheap and sizable sandwiches for people going on or off shift or stumbling in after a long night of drinking. Pretty much the same reason why the grease trucks at Rutgers do so well but I will take my Fat Darryl over the Pitts-Burgher every time.

Overall Review: 6/10

I'm not a fan of this place never was. I guess I'm not your typical pittsburgher but someone told me hey they have this pizza night it's cheap. Well i have a family of six so you just said the magic word. I was kind of worried because i thought hey 22$ it must be like little Cesars. Boy was i wrong got a warm welcome entering which gave me hope. Sat down and ordered the pizza feast. Which came with a large pizza a family salad that could be refiled for free. Also for a couple bucks more came with wings. And of course a 2 litter or soda. For 22$. The pizza was amazing loads of cheese. You can pick up to 3 toppings which we got extra cheese and didn't have to pay double like most places. Pep and mushrooms the mushrooms could of been bigger. They were like shaved pieces. But it was good i didn't really care. The wings were amazing i got the honey bbq. For 22$ you get a lot of food for your buck.
Great food and very convenient location. The people that work there are very friendly. And the atmosphere is great for sports games.

Whoa! What a sandwich! This spot was recommended as a great place for lunch and is known for their sandwiches. We were down the way from the location and decided to give it a try. I was definitely pleased with the meal I got!

First and foremost, the place wreaks of PITTSBURGH, which is fantastic if you're a visitor. With memorabilia every where, you definitely know where you're at. The servers were so nice and gave a really great run down of the menu, even recommending several sandwiches to try. In case you weren't aware, Pittsburgh puts fries on everything, which was a surprise for me. I decided on the Capicola sandwich consisting of spicy italian ham, cole slaw, tomatoes and fries (yes, fries inside the sandwich). IT WAS AMAZING! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone that's in the Pittsburgh area.

Doesn't live up to the hype.  The sandwich was "ok".  The wait staff was friendly, and the beer choices are great!  I was expecting that a regular helping of meat on the sandwich would be overwhelming, that to order double meat would have been way too much food, but now I'm thinking a double meat sandwich would just barely cover it.  It all tasted good, I was just expecting more from my friends who swear up and down Primanti Brothers is "the sandwich".  

The fried pickles were awesome!  I'd go back, but I think I got sold a story more than a sandwich.

I've been to several different Primanti locations within the city limits, but never to one outside and that is mostly a sit down/restaurant setting.  With that, I'm happy to say that I enjoyed it.

Within seconds of walking in the door we were sat and our drink orders were placed.  Unlike at city located Primanti's we actually had a menu to look at and I was a little mixed up.  I was surprised by the selections that they had.  I opted for the Coney Dogs.  Interesting way to make some dogs.  Instead of a traditional hot dog bun the use of Italian bread was a great way to go.  The dogs were topped with their chilly, filled with beans and meat.  Then topped with some shredded cheese.  A huge serving of fresh cut fries and a fried pickle completed the place.  

Was loving  the tunes being pumped in overhead, a nice mix of older rock hits that just seemed to be the appropriate selection for such a place.  Sports memorabilia lined the walls along with some Pittsburgh themed items.  

The wait staff was amazing, very attentive and on top of their game.  I can say that I will definitely revisit this location.

Just as I remembered. Took my wife and kids by for a sandwich (as only Primanti can do) during a Steeler's game while we were visiting relatives for the holidays. Nothing compares to a Cap & Cheese, Primanti Style, with a cold Iron during a Steeler's game. Some things just work together...

I can't stop coming here! So freaking good.
They're tots are so addicting and the service is so welcoming, friendly and attentive.
My kids love primanti's! !

The sandwiches are often raved about, and they're good, but I come here for the pizza - specifically the personal pizza.  It includes 3 toppings which makes it easy to order instead of fretting over how much extra an additional topping is.  The crust I think is what makes these pizzas standout.  It also pairs great with a beer and they have good craft beers on tap. At my most recent visit, there was 3 of us and we all wanted the pizza so we decided to get a 14" deluxe which includes 5 toppings. It was large enough because we weren't starving, but on a more usual night we would need to order a larger pizza.  The crust in the center of the pizza was soggy.  This doesn't seem to be an issue with the smaller personal size pizzas. This is a good place if you're looking for a fun time with conversation that prompts laughter, to watch sports in the background, maybe to tell a few exaggerated stories.

The best! The pizza and classic sandwiches are the best. If you live in south hills, follow this advice...make this one of your usuals and you'll never be disappointed. Round out you list with Doridos, Galis, Pan Asia, and Big Jim's and you'll never need to try a new place!

I love the white pizza and the Monongahela (bloody) Mary. Boyfriend always orders the Smallman Street fries & a huge, capicola sandwich. He can finish it every time! Not the cleanest place, but the food is consistently good and the beer is cold. A family go-to!

We had a pizza. Meh.
A colossal fish sandwich. Ehhh.
A fish sandwich...Ohhh.

Food poisoning. Requests to have food removed from our bill (and our memories), and vows never to return.

Our server was very nice and attentive. It was freezing cold in the restaurant and no matter how hard we tried, we couldn't smell food aromas.

It was roota-to-the-toota GROSS.

Want to gain 2 lbs just by eating a sandwich, here you go!
Stay skinny and good looking Pittsburg, or not!

I love Primanti's. Over the years the style and flavors haven't changed at all. Oversized portions for a good price! Coleslaw and fries on the sandwich are a trademark of this place. Definitely a must to go to Primanti Bros!

I'm not from Pittsburgh so when I moved here I was looking for something that was a local staple. This place fits the bill perfectly. Never have I seen slaw and French fried on a sandwich. Maybe one or the other but never both. I love cabbage but cole slaw is not my thing. That being said the steak sandwich with double meat and all the fixings was really good. I'm actually a fan. I did end up taking a bit of the slaw off but thats just personal preference. This is a place I will be visiting again. It's not my Mexican food from home (Phoenix) but its a must have while in pittsburgh.

I had the Colossal Kicked Up Fish with the Old Bay fries!! It was very tasty! I also enjoyed an Angry Orchard that was ice cold. It was very refreshing since the fish was piping hot! Good service and speedy despite the fact that the place was packed Friday night. Will return again for sure!
Our favorite Primanti Brothers in the area. Service is always on par, and the food is consistent here. The sandwich is a 10 + !!!
love Primanti bros.great food. good service. friendly people.
Decent sandwich. I don't get what all the fuss is about. Must be a Pittsburgh thing.

What else can you say about a Primanti's sandwich?? Capicola or egg and cheese is my go to sandwich. What is really great here is the pizza. Hand tossed, great toppings. Love the white pizza with anchovies. Also a great deal on Tuesday nights. Pizza, salad, pitcher of beer for under $20. 
Great happy hours with discounted draughts, slices of pizza. 
This location is a nice one. Outdoor seating, specials on craft bottles on Mondays. 
Nice way to hit the Primanti's experience without heading into the strip.

The food was good, but the staff wasn't overly friendly (well at least not to me).  I guess there were some regulars in there that my server paid more attention to, and was very curt when it came to interacting with me.  I've been to the original Primanti's in the Strip District as well as the ones in Monroeville, Moon, and Harmarville and they all have friendly staff.  However, I guess it's who you know at this location.  Like I said, the food was good, it was clean and the price was right and that's what mattered the most.  I'll just stick to the other locations in the area next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

West Mifflin (or is it Pleasant Hills?) has their own Primanti Brothers franchise. How 'bout that? Now one can grab a pastrami/corned beef monster sandwich before or after an ordeal at the Mart of Walls nearby.

Primanti Brothers sandwiches are often maligned, particularly when consumed at the original Strip District locale, but I will continue to vouch for the suburban satellites for they offer streamlined, more professional service, preparation, and atmosphere. Take your mother-in-law to this one and convert. 

But back to that sandwich on the Italian bread, the one with the slightly sweet sauerkraut-ish slaw, the french fried tater blades, the tomato, the onion...the bacon???

Hence the beauty of the suburban Primanti Brothers restaurants: the menus are more flexible and expansive. If you don't like the slaw, you can leave it off. Do you feel like a burger, pasta, pizza, or a gyro? This Primanti's has 'em, and will bring 'em to your table on that custom, bakery tissue-lined aluminum cookie pan that always evokes sheer comfort. 

And, unlike PB's grittier urban establisments, here one can indulge in dessert. In this case, we went with their...bread pudding? Hell yeah, you can have some of that here (brownie sundaes and pecan pie are also on the card)! Topped with a potent Maker's Mark whiskey sauce and raisins, this tart, spongy, honeyed, wholly housemade end to dinner brings to mind french toast or Bananas Foster sans bananas, if that reads sensibly.

I'm knocking off a star due to a slightly bitter aftertaste left by the slaw towards the last couple of bites. Was the cabbage cored before shredding? That faux pas aside, Primanti Brothers is a surefire way to make me smile on a wintery shopping trip, their sandwiches never failing to remind me why they are legend, clueless haters be damned.
Solid 3.5, amanda the server was so fun on both trips. Food is ok, pizza was good, the mystery meat with fries and slaw was ok.

I just moved to the Pittsburgh area and could not wait to try this place out. On Sunday we were starving after moving all day and driving seven hours, we stopped by for carry out. Somehow we ordered six sandwiches but only got five. We called the place and somebody told us just come by and will take care of you next time. Well I just called and caught a massive attitude from a manager name "Jamie". All I wanted was the sandwich. One on Sunday and one today. But I got nothing, but an attitude from "Jamie". I'm not going to any of the restaurants in this chain if I can help it.

Having to live in Northern Va for the past 24 years and missing my home town the Steel City of Pittsburgh.......this is a must stop for me when I am in town!!!!  Wahoo!!!! I live for this place.  After all these years we tried a slice of Pizza.  It was good!  My wife is from D.C. and now is in love with these wonderful sandwiches of delight!  If you never been in here your are missing on a treat!

Primanti Brothers is a Pittsburgh legend. While this Primanti Brothers do not have the classic appearance of the original restaurant in the strip district it does offer the same classic Primanti Brother food.  I have tried several of the Classic Sandwiches and my favorite is the Cajun Chicken.  This Primanti Brothers is located near our Hotel and we tend to visit several times whenever I am in the area.  We are always greeted and seated promptly and our waitress quickly appeared and took our drink order.  Once our order was taken our food was prepared and delivered quick. As always our food was good and is the reason we keep returning.
Great place to have fun and eat delicious food. The servers and management staff are top notch!

Growing up in the Burgh and IMHO they know what it takes to establish a decent bar and Pittsburgh does this better than any city in the USA. Now the food, decent bar grub and of course they are almost famous for their overstuffed sandwiches with everything but the kitchen sink thrown on there including slaw and fries.

It's the bomb - the belly bomb that is.  Now for the stainless topped bar, very cool and the barmaid working the Pens hockey game the night my buddy and I were there, very cool as well as she was always on her game.  Most of the patrons drinking these 23 oz draft beers, life is good in Pittsburgh.

It all seems to come together here at this Primanti Bros. location in the South Hills.  I enjoyed my visit and shall return.

A Pittsburgh staple, you must try a Primanti's sandwich whenever you visit the city.  I grew up in the area and wasn't much of a foodie in my youth (I didn't even have buffalo wings or Chinese food until I was 18), and I didn't care for their sandwiches when I had them as a kid.  Fast-forward twenty years and I love them... the vinegar based cole slaw is the perfect compliment to their hand cut fries.  I get the capicola with fried egg and it's spectacular.  I can't help but do a happy wiggle in my seat when I have my first bite.  We had Primanti's twice in as many days on our last trip to Pittsburgh.  You won't be disappointed... and if you are, you don't love food.

I had never eaten a Primanti's sandwich before coming in here, and although I had some idea what to expect, I wasn't quite sure how well I'd like it. But I was willing to give it a shot.

I am so glad I did. The restaurant was clean and well-staffed, and our waiter, although not real friendly or anything, was polite and efficient. I ordered a Yuengling which came in a huge .5L glass (a surprise to me) and was perfectly cold and fresh.

I ordered my sandwich with spicy Italian sausage. What came out of the kitchen was a thing of beauty. Two slices of soft, fresh Italian bread, with layers of sausage, fries, cole slaw, tomato and raw onion. It was absolutely delicious! It was filling without being really heavy--the fries are not real greasy and the cole slaw is vinegar-based, not doused in mayo.

The flavors of everything in the sandwich work perfectly together, and my pronouncement upon finishing the first half was that this was easily one of the best sandwiches I had ever eaten.

What I also find impressive is that Primanti's is such an institution, they could put out far inferior food and still coast on their reputation, but far from just being some gimmick, the sandwich is actually really tasty.

Definitely worth a visit!

LOVE the food, service was great. Not going during happy hour ever again. Took my 16 y/o daughter, she had boneless wings with cheese fries, I had the roast beef and cheese. The table next to us was 2 men and four boys who didn't understand how to behave in public. The noise level was overwhelming, between the music, televisions, and all conversations being yelled over everything.

Came in to give it another try. The waitress was nice but wasn't allowed to serve alcohol because my 37 year old friend forgot his ID BUT HAD NO INTENTIONS OF DRINKING. We have been there many times before and a manager could have stopped over to explain. I left very angry.

Thank the stars for Galaxie!  I can't believe this place!!  The most organized store - They sell newer pieces along with every sort of vintage stereo equipment - with beautiful wooden bases - all restored and brought back to life by Vince.  What good luck to stumble upon this fantastic store.  I am about to go back to buy the beautiful "GALAXIE" Speakers - hand made - super sonic speakers.  The story of the local craftsman who makes them - it's just too much - they sound ten times better than my fancy Rosewood QUAD speakers.

I am not an experienced audiophile - and the equipment can be intimidating - Vince made everything easy and was patient enough (and kind enough not to laugh at me) when I came in with my novice turntable problem.  

I brought in a used AT PL 120 turntable - with an upgraded cartridge - as a Christmas present for my parents - but when I connected it to the phono input on the receiver - it was cacophony - I took it to Galaxie - prepared for the worst - and within five minutes Vince sorted the whole problem out.   Simple - newer turntables have preamps which will interfere with the receiver's preamp -  and you have to flip a switch to turn off the TT preamp (hidden under the platter).  Disaster averted and everything working perfectly now.  We listened to records for hours yesterday!!  

I'm so excited to pick up the speakers today and get the home stereo all set up.

Thanks VINCE!!
They fixed my 1970s Technics receiver, and it works like new. I didn't think parts would even be available. And the price was right.

The only place I would go for all of my electronics repairs.  Not only does Vince do a great job, he charges the most reasonable prices.  Never been to a more trustworthy repair shop.  And the location's great too.

I needed to find an honest, reliable and competent person to refoam my 35+ yr old speakers.  I am so pleased that I found Vince and Galaxie Electronics.  He did a truly excellent job in a timely manner.  He also completely checked them out to see if there could be any other issues.  Vince did such a fine job, so I also asked him to check out my Pioneer receiver and turntable.  I then asked him to refurbish my reel-to-reel tape recorder.  All of the work was expertly done and the price was reasonable.  I highly recommend Vince and Galaxie Electronics.  I would not hesitate to have him repair anything.  I am so glad that I found this place !  And it's also great to check out all the vinyl at Jerry's Records while you're there.  They have everything you need.

After getting burned by Atlas Audio, it was refreshing to take my tape duplicator here. The thing just needed a little TLC, and Vince was just the man to service it. He located the problem (which was not what the chumps at Atlas had said it was) fixed it quickly, and provided the service at a reasonable price. He was very informative, and didn't seem burdened when I asked questions. All in all, a great experience. Hope I don't have to get this thing fixed again any time soon, but when/if I do, I'll be going back to Galaxie.

Best place to get your electronics fixed!! Vince fixed my VCR with ease, and the cost was low. He's an honest guy who knows what he's doing. He's  nice to deal with, and he's the owner, who is also the electronics expert!

Excellent service! They were able to hook us up with an awesome turntable with all the audio equipment and stereos for a very reasonable price. We thought we may have to go shop at different places afterwards to get everything we need, but we were in and out with all our purchases from one place. They offered help with anything if we had any difficulties and provided plenty of information to help us pick out the perfect system for us. I highly recommend going here for your audio equipment purchases or repairs.

You want a record player? Yep, you can get one. You need your turntable repaired for a reasonable, in my mind, cost? Yep, they can do that too. You inherited, or came in possession of, your great-grandfather's old turntable console that needs repaired? Yep, they even work with vacuum tube units. 

The last story pertains to me as I took the main unit, which ran the turntable and FM/AM radio, in earlier this year to fix it due to it not powering up. They tested the vacuum tubes and they were still good even though the unit had sat for over 20 years and had been moved to different homes at least three times. A couple resistors, however, were bad and thus replaced. NOTE: It took about a week for them to finish this due to the reason below.

Keep in mind that they are almost always getting in devices to repair and/or sell so it might take them some time to finish your work order. I believe this place is both cash and credit card, Jerry's Records is not. Regardless of which, this is a local business that I will keep on supporting for a long time to come.

Visited Galaxie, Atlas, Vintage Hi-Fi (after I finally found it), and Phils TV to get an idea where I was going to bring my vintage Pioneer SX-1980 monster receiver to get some much needed attention. 
I ended up bringing it to Galaxie. There were some things about the other places that just did not "click" with me. 
It took about 1 month for Vince to email me and say it was ready to be picked up. I was not in a hurry and wanted him to take his time on it and do it right. 
Well, I picked it up last week and I am happy. Everything now works on it and it was done for a reasonable price relative to the value of the unit. 
THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!

Vince did a fantastic job cleaning up and repairing my mothers turntable for me. Planning to pick up a new amp from him in the near future and maybe having him work TL1200 too. They also have great prices for sleeves and slips too. Have bought a few hundred over the past few years.

I left 2 turntables there & expected a long turnaround & got them both back fixed for a reasonable price in 3 days.  Fantastic!  I can't recommend these folks enough.  Unfortunately, they're so swamped with business right now that they're not accepting any more repairs for the indefinite future.  They do have stuff for sale, though, so if you need something they might have what you want for a good price.

Galaxie provides everything you could hope for in a business transaction:

1. Locally-owned
2. Good communication: When my item was ready to pick up, I received a voicemail message including the price of the repair, Galaxie's hours, and contact information.
3. Affordable: My touch-sensitive lamp turned on when plugged in, but the touch sensitivity no longer worked. I had called another repair shop before trying Galaxie, but it was unable to fix that type of problem. Galaxie repaired it within a week or two for a whopping $10.

This is the second time I turned to Vince to fix my hand-me-down record player.  The first time he needed to keep it a couple days to fix it, but it was back in no time and as good as new.  This time,  after a moving mishap sent me back to the store, he was able to fix it right away and I left with a working record player in minutes.  Unreal.  He's so nice and knowledgeable, and not a bit cocky or intimidating.

Gave this place a number of tries. I have bought two turntables here and one cheap receiver. The receiver broke literally the moment I plugged it in. No big deal it cost around $15-20 and was very low end. Two other turntables I bought stopped working within a month of purchase...not belts...not needles, these were replaced and they still do not function. When I bought the last one I asked what his return policy was because of my previous issues...he sort of chuckled and just assured me it worked. I got burned three times and I will not be back. BUYER BEWARE.

Great find ... stopped in to find some new Vinyl at Jerry's, looked in at Galaxie.. blast from the past.  Walked away with a set of Kenwood KL-660's .. got home, plugged them into my NAD Amp, great sound!  Vince was amazing ... super knowledgeable ... tried out some different Receivers and Speakers .. can't wait to go back.  Building a vintage stereo system to listen to old vinyl and some new stuff.  Glad he's here in the Burgh

I brought a stereo speaker in to have a woofer replaced. He had the job done within a day or two and didn't even charge me! It goes without saying that I had a great experience at Galaxie. I would definitely go back if I ever need a more involved repair or am in the market for some stereo equipment.

I brought in a Thomas the Train toy that my kids love. Galaxie Electronics had it repaired the next day. Great prices and very friendly staff. 

The sign out front marks the store well, go up stairs to the record store and turn right, Galaxie is through another door in the back. Kind of a maze but fun.

I had a special request for Galaxie, I wanted them to eliminate the beeping sound and bright light from my air purifier. Galaxie made the changes within hours, and I picked it up same day. Excellent and friendly service, high quality and dependable work. I would definitely go back there and I highly recommend Galaxie. They care about their customers and they care about providing a high level of quality service.

I just love supporting the small businesses in Pittsburgh .

Just got another record player for $70.00 here , and it sounds wonderful . The record store (Jerry's records) was giving away box's of records at the bottom of the stairs. But you have to take the whole box. (100 or so records per box )
I found a few gem's .....King Crimson , Cream , Almond Brothers , Traffic and Groove Holmes just to name a few .. I even got a Mister Rogers LP ! ....Not great condition , but I will be playing them on my new record player.  

both places have very friendly and knowledgeable staff.. Prices are CHEAP .If you have some time to kill , you have to pay these guys a visit.



now I gotta go get some pizza & beer so I can play my records.

Awesome, fantastic, friendly---I honestly can't think of the best word to describe them.  I had bought a Vietnam-era stereo receiver for $2 and needed someone to fix it up before I moved.  The left speaker fuse blew constantly, and since I know nothing about stereo equipment other than how to hook up the speakers, I was a bit in over my head.  However,  I was also nervous about taking it somewhere because overall, it was in excellent condition.  

I finally found Galaxie, and I brought the receiver in less than a week before I was about to move (not the smartest thing I could have done).  Despite the time crunch, they were courteous, looked at it right away, and fixed it up with two days to spare before I left.  Plus, they treated it like it was their own piece of stereo equipment.  Their prices are extremely reasonable, especially with the great service that you get.  

If you have a piece of stereo equipment that you really care about, whether it's a vintage piece of equipment or something newer, go here.  They are absolutely incredible.   

 Plus, if you need some vinyl records to go with your stereo, you can stop in to Jerry's right next door.  Now that's convenience!

Amazing place. The craftsmen who work here can fix anything, hence the wide variety of players they sell, plus cool, modern stuff like this Crosley I just bought from them (http://www.crosleyradio.com/Product.aspx?pid=1686).  I feel really good about how they'll stand behind everything they sell maintenance-wise 100%.  Highly recommend this shop to anyone, even someone who has never owned a record player before (like me!)

I recently traveled to Las Vegas from So Cal with my husband and 3 kids.  My car began to overheat on the way in.  I started to panic and came to Yelp to find a mechanic who, not only, was open on Saturdays but who would not take advantage of my desperate situation. I called Nacho at 5:30 on friday and he was very reassuring.  His shop is open 8-5 on Saturdays. Once we checked in to our hotel, I googled directions and found out he was 5 minutes from our hotel.  We got the car there before 8 and he was ready to accept it even though his shop opened at 8 am.  He kept in contact and notified us before he did any work was done.  We had our radiator,thermostat and water pump replaced and were back in it by 4pm.  We were willing to pay anything because we had no other option to get home and he was honest and did not take advantage in any way.  His prices were fair and reasonable and I highly recommend him to any out-of-towners who are in a desperate situation.  Thank you Nacho for your help!!

I would not recommend anyone going to Nachos unless it is for something very simple like putting in a new battery. The mechanics for the most part do not speak English. I have no issue with that except they are apparently shade tree mechanics. My car was towed there by the Auto Club who said even though he wasn't on the AAA approved list, he was good. This must have been his cousin ! He repaired a transmission seal on my car which became a disaster. Once I made it home on limp mode since he ruined a speed sensor in my car, the mechanic took photos of the lines they had cut in half and then re did with blue masking tape. I still have the photos. Don't go there for major work. It will be done by guys who are not true mechanics and do not even know that you do not cut wires. It was sloppy work and my transmission never worked right again until hundreds of dollars more were spent to repair the damage done. I was taken advantage of since I was a tourist.
Nacho goes above and beyond to service his customers. He provides polite and honest service at a reasonable price.

My car was overheating and I didn't know why. I took it to my usual mechanic and he told me to just change the cap. I  bought a new radiator cap and my car STILL over heated. Ugh. So then, a family member recommended me to Nacho's. 

I went there today and he told me to pop the hood. He asked me a question, "Is the A/C on?" I said, "Yes sir, and that's the only time it overheats." He quickly diagnosed it by looking at the fan. lol  Nacho said my fan wasn't working therefor it wasn't supplying the radiator with its much needed air. He ordered the part. I came back an hour later once he received it and he installed the new fan within 25minutes. By the way, Nacho also spotted other malfunctions that my car has been needing attention but my usual mechanic never advised me on. Bye old mechanic. Hello new mechanic. :)

I drove the whole day through this hot las vegas weather on my 1999 acura with the a/c full blast and NO MORE overheating!!! so happy. 

Fast service, Reliable diagnosis, and will come back and refer friends. Thanks Nacho!
Have taken several of our commercial vehicles and have not had any issues after repairs, pricing is very reasonable.

During Christmas 2015, I drove my 2014 Toyota Sienna van from San Jose, California to Denver, Colorado (1300 miles). On the way back to California, I passed by Las Vegas NV, and my engine temperature raised high, and engine red warning light was on. I realized I have over heated the engine. Since I believe the AAA truck driver is very knowledgeable about car and engine issue, I trusted his knowledge so I asked him (NOT AAA) to recommend a good mechanic. He recommended Nacho Mobile Auto Repair. Nacho (owner) told me that the engine block was cracked and was not fixable, he had to replace my engine with another used engine. It was a big job, so I went back to San Jose and waited for a few weeks. During that few weeks, Nacho kept me posted with my van's progress. Then, I picked up my Sienna, and drove back to San Jose. He even helped me and smog checked the van to make sure it pass smog test. I could feel that the engine that Nacho installed was good, and smooth. The power was as good as before, and transmission was smooth. But, since I want to make sure that the engine was indeed installed well, I had another very trusted and knowledgeable mechanic at Leader Auto Repair since 1995 in Santa Clara CA to double check the engine. Leader mechanic told me that Nacho did a very good job putting the engine together, and my van should be fine for a long time.  So, Nacho Mobile Auto Repair did a good job installing my engine, and I will definitely recommend this place to anyone with engine or car issues. Nacho is honest and he did not take advantage of my situation. The price is fair and reasonable even my mechanic at Leader Auto Repair would have charged about the same.

The alternator on my 2004 Lexus RX 330 went out Friday night. I was referred to Nacho Saturday morning and he had it fixed by that afternoon. Nacho did good work, really reasonable price and did it for what he quoted. He'll give you a free tow and ride home, if you need it. He didn't try to upsell me or bs me on anything else. I'm bringing my 1999 Ford Expedition for a new transmission next, I'll let you know how that goes but this has been a really good experience.
Needed a new battery nacho took care of it, Humberto installed it. All done!

I was in Vegas, to pick up my Sister in Law at the airport. We had driven up from Hemet, Ca. While at the airport my car breaks down, it just died while sitting in traffic going the airport. I have AAA so I called them for a tow. When the tow truck driver got there we figured out the alternator died. He was very helpful in giving possible solutions for us and suggest Nacho Mobile Auto Repair. He said that he was fair, honest, and would get to it right away. It was after 6 pm at this point and he was closed already, but said that he could get to it first thing in the morning. That night we needed to get back to Hemet, so the tow truck driver took us to meet my sister in law at the airport and the car was towed to the repair place. We rented a car to go back to Hemet that night and the next morning I called and talked to Nacho and he confirmed that it was the alternator and he could have it fixed in a few hours with a very fair price. We weren't able to pick it up until just before they closed and met him for the first time and noticed his small shop very clean and well  organized. Not something you come across in small repair shops. I was fully expected to be ripped off and given the run around, because I was from out it town, but that was just not the case. My family and I are very grateful for having met him. I would highly recommend him to anyone that needs any type of service done to their vehicle. He is very rare in the automotive repair business, honest and fair. Thank you, Nacho!

My suburban blew the water pump while we were vacationing in Las Vegas.
I called AAA and originally was going to take it to the dealer. Glen the tow truck driver for AAA recommended Nachos.  Telling me they were AAA approved and would do a great job at a decent price.  I was in a bind cause we were leaving in a couple days back to California.  We left the suburban there, there were closed at the time and left a message.  I called back the next morning and I was told the problem and the price.  I was surprised and relived that he took care of the problem and called me back to let me know it was ready quicker than I thought. Highly recommended by others and now by me. Thank you ignacio for saved my vacation

These guys are the sh*t!  Highly recommended! I drove into Vegas Thursday, my clutch gave out on Friday, googled for nearest mechanic/body shop to tow and diagnose my car. Very accommodating. They were able to get my car, diagnose it, get the parts, worked overtime just to replace my clutch and have it ready by NOON the next day!! I don't kno anyone else being able to do that next day service, but I needed my car by Sunday because of work! So price was worth it and like I said, they will work with you. Thank you guys!

Nacho to the rescue! The AC for our 20 year old passenger van quit working on our drive up to Vegas from San Diego with our gymnastics team. The return trip forecasted even hotter weather so getting it fixed was a must. We tried our best Sunday to no avail. Called Nacho first thing Monday morning and he took the van right away. Replaced a fuse for free, unrelated issue, explained hat could be wrong with the ac very clearly. He was personable, knowledgeable, and I felt he was trustworthy. 45 minutes later our van's AC was charged and running like a champ! The drive home was much more comfortable than it would've been! If I am in Vegas again with car issues i know where I will go and even refer

I had to get towed today in Las Vegas y tbird had a busted hose and coolant was shooting out of it , I got towed to AAA nacho mobile. I really have no choice because I'm new in the city Vegas via Henderson. I wasnt happy it happened on a Saturday but by Monday morning it was ready and while working on my tbird he fixed my dashboard column that's been broke for 5 years. I guy in hendo wanted 500.00 toreplace the whole Column he did it free! And fixed my problem at a fair price. I have I found my guy in Vegas to work on my tbird for sure!

Very happy I brought my 5.3 V8 Chevy suburban to him while in Vegas to have my radiator replaced . It was great price ,service and timely repair took the time he quoted ....  He warranties all parts and labor,Highly recommend Nacho to everyone

This auto repair shop is a hidden gem! The location isn't ideal but the services provided are superb. Ignacio (Nacho the owner) is very humble and takes pride on how he treats his customer. He goes above and beyond and checks for anything else that might need your attention while servicing your vehicle. He'll explain to you what's urgent and what can wait, along with other options that you might be interested in. My boyfriend has used him for 3 vehicles over the years. Anyone looking for an honest mechanic should check him out.

My Lexus shut down just after getting off the freeway from So Cal.  AAA driver recommended this place, where I could probably have it repaired the next day, Friday.  Nachos diagnosed a leaking water pump, and got it done by 2:00 on Friday at a very reasonable price.  Very happy!

After driving from California to Las Vegas my check engine light turned on and my car would shake when I pressed the brakes. I made an appointment with another mechanic for this morning at 11 but he never showed up or called/texted/ emailed me letting me know he wasn't going to make it. I started looking on yelp for other nearby mechanics when I came across Nacho Mobile Auto Repair and decided to call because of good reviews. He was very friendly and I was out in less than 20 mins and only paid $60! Now I know where to go If I ever have car trouble in Vegas again.

Outstanding service is what keeps our family coming back. My husbands family has been coming to nacho for over 10 years. I've been coming to him for over 4 about my car so I can speak for personal experience. It's about time I've written him a review so for that I apologize.

The owners name is really Ignacio but everyone calls him nacho and that's why his business is named so. He is very technical and knows his mechanics. I can always call him and ask him questions as he will answer them or let me know I need to bring the car in. He's usually busy so I recommend getting there early. He's very friendly and answers any concerns. I have called him and gotten second opinions but he had always been the cheapest. It takes him usually about two to three hours todos my car but he gives me a heads up so i can get picked up and got to lunch while I wait. 

Fixing my breaks, replacing my wires, pipes and flushin my injectors cost me 250. Another place wanted 350. Come here for excellent service with someone you can trust. 

There's been times he's driven to our house and fixed our cars, so it's been easy to have our cars fixed without being towed to him. 

FYI, He's closed on Sundays.
EXCELLENT work. Problems get fixed right the first time, and they don't break the bank.

Frank and his mechanics are the most honest people that I know. Frank makes sure you understand what is happening to your vehicle, gives you some options and makes every effort to ensure you get the best price on parts and labor. My mom was going to a mechanic who was ripping her off. I told her to try Cool Cat Auto. Frank confirmed the other mechanic was charging way too much on a recent air conditioner replacement. Frank could have saved her over $500. Wow! Now both of us are Cool Cat Auto Loyal Customers. If you want to get a great deal and have your vehicle fixed properly then this is the place.

I think Frank has to be one of the best Mechanics in town, He is honest, hard-working, super quick, and his prices are very fair. I do not think there is a better shop in town for those on a budget to get their repairs done. I will only go here from now on, and only recommend Cool Cat Auto for their friendly fast service and efficient repairs.

Again I find myself at Cool Cats Auto with Frank and Beto, this time my transmission was acting up. Frank immediately told me that the don't rebuild tranny's and referred me to a shop they deal with. Come to find out it was just the digital sensor (thank God) and Cool Cats was more then willing to help. As matter of fact they were able to do the repair the same day I stopped in to let them know the diagnosis. Better yet they did the repair for much cheaper then I was quoted from the tranny shop. I can't express enough how friendly, helpful, and talented they are at this shop.

I will start by saying I drive over an hour to get to this shop.  The building is older but shop is clean and organized.  The owner Frank is honest.  His prices are very fair.  I have never been upsold.   Recently I went to the dealer to look at my vehicle.  My estimate was over $1,200.  My final bill at Cool Cat was $485. Frank told me that many of the items on the dealer list was not needed.  They even changed my oil for me with no charge. 
The drive for me is worth the honesty.

Frank is so honest and does great work.  I have been there several times now with three different vehicles and the quality of work can't be beat.  I was recovering from foot surgery and barely able to get back and forth from work so the logistics of getting my car repaired was difficult. He went the extra mile and  had one of his mechanics pick up and drop off my car!  A quality job from a person on quality-can't do better than that.

Extremely friendly service! Always gives a reasonable prices and is very honest. I have always got everything done in a reasonable timely fashion. I have been coming here for about 1 year and it has always been a pleasant experience if I could give more than 5 stars I would.

I have been using this shop for over 5-years and the customer service does not get any better than Frank's! His prices are the best and he is always fast, I can easily say I do not go anywhere else with my import or domestic truck or cars! Thank you Frank!

Frankie is the best....his staff exceptional,I bring my vehicles 23 miles one way....Trust is a word you don't hear enough of...I Trust Frankie and the staff @ Cool Cat Auto Repair...
                       Ron(Scottsdale)

I saw Hamid at Tonyc. He was EXCELLENT! He listened to exactly what I wanted and I went from black hair and wanted blonde . I went in with hopes for blonde and he gave me exactly that . He worked magic . He offered me a drink and was so nice I will definitely go back to him. I AM SO IN LOVE WITH MY HAIR!

Being a mall salon, I didn't have high expectations for this place going in. My stylist was friendly and did a pretty good cut and style. What was missing from this place was the "extras" that I expect from a salon of these prices - I was not offered a drink, the stylist abruptly walked to the cash when she was done cutting my hair instead of helping me to disrobe, and just seemed to be more concerned about making sales rather than building a guest connection. Of course, when it came time to pay, the price was higher than what was communicated on the phone when I made the appointment. This often happens at salons like this, so I would be careful to make sure if you are at all concerned about price. Compared to the other mall chains eg. Donato's and Fiorio, this place falls a little short. I probably wouldn't go back.

Amazing genuine service! The place firstly is top notch, very stylish and very modern. I had my cut, color and blow dry done by giuseppe (a very experienced stylist) and he did an unbelievable job fixing a screw up from Donato. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a high quality look. All the compliments i receive makes it worth the $$!

Kayla is the girl you want. When I was going blonde (from brunette) Kayla understood my fine hair and made the highlights SO natural and so fine. Then when I went the opposite (blonde to brunette) she made sure the process was so easy. I feel safe with this girl, and I am so picky with my hair. I have been all over the GTA. Even to more expensive salons in Bloor West. I would recommend this gal to anyone... and have!

Tonyc is a great salon. The staff and owners treat you well . It's a nice environment. We travel all the way from the Beaches to see Kayla  . She is great . She takes the time to listen and understand .

This was a while back but I felt it important to write this review after a friend also got a crappy cut from here. 

I made an appointment by phone to get my bangs trimmed and they gave me a quote of  $5-$8. They ended up charging me $12. But that's not the worst part. When I sat down I told the stylist I just needed my bangs trimmed slightly because they were touching my glasses. I also asked they NOT be cut above my eyebrows. Because I didn't have my glasses on I couldn't see what he was doing and everything felt normal until he started blow drying my bangs.  He kept using the palm of his hand to push down hard on my hair while he was blow drying. After I put my glasses back on I realized why: he had trimmed my wet bangs WAY ABOVE my eyebrows and was trying to smush them down with his hand as it dried!! WTF??? How do you screw up a bang trim??? 

Needless to say I have not stepped foot in that salon again. I should have vocalized my grievance at the time but I must have been in shock.

I write this review about how good James was during my time at Tonyc. I haven't been to a salon in ages so I figured it was time to try it out again. I got colour and cut done. James really listened to what I wanted in my hair and really pulled through! My hair tends to be thick and I constantly needed to get it thinned out. I loved the colour in my hair, it was not a drastic change but I loved it. He was wonderful to talk to and I'm really shy and awkward. He made me feel comfortable with the choices i was making with my hair. 

I will definitely go back to him!

I have been coming to Tonyc now for over a year to see Cherry and I have never been disappointed with her services. I first came to Cherry with really damaged hair from perming and a previous balayage and was worried no one could fix it. I wanted to dye my hair back to my natural color but she convinced me that I would be unhappy with the results and to let her fix it. She listened to exactly what I was concerned about and fixed my hair the way I wanted it with a darker balayage and cut off the dead ends. A year later my hair is back to full health all thanks to Cherry and my hair is exactly how I wanted it! She always makes sure to ask how much I want to cut off so that I am comfortable with the length and has never cut more than we talked about. I have been looking for a new stylist for several years now and never found anyone that I fully trusted and now I have! She's always extremely pleasant and very professional. I highly recommend coming to see Cherry at Tonyc! It doesn't hurt that the receptionist always makes you feel welcome as well!
