The bartenders shared their displeasure, as I probably would too, because of the potential sales/money they were losing out on by serving a VERY small portion of the menu. We felt bad for them because they were very nice and attentive and deserved better. I didn't mention that we had a member of our party who is disabled on crutches before they led us on the journey upstairs. I would never eat here again but it might be a decent pre-game drinking environment on the patio before the game. Maybe next visit.. until then, I'll stick to Padres games in SoCal! This place should take some notes.

Extremely disappointed with the new game 7 apparently the owners wanted a more family themed bar/restaurant which I can understand for pregame and change to menu looks good although I did not get any food. The fun ways of the old beer girls outside with a big crowd of fun is over no drink specials except for Sunday day games supposedly and drinks after the game forget about it since they close at 11 lame but they're loss in revenue, went to Coaches Corner right across the street from game 7 for after game fun and great drink specials. Bring back Sliders I always went there before and after games will not return.

Will not return...ordered 2 small side salads...pork sandwich with fries...quesadilla with brisket...received one salad and one hamburger and quesadilla...what the heck...didn't take too long to get rest of food....don't think quesadilla had any brisket...a small scoop of coleslaw was with pork sandwich..what was that all about ...two stars only because the draft beer was cold and sauces on table were good...had to ask for dressing for salad..Doesn't a server..waitress check order slips when they pick up food...too many other places to enjoy before DBacks game...plus we felt prices high for what you get.

I miss Sliders.  You walk in here and "the right side of the restaurant is open seating, but you can't order from the menu"  the left side of the restaurant is for seating and eating??  Annoying. 

This is not the same "Pre-game" spot it used to be.  $16.00 for a hamburger?  Served in a metal "tub"?  

I opted for the Brisket Sandwich and the brisket was beyond over cooked and DRY!  I mean it was chewy and tough.  The fries were soggy and not good at all.  

My friend ordered the pulled pork potato skins and they were the size of a teeny tiny potato...one that had probably been grown in Smurf village...I mean they were tiny.  

For a pre-game spot that is literally a stone's throw from the ballpark...this place is ridiculously overpriced and not at all the fun hang out it used to be.  

Yes, when I say over priced for where it is and what it is for....I mean over priced.  The quality of food has gone down.  Not to mention, my beer was not very cold at all!  

I would have given it two stars, but the service was very friendly and very helpful.  

Need to find a new place to hang out before the game!

Waste of bar space. Every TV behind the bar was set to a slideshow of the DBacks logo then their lineup. Definitely needs a big change. Coach's corner is smaller, but a lot better. They show baseball games on their TVs
Ordered my food an hour before the game. Got it 5 minutes before the game. Couldn't find my waitress to cancel my order or pay my tab. Terrible.

From the reviews it seems that the owner/managers or anyone working at this establishment do not really care too much that the service is the worst. All because they know, no matter what people will return because its closest to the stadium. The hostess was nice. The waiter was okay, seemed to be stuck w too many tables. The food was cafeteria food. Not worth it. Sadly this review won't change much but if you don't really care and only need a quick beer and crap food, this is definitely your place!

Poorly staffed. Either need to get better quality servers/bartenders and/or just more staff working. Servers were running around like crazy, driving people to the bar to close out or get drinks. Similarly, bartenders could not multitask. It was awkward to watch as the two bartenders looked lost working at snail speed or they would form into pods with whom looked like mgmt for minutes at a time. It took me 10 mins to get a beer. The group of three next to me wanted to cash out to get into the game. That started to build up tension as staff ignored them. Lost out on sales. Multiple groups stopped by next to me to grab a quick drink, all of who just left, went into the game because they didn't want to wait any longer. To add, the bartender didn't know where basic bottles were or if you had them. Lost money! And finally, you are a place right next to a pro baseball stadium and you don't have the MLB package or at least sporting events on all the tv's? I asked about a certain game which I received a swift "no", and left with nothing. Not an offer to change the channel. There was an R rated movie on with explicit subtitles playing on multiple tv's. I couldn't believe it at first. What the heck are you guys doing? I'm guessing because you are next to the stadium, you believe you will make sales regardless of quality of staff and product. Disappointing business portfolio. I won't ever be spending my money here again. The bud light tasted like bud light. That's a positive.

Came here during Dbacks Fan Fest not just for the DBacks Alumni Players signing that was happening on the restaurant's corridor, but also to visit friends who were there and grab a bite to eat during a break int he action of Fan Fest. Well, come to find out they closed the kitchen so I wasn't able to get anything to eat. I was majorly disappointed...that's a BIG fail in my book! 

Looking over their menu ahead of time, about the only reasonably priced item I saw was their salad, I believe a grilled chicken one if I recall...the rest of the items were rather pricey, and from seeing what friends of mine have ordered in the past, they definitely give you your money's worth and then some, but yeah, I wouldn't make this place an everyday stop for food.

I would like to be able to TRY it sometime,, however, so I can give it a "second chance" and see if my star ratings will go up or not.

Took 15 minutes for a waitress to arrive after being sat at our table. Waitress could not tell us what was on tap or provide a list of available beers. Took another 15 minutes for our drinks to be served. Specifically asked for lemons and lime wedges which never came. Waitress never asked if we wanted food. Waitress left an empty serving tray at our table for about 10 minutes. Very unimpressed.
Very slow and the food was ok. Kind of overpriced for what they had. The menu was also very limited. Don't come with kids.
Terrible service. The waitress had no idea what she is doing. Food is just as bad. There is tons of better place near by. Do yourself a favor. Go somewhere else.

The location is outstanding, but the menu is bland and the drinks are quite overpriced. Service is about what you'd expect, but the place has possibilities. I'll be watching for signs of new management and/or ownership ...when I see it, I'll be back again for sure.

We came in after the Padres game a few weeks ago because my buddy wanted to do the wing contest......epic fail!!! Those wings are soooo hott!!! We split a regular order of wings, pulled pork sliders and a burger, the food was great!! Service was excellenct and the beers were ice cold!! This is one of the better sports bars in the downtown area and i would give them 5 stars if they were open ALL THE TIME, and not just gameday!

We attended a Dbacks game and needed to catch a bite to eat since we were hours early to the field. Game seven was closest so we went in. We were seating promptly since the Restaurant was pretty much empty. Our servers name was Carlos and he seemed friendly enough. Most of their food had really sweet barbecue sauce but it was edible. Within an hour the restaurant pretty much filled up. Our server forgot about us and treated us like an inconvenience for ordering drinks, which he kept forgetting to bring.

We decided to move outside to the patio so we didn't have to sit at the table any longer. We split the bill and one of us was charged with the whole thing so they got paid twice. We brought this to the servers attention. He reran the card but when our card cleared we were still charged the full amount. That was a week ago.

Since then I have contacted the restaurant multiple times. I finally spoke with the male manager whom informed me that it wasn't his job and I would have to contact accounting.  He didn't take down any of my info he just gave me another number to a lady that wouldn't be in the office for another five days. 

Since I have been playing phone tag with her. I am still waiting for someone to take my info and I can't get my money back. DON'T eat here... Unless you like crappy service, crappy management, and crappy accounting!!! This is the service industry! I would expect to be treated with some hospitality!!!

I wouldn't stay here again .. My room was stinky and the bathroom toilet was broken the skirt around the bed had dried throw up on it and the breakfast was gross ! 90.00 was way too much for this dump !

This hotel was terrible!  It smelled, was dirty, and the night and morning desk clerks were rude and lied to us.  The "continental" breakfast was some cheap stale white bread.  Do anything you can to stay somewhere else, even though it was very cheap.

For my birthday, my husband asked me to find a motel with a jacuzzi in the room. I called different hotels around Elyria and found that, Best Western has a better deal. When we checked in the front desk person was very friendly and found that the room was ready even for early check in. The room was so clean and even for an older building it is so well-kept. The room was very comfortable to be in as well as the bed for sleeping on.
Nice place to stay, very friendly and helpful staff. The many breakfast selections are sure to satisfy.

In my trip across the country, this was one of the two places I stayed that offered the best value.  The room was very inexpensive, and yet very nice.  The premises were clean, everything was in great shape.  The bed was comfy and the room was quiet.  Wireless internet worked seamlessly in my room and had a strong signal.  The staff at the front desk were friendly, and the breakfast was tasty.

This motel is conveniently located near I-90/OH-2 and the Ohio Turnpike, I-80.  Although it is in a nebulous suburban wasteland between the two dumps of Elyria and Lorian, there are a few places to eat around it, if you know the area.  Not my favorite part of Ohio, but if you're staying here, this is a perfectly fine place to say and I would gladly recommend it.

Stayed here for a couple nights on a trip to Cedar Point.

It is perfectly located between Cedar Point and Cleveland. The highway on/off ramps around the hotel are goofy so be careful that you don't miss your exit!

Elyria is a desolate Ohio town that looks like it got hit hard by the recession. There is nothing left in the area but a few chain restaurants and empty strip malls.

Hotel Pros:
The room was very very clean! I was surprised.
I got a fantastic rate by booking online with my AAA membership.
The staff were very friendly.
My wi-fi worked.
Vanity located on outside of bathroom.

Hotel Cons:
The breakfast was TERRIBLE. This is where they lost 2 stars. I'm not going to lie...I may have booked this hotel because it offered a breakfast in the morning. I knew I was going to spend a lot of money on this trip and quick and convenient free breakfast in the morning was a really nice perk.
There were absolutely no menu options but 3 cereals, mushy instant eggs, and sausage gravy. My friend and I did a once-over and left, in search of a breakfast place.
I will probably never choose Best Western again because of this.

I had been driving all day on my way to Chicago and stopped here to get some rest.  I called while I was in the parking lot of another hotel (I made a wrong turn) and the woman who answered the phone was so nice (I think her name was Donna).  I had stayed at a Best Western on a road trip before and liked the service and their beds so I hoped they would be the same.  They didn't disappoint.  The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and the breakfast was awesome! It wasn't a skimpy "continental" breakfast either.  In addition to donuts, there was pancakes, sausage, hash browns, cereal, eggs, coffee, juice, milk.  It was pretty good, I was really surprised.  If I ever drive through here again I will definitely stop here!
Clean room but no Internet, even though it was advertised as having Wi-Fi.

The hotel was better than I expected. When we opened the door it smelled clean and fresh as so did the bed covers and the towels. My only real complaint was that the pillows  were a little small. The breakfast was pretty good to they had your usual cereal, donut, bagels, toast, what I really liked is that they had a pancake machine that makes you two pancakes in about a minute, they also brought out hot eggs, hasbrowns, and breakfast party's.
This was a very decent hotel, and the breakfast of fried eggs and hash browns was a step up from the usual stale cereal and bagels.

This place is actually really nice, it looks like it was completely remodeled, the rooms are very clean, everything looks new, the beds are very comfortable,  the bathroom is clean, def worth the money...
We had a blast in our jacuzzi suite for New Years! It suggested two people for the hot tub, but we EASILY fit six. Comfortably.

I could not be happier with Apex Dental! Everyone is very friendly and professional. The charges and billing is thoroughly explained so there are no surprises. Dr Wang is extremely knowledgeable and easy to talk to. The staff makes you feel comfortable during your visit. Highly recommend!
Dr Wang and his staff are great... I really appreciate their professionalism, courtesy and compassion... I highly recommend Dr Wang!!!

I had been long overdue for a dentist check up so I was recommended this office and everything has turned out great so far.
I was eased into a plan to take care of some needed and future maintenance, and guided in detail what was to be done and why.
The staff is friendly and courteous, A+

What a great place to get a haircut!  Lori is sweet gentle and has the patience of a saint. Her setup up in her room is awesome she has an Xbox with two remotes lots of games and movies and for the Littles she has an awesome car for them to sit in when she is cutting their hair! So she's amazing hee room is amazing and her talent level trumps it all! She cut all three of my kids hair with no issues we never once questioned what she was doing or if it was going to look okay. Not only that but my one year old daughter that hates to have her hair done or messed with LOVED having her hair cut! She laughed and smiled and loved every second!  I will definitely be back with all three of my littles!

By far the best person to cut our son Andys hair.
Lori was patient and very professional,  our son put up a good fight and not once did she break.
Lori managed to calm Andy down and did an awesome job, my wife and I will deffinetly be back the only bad thing is that we live in LA.
If you're thinking of visiting this place I deffinetly recommend it we are satisfied with the service and the way Lori treated us and our son shes a wonderful person and an amazing kid stylist.

I'm so glad we found Lori for my son's first haircut, and we will be repeat customers, for sure! We chose her first haircut package and it made the "occasion" that much more special. She was so patient and sweet with my 1 year old. He wasn't happy at first but he loved sitting in the car, and playing with the balloon after the haircut was done. We received a certificate with a before and after photo, a small lock of hair in a tiny ziplock bag, and Lori will email us all of the photos she took! This was such a wonderful experience and we'll definitely be back for future haircuts!
I can not say enough good things about Lori. My daughter loved the experience. Nails painted, hair perfume, and sparkles! Amazing.
Great place to bring your kids!!! Lori is super patient and very nice i loved it here!

My 3 year old son hates getting hair cuts. And although he cried the entire time, Miss Lori was so kind and patient with him. Talking him through the haircut all the way to a lollipop and balloon! Lori is very kind and professional, and she even took a picture at the end and will email it to you! Such a wonderful woman!

Lori is AMAZING! I will never take my kids anywhere else. She is so sweet and patient. She takes her time and makes the kids feel comfortable and knows exactly what to do to put them at ease if they do start crying. My little one screamed during his first hair cut at another place. They just held his head and finished :( When Lori noticed he was about to cry, she stopped and let him see the buzzer and put it on her face to show him that it was ok and didn't hurt. She sang to him. She just went above and beyond. Her prices are more than reasonable with all of the effort she puts into it. Girls get a cute hairstyle, glitter spray, perfume and nail polish also! My girls told me that they will not go anywhere else after today. We all LOVE Lori! You will not be disappointed if you see her!

Lori is great at what she does. My son really looks forward to getting a haircut because of her personality and the environment she creates! I'm so glad I found Lori thanks to all the other well deserved positive Yelp reviews.

Took my 2yr old son here for a cut, and he LOVED LOVED LOVED it!!! It's the cutest little place!!! And Lori is super nice & welcoming!!! I brought my 5yr old daughter along and Lori made sure to give her a lollipop and balloon too! Which I loved! Cause my daughter didn't feel left out. We will be taking our kids to her from now on!! Highly recommend!

We loved going here to get our 13 month old son's haircut here!  She was very patient and our little one loves it!  He was scared at first but with the Disney cartoon and things to look at it, he enjoyed the experience. We got a certificate and a lock of his hair. We are definitely coming back! It was a very clean and fun environment.

Lori is such a wonderful person with a native talent. I'm really impressed by the experience we had today. My son was very comfortable in her salon. Even if I have to drive 40+ miles round we'll be seeing her again. Thank you Lori for this great haircut and for being so nice!
My kids absolutely loved getting their haircut here. My 2 year old keeps asking to go back and sit in the race car. We will definitely be going back.

I cannot say good enough things! We took my son in for his first haircut today and Lori was super patient with him and did an amazing job! She sure has a way with kids and it shows in how they interact with her.

Lori's little salon for kids is so cute. She gave my girls a shampoo, cut, style, nail polish, hair perfume & hair sparkles, a balloon, and a lollipop. They got to watch a movie too. She did a great job and I can see why she is so busy!

I took my 1 1/2 year old daughter to Lori for her first haircut and it was wonderful! Her little salon is adorable and super kid friendly! I was definitely nervous because my little rosy doesn't often sit still but she loved sitting in the little race car and watching Mickey Mouse club. She didn't cry or fuss once and Lori  was so friendly and sweet. After cutting her hair she styled it and took before and after pictures and even e-mailed me the rest of the pictures she took. Needless to say we will definitely be returning for Rosy's next haircut!n

Lori is extremely sweet and has so much patience. She gave my three year old daughter the prettiest cut. She loved getting pampered while watching her favorite movie, Frozen. Coming back for my second daughters 1st cut as well.

I'm not surprised to see Lori has so many 5 star reviews; I love my son's haircut and she was great with him, despite his tears (he's 14 months old and hates having his hair cut!). We will definitely be going back; cute little salon, sweet lady, and a great hair cut!
Lori was fantastic! She had mickey mouse on the TV for my son and was so patient with him. He got a balloon after and was so happy! Great experience! Will be back!

Today I took my two year old to Lori for her first haircut. I was expecting tears and we got them. We also got an amazing experience with Lori!

She was so understanding and patient with my daughter. My daughter screamed, cried, tried to wiggle out of the chair, and tried to put her hands up to block the cut. Lori's cheerfulness never wavered. She kept talking to my daughter, entertaining her, distracting her, and giving her a chance to get comfortable. Oh yeah, and she gave her a completely adorable cut. How she managed that with a moving target is beyond me. 

We left with both of us smiling - my daughter with a balloon (which she played with all afternoon at home). We will absolutely be coming here for all of my daughter's future haircut needs. We drove all the way from near Summerlin and it was 100% worth the distance. 

Thank you, Lori!

Lori is absolutely amazing! My 2 year old loves her! She is wonderful at getting him to sit still through the haircut and is so patient with him! She has movies and games to help occupy him and he loves getting a balloon at the end. His hair always looks amazing when she is done. Thank you Lori for being so amazing!

Lori your AMAZING ! I recently move from California .. My 13 yr old son has Autism I've been looking for someone that is patient with kids when it comes to my sons hair cut and is very hard for him to trust anyone he gets very anxious and  nervous ! I went Yelp i read all the positives that Lori had and something told me to send her a message ! Without hesitation Lori said she will be happy to cut my sons hair as a mother she made me feel more comfortable that my son will be ok in her hands ! We got there and I must say my son has never felt more comfortable with any one Lori had an XBOX with games she has her own room inside studio salon that was a plus for my son because he doesn't do well with crowds first time ever my son wasn't fearful of the clippers and did not move at all I was Amaze before he knew it she was done ! You're an Angel  LORI We will be back You're AWSOME THANK YOU THANK YOU

I took my son to Lori for his first haircut and I was very impressed on how good she was. My son was calm and quiet during the whole process. I like his new haircut and it looks really great on him! I will definitely bring him back to her for his next hair cut.

Let me start with saying that everytime I took my 2year old son to get a haircut at another place, he would always start kicking and screaming and crying during the whole haircut. We literally had to hold him down to get it done. So I decided to try this new place and I do not regret it at all! My son was a completley different person. He was scared at first but Lori was so nice and warm with him that he calmed down right away. Lori put on his favorite movie and he sat down in his car chair with ease. He watched his favorite movie while she got the whole haircut done with no fuss. I was completley in awe of how good he was behaving. I was extremly satisified with the whole experience and so was my son. He also enjoyed getting a ballon and lollipop in the end. Haha. Another thing I really liked was the privacy that we had. It isn't like regular hair salons, all loud and so much going on. This was its own room for you and your child.  I will definitely be coming back to get my sons haircut here. I totally recommend this place. :-)

After my daughters original hairdresser canceled on me two days before my daughter was supposed to be in a beauty pageant, I was in a panic to try to find another hairdresser that I could trust to make my daughters hair look fantastic! I had called Lori and a few other places in town trying to get a last minute appointment and, of course, no one could take her! The night before my daughters pageant I received a call from Lori stating that she had a cancelation and could do my daughters hair the next morning! Of course I was ecstatic and took her appointment! Let me tell you how impressed I was with Kidz Cuts by Lori... Once we arrived, Lori asked my daughter what she liked to watch and quickly put on a Barbie movie for her and got right to doing her hair! It looked fantastic when she was finished....  but she wasn't done yet.... She sprayed my daughters hair with glitter (if you knew my daughter you would understand how much she loved this added touch) and finished our appointment by painting her nails a beautiful pink to match the color of her dress! Lori totally saved me this day and saved my daughter from the embarrassment of me having to do her hair myself... Lol! And on top of it all she won first place in her division in the pageant! 
From now on my children will be seeing Lori for all their hair needs and thank you again to her for finding the time to fit us into her busy schedule!!!!

Came here with my niece to watch her get her haircut.   What a unique and cute Salon made just for kids. It's perfect to keep kids who can't sit still especially while getting their haircut. Lots of things in here to keep them occupied and distracted to keep their anxieties down and to keep them put. From the cute little race car chair, the tv, game console, candy jar, and the plenty cute decor all around makes this place perfect and you have the wonderful stylist Lori who is darling to children. What I like about it is its one kid at a time so it makes it really personal.  This is your go to place for your lil ones to get their haircut!

We love Lori! Our 4-year old son started seeing her for haircuts a little over a year ago, and we just recently started taking our 2 year old daughter to her as well.  The kids love chatting with her, enjoy all the creature comforts of her salon (racecar, movies, balloons, etc), and she has a great rapport with the kids (and us!). 

The little things mean a lot when you're talking about new experiences with little ones - she gets it.  My kids are immediately jazzed at the mention of a visit to see her!

Lori was amazing with my 9 month old! My little girl was squirmy but Lori handled it like a pro. She is patient and takes her time. So glad I went to her for her first cut. Lori also has great entertainment for kids of all ages. I would 110% recommend this place.

I sent my husband to Lori today for my 10 month old son's first cut. Having to work, I made sure to tell him to take a picture so I could have the memory.  The two of them come to visit me after the appointment and my son has the biggest smile on his face and a perfect haircut to match!  Lori was awesome!!  She even sent us a little certificate with a lock of hair and his before/after photo.  My husband even took video (I was amazed) and my son had a blast the entire time he was there. I couldn't be more pleased!!  I feel confident we will be customers for years to come.

Lori was AWESOME. I had taken my almost-3 year old daughter elsewhere for her first haircut and she was very scared and freaked out, we weren't able to get her haircut because she was moving around so much. I thought hope was lost until a friend recommended Lori. Amazing. So friendly, my daughter was a little afraid but Lori made her at ease. She picked out a lollipop, a nail color, and balloon color. Lori was quick but thorough and we are very happy customers. Will definitely be coming back!

We have been taking our kids here for over a year now and have never had a bad or even mediocre experience. Lori always does a great job, and her shop is perfectly suited for kids. She has every video imagined to keep them entertained, and balloons, nail polish, and scented and sparkly hair spray for after thier cuts. Her shop is always clean, she's always on time for appointments, and she's super friendly and cheerful. Haircuts have become a real treat for our kids!

If I could give Lori 10 stars I would. Not only does my 5 year old LOVE getting his hair cut here but my almost 2 year old also loves it! Their haircuts always look beyond awesome  and the kids leave smiling. I love taking them to Lori and as long as I live in Nevada we will follow Lori anywhere for haircuts. Thank you Lori!

I normally take my 3 year old son, who is autistic, to have his hair cut by my friend in Bullhead City, AZ.  My friend is able to take her time with my son and cater to his sensory needs which is a must for a drama-free haircut experience.  As much as I love my friend, driving to Bullhead City is not always convenient for me so finding a nearby hairdresser for my son was a must.  After googling haircuts and autistic children, Lori popped up.  I figured, "why not?"  Lori was able to fit me in on a Sunday at 11:30am, major bonus!!  Upon arrival, she was nothing short of amazing!  She made my son and I feel welcomed and comfortable.  She placed my son in a race car chair and turned on Elmo and away she went.  She talked to my son, showing him the electric razor and letting him feel it.  20 minutes later my little man's haircut was finished, complete with a smile.  Thank you Lori for a fantastic job!  I can't wait for our next appointment!

Trying to make a 2 year old toddler stay still while getting a hair cut can be very tricky. My son was in desperate need of one and I gave up trying to trim his hair because he would not sit still. I decided to look up a salon for children and Lori's happened to pop up, I was able to get an appointment for the next morning so I booked it.

Lori is very nice, sweet, and friendly, she has a car that children could sit in while they get their hair cut and also a tv to keep them busy. My son was serious the entire time but he was happy with his hair cut and we were satisfied with how his hair came out. Her little salon is very adorable, it has a happy feel to it, very bright and cheery. I think we've found our permanent salon!

Lori was great with both of my daughters, she had no problem wrangling my 2 year old as well as dealing with my 6 year old.  She even painted their nails!!  Completely worth the drive and she is so reasonably priced!

I loved our experience with Lori. She was wonderful with our son, who is only 13 months and was a little frightened at first. He got a great hair cut and she was very patient. Plus if your child is scard there is a regular chair they can sit in with you. We got the first haircut package that comes with a certificate, picture, and locks of hair (plus lollipop and ballon). She will even email you all the pictures she took. The place was super clean, Lori was great, and we just loved it.

Lori is wonderful!  She really makes my son feel at ease and does a wonderful job with his hair.  Her salon is cute and very clean.  The balloon and lollipop are what my son comes back for, but I'll keep coming back because Lori is the best!

Lori is awesome with the little ones! We took our 4 yo and 2 yo to get their haircuts for the first time with Lori this past weekend and will definitely be going back in the future.

Lori's calm and relaxed demeanor really helps the kids to relax, enjoy their movie, and have a ball in her haircut race car. Follow that up with a balloon and a sucker and they really enjoyed themselves.

On top of that she did an outstanding job on their haircuts. Styled and cut how we asked along with her professional input on what would look good as well. Do not hesitate to take your little one to Kidz Cuts by Lori.
Lori is amazing. She really knows how to be with kids. She exceeded my expectations. My angel had a fabulous time and even got her nails done. Her room is super cute also.
Amazing with my 7 month old !!!! Made a great decision to go to her . Lovely lovely place!

Lori is the absolute best! I took my daughter for her first haircut and it was the perfect experience. There was a cute little car chair and my daughter loved playing with the steering wheel and watching Mickey Mouse clubhouse while getting her haircut. It was so laid back and relaxing and Lori makes sure to explain everything she is doing so your child doesn't get scared or confused. She's is great with kids and so friendly and she even gave my daughter a balloon at the end. Also, there is the first haircut experience so you get a little certificate with a before and after picture and a little Baggie of their hair. So sweet. We will definitely be back!!

Just went to Lori for the first time and love her!  She gave my daughter a really cute haircut. My oldest daughter (5) was too big to sit in the car chair but my youngest (2) was entertained the entire time between the car, the movie, and being able to move freely around the studio. My oldest got her nails painted as part of the hair cut and got to pick a scented spray for her hair which she thought was awesome. I really enjoyed my time at Lori's studio because both kids were happy and contained and we left with a cute haircut for my daughter!

My (typically) shy son who has a super hard time sitting still for haircuts was like a dream in Lori's hands! He felt comfortable almost immediately and she was not only able to keep him entertained with the Lego Star Wars video game (giving him tips as he is a newbie) but cut his hair to perfection despite him bobbing and weaving all over the place. He even got a balloon and lollipop at the end! What a gem! We are so grateful to have found her and plan to see her for all of our haircutting needs in the future!

Lori is great! We used to go to her at sharkys and were sad when we tried to make an appointment with her and she wasn't there anymore. So glad we found her again! I have a 3 year old who has a new fear of haircuts. Lori was so patient and got the job done! She took over 30 minutes and didn't rush. Will 100% be getting his hair cut with Lori from now on! Thanks Lori!

Ok so I read all her reviews before going. I am writing this review on the way home from visiting Lori. ( I'm a passenger) I have gotten my two year old sons hair cut 5 times and every time it's never what I want and looks terrible. So I booked an appointment for my daughter and son today and their haircuts are AMAZING. Better than I could have asked for. My sons hair is blended and perfect and I'm so happy. After seeing my sons hair my husband asked Lori to please do his and she did! And he couldn't be happier. She is so good with the kids and knows what she is doing. I will NOT be going anywhere else ever!

My son loves Ms. Lori! She is the first person my son has never cried for, she's extremely patient with him. I would never consider going anywhere else. We've been using her for a year now and she's always able to fit us in. My son is 3 and refers to her as "the nice haircut lady" and the only one he will go to. If your considering booking an appointment with her- do it! I promise you won't be disappointed. Her cuts are also amazing, anything I have wanted she has done! If your son gets anxious she shows them the buzzer and let's them know it won't hurt them, which is incredible because that's what my son was afraid of. Her prices are great for how wonderful she is!

My daughter had an great experience. Even though it was her 2nd haircut, it really was her first one, since she was too little to remember the first haircut :) Lori was super nice and fun and my daughter loved getting her hair & nails done!
I took my quite persnickety almost 4 year old for his first real haircut (not by mommy) and he did so well thanks to Lori putting him at ease. She definitely gained a loyal customer!
Lori is great!!!!! My 3 year old son LOVED getting his hair cut! He got to sit in a fun car and watch a movie while she cut his hair. She was friendly and fun! We will definitely be back!

Nothing short of AMAZING! Lori was so kind, friendly, and patient with both of my boys. One of my boys was getting his hair cut for the first time. The haircut was gentle, efficient, and accurate. She showed him the buzzer before putting it on his head so he wouldn't be frightened. We all had a wonderful experience. Thank you so much Lori!

We have been to Lori a couple times now, and I can honestly say she is meant to do this!! She is so patient, friendly and loving. She really takes her time and makes sure the child is not scared. My son has Autism and she made his haircut experience very easy! You won't be disappointed if you take your child to Lori, I promise!

Another happy camper. My son can be very difficult - 2.5yo full of energy. FULL!!! 
Lori was amazing - she interacted with him throughout the haircut. He watched tv, rode the awesome car, got a lollipop and a balloon at the end too (and he stole a chocolate). 
He had haircuts before but he has never been this excited while getting one. Totally recommend Lori. 
The only problem is that she is super busy and super booked and it might take a while to get an appointment.

Lori is great! My almost 5 year old doesn't like getting haircuts and she went above and beyond to make sure he was comfortable! He got his mohawk and everything went smoothly. The lollipop and balloon were a definite bonus for him. We will be coming back. :)

There are few things that scare my 2 year old son, but getting his hair cut is number one. He hates having it done. He ends up screaming and thrashing around the entire time. Lori is so amazing with him! She is patient and understanding and just plain wonderful. Even though I have no idea how she does it with all of the squirming, my son's hair looks great every time. We live about 35 minutes away from the salon, but I will only bring my son to Lori and you should too!

Love, love, LOVE Lori.

She is wonderful. I am so thankful I found her. Amidst my son losing his stuff and screaming the ENTIRE time, she stayed patient and gave him a GREAT first haircut! I don't know how she did it?

Eventually he calmed down and they had a better time. I appreciate her telling me to leave the room and stay hidden, because had I not he would have cried and screamed the entire time and nobody wants that! She gave him a balloon, and he even had his 1st lollipop! We will absolutely go to her for his haircuts in the future, and I suggest you do too!

I've had a hard time finding someone who can cut and style my 11-year-old boy's long hair.  Lori did a great job! My son was very comfortable with her and already said he wants to go back to her next time.  Thank you!!!

Lori is the absolute best! My son hates even having his hair brushed so I was amazed how great she was with him.. He was moving a lot and crying but she still managed to do a GREAT job, definitely recommend!! (:

Ms Lori did her thang with my 3 year old son hair...I was skeptical of cutting all his curls off but she definitely put me at ease. I like how she has ways of distracting kids who are not prone or use to getting their hair cut. She made my son very comfortable and he didn't even realize he had gotten a haircut until she was done. Awesome work Ms Lori. We will definitely be coming back.
Just went back today to get our baby girl #2 first hair cut! And as always, Lori made magic with her shears!!! Thank you LORI!!!

Took my grandson to get his hair cut today...he's 7 months.  It was adorable!  Lori is wonderful!  Tons of patience : )  Her salon is so cute and clean.  We had a great experience.  Will definitely be back when he needs another cut. Thanks Lori!

My kids love going to Lori, especially my daughter.   She thinks she's a princess getting her hair and nails done.   Lori is the best with kids.  They feel comfortable with her in her shop.  She's really friendly and has a fun outlook on life.   We always leave with our kids donning the cutest haircuts.  I even got my hair buzzed one day!
Really five stars. Very caring, patient, kids friendly. We love going their for my 6 y/o high maintenance boy. X box, balloons, lollipops,  clean welcoming environment
Lori was amazing.This is the first haircut for my son.i am so thankful .

She is amazing! Our first time going there and my husband gets lost, but she's so nice and accommodating that she still took us. My son wasn't scared or frightened because she creates such a warm environment. We will be definitely going back to her!!
Lori is the best. Great deal, too. Hair and nails for my daughter $20. Very friendly and the place is decorated well. I highly recommend LorI.

Lori is great! !!! I took my son for his first haircut with Lori when he was 1 1/2 & he had a blast! I was so worried he wasn't going to like it but she knows how to work with kids. He loved the car he got to sit in during the service. I love the certificate we get at the end with a before & after picture & a piece of his locks. 
We went for another haircut today at almost 2 years old & he had so much fun that he didn't even realize he was getting a haircut. 
Thanks Lori!

I am new to Henderson and wasn't sure where to bring my little boy for a haircut especially because he is afraid to get his hair cut. Lori Put him right at ease! Her studio is SO cute! She has movies and a little car for the kids to sit in, xbox to play while getting your service!! Seriously, she has thought of everything to make it fun for kiddos! 
Thank you Lori! My little Boy cannot wait to get another haircut!

Lori is fantastic! I was so nervous about my son's first haircut mainly because he hates to have his hair or head touched in general. I was afraid he was going to whip around and not stay still and it would be a disaster. But Lori assured us that her "special gift" was being able to work fast and efficient even when your toddler is squirming. He didn't end up moving too much but she wasn't bothered by any movement at all. My son's hair came out perfect and he was entertained by her tv playing Mickey Mouse Clubhouse and lollipop enough to let her get her job done. I also think it helped that she only does by appointment only sessions and she has her own private little studio room so there aren't any other people in the room to distract or upset your kids. He ended up crying halfway thru and wanting to get off the chair but she was quick and he got over it. So glad I came to Lori and we definitely will be back again!
Lori was awesome during our son's first haircut! The facilities were clean and kid-friendly with a TV for our son to watch while he was getting his haircut. Highly recommended!
If you like iced tea, this is the place to go! They have a really big selection, freshly brewed, that is help yourself. Very cool place!

My girlfriend and I had never been to the shop, and we're not quite sure how it worked when we walked in. The young gal at the counter was assisting a customer with a very large loose tea purchase of six bags at a cost of $80. She never even looked up and greeted us as we waited.  we finally interrupted and asked how does it work here?  she said oh you just pick out what you want and I'll start it for you. Never once did she say there is freshly brewed tea by the glass, self service around the corner. We only found this when we took seats nearby.

I had chosen a tea that was not available in the self service area, but had I known about this area prior to my order I might have chosen an option that was self service for about half the price and zero wait. After tasting several of the self service teas, I was still satisfied with my choice.  It was a roibos red tea with the name coffee cake. It tasted a little like coffee and caramel. 

I really enjoyed the tea, and I love the inside of the restaurant. The decor is comfortable and upscale modern, with a huge display of olive oils available for tasting as well. I think they have a ways to go on customer interaction skills, especially when it was clear that we did not know how the ordering process worked and that we weren't even advised of the self-service bar. If this is their whole concept, and we were clearly newbies, why didn't she advise us?

In summary, I do like the concept, and the Self Service pricing is excellent. If you are ordering coffee or brewed tea expect $4 to $5 each. It seems like quite a splurge for me, seeing as how I have a pantry full of herbal teas. But for a nice atmosphere and comfortable seating to visit with a girlfriend, it is a nifty place.

Closed up shop as of yesterday.

Shelves were being emptied today

Products and Service good based on previous visits, but location Manager/Owner need to get store hours properly listed. Store website shows 9 am, store door says 10 am, Yelp shows 11 am.... Which is it? Showed up a little after 9 am today

Really good spicy chai latte. Worker was kind and friendly...Whoever was working Wednesday afternoon, you were really nice..thanks! If I lived closer I would be there every morning.

The smell when you walk in is really nice and everything is clean. Bathroom is well-designed, too!

One of the best tea places I've been to. Love the multitude of loose leaf options and other drink options. The staff is very helpful and the teas on the wall are labeled by category so you can find teas that relax, energize, boost health, etc. Great atmosphere too! Very open, clean with a fun industrial/rustic appeal.

Finally made it in. Need to spend some dedicated time there but like what I see so far. Service was very friendly and helpful. Took a great iced tea to go - lots of great choices available that day. Glad it's close by!
The woman working on 7/19 was so sweet and helpful. Plenty of tea to pick from. Definitely going to come here more often!

Delicious tea, better than most teas that I've ever had. Great smoothies and milk teas with boba as well. Same is to be said about the staff. Truly more friendly and helpful than most stores I've ever been to, bar none. The environment is very trendy and inviting. Highly recommend over something more chain like such as the usual Starbucks or Dutch bros.

Super friendly staff and delicious drinks! We got the sweet chai with almond milk and the spiced cookie latte with almond milk, both iced. The sweet chai was AMAZING, as was the spiced cookie latte, although I think it would've been better hot (I know for next time). Great atmosphere and I can't wait to buy some of the loose tea.

I'm in town visiting and I'm really glad I found this place! It's been very difficult to find a decent tea shop in Phoenix, most of the tea shops I've been to can't even prepare tea properly. I was definitely impressed with Tea2go. They have a good selection of loose leaf teas and while I'm not the biggest fan of flavored teas they still had plenty of options for just straight tea. They can also prepare the teas latte style which I love. I wouldn't say these are the most high quality teas for a true tea connoisseur but if you are looking for a decent cup of tea this is the place. They also have excellent customer service, Jordana (I believe that was her name) was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Phoenix!

Tea Please! That's what I say when I drop in at Tea2go. Fresh herbal teas hot and cold. Varies flavors based on your tastebuds and needs. A dynamic concept of organic teas that taste amazing. I am not a fan of bag tea's so dropping in to grab a tea 2 go makes my day. I do have to wait since it is freshly brewed however the tasty tempting olive oils make it worth the wait. I am planning a day to come in and really spend some time. There are so many wonderful olive oil flavors to choose from including ones that I have never heard of before. 

Now the real tempting part is the tasty treats. Unlike Starbucks they are made in house. Today they had peppermint brownies which are my ultimate favorite but since I am trying to be good I settled with the gingersnap cookies. I bought three of them and they did not make it back to the office. Can't wait to try the other bake goods they offer.

Let me mention they have a Tea Bar. That's right fresh brewed flavored tea with an ice machine next to it. Need to flavor it up they have sweeter to help give it a little sweetness if needed.  

Sitting area to enjoy your drink or have a small one on one meeting. Staff is friendly, informative and helpful. Be sure to stop in and ENJOY!
Love the tea bar but the service is awful. Employees never know how to answer my questions and the times on Yelp are always wrong! This is the 3rd time I came and they were closed.

Really nice addition to high street. No better way to start off an afternoon of driving around in the Arizona heat then a 44oz ice tea. 

The staff is really nice and helpful. Very knowledgeable about tea. Jordanna had me try chocolate mocha / Carmel Java which was a complete surprise. My taste buds couldn't decide if I was drinking coffee or tea. 

Keep up the good work!

I popped into Tea2Go to grab a quick, cold beverage after running around in the AZ heat all day. Their concept is amazing and you can choose an organic loose leaf tea selection from their wall full of SO many flavors. {See Pic! & they will even let you smell them before choosing!} The prices were definitely reasonable and the portions were very large! It was literally the perfect refreshment during a hot summer day. Dear HQ, Please open a store closer to Old Town Scottsdale/Camelback Corridor area!! :) I would absolutely be a regular! They also have already brewed selections for a little bit cheaper if you wanted to quickly fill up a cup that way! If you're on High Street, stopping into Tea2Go for a cold or hot beverage is a must!

This tea shop is located in the high street where parking can be a hassle. I called and came on several occasions to see if they had boba tea but they're always out. When they offered me jelly, I thought they were going to have grass jelly like boba shops but they pulled out something super colorful. I had settled with the Thai tea which was way too sweet.

This place is great, you can choose from their iced tea bar with several black and green tea selections or have them freshly brew whatever tea or coffee you want. They also have an olive oil bar. Love this place! Located on High Street right off the 101 and 56th street.
Tea2go I am obsessed enough said I always look forward to getting my tea here.  Best in town!!

Wonderful place to visit!  My daughter recommended it to me, and right away realized it's unique offerings. My first visit was a delicious nutty-flavored coffee, second and third stops were the Coconut Creme Iced tea from the tea bar--OMG AMAZING!   Very friendly barista, too.

I'm a little ashamed it took me so long to get to this great little Tea place which is a stone's throw from my office.  You can't walk around our office of 300 plus employees and not see multiple cups of tea from Tea2Go.  And since I'm a huge lover of tea, you'd think I'd be the Duke of this place-I will be shortly.

This is a super place to get in all likelihood, the finest tea in Phoenix.  They have approximately 16 blends, some sweetened, some not, on tap.  Grab a large cup and go to town!  Even better, wash the cup out and bring it back for a discounted refill.  I understand you can also pick out some loose tea and have them brew it for you, sounds like a plan!

This is also the place to grab some amazing flavored Olive Oils and Balsamic Vinegars. If you think 16 variety of teas is impressive, check out the oils and vinegars, all kinds for all types of tastes.  The hottest oil is Harissa, can't wait to try it!

If a cup of Joe is more your liking, they have you covered there as well-no need for Starbucks on High Street.

Amazing tea! I went here with my mom today for some tea and wow we were so pleased. It was not busy at all and actually really spacious which was surprising to me! Would be a good place to come and study, not too loud or crowded.
The tea selection is huge which is awesome, I had a hard time choosing. There's a big wall of the loose leaf teas and you can smell them. They have so many I was surprised to see it! Also being able to smell definitely helped my decision. I went for green pomegranate mojito tea and it was sooo good. I got it iced, took a long time to prepare kind of, but it's nice that they have some already prepared read in the back! My mom got a coconut chai and it was really great! Also the "small" size is huge and reasonably priced. Love it here and can't wait to try more. I certainly have a new favorite tea joint!
The most amazing iced tea bar. What a perfect concept for AZ. I love this place. I go every week.

I absolutely love this place. Starting off customer service is spot on. Brea has helped me several times and has always been super knowledgeable and friendly. The best part about Tea2Gois you can smell the Tea prior to ordering them. If you don't have the time to have a tea brewed they have a wall of ready to go Ice Teas. I also like that they have a good rewards program and give you discounts for bringing back your cups. You have the options of ginger lime, lemon and coconut sugar. 
My personal recommendations on tea would be the pomegranate blue or the Yoga tea unsweetened if you want to add sugar to it I would recommend the ginger sugar. Yum!

Love this little place! The flavored organic berry sugars(which they will add to any tea) are located behind the counter. 
There are about two dozen times of ice teas steeped daily, 20 custom Evo oils and lots of loose leaf teas. 
 
Discount if you bring back your empty ice tea cup.

Good place to enjoy a quiet afternoon tea with friends.
This place is awesome!! So many teas! There is a tea bar and hundreds of loose leaf options too. Black, white, green, whatever you're in the mood for! Would totally recommend!
It's great but they need to update their hours on here. They close at 6 on week days I believe and 5 on weekends. I'd still recommend this place
This has become an almost daily habit! Fresh tea and a great variety, don't care for coffee so this is a great alternative.

Clean and fresh look/atmosphere.  Don't love the current hours.  Not even a huge tea fan, but I could see this place really swinging me away from my standard ice coffee.  Reasonable prices, with great loyalty program and refill policy.  Owner/staff very friendly/knowledgable about products.

We went in for coffee before heading off to apartment shop. We are new to the area and the owner took the time to educate us about the different areas we would want to look at and how the commute to work would be from the different locations. On top of owner being very personable the coffee was great!
I love this place and the staff makes it all the more worthwhile to visit! With so many options I need to venture outside my comfort zone of pomegranate mojito green tea; I just love it though!

The staff is super friendly! If you come here enough they'll even remember your name and order! I love the yoga tea, but almost everything I've had has been great. There's a huge selection of teas, but they have coffee and smoothies as well. Prices are better than Starbucks and the lines are shorter too!

Our office is not only a big fan of their teas, but we have also enjoyed utilizing their gift cards as a thank you for colleagues.  Their loose leaf teas are delicious, good quality, and varied!  What a nice change from Starbucks!

Extremely slow, I went to school around here also and very slow and sometimes kinda rude. Years ago we also found bugs and what not crawling up the walls and stuff and of course it has gotten cleaner but still. Overall the service is extremely slow, the shawarma lady took her time making her friends shawarma by talking to her about random crap but at the same time taking her time actually making the food. Like people want food and to leave, but the food is pretty good. If you're looking for a quick place to eat, this is not the place.

I always come to this place to buy shawarma sandwiches and usually the service is good.  Unfortunately, there was a new sandwich maker and she was really something...  I asked for a falafel dinner and she tells me that there are no more falafel available... only chicken.. (it was 6:30pm).  I got upset at her tone and so I just order a caesar salad for my girlfriend.  The gentlemen that took my order did not pay attention to what I said about adding extra chicken and 25 minutes later my caesar salad was ready.  I didnt know it took 25 minutes to make a caesar salad without the chicken and bacon bits (it was missing).  In addition,  another customer walked in, a white gentlemen, he ordered a falafel sandwich and the lady agreed to make his sandwich but replied to him in a really rude fashion...  It really sucks that this place is hiring people who dont want to even give good service to customers..  I will not be coming back... fix your service and treat your customers right because we are the ones paying your paycheques.
Really good pizza and fries! & panini! Super big portions and cheap! I always order delivery here and they are always early which is amazing! Will be ordering lots!

I'm giving this place a four stars for the quality of their food.
Their pizzas are delicious and inexpensive compared to what you would pay at Pizza Nova or even Pizza Pizza. A large deluxe pizza can cost you $15.00 and you get three sodas or your chose or sauces. The only thing that I would like to see is them including pizzas with the cheese crusts but that might be too fancy for a place like this.

Having said that, I would give them two stars for their establishment. Every time that I go there to pick up my pizza, I see the same guys sitting around drinking and being loud and they completely ruin the atmosphere. If the owner is reading this, please ban these people or put a limit on alcohol purchases so that we can eat our food in peace because until then I am always going to take my food to go.

Cheers!
JF

VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. I called ahead of time to place my order for pick up. When I arrived my pizza was not ready yet.  As I was waiting, another customer walked in and ordered the same exact pizza and received his order before I did. When I complained that I had ordered well ahead of him and questioned why he would get his order first, I was given tons of excuses, none of which made any sense whatsoever, and absolutely no apologies. When I reiterated that they have terrible customer service and that I would not be returning, I was once again given invalid excuses as to why he was served first and no attempts to rectify the situation! If they would like to keep their customers, they need to learn how to manage their orders properly and have some integrity when they mess up.  We have gone here a number of times and this experience has completely ruined it for me.  We do not plan to ever go back here!

Waited to order and the staff were arguing and went behind the doors and when they fi ally came out they asked the customer behind me for their order... it was very strange... they said i was there 1st and they still ignored me... maybe they thought i was a student but i was so turned off by this behaviour i left and will refuse to go again. The worst showcase of service i have ever experienced

We live nearby and I enjoy bringing my daughter there for a pizza (ask for a fresh one, not a slice that's been sitting there all day). Depending on who is cooking it, the dough is sometimes a little undercooked, but overall, I'm very satisfied with service and quality. One time, my pizza was a little burnt and they took the initiative to make me a new one without waiting for me to ask for it. My personal favorite is the shawarma with everything on top. It's truly a great one. Their fries are nice, but seem to be frozen. Finally, the staff is friendly. Overall, it's fast food and it's nothing fancy, but I gave it four stars because that's exactly what they are trying to be, a humble local establishment that wins over the community with simple and good dishes and at that game, they won me and my family.

Ordered on here from Just Eat when we got tired of our regular pizza place. Can I just say that this is the most amazing tasting pizza... ever! It's seriously amazing! We've ordered there a bunch of times now, over the phone too. I wonder how much they paid to get that number! 4162220222! I mean seriously?! :D
Fast, hot delivery.  Best wings in Toronto. Hands down. Fresh veggies are crisp and cold. Super delivery guys. great value!

Local hole in the wall pizza and shawarma place. Very well priced and good quality. I usually get the shawarma (2 for 1 special) . It is turkish styled shawarma with great topping selection. Their pizza's are well made. Just beware that this place is not the classiest pizzeria in the city, and you will guaranteed find some of the local neighbourhood drunks hanging around in the store. They dont bother anybody, just there since there is no local bar in that area.
Great food! Service isn't wonderful, but it isnt billed as such. Food is totally reasonable, tasty, and well prepared.

This place is dirty and the service is super slow. It took us almost 15 minutes to even order a shawarma and there was only one person in front of us. 
The place just has this sketchy vibe to it (dimly lit) 
The woman who served us was also very ruse considering how much money we spent. 
Shawarma was mediocre at best. Have not tried the pizza so can only comment on the shawarma. 
Would not recommend

Thought I'd expand my pizza choices to other than the major ones. Try local all I got was burnt pizza that was all dough and drips of sauce. To make matters worse I called the store and the guy seemed to not care and was rude. All in all poor service and the worst pizza ever. 

Stay clear of this place.

Love love love the Knitting Tree! Jackie and staff are very helpful. Anytime I need help with a project I sit in the store and work and they help me along. They are very encouraging too. Will order other colors of yarn for you , mine came in within the week.  There is one staff member who isn't very patient or helpful, so just ask someone else if you get her.  The new store is lovely with lots of knitted up projects throughout.

A great selection of natural fiber yarn.

However, they could be clearer on their policies.

I went to exchange some yarn because the project I started needed less than what I anticipated. Did not think it would be a problem because the receipt clearly states that store credit would be given with a receipt within 3 months of purchase. Check, check.

I go to exchange my yarn and I'm denied because "We don't accept yarn that's already been wound. You might have knitted off it already." Fine, whatever, get a scale. 100g = 100g. 

But my biggest complaint was that I never asked to have my yarn wound when I bought it -- I went to check out, and the yarn was taken from me and wound. No explanation that it nullified my ability to return it, nothing.

Despite the fact this store is half a block from my house, I won't be back. The flippant manner in which I was treated (as if I should have known this by osmosis?) soured my experience.

Love love love this yarn shop. It's only my second time visiting the Knitting Tree, as it's a bit of a drive from MKE, but it is a lovely shop. The woman who owns the shop (she has a business partner that I've not met) is helpful and very friendly. 

But the best part about this shop is the variety of yarn within its four walls -- Malabrigo, Madelinetosh, and plenty of other hand painted yarns to choose from, and in many different weights.

The Knitting Tree has been THE yarn place on Monroe Street for many years. My daughter has gone there many times for help with her knitting projects over the years and the people there have always been friendly, helpful, patient and understanding with her. They have a great selection of yarn and loads of experience. If you need yarn or help with your knitting, this is your place.

Local tip: since it's street parking only, try to avoid going there during the evening rush hour as there's no parking on that side of Monroe St. then.

Jackie and friends are the best. I am taking a class here and they are very helpful and Jackie and Patti and teaching assistant Peggy are great at teaching. Very patient. If you get frustrated and need help you are welcome to walk in. Beautiful tasteful samples to choose from. Things you would truly wear are shown in the store to tempt you to try to make for yourself . They have wonderful patterns! Thursdays they are open later and you can park in the lot across the street! They are expanding their store to a brand new spot right next door it will open in August!

I have to say, this shop is very cute and will fulfill the needs of any dedicated knitter.  The store clerk helped me pick out a gift, a nice book, for a friend of mine.  Unfortunately, the gift was not what my friend was looking for.  I was told later by another employee that they do not do returns on books as they have had issues with people photocopying the knitting patterns and returning the books.

After speaking with the owner, she agreed to give me an exception after explaining the policy.  It is not likely that they are willing to do this again for anyone.  So, if any shifty knitters are reading this, SHAME!

Also, if you had read my last rating of this store, please disregard it.

I have had two opportunities to buy yarn from this store. Great yarns. Lousy customer service. Sales staff seemed put out by my questions. I will give them one more try--but if I am treated poorly I will take my business elsewhere.

This is a strange place. I went to buy some yarn and asked one of the clerks for a recommendation. She told me I would have to choose a pattern and handed me a book. I already had a pattern, but she told me to pick one. I flipped through the book for a second and just picked one at random so that I could just buy some yarn. She finally helped me, but then said that I would now HAVE to buy the book, since I had used it. There's really nothing wrong with the place, but after that bizarre exchange (I refused to buy the book; she relented but seemed pissed about it), I'd prefer not to go back.

I used to work at the knitting tree, way back in the 70's.  I was at Edgewood College then, and Dottie, Suzie and the gang helped me learn more about knitting than I even realized possible.  I was so happy to walk in recently ( Early Feb '09) to discover things are better than ever!  Jackie gave me the grand tour, and things were much improved since I worked there.  The selection is wonderful and the space is bright and open.  The "library" is inspiring and the pattern selection rocks.  
Thanks to Jackie and the folks there that day I felt welcomed and was so happy that I stopped in.

The woman working was friendly and the customers who were also there seemed like happy regulars.  The shop isn't nearly as big as other places, but it was stuffed with great yarn.  There were many many books, beads, and knitting supplies to choose from, as well as some cute stuff.  I'd recommend a visit if you're into crochet/knitting at all.
A gem.  Great displays of sample knits.  Good books and magazines.  Quirky staff.

The Knitting Tree looks so cute and inviting. Years ago, when I first started knitting, I was excited to finally get some "real" (aka: not cheap acrylic) yarn and embark on a major project. I was treated rudely and dismissively by a clerk who couldn't bother to have her personal conversation interrupted to help a customer.

Flash forward a few years: I give them a 2nd chance. i ask for some help. I am ignored. I wait patiently. Finally, I am snapped at with "can I HELP you!??" and in the end I leave without a purchase.

Flash forward another few years and, even though I have had bad experiences, and have seen how the mutual management has ruined Lakeside Fibers, I go in as a yarn company online notes that The Knitting Tree carries the yarn I seek. I was in search of a particular color. Not only did they not have the color, but they seemed to not have the yarn type. And that was fine. It was probably old info on the website that referred me. But the salespeople are always just so rotten and unhelpful. 

Three strikes: you're out. No matter how much they spruce this place up on the outside, it's like an evil beauty queen: pretty on the outside and coldhearted on the inside.

This is my second visit to this nail salon and this is now my destination place. Last week I happen to stumbled onto this place and noticed this sign "Peds and Manis for $30"
I went inside and noticed how immaculate clean and bright freshly paint pink wall. I've decided last minute to do pedicure because manis don't usually last long for me and chips easily.
 
I was greeted by this young woman presumably in her early twenties named Wendy. She was friendly and she did my pedicures quite nicely. Her hands were light compared to other not so nice and shady nail salons I've been in the past especially at the Yonge and Bloor area!

She has even mentioned to me that they recently opened in August which was a bonus for me because of its cleanliness and cute decor.

I can't wait to go back and have Wendy to do my nails again but she's only available on Sundays :(

As promised, today (October 11, 2014) I went again for their facial treatment for $40 for 1 hour which was reasonably price and I was quite happy with their service.  There were affordable with the many steps involved and the attention I received.

I am pretty sure the management of this place changed because the service is completely different. Pretty sure completely new staff also. 

I called ahead of time to see if they didn't acrylic nails and they said yes but when I got there they told me they don't do it anymore.  I got gel nails instead and it was so poorly done I had to fix it at home.  I got them removed at another location and the nail technician commented on how badly they were applied.

Great place for getting my nails doneExtremely clean and friendly.Excellent servicethey don't rush. Pedi meni combo only $30they do shellac last longer than other place since I do. I love this placeand it is also my only nails salon for my nails.
Long wait times and worst nails I've had done in Toronto. All of my nails are different shapes and the shellac is uneven. Would never recommend or go back

Service is okay. I got a Mani pedi but my polish didn't even last 24 hours. I went back for a redo and was in a time crunch which I told then I was. I was told to sit down and wait as I was told my nails didn't last because it wasn't shellac. it's not my first mani pedi!!!  After being told multiple time not long not long, I had to walk out. Won't be going back
New place open on Bloor near Dufferin. Clean place, friendly staff, good service. Prices are typical of places in the area.

I went there to do my menicure and pedicure last weekend, a girl named Lina did very good job. She cut my cuticle very clean, and help me fix the in grow nails. Price is nice, service is good, I will come back again.

Updated review: new owners, it's still a very clean salon but the quality isn't quite as good as it used to be particularly with pedicures. It feels rushed without the attention to detail that the old owner had.

I've been here before for pedicures and manicures, and I've always had good results. But the last time I came here was quite disappointing. I arrived and asked for an acrylic set and the woman working there said they didn't do acrylic. Thinking this was strange I turned to leave, but she called after me and told me that they do bio gel instead. I thought this was a little odd as bio gel and acrylic are pretty much the same so I thought she would've mentioned that when I asked for acrylic. I wasn't too put off by this though, just thought it was weird. 
She then started to do the bio gel nails, when a group of women came in requesting manicures. That's when she started rushing.she was using tons of layers of gel, leaving me with thick uneven nails. She didn't file them properly so the tops of the nails expanded out and had that kind of "duck feet" look that isn't very attractive . Many of the nails were uneven along the top. The Polish job was smudged and full of air bubbles. To top it off it was $40 and took an hour and a half. I've had better acrylics  done for $30-$15. I had to go home and remove the nails myself.  If you're looking for a basic manicure pedicure, this place is fine, but I wouldn't recommend this place for fake nails.

Great guys, super helpful. They have a solution for all your vaping needs. I just picked up a cloupour cloutank-Dry herb/wax  vaporizer and couldn't be happier. They have  a sweet taster bar, only one in town so you can preview your flavors! Ask for Manny, dude can seriously build and is super helpful. Happy vaping!

Best vape shop in Vegas. Very knowledgeable staff and great juices. They have a tasting bar so you can check out the flavors before you buy. If you have any questions or just need a build, this is the place to go.

I've visited numerous Vape shops around town, and this shop is my #1 go to spot for all my Vape needs. There customer service  is outstanding, they make sure you leave with 100% customer satisfaction and all your   questions are answered. Pick N Puff is a distinguished shop from the rest from the second you walk in the ambience alone is good enough to just Vape and meet new people or just relax and lounge. They have a variety of juices including their own called " Daval" I definitely recommend their DTG Vanilla Custard or you can try all their different flavors on their samples bar. This shop has it all their shop is immaculate, sure does make you feel like your walking into a high end Vape shop! Overall this shop easily became my one stop shop for all my vaping needs.

David has a very nice shop that can accommodate all your needs.  He carries a nice line of AUTHENTIC mods which is a nice change.  He also has a great selection of quality clones.  After buying a couple of rba's, he took the time to build the coil for us along with great instruction on care and how to build ourselves.  Also has an awesome juice selection!  He never made my wife and I feel rushed and answered all of our questions.  There are a lot of options in Vegas, but we will be loyal customers to this shop now.

Found this shop via yelp while in the area running errands.  I walked in looking for some e juice, was welcomed to sit and sample from a wide variety of juices on hand.  I was pressed for time and asked for something sweet and the guy (I'm horrible with names) suggested "Summer Wapple". I believe it's one of their "Da Val" in house blends.  He even mixed a bottle for me right there, smelled delicious like some kind of watermelon candy...I can't put my vape pen down today it's so good!  
Friendly service, tasty juice.  Will be back.

This was my first time ever in a vape shop. So I didn't really know anything about vapping or the like. Manny (the gentleman working) explained everything to me and answered all my questions. He explained the difference between a start up set and the modded sets. He was a huge help and I will be stopping back by whenever I need questions answered. 

On top of all that they seem to make their own liquids at the shop which is awesome. It's unique and helps set this shop apart from basic shops. 

I highly recommend coming by this shop and I will definitely be stopping by here more often!
Love this place & the atmosphere! Great selection of mods & rbas! Will deff be back for future needs.

Best employers
Always helping me out with good deals
Very kind. 
Tahnks to Manny and Conner

Seriously the best vape shop I've walked into, you will not regret stopping by. Dave the owner is awesome, customers experience comes first. They have tons of mods, authentic and clones, and will customize your rig. Come in and enjoy the e-juice bar and find your new favorite flavor.
Thanks for hooking me up with a sweet mod!

This is a pretty good shop, overall nice selection of items and Ejuice. Staff is alright, could be a little more interactive with customers but overall were helpful then most other places I've been too. The one thing i did like is their house Ejuice line. They have some pretty good flavors. Summer wapple has to be the best out of all them. 

In terms of large selection they don't have a lot, they do have nice authentics and clones but not a large selection to choose from. They do have updated items that people are looking for but for me  I wish they had more. Instead of going every week to see what they have I wait about two or three weeks because  I know they wont get in stuff for a little. Might be a downer for most but I can live with it.

Sandcastle is a mixed bag for the kiddos.  On the one hand, there are plenty of waterslides/pools that are a good fit for young "riders", on the other hand, Sandcastle, like any city amusement park, attracts more than its fair share of highschool kids looking to spend some time away from their parents and assert their personhood.  

Unfortunately that element doesn't particularly care about "censoring" speech for 9 year old ears, and worse, in the Mon Tsunami, about personal space, since the wave pool becomes a near mosh pit of jostling and strutting and shoving and 'showing off' for the fairer sex, and that can be a little dicey for the littler kids.

Having said that, it's still a good day at the park. . . cheese fries, a cool dip in the pool on a hot day, some fun slides. . . 

I think in rating Sandcastle fairly you have to understand the context of the park.  It is NOT policed particularly effectively.  if you take small children you have to be a diligent parent and be aware of your surroundings, paying attention to the group of 17 somethings thrashing around in your near vicinity, "accidentally" bumping into people for a reaction from their group.  

MOSTLY it's a good time.  Mostly.

The attractions themselves are very good. Lifeguards seem to be attentive to what's going on. The food service wait times are ridiculously slow. And the restrooms are in horrible condition. I have only been here two times, once last year and once this year but the above was true for both visits.

Insanely expensive! $6 parking. $8 locker. $9 wrinkled, burnt hot dog. I really hate this place. Kids received season passes for Christmas present. Brought kids once and will never return. Spent $46 on food and threw most of it away

A few years ago I visited this water park with my family and I loved it so I decided to go again with my friend.That was a mistake. When I got there most of the slides were closed and the lifeguards were goofing off. We only got to stay for an hour because when it got cloudy the lifeguards told everyone to leave and closed the park down. When I entered the changing room it didn't look very clean but I changed anyway. When I exited my stall I realized that there was a brown substance on my leg. It was poop. After I cleaned myself off my friend and I inspected the changing rooms and at least two of them had poop inside. Not pleased with there services. Didn't even get a rain check ! Also if you have small children I do not recommend taking them into the pools. The lifeguards paid no attention to anyone! Do not recommend

This is my 4th year as a season pass holder. Each year the park seems to go downhill a little. I was there yesterday and the bathroom by the wave pool was deplorable. I hate when people leave a bathroom disgusting but Sandcastle needs to do a better job of keeping them clean.
