So, the star rating is mainly for that. However, their customer service definitely needs work because we don't feel like coming back anymore. We know about their affiliation with a timeshare group, so we expected a membership sale from them. This was not our first time at this place. So, the staff who helped us checkout, did her sales pitch and told us all the wonderful benefits. We kept listening, then she mentioned a fee we needed to pay in order to get the offer. So, naturally we said no thank you and we'll think about it. But she kept insisting and wouldn't stop with the attempt. We declined politely so many times but she kept trying to convince us. My husband was fed up and just started to walk away while politely declining her offer. Then, instead of a " thank you for staying with us" to end it, she just said "well, I guess you guys don't want the free stay, have a great day."

That type of service, regardless if it was towards the end of the stay, is still important because you want your guest to come back and hopefully those who declined the timeshare offer before would accept it. Not pressure them into signing up or keep insisting after declining the offer. Funny thing was, she first asked us how our stay was and we said excellent, then this happened. The encounter we had with her turned our good stay with them to a not-so-good-not-coming-back feel.

Brought my granddaughter for a staycation this week. Pool and slides were great. On site amenities were normal.  We had room facing the pool - no complaints on the room. 

My major complaint and deal breaker for my ever coming back is the solicitation and pressure to invest in their timeshare program. What made it worse is they looked at me like I was an idiot for not jumping right in and signing up. 

I just wanted to have a relaxing few days and not be harassed about their timeshare. 

Dial it back guys -ask once and then leave your guests alone!
Shitty service, gross rooms. There were cockroaches in the cabinets and water stains on the carpet. Get it together.

If you get the 2 bedroom villa your in LUCK. 
Jacuzzi tubs  in both bathrooms AND a jacuzzi on the balcony. 
So lavish 
Great pool view
VERY SPACIOUS 
I mean wow 
Nice big flat-screens with a DVD player, Surround-sound ^_^ (only negative was the remote was so confusing to use) 
Even have a bar for entertaining!!
Like seriously it gets better, 
Nice kitchen fully loaded with a dishwasher and all the cooking and baking utensils you will need! 
I am telling you this place had it all! 

Even the slides at the pool were pretty damn amazing. 

ONLY negative is this is not a hotel where housekeeping comes daily. But you can order room service, and towels and material that you would need. 
They service all needs!

Great place for a stay-cation for a Vegas Local!. I used this place to host my daughters 6th birthday party and took advantage of the pool!!
No need for clean up.. just ordered food and enjoy. 

I was able to  enjoy my 1 night stay and I am sure to come back.. 

pro-- everything is provided in the kitchen from dish soap to paper towels. 


cons--parking is very limited in the garage.. make sure you see the signs that say "elevator" those goes up to the rooms. you might mistake this for a maintenance/service elevator. You will need a key to access this door. If not you do have to walk around to the other side of the building. 

Kids enjoyed the pool and the water slides.. For sure she had the best birthday ever!!

Rooms were ok.. hotel had cold atmosphere.  Only one eating lounge, most of the time the key to the  gate to did not work. The water faucets dripped and could not regulate the water. They are only interested in time share  group, we were not with them.  We will never stay there again!

Not impressed. This place is hardly a resort. Everything is old and run down.  There is NO internet. They really need to stop advertising they even have it. When I talked to the staff they apologized and agreed they don't have it. We were told they are transitioning to a new provider and it's non existent at this point. The property is very dirty. They  allow pets (which is nice) but no one picks up the dog poop. It's all over the property and it smells horrible. The parking is a nightmare, my room had no bathroom lights and no blankets for the fold out sofa. It took 5 hours and 3 phone calls to get bedding, my bathroom lights were fixed the night before we left.  They trick you after you check in by sending you to the "concierge" for your check in package- it's a timeshare presentation and show sales, they aren't nice when you say you're not interested. They are high pressure and get snotty when you want to leave!  I feel like I was scammed by false advertising. I really don't want apologies and an invitation back after they finish the much needed renovation. I want a partial refund for the  false advertising. It's not worth the money. The best thing there is the water slide and the pool, but be warned, the water slides have a bad odor! The landings need to be cleaned and sanitized. The wait staff at the pools is non existent. The staff seem friendly enough but they all appear to be embarrassed when you talk to them about the issues, they all seem to know  the property is run down and not managed properly. I understand the people I talked to have no control over the operational side but I wonder if anyone in upper management truly cares.  If you can get a rate for $59 a night it's worth it- I paid $189 and feel like it was a HUGE rip off.  I've stayed at MUCH nicer resorts and hotels for the same price or less.  Seriously- there are so many places to choose from in Vegas, don't waste your money here.

I will start with the good , nice room size and I like having 2 bathrooms . The pool area is great and I like the water slides . It's very family oriented and It serves that purpose well . 

The bad, it's a time share so they hassled us to buy more stuff when we checked in and it made us uncomfortable . The elevators lag and are very old besides that it's nod a bad place .

I'm disgusted by the "service" here. We were lied to directly by the manager, Suzette, and she refused to make up for her mistakes and those of the other staff. We were backed into our room 4 hours late which heavily impacted our plans for the evening. I don't recommend staying here at all. Steer clear of this place and go stay elsewhere. There are many other better options which are very high-class and affordable.

This is a TERRIBLE place to stay.  We had the worst vacation ever.  The rooms were terribly unclean.  The pool area was gross.   The jacuzzis all smelled and were filled with green water.  Upon our return the determologist determined that our rashes were from unclean pool water.

During out stay, the refrigerator top shelf collapsed sending glass and groceries all over the kitchen.  I had to replace all the week's groceries at my cost.  I called housekeeping to help clean up the mess.  When they finally arrived they spot cleaned, and we were finding glass shards for the entire duration of our stay.  We also were charged an "extra" cleaning fee of $200 a week after our departure for this service.

DO NOT GO!   THIS IS YOUR WARNING!!!

What a WONDERFUL staff!!! Best customer service I've ever dealt with in Las Vegas. Clean hotel, washer and dryer available for free, great restaurant on site with delicious food, beautiful pool, quiet rooms, and did I mention how wonderful the staff is? So accommodating and friendly. Thankful to have found this place.

Our first time stay here as timeshare owners. Beautiful place, wonderful people who were very friendly. As an owner I checked in at the VIP lounge, got a two bedroom which was very nice. Our son and his wife were our guests for 3 nights and they loved it. Beds are nice and comfy, big jet tubs, kitchen is small but serviceable, I was able to cook breakfast and use the oven. The pool is gorgeous but was a little too cold to go for a swim, maybe next time we'll come when it's warmer. We actually came in November so we can hike Red Rock Canyon. I usually like to stay at different resorts but I think I would like to come back here in the near future. We like staying off the Strip so this is perfect.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!
I did not have any problems initially. Then I asked if I could extend my stay by 3 more nights. They accommodated me and gave me a total amount of $336.0 with tax etc.... Which was fine. The next morning I go outside to get in my car and someone had stollen the Rim from my car!?!?! I file a report with Security and they tell me they can't check the cameras until the next day when the manager will be in. Next day comes and nothing. In fact Security does not contact me until after I checked out and left. On top of that two days later I check my bank account and they took an extra $66.00 out of my bank account. I call them up and ask what is going on and they try and give me some excuse for some fee???? Bullshit. Called my bank immediately to dispute the charge and called the resort back to get a refund. All around bad experience. Nobody ever greets you in there. Everyone looks like there pissed off for having to come to work.

Pro's:

-Huge pool
-multitude of hot tubs spread across the pool areas.  
-Water slides! What what! The water slide tops any other one I've been on at a hotel thus far.
-2 beds + couch bed
-Kitchen in room (fridge + stove)
-2 bathrooms
-shuttle to the strip

Cons:

-Check out time is at 10 am

This place is solid for an off the strip joint.  
Not being an owner like most that have reviewed this place I didn't experience  a lot of the time share madness.  I was just a guest enjoying my time in vegas!

I didn't know this was a timeshare when I booked my room because I booked it on expedia, so I was a little surprised by the timeshare solicitation when I checked in, but after I declined, I wasn't bothered about it again. The price was great, the room far exceeded my expectations and was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again!

Do not stay here unless you are willing to NOT sleep at all.  They have horrible 1810 style wood blinds that let in enough light to grow weed in here.  To top it off they add extra light outside each window (for security I was told) just in case you wanted to sleep at night.  The room is very nice but does me no good if I cannot sleep.  I called the front desk asking for help with this or a hammer and nails so I could block the light and was told "sorry."  The showers next door were extremely loud as the insulation in this place is horrible.  Do not stay here!!!

They never disappoint me here! We haven't had a bad experience or a moment of disappointment. Hospitality is quick, and very accommodating. Love the concierge service, every one seems to want to serve you, nice quality to have today. 

We got to stay in the penthouse this trip & just love love love it! 

Happy owner with Monarch now switching over to Diamond - I'm ok with it!

I wish I could give this place zero stars; and if you look at my other ratings you'll see they're mostly 5 stars.
This review is specific to their marketing presentation; 

Their presentation is a freaking 3 hour steal of your holiday. Now of course you can tell me: you didn't have to go for it. We didn't know; they just said come and receive your free gifts and meet us in the morning. 

3 fucking hours! And I had to fight with them forever for my gifts!

We stay in this resort for the first time. We didn't really see anything WOW.. The room we stayed had dirty bathroom sinks and tub. The windows don't have blinds that will block the sun light from coming in the room (it's Las Vegas, people go to sleep at sun rise)... During our stay, no wifi unless you pay some extra bucks. Last day of our stay, we got people coming and knocking on our door at 7 in the morning.. 

Another thing that went wrong. We went to an owners meeting and the rep that talked to us gave us a bunch of wrong information that left us puzzled about our ownership. When we came back home, we called corporate office to try to understand what we where told about our account, it turn out that the rep had "supposedly" the wrong account that it was not even ours...

I always stay on polo towers or desert paradise but wanted to give this place a chance.. I don't think we are staying here again even if the points are less..

Older, charming, perfect for my family. Price was great and the rooms were big! Got to spread out for four days. Rather have room, than a small modern boutique hotel down on the strip.
Pool was great and everyone we met on staff ***"friendly! 
Restaurant on site a bit pricey.
Activities for kids daily
Game room
Clean

Our car along with 4 other cars were keyed and the hotel didn't express any concern nor did they say sorry that it happened. Was really disappointed with thier service. It took 3 phone calls to ask for towels, shampoo and conditioner. The staff only brought 75% of what we wanted. They don't clean or replenish towels daily so I asked for 6 towels and they told me that since I only have a one bedroom that I only get 4 towels. Wow. Not returning here. Also, we did the timeshare presentation and the guy said I would get the Matt Franco tickets I wanted for the day and time I wanted and when I went to claim my tickets they didn't reserve the date and time. It messed up my vacation plans.

I have to rate this hotel 5 stars.. everything thing was amazing from start to finish. Check in was super easy and everyone was super friendly.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will most definitely be back for a longer stay next time.

So we picked this place when we had a convention at the South Point but the south point was sold out. Look it's not the Wynn but for the money you can't go wrong. We got a 2 bedroom suite that was plenty big for out family of 4 people. The place Is clean and a great overall deal for the money. Great for familys.
Excellent experience. Beautiful rooms. Amazing pool. Exceptional room service and customer service was on point. Great time. Try this wonderful place off the strip

The grounds are beautiful and the staff are extremely nice. The rooms are ok. My Mom is an owner and we've stayed at several Diamond properties and all the rooms look like these. A little worn out but ok. Here's the #1 problem with this property and you can't entirely blame the property ... The clientele are ghetto. They are swimming in their clothes, falling down drunk at the picnic tables, their kids are everywhere including the adult only hot tub. We tried to go down to the pool but they took over the entire pool with their ice chests and loud partying.  Next time we will stay at another resort.

Cancun resort I see has mixed reviews. I honestly had a great time. My family and I enjoyed the resort. The guy that checked us in was friendly. Only reason it's not a 5 is because he was arguing with his co-worker in front of us. Awkward! 
I enjoyed the fully functional kitchen and was not disturbed by anyone. I enjoyed having food in the fridge instead of having to eat out all day and night. The grocery store is nearby. Fill the fridge and save your $$$ for gambling and shows. Perfect for families that are "over it" staying in a hotel the middle of the strip. Our kids enjoyed the pool and the trip to the Hoover Dam.

This hotel is a timeshare location that was owned by Grand Monarch Vacations and was sold to Diamond Resorts. This is located on Las Vegas Blvd. but is not within walking distance of the strip.  It's a good thing I drove here from SoCal so I had my car for local transportation.  I was told that there used to be a shuttle but no longer. I had a great time staying at this place.  I had purchased a "trial" membership from Monarch so I did not need to go through the pain of seeing a presentation here (that was a different place!).

The check-in lobby was no-frills.  When you go out to the rooms you see the gigantic pool and pyramid structure in the center of the pool.  Water cascades down the sides of the pyramids which looks really cool.  The pyramid has two tube waterslides on it which is also cool.  The pool is heated and is awesome to hang out in with the family.

The room building are unimpressive but are pretty cool on the inside.  The rooms feature a full kitchen, dining room, living room and multiple rooms.  I was impressed that the living room had a large tv with surround sound and a bar structure in case you wanted to stock it yourself.  The was a balcony had a hot tub on it and a nice view to the pool.

I did not eat at any of the restaurants here but they did have different activities each day in case you wanted to leave the kids behind for some gambling on the strip or some alone time.  Four stars!

For my first Vegas trip my parents and I stayed here. (Which was way back in 04, so i'm guessing a lot of things might have changed, i'm just going with whatever i experienced back then). The rooms are okay. I wasn't a huge fan. The rooms aren't that big. I remember in the room we stayed at, there was an extremely uncomfortable chair. 

The service was great though! They have shuttle service to take you to the strip. I would only recommend this place, if you don't want to be around the strip the whole time you stay in Vegas and want to just relax and chill and don't mind it not being luxurious like the hotels at the strip.

We have just returned from our "Start Summer Vacation" LOL and I must say I was very worried by all the negative reviews but went anyways and so glad I did!

First, we go to Vegas a few times a year but never with the kids, 13-12-16-17 yes I have! LOL Anyways.... I wanted a hotel that was off the strip and family friendly without a casino, kids have bad allergies and casinos are all bad for that. So I found a groupon for a 2 bedroom villa for $345 for 3 nights 4 days. I thought that was an awesome deal!

Arrived on Monday, early and requested to check in early, the gentleman at the counter was very nice and said that wasn't an issue and got us our room early. After check in your escorted to another counter (timeshare) there was a gentleman there asking us to go the presentation and I said no, if we did it would be on the last day and thats not likely. He didnt pressure us, said heres your free kids dinner and drink passes and we were on our way.

Upon checking into our room, 2232, 2nd floor room. It smelt like curry, possible and indian guest was there before us. Room was clean, had everything you need, cooking stuff, plates, coffee maker, everything! We settled in and walked across the street to the grocery store and stocked up! Loved the fact that there was a full kitchen! Awesome! Beds were okay, kinda stiff but not bad. Cable in the rooms and free wifi for 4 phones! All worked well and we had no issues. the rooms are outdated and could use some better upkeep but it did the job for us.

We spent our days at the pool which was AWESOME kids loved it! The slides were a big hit! They have a gift store which I found to be reasonable priced. Beer there is so much cheaper then going into the bar, so my tip is buy beer at the gift store! Plenty of sitting for the pool area which was great. I wish they had servers though, if you do want a drink you have to go to the bar. The restaurant was ok-good and I didn't think pricing was extreme at all. I will say though, one day they had offered a coconut drink, when I ordered it, the girl couldn't open the coconuts to make the drink so she just said sorry we can't make them.... well don't offer them if you can make it LOL or go ask for help! They also have buy one drink get the second free and happy hour times, however its only on there very basic drinks..... also another tip we learned at the end, for the kids sodas, have them save there cups because refills are free! I didn't no and no one told us so I kept buying them each time! UGH I guess I should have asked, I found out on our last day to just save the cups.

At night, we went to the strip at night and Fremont street, we took Lyft which was anywhere from $23-35 bucks each way... it was little much but we wanted off the strip so thats what you get LOL I guess the resort use to have a shuttle, I think that would have been awesome if they bring that back!

Upon check out, it was easy and there was no extra charges or anything. I would come back here again if I was bringing kids or family with elderly people because it is very low key and relaxed. We enjoyed our selfs very much!

Our experience with the Cancun Resort was very disappointing. I gave it two stars because the room was clean and comfortable, but both bathrooms had broken faucets, and there were only a couple of towels in each. The front desk staff was mediocre, at best, seemed to be annoyed that they had to actually work. As soon as you think that you are finally checked in, (yes, it took quite a long time for what seemed to be a simple reservation of one room) some pushy sales guy snags your key and insists on giving you a "welcome package" that you don't need. I explained to the guy several times that we were just stopping over for the night on our way home, we had two kids with us (one is severely handicapped) but he just held tight to the keys and kept up his pitch. I had to phone the front desk to ask for extra towels and blankets, the guy at the desk responded as if I'd asked him to come up and paint the room! Just some towels and blankets, dude, really, it shouldn't send you into a panic. The pictures of this resort are misleading, it's dark, and smells like a hospital cafeteria throughout the hallways.

Resort is very nice rooms great, yes huge pool nice landscaping etc. EXCEPT there are a few things you should know BEFORE you book this place...
I booked this place for my mother in law she wanted to see the pool and the waterfalls but on the contrary not 1 waterfall was working in fact it was under construction!! No why wouldn't they tell guests up front about this oh it gets better...then you are approached for timeshare crap. I told my husband Straight out he'll be sorry if he goes to this thing. Sure enough he was. Not only did he end up getting a condescending rep Punk ass kid who had a attitude ruined the whole presentation no way was my husband going for this type of treatment. So they lost us as a customer for sure plus didn t want to spend $20,000 plus for something that to me seems like a pyramid scheme.
Oh and as for the "FREE" stuff there isn't any. They gave a prepaid VISA and of course it doesn't work not can you activate it. This is a 100% SCAM so beware all.

Moved from South Point to Cancun after a ton of operational issues, much better at Cancun, the people were nice the management was accommodating and the tv, internet and heat functioned properly.  I would definitely stay here again.

Great pool. Nice family atmosphere. The rooms were nice and the pull out bed (sofa) was the most comfortable EVER! The master bedroom bed was amazing. Nice break from The strip. I would stay here again.

We stay this year again on my birthday Oct 22 2016. Love the place for a family get together. I am just a little disappointed that they have not updated any of the rooms , at least the ones we all stay inn. The timeshare people most of the time we can just say no no no no, yes they can get pretty mean. After read the roaches problem and the person with bed bugs... I am going to have to make some changes. That's just to bad because we had a great time as a family here with all my sisters and nieces , nephew, and friends and our adult children.

I was told their presentation would be 90 minutes for information related to a timeshare. They did not have a shuttle for us until 5 hours later. The front desk made it clear they would not send a taxi for us because they would have to do that for everyone and only if we purchased would we be entitled to a taxi !!!!! I asked for a manager while waiting no one ever came. I along with many others had to forfeit our entire day as they had shuttled us over there. They were very pushy and rude and kept asking over and over to buy in. Yes the resort is beautiful but the customer service was extremely rude. I warn you I boarded at 11:35 wasn't back at my hotel until 4:40. Terrible service

We stayed here for 3 nights in a penthouse. We had a very good time. Place had 3 flat screens tvs, full kitchen and a dining table. Rooms were huge. We got a great price by using our AAA discount. The hotel is about a 10 minute drive from the Strip. There's a supermarket across the street where we bought our groceries for the stay. The sofa bed in the living room had the best sofa mattress ever. The master bedroom's shower tub is hard to get in/out of since it's also a hot tub, too. Our view was towards the hotel's pool and we could see the RED ROCKS far to the east.  The jacuzzi out in the balcony was not as fun as I thought it would be, took an hour to warm up and I thought it was a little dangerous for my little girls. 
We did enjoy the many jacuzzies they had in the pool area, along with the heated pool. Loved the towel service they provide. They had a nice little gym, too. There's plenty of parking and we were able to check-in in minutes. 
Check-out was the only negative I had in my stay. Since Cancun is also a timeshare, Diamond Resorts, tries to get non-timeshare guests to join a sales meeting.

Very disappointed with management.  I had the worst Bday ever in Vegas.  I arrived & to top it off they lied to me that they had plumbing problems to find out they overbooked & moved me to another sister hotel which when I arrived to the room the bed was full of hairs & the sheets were dirty.  They told me they would comp me & till this date I haven't gotten a call or email.  Tried few times to get a hold a management.  But all they've given me is the run around.  I really enjoyed my previous stays but this one was the worse.

Because we own through the Marriott, this felt like a downgrade. Got food poisoning from room service and the front desk person was rude since I was trying to ask for a wake up call for an early checkout since there were so many threats in the rules and regulations if there should be a late checkout. I guess for people who have not experienced other timshares, they would love this one, but for us, we will never exchange to stay here again.

This place is my favorite at Vegas. Such a calm and relaxing environment. Pool is really nice. Gym and game room are awesome as well. The rooms are big, clean, and modern. As always, Diamond Resort beds are the comfiest!

Minuses:
-No free Wifi.
-Far away from the Strip.
-For a room with 2bd we get 1 bed and 1 sofa. Great!
-Not compatible with hotwire.com(cf above).
-The hotel agent did not try to find solution and was very not commercial.

Pluses:
-big swimming pool.

I'm an owner at this resort and this is my first time using this one.  We have the penthouse which is very huge!  Jacuzzi on the 50 foot patio so when the pool closes at 10pm you can do you own thing.  The place is beautifully done and we have truly enjoyed our stay.  The staff are awesome!

I would only want a couple things.  Later hours at the pool...say midnight?  And I'd like bar people to come around at the pool to serve me drinks.  They used to have this feature but have since stopped.  The bar is literally right next to the pool but who wants to get up, put on a shirt, burn your feet on the hot pool deck to go get a drink?  Not me.  However, the bartenders are all very cool and fun!  I highly recommend this place if you have the means to do so.  

It is removed from the strip which is fine with me.  Less traffic.  Very close to the airport if you fly in.  The resort has a shuttle that takes you to the Tropicana and it runs every half hour until midnight.  Aside from that it is a $20 or less cab ride to the heart of the strip with 4 people in the cab.  

Enjoy!  I love the Vegas babaaayyy!!

Beautiful resort. SUN, the front desk associate that checked us in was so sweet. It was so nice to be greeted by such a friendly and professional employee. The room was beautiful, I would have preferred a pool view but with my last minute reservation you can't be too picky. We'll definitely be back soon (:

stay on the strip. spend the money and stay on the strip. it cost me nothing to stay here. (Dad has a timeshare) Even my dad wont stay here again. they dont clean up. never told us we have to call them to clean up. too far from the strip. $25 buck for a cab to get to the south side of the strip. their cafe sucked balls. the only good things were the beds and Deli Pizza Cafe accross the street. no gaming, no entertainment.

huge suite 
we were there at the end of november and the pool was closed the whole time
we werent too bummed because there was a jaccuzi on our balcony that we used but that started spraying water everywhere (we were not pissed because it was funny memories) and so we used the master bath jaccuzi tub which was bigger
a little far from the strip but close to grocery and fast food and gas and drugstores
room service was pretty cheap and good (we had breakfast burritos)
full kitchen
huge entertainment center 
i am actually feeling more of a 4 star rating but i will leave it at a 3 because i had a really good time on this trip but i think it was the friends i was with- we made it fun

The only reason they are getting the second star is because they were kind enough to have a few things set up in the room for my husbands birthday upon arrival . As far as the rest of the stay .. They have a nice pool . Food , now that's a different story . In 3 days .. 1 day I ordered a po boy with fries . All I received were the fries . One night I ordered a salad with chicken from room service .. Chicken was missing . Last day by the pool my husband ordered chicken nachos and again missed the chicken . The restaurant by the pool is a joke . Worst service ever . To finally get our 2 sandwiches correct it no joke took 2 hours ! There was so much more wrong with this stay but I rather not write a book tonight .. If you want to go to the spa (what a joke ) I would seriously opt for an Asian massage parlor before I went back to that place and I'm a female . Been sending messages about our stay for 2 weeks . Still no response . surprise surprise

Wow this place has gone to shit since diamond took over. It's nothing like what it used to be. For starters the the rooms are disgusting! The walls were dirty, carpet all stained, furniture dusty, sheets smelly, I was going to shower and it got all clogged up with brown water. The pool is nasty! There is nothing but hair everywhere, things floating, and bacteria looking stuff in the pool. I called the front to inform them and see when the pool will be cleaned cause it is normal to want to go swimming in a clean pool and I was told that it is cleaned as needed. I explained to the girl what the pool was like and she said that is because of the wind in Vegas, that Vegas is very windy. What kind of response is that?!? Then I was looking over the menu for room service and wanted to place an order and the girl that answered was rude and very sarcastic. The first night we stood I ordered a pia colada from the bar it was so nasty and so strong my mom and I got sick. That whole first night we couldn't go out as planned due to being sick. It was for the whole stay we were  sick but had to make the best of it. When this resort used to be pacific monarch it was well kept up and everyone was very nice. It was more of a family place and you had to be a member to stay. They didn't let just anybody stay. Now with diamond they let just anyone stay in the resort. The elevators have no ac in them and smell nasty, the activities room was dirty there were starburst wrappers everywhere. The parking sucks. Be prepared to park far and walk to the parking structure to go to your room. We were told that the next time we come that it will be better cause they are putting millions into the resort. If your still a pacific monarch owner don't expect to be treated good. We felt as if we were treated bad. This was by far the worst experience ever. We used to enjoy coming to this resort and knowing that we would enjoy our stay.

We stayed here as a part of a promotion. 
This hotel is about 10 minutes from the strip away from the madness of the strip. 
There isn't a casino. This is more a family friendly hotel. It has a pool, rec center, a restaurant. Its quiet. I liked the quietness. This hotel isn't far from "old Vegas" which is a must see if you're in Vegas also. 
Onto our service and rooms. The front desk, and concierge were very helpful. 
We stayed in a 1bdr. There were two bathrooms, a full kitchen with a full refrigerator and stove. There is also a dining area. Balconies come with each room with a view! The views are magnificent! The pool is nice along with rec center. Which has a pool table, tv. It's a good spot for the teenagers to hang out at. 
The rooms need to be updated. But overall a good stay. The restaurant is mainly good for drinks. Make sure you go during happy hour from 3-4 each day. I wasn't too crazy about their food. We ordered Parmesan fries, nachos, wings and Mac n cheese 
Their Parmesan fries would have been good except it tastes like they sprayed some type of garlic seasoning on it rather it be real garlic. There was an odd after taste about it. 
Nachos were ok. Nothing special to say about them. 
Wings were overcooked. We got the chipotle BBQ. 
Macaroni and cheese is ALOT bland. We saved it by added some salt and pepper. Lol.

I quite like this place.  The pool is lovely and the decor has a very authentic feel to it (not that I think there are actual Mayan artifacts kicking around the hotel), and the beds feel like home.  On a less thrilled note, the in-house food is expensive.  I mean REALLY expensive.  I'm no stranger to hotel and resort room service prices, but Cancun Resort takes it to a whole new level.

Although it was pretty nice pizza.  Can't complain about the quality.

This place is amazing!!!! We stayed here using a groupon we purchased, we will be coming back in the year to come. So relaxing and pure fun for the family lots of activities for the kids through out the day.  The pool area is clean, the kids enjoyed the slides and spa. The best part is HAPPY HOUR 3-5:) 2for1 drinks, the staff was awesome and very polite. It's far from the strip but if you truly want to relax this is the place to do so:)

As several reviewer's noted, conventiently located 10 minutes south of the strip far from the hustle and bustle, if you like that sort of thing. For us, and I speak for my family, it worked out beautifully. 

We came with a group of friends occupying a couple 2 bedroom apartment/condo-esque rooms. Las Vegas from what I'm observing, is making staying in the city of sin much more accommodating for visitors staying beyond the weekend evidenced by all the 4-5 diamond non casino hotels. Our rooms came equipped with two bathrooms, two bedrooms, a dining room, kitchen and living room with pull out couch. It comfortably housed 6-8 people.

The resort itself if huge and we had to go through several buildings to get to the main lobby, front desk or to their administrative office for information about their time-share residency option. What stood out for our party was their amazing pool and water slide which the fellas could not get enough of. I'm certain they hit the pool several times a day taking breaks to eat and rest. Overall it'sa good place to stay away from the traffic, close enough in proximity to hit the strip and walk to the market for all your needs.

Very nice timeshare but would have definitely enjoyed more during the summer time because of the slides and large pool area. We stayed in a "penthouse" and even had a jacuzzi which wasn't put to use because it was so cold outside. I thought it was funny how they referred to this room as a "penthouse" even though it was located on the third floor and not the top. The room was equipped with 2 bathrooms which had their own spa like tub, the one in the master bath could've fit maybe 4-6 people while the other one could fit 2 comfortably. One thing I didn't like about the other bathroom is that because it was a handicapped equipped bathroom when you showered the water would flow out and onto the bathroom floor. They should've buit the drain of the shower to in a way that the water would easily flow down the drain as quickly as possible instead of flooding the bathroom floor as this would cause a major accident. We also had 2 king or was it cal king beds and a pull out couch bed in the living room, enough to sleep 6 people comfortably.
Another con I found was the bathroom setups. The master bath was huge which had a jacuzzi plus shower in one. If the curtains to this jacuzzi would cover it up it'd be easier to use the toilet in this room at the same time because this was the only toilet that had a separate door. The second bathroom had a toilet, shower and separate tub area but there was no door to separate the toilet from the rest of the bathroom. 

*Wish this timeshare was located closer to the strip because most of the time we took taxi's and it was about $30 (btwn 4-5ppl) each way including tip. If we stayed in the strip it would've only been half that with the tip.

Own time share. When you don't agree to go to 90 minute presentation for upgrade, you suddenly feel a chill when the nonverbal message says,@don't let the door hit you on the way out!"  Elevator takes 15-20 minutes and services beyond rude and poor!! PS use to love coming. New management??

I'm a share holder here and I honestly would say...."DO NOT PURCHASE" this time share. I've had several issues with them and it seems like they are just out for your money. I pay maintenance fees every three months so why are there ROACHES here? Seriously, I took pictures and wanted to take it further but didn't. The next time I come across something like this, I will post the pictures. The place looks nice but it is not worth the headache. Payed the entire loan and 6months later, they began blowing up my phone saying I had a $374 balance. LMAO.......wow! They figured it out and took care of it after a month of harassing me. It's just been a rough ride with these people. Trust me.

This is a really cool place. Very clean and the staff are all really nice. The villas are really big and very clean. Most if not all rooms has a Jacuzzi tub and a balcony that's a really nice size. I recommend this place to anyone.

I was not impressed with the resort at all. The room was a lot smaller then expected and lacked decor. The kitchen was in what looks to be an old closet which made it very hard to cook anything in such a small space. We accidentally broke a glass on the kitchen floor so we called the front desk. A half hour later someone showed up with a broom and dust pan. We had to insist that the floor be vacuumed because there was glass all over the carpet. The master bathroom was the only nice area. It was very large with a granite double vanity and large Jacuzzi tub.

As for the Pool / Barbecue area, there was construction going on so while sitting around the kiddie pool there were workers walking back and forth with wheel barrows. If you are planning on using the barbecue's, expect to get your cooler inspected by security. 

The common areas (interior & exterior) also lacked decor and the hallway leading to our room smelled like a cat litter box. There were several times where my husband and I smelled pot.

I didn't check in personally but I was told that the main building is a lot nicer. I would imagine that is where they do there time share presentations because I would never buy in based the building our room was located in.

After staying at other properties, we will not be returning to this one.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d277719-r415344608-Cancun_Resort-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

Where do I start?!!! This place is the pits!! I came here with my friend as her guest! We got in very late, after a 4 hour drive, tired and exhausted! 
Checked in, drove to our room, opened our door to the room and we were just flabbergasted! It looked like a crime scene or someone was there trashing the place!! My friend called the front desk to complain and they acted like we were bothering them! Their customer service sucks! Then finally security came with new keys to a different room and he was so embarrassed about the whole situation! He even took pictures of the room to show the manager! 
The next morning we called the front desk to see if they had a shuttle that will take you to the strip, it only takes you to the mall before you get to the strip! And there is no little store in the resort to buy toiletries or snacks or water!! 
This is supposed to be a diamond resort and it's more like a piece of rock resort!! 
I'm an timeshare owner with Tahiti Village and that place blows this place away!! I felt bad for my friend who was a little embarrassed about this whole situation!! Next time we are staying at the Tahiti Village!!

I had so much hope for Cancun, but was sorely disappointed - especially for 300 points per night - which is roughly equivalent to $300 per night!

The room was a bit dated but average clean, so I had no problem with those aspects, BUT

Starting with parking, a large number of spaces don't have tire stoppers, so vehicles were parked over the sidewalk - rendering it impassable - meaning all walking in parking lot had to be done in the middle of the drive way with the moving cars. (pictured)

The concrete leading from the parking lot into the resort was dirty with grease and other spots, and obviously hadn't been pressure washed in a very long time. (pictured)

AC was controlled by an analog thermostat that was either on cold all the time, or heat all the time. It didn't stop when it reached a comfortable temperature, and since it was analog, you couldn't accurately set a temp. If you moved the thermostat above ambient, then the heat blew. If the temp was set below ambient, the the ac blew. It was impossible to ever reach a comfortable temperature and then hold that temperature.

The kitchen sink faucet was falling apart, and didn't work well. (pictured)

The shower faucet handle in the main bathroom was also loose and didn't work well.

The carpet in the unit was old, stained, and worn - with thread bare patches next to the tile carpet transition. (pictured)

Although we had a pool view, it was essentially worthless - because the wall in front of the balcony was so high - you can't see a thing while sitting down! (pictured)

Balconies are all very dirty, and haven't been cleaned in a very long time! So don't go out there barefoot (pictured)

Wi-fi is slow, and there are only two devices allowed on your wi-fi at a time. Otherwise, you have to pay daily fees for faster speed and 3 or more connected devices.

Ate at the restaurant, and the food is sub par. My 14 year old daughter and her friend love and devour French fries, BUT - the fries here are so bad they couldn't eat half of one order - together! Smoothies are very sweet and fake tasting.

The location is good if you don't want to be near the hustle and bustle of the strip - so maybe great for families with young children. BUT - there were no other teenagers for my 14 year olds to hang out with. We were so very bored and unimpressed with this property, that we canceled our stay mid stay and moved someplace else!

While it is true that there are four slides, note that two are  little, and two are bigger. When we went, the biggest one was CLOSED - so for my 14 year olds, that meant only one slide. I think the slides are the main attraction for kids, and should be on Cancun's priority list for quick repair - so there is no excuse for one being closed!!!!

The jacuzzi under the waterfall was also closed when we were there ... 

I do not recommend this property!

My boys (9 and 10) love staying here. We love the huge pool and water slides. It is about 15 min south of the strip, which we like. We also like the local places to eat, which aren't the big buffets from the strip.

This resort was amazing! We had the best time especially at the pool! At the end of my trip I forgot my keys to everything back at home, and realized this when I was at the airport. I called the resort to make sure and sure enough they had them. The lady helping me actually drove her vehicle to the airport and met me to give me my keys! I made my flight and had my keys! Thanks to her and their amazing staff! We will definitely be back! Thank you!
My stay was short and sweet.  I just wish when making the reservation it was specifies that there was more than one location.
Love this resort. But wondering where my dues are going. Nothing seemed to work properly in the penthouse. Fortunately the weather was nice. No need for broken thermostat.

Keep in mind this is a time share resort community and not a hotel. 

Our family currently owns a time share within this company so being forced to put a down payment to take a 2 hour tour to try to be sold on another time share? Not cool. They ask you after they have charged your account and claim its refundable, but with previous experiences that's not the case. It took weeks and other unmentioned charges were charged to our account. 

Horrible headache I didn't want to go through again.

Other than that the rooms are nice and a decent size

I stayed here last year since I had a timeshare with Monarch Grand Vacations. My friends Gardenia H. and Keri W. stayed with me in the "penthouse", which was not as nice as we hoped it would be. It was a pretty decent size--a large master bedroom with its own bathroom, a second bedroom with bath, a large TV room, and a decent dining area and kitchen. The master bathroom had a jacuzzi in it but the second bathroom just had a shower. And it was weird because there was nothing to cut off the shower area from the rest of the bathroom--no glass wall or curtain. But everything worked well, although the water pressure was not great for the shower. The balcony had a nice view of the pool area. We didn't go to the pool area so I can't comment on it but it did look nice. The main pool (Mayan Lagoon) is only open from April through October, but the small pool (Mayan Cove) is open year-round. We didn't utilise any of their spa services but they do have a spa so that's definitely something you can check out if you want.

This is definitely one of the nicer timeshare resorts that I've been to with Monarch Grand Vacations. Parking for one car was included with our reservation. They said any additional vehicles would have to be parked off-site. Like others have mentioned, daily housekeeping is not included. And the kitchen is a full kitchen with most necessities stocked, which is great if you want to cook anything during your vacation. This place fulfilled all our basic needs. It would have been nicer if it was closer to the Strip, but then again, it would also be a lot more expensive :P And no pets are allowed (with the exception of service animals).

Excellent hotel. Family friendly. Awesome swimming pool. Their room/villas are clean and big. Our for 5 is huge to bathrooms with jacuzzi each.... small kitchen but has everything... really happy and excellent experience. You really enjoy Las Vegas with kids.

CHEAP AS HECK: Wifi? Two devices. Extra charge per day, per extra device. Room service? Once a week. Towels? Have to rent them with a card. $25 per card if you lose it. Coffee? You mean rusty water flavor packets? 

The VIP check in is a  cheesy little room with a keurig. TWO attendants were sleepily working with their customers. I stood there awkwardly for about 5 minutes before one of them looked at me and asked "Are you here to check in?"

"Yes."

"Someone will probably show up soon."

...That's the "VIP" experience. I can't imagine saying "I've got a groupon voucher."

Fifteen minutes in, our concierge showed up and called me to the counter, looking upset, as if I had personally dragged her off her lunch-break, and then slapped some stuff in front of me. Sign here, there. She remotely droned off amenity schedules, which were all wrong.

We're a young couple and requested a strip view... they put us in a room where our bedroom faced the children's swimming pool. Had to argue for a room change.

She gave us some magazine of Vegas sites, and I assumed that was their new upgrade to the old coupon book. It wasn't. It's just a book of ads.

Our concierge just didn't feel like bothering to give us the coupon book. Talked to another and she opened a drawer full and handed us 3 or 4 that she randomly selected. Before handing them over, she started trying to sell me on another timeshare opportunity. I told her I'd tell my girlfriend about it later, but she kept trying to sell me right there.Then she pushed more saying "Just buy it. I have to win a contest."

I lie and say we're unemployed. She looks pissed off and slides the tickets over saying "yeah, there's a wage requirement."

When we finally got to our rooms, our tub was cracked. Whatever, though, because we were tired and wanted a jaccuzzi. I rinse it off and start filling it up. The water is LUKEWARM. I had to boil water in pots and bring it over. As we dip into the tub we notice the shower curtains have BIG dried red and white globs of something on it (looks like lotion and tomato sauce).

Our safe was broken so we call the front desk and request a new shower curtain, and also to fix the safe. They tell me someone will be up in 30-40 minutes. An hour later, I call again, and the same girl answers, sounding, like many other employees, annoyed that I'm making her do her job. 

I ask her when the security guy is showing up for the safe, and she says "I transferred you to them already. You want me to call them myself?"

She didn't freaking call them. 

EVERY front desk / concierge person is like this.

During one call I got put on hold  for 15 min. and had 2 people ask me if I've been helped, and I said "I'm waiting on ____ can you check if he's still there?"

They responded by saying "Oh, you're already helped then?" and putting me back in hold. Finally the first guy I was talking with gets back on line and asks "Have you been helped?"

"YOU were helping me. DId you find out about the dry cleaning?"

"I already told you about that."

"No, you said you were going to ask someone and then put me on hold."

"Oh. You're right, sorry. Well I don't know yet. I'll call you later."

We ordered room service and our food came to us cold, and the boy who ran it up had a runny nose and wiped it on the back of the hand he used to hold our food.

Half the staff just show up whenever they feel like it. Most of them are texting on their phones.

And the cafe REALLY lost quality. They had burgers with fresh fruit salsa and black beans, and all kinds of interesting stuff. Now they serve soggy fries and their food just tastes microwaved. 

Because we were told the pool opens late (not true), we wanted to hit the on-site gym in the mean time. Turns out they were moving the gym THAT day. When is it going to be ready? "30 minutes." "a couple hours." "Check back tomorrow."

2 yrs ago you could get REALLY good bloody marys and mimosas for $3 in the mornings. It was one of the main things that I was looking forward to. When i asked the bartender about it he literally laughed at me. Now? $8.75. Same exact size and quality.

Room cleaning is ONCE A WEEK.

A relaxing resort away from the hi-jinx of the strip.

I needed a family-friendly room on the fly.  Leave it to me to book a room last minute.  There were going to be 2 adults and 2 teenage boys, a regular hotel room wasn't going to do.  Went to bookit.com and found this gem for $100 a night.  SCORE.  Since it was a family trip I didn't need to be in the epicenter of the debauchery, but close enough to take a cab (which I did).

The property grounds were very nice. It seems like everything in Vegas was just built.  And this resort was no different.  The check-in was seamless and easy.  Had family meeting us and requested we be close to each other, done..... no hassle.  Upon checking in you meet with the concierge who gives you coupons, maps and a chance to attend a timeshare meeting I think.  I didn't go either way obviously.  

The room was very nice: Kitchen, dining area, living room (with sleeper sofa, and patio with view of the pool.  Bathroom off the living room.  Bedroom had a very comfortable bed (that we stayed in ALL day Sunday) and big soaker bath/shower combo.

The pool is awesome, for those who swim.  Sorry I don't get my hair wet unless I'm in St. Thomas.  There is a big Aztec-like temple with water slides. You can check out rafts for the kids.

There is an on-site restaurant and bar, that I went to a few times.  Underground parking to shield your car and forgotten lip gloss from a total meltdown.

I really like it here, and a $20 cab ride to the strip.

I loved this place. We had a 2 bedroom villa, it was huge and very clean. Pool was great. There's no gaming here and its a few miles from strip but that doesn't bother me at all. Its a family resort, which is what we were looking for. Theres a cool arcade hang out room with pool tables and ping pong table. I would definitely stay here again.

Not bad at all.  Stayed in Building 5, 4th floor.  Not your ordinary hotel experience as these are timeshare units.  So you get a fully stocked kitchen (Yes, plates, cups, mugs, pots, pans, utensils, sponge, dishwashing liquid, etc)  One king-bed.  Two bathrooms.  "Living room" has a pull out bed couch.  Old skool tube TVs. DVD player.   View was of the pool.  You don't get daily housekeeping unless you request it.  Overall a nice place to stay if you don't mind the drive to the strip. I agree the 10am checkout is a bit too early.  And no free Wi-Fi.

Also, if you're on the North side of the property and use the alternate exit (puts you onto Shellbourne Ave) , I suggest driving around to Wigwam Avenue which has a stoplight to make the left towards the strip/freeways.  Otherwise, you either make the treacherous left turn against Las Vegas Blvd traffic or make a right and flip a U-turn at Wigwam (which seems to take forever because everyone else is doing it too).  We passed by a pretty nasty accident from what appeared to be someone making that treacherous left turn from Shellbourne Ave.

I like this resort but the hard sell initially after you check in is really annoying! Skip the concierge desk because they try to sell you the timeshare. Thanks but no thanks, I'm here too vacation and don't want to here some sell pitch, learn to take no for an answer and don't be so pushy! It cost $100 but I would pay $100- just to get out of a timeshare presentation so there was no way I was going to but it, they act like it's part of check in..smh. Now on to the resort. The pool is suppose to be heated and it was 90 degrees outside and the pool was beyond freezing so we can't even enjoy it! We came to enjoy the amenities which are not even up to par. The bathroom has cracks and scuff marks and the tub needs cocking. There was even a hair which doesn't belong to us. This resort use to be nice..What happened???? This will be our last time here, will go back to stay at the resort across the street Tahiti Village.

The star rating is for the quality of the bed--good, and the plentiful hot water and decent shower. 

Contrary to some other folks, we found the staff pretty pleasant and helpful, except for the concierge staff, that is. They are here to ruin your visit, constantly hounding us with insistence that we needed to sign up for this marketing meeting or that offer with all sorts of strings. From the minute we checked in, these folks, who I am sure have gone to speed-talking school during their training, hounded us. We were tired when we checked in and only wanted a shower and go to bed when we got here after a week of driving and hiking in the Bryce Canyon area. But we were forced to listen to more than 20 minutes of pitches from the concierge (who were told to see by the clerk at registration) about Diamond Resorts time-share program. 

Finally we get to our room and there are no bath towels. I tried to call housekeeping using the extension posted on the phone and could only get a fast busy signal. In fact all of the extensions listed resulted in the same signal. So I called the main number from my cell phone, got towels delivered by a very pleasant person. 

Also, when we got into the one bedroom suite, there was a howl coming from air passing under the door to the hall. It sounded like a banshee. We got a pleasant man from maintenance to come--by way of my call to the main number, mentioned above. He also explained to me that all the extension numbers on the phone were no longer active, that one needed to dial zero to get the desk and they would connect from there.  When we went down the hall to get ice from the ice machine, the water sounded as if it was running constantly and, indeed, the carpet in the area was soaked. Great behavior on the part of management when there is a record drought. Good news is that after 3 days they did finally fix the ice machine, although it still sounds like water is running constantly.

The final insult  was when we went to check out, we were informed that while we were being accosted at check-in, we had inadvertently approved an additional $20/day resort fee. 

So, buyer beware....stay somewhere else. We certainly will if we ever come back to Las Vegas.

I've been here twice now. Everything is cool, except for one thing: no free wifi. 

Seriously?! Even McDonalds offers free wifi.

To say this place needs a rehab is an understatement. Diamond is in the process of doing this but it is a long drawn out process. Our room has water damage, the sink is clogged, and the dish washer is non op. Overpaid for the room based on the point we used. Expedia has it for around $60/ night. On the positive side, the staff is very nice and the pool, hot tubs, and slide areas are fantastic for the entire family.

Being an owner and stay quite frequently the last 3 stays have each got worse. So much I have already started looking to sell this time share and met with others. This resort is slow to update rooms, stuff in rooms the last 3 times doesn't work whether it was the ac vent, shower head or the other things each time. Not to mention each of the last few trips id hear employees foul mouths on the grounds and in the the cafe. Food has been cold and slow to get. What's going on Monarch Resorts? You pitch us the big show to buy but for the last few years I see less and less good and more and more bad. Not very happy with this stay right now. What used to be a fun place has steadily got worse each trip. Will not be keeping this timeshare that's for sure. Sad thing is the way my GF's parents were treated at their check in, luckily for them they printed out their conformation to prove it all. Decided to eat breakfast there for the 1st time in awhile and what a waste, everything was cold, not warm but cold. Also being an owner it would be nice to be informed of any changes that take place, like when shuttles are no longer available and its nothing but cabs which is a huge inconvenience at about a minimum of $15 plus tip each trip. From what they presented a few years ago to what I saw this weekend was a joke.

Overcharged on phone bill! Charged us for using phone even though no one was in the room making calls!  Whatever you do not go to the tour that's when they charged us for using the phone, even though no one was in there!  The managers are disrespectful never called me back when I tried to dispute it!  Called corporate and they even said the couldn't do anything!  Never again well I stay here because of this!

I am a diamond owner, booked a girls weekend way in advance. My reservation was for 5 guests in a two bedroom suite. I requested 3 beds, when I got here 6 months later I was given 2 beds.. after complaining to the manager about my situation she told me that I "have" to share beds as this suite accommodates 6 people... who does that!!! After talking over with my guests we agreed to settle and use the sofa bed in the living room,  well that bed is broken... the manager refuses to accommodate me elsewhere. .. her customer service is horrible. .. she sure didn't get the memo from owner about the power of yes... I will never recommended Diamond to any of my friends. .. and I'm sure my guests will not either...

Their new slogan is "we love to say yes." But they love to say no. Their customer service is still less than. One year later. they say they are "really busy" but they all are standing around like idiots.
Very disappointed the main pool is  close to March 2017 and there's no room service available and less you spend four nights.

We have been here several times over the last few years, and I have to say that it has exceeded our expectations each and every time! The staff is always amazing, the food is good, and the kids LOVE the pool and water slides! Is it a typical Vegas hotel? NO. But what this means is that you don't have to deal with the traffic from LV Blvd, get to park fairly close to your room without having to walk through an overly crowded, smoky casino, and you basically get a 1 or 2 bedroom apartment complete with a kitchen for probably less than a typical room on the strip. I have been there and done that with the crazy Strip hotels and I am soo over it- this place is somewhere you can come to to actually feel like you are on a real relaxing vacation, yet all of the craziness of the Strip is right down the road whenever you choose to partake in the craziness. Will they try to entice you to see a presentation and attempt to sell you a time share? Yes. But believe me, the ownership has been worth it and even if you decide not to own, it incentives are always very good (Visa gift cards, free stays, dinner vouchers, free tickets for shows and events, comped bills at the lounge and cafe, etc.) and totally worth the hour or so of time that it takes to attend a presentation! After staying there, I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Vegas!

We just got back from an all girls trip to vegas and stayed here for 4 days.  The room is like an 1 bedroom apt, with kitchen and living room, patio, entertainment center, and 2 baths.   I really enjoyed my stay, but hated walking to & from the car.  The pool is very nice, however we didnt really spend much time there.  This resort is located a lil bit far from the strip, and took us an hour to get out of traffic..  memorial wkend is super duper busy!!

My boyfriend and I were able to visit Cancun Resort as part of (unbeknownst to us at the time) a timeshare presentation. The pool area was beautiful with a Mayan temple water slide. The various show rooms were spacious and included full kitchens and bathrooms. There were TVs in the living room and bedrooms but they were all small. This place is located a few miles off the strip.

After the presentation and tour, we felt pressured to buy Diamond Resorts timeshare from numerous workers. We repeatedly explained that we needed to think more about it but each time, a new employee would come in with a new "deal." They were pretty relentless until the very end and honestly, that just took out the appeal of this resort and others.

Because I only have a limited space to tell of all the horrid things that happened on my stay at this hotel I will make an attempt to list them. 

1) The hotel lost our reservation & took 30 mins to check us in after we had to call a million numbers to prove to them we had one. 

2) The TVs were all missing the buttons, the remote had no back so the batteries flew everywhere & the DVD player did not work. 

3) Upon trying to put clothes in our dresser, it fell apart! 

4) Maintenance came to our room for these issues 5 times in the first two days! 

5) We found a pair of mens underwear in our room that did not belong to anyone in our group!! Housekeeping suggested they were ours & did not take responsibility for them. 

6)We had to move to a different room b/c of all our problems. The hotel did not offer to help with the move from one building to another. (6 people & a week work of groceries)

7) You are only allowed 1 pool float per room, even if you do have 6 people. There are not enough chairs for all the people. 

8) They say shuttle takes 15 mins. But only had 1 working so we waiting a min of 30 mins. Due to location taxis from here to strip are a min of $20 but avg $40. 

9) The GM was very skittish & wasn't happy about having to comp us dinner & drinks for our troubles. 

10) After moving to our new room. My husband & I both began to experience itching, welts & redness from sleeping in our bed. The front desk suggested we must both be allergic to the detergent. We did not find that likely since we were fine in the last room's bed. We had hives for 4 days! After replacing the sheets they finally started to go away but that was our last day. Housekeeping didn't even put them on the bed, we had to ourselves!

The organization and planning of this hotel is a disgrace. After staying at this hotel I will NEVER purchase a timeshare. I will NEVER EVER recommend this hotel to ANYONE! This is the worst hotel on the market. I am highly disappointed. Especially after reading so many great reviews. I could go on and on about how much this hotel ruined our trip but I will stop. I think you get the point. It was awful and completely ruined our trip. Oh and my husband and I just finally got our hives, redness and severe itching to go away today...one week after being home! DO NOT stay here!!!!!

We had a great family vacation here.  We had a Groupon, so I was worried the price would be too good to be true.  Our room was like new and HUGE.  Full kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms.  The pool is also huge and wonderful.  The slides and waterfall are great features.  I would definitely stay here again.  The strip is literally just down the road and easy to get to and park (parking in the casinos is plentiful and free!).

This has to be the dirtiest place we have ever stayed. There was so much hair and dirt on the floor we called to have it cleaned. When she left, the hair was still in the corners!  Ugh. By the elevators was a chicken bone, trash in the corridors and when i pulled out a dish, food stuck on it.

We stayed at Cancun Resort for 3 days 2 nights. The rooms are very spacious and well laid out. We stayed in the one bedroom . Came with a full kitchen, 2 full baths, spa tub in master bath, pull out sofa sleeper , dinning room table for 4, and a good size balcony with chairs. Pool area is amazing! Only thing I would change would be the pool and water slide hours. It's Vegas, why not a 24 hour spa like other resorts . All the employees were extremely friendly and helpful. Def recommend Cancun Resort!

This hotel is nice for families, not for those looking to gamble and party on the strip. It's too far for that! One cab ride to the strip averaged about $25, which I think is way too much. The shuttle they offer runs every hour, and it drops you off at the mall and near Tropicana. I said near. You have to do some walking from there. And the shuttle runs til about 10pm, so a cab ride back is the only choice you have. That being said, we stayed because it's a timeshare and it was free. The room was really, really nice. With a nice view. It was clean, with a huge bathroom that had a jacuzzi tub. The pool is nice too. So if you're taking the kids, or you have no desire to hit the strip, then go for it.

We stayed for a long weekend and it was a perfect place to be. We got a room facing the strip and it was beautiful. The best part is we got to enjoy Vegas away from all the business & it's only 3miles from the strip. The kitchen has all you need, so we brought groceries and cooked most of our meals in our Villa.  If we needed anything there is a CVS across from the Resort and a Market down the street. The pools, spas, & hammocks are perfect to relax from a long night playing on the strip or if you bring the kids. The Villas are clean, the beds are comfortable, & the whirlpool tub is huge. I loved our stay and plan on many more visit with my kids or just a weekend away with my husband and I.

The rooms were a big disappointment. We did  enjoy the pool area and the service was good and the staff members were very friendly. Out of all the diamond resorts we have stayed at this was the most disappointing one.

We made our New Year's reservation for the Diamond Cancun Resort back in May, requesting a Strip View Room.  We e-mailed and talked to someone a week before we arrived, with the same request.  We called the front desk while on the road in, four hours before arrival, and were assured that we were assigned that room.

We are in the VIP registration room and Suzanne informs us that we do not have the room.

She points out they've been reserved for months.  I shared our history outlined above.  She then told us she would have to "e-mail my boss" and see if something could be done.  By the time she was finished checking us in--lo and behold--her boss "answered" her and we got our room.  Of course, we thanked her profusely for her service--not wanting her to mess anything up.

Suzanne then informed me that we were going to lose thousands of points as of Jan. 1 (it was Dec. 29).  She said that they weren't rolled over.  I insisted that they were, and asked her to check my status.  She said she couldn't get access to my account--in fact, no one there could.  The only way I could get this rectified was to attend an owner's meeting the next morning.  Our schedule was full, and were not planning on attending a meeting, but she insisted that it was the only way to fix this and not lose our points.  Reluctantly, we agreed, and set it for 8:30 the next morning.  Suzanne reminded us not to miss it, or we would lose a $40 deposit she put on my credit card.  As we left, she came out into the hall to make sure that we remembered her name and how helpful she was for us, and she asked us to write something nice on the evaluation we would be receiving when we got home.

When we got to our room, I went online and discovered that yes, all my points had been rolled over to 2017.  She lied to us to get us to attend a meeting the next morning, which we did, not wanting to lose $40.

In all the years I've worked with Diamond, this was the sleaziest, most unethical thing one of the employees has ever done.  We would never recommend this company to anyone, and if we could sell our time share without losing thousands, we would in a second.

Stayed here with the family for a sport competition. I was extremely nervous after reading the reviews but decided to try it out anyway and we had an awesome time. Our room was in the Cancun tower on the 4th floor. The room decor and amenities were nice and accommodating for my large family. We had a 2 room suite and requested a crib. The pool, slides, afternoon activities and children activities were an added plus. Here are the things that were less than appealing: minimal underground parking, towel cards for the pool, only 1 bar (located at the pool). Luckily we were not approached for the time share presentation. So overall nice stay with a Food 4 Less grocery store across the street. Great stay for families.

this is an update from my review. I stayed here again and i must say their pool this time around was warm. I cant stand a cold pool and the rooms seemed to be nicer this time around. Decent parking and all. I would stay here again

Let me tell you that I've never seen such great customer service all my life! :-) It was after midnight but Robert the engineer and also Alejandra his assistant as well as Jordan the security guard were immediately willing to help me get my suitcase open. I had lost the keys and within a matter of five minutes or less I had access to my suitcase. These men should be commended for going above and beyond the call of duty especially after midnight! Thanks a lot I'll be coming back! :-)

Im an owner with no kids, this place is not for my husband and I.. The element here is all about families and cooking in and playing in the pool from the moment it opens.

The restaurant bar is a bit of a joke, and the pressure to buy more points makes a relaxing vacation more stressful. We were an original owner and saw most of it built.

We noticed that they no longer offer a shuttle which is a mistake for those that want to go to the strip and not have to worry about driving. But after this weekend I see that they don't need to offer the shuttle because more than half the people there don't plan on leaving the facility at all.

The guests that we ran into all seemed to be there on a free vacation offer. They were tatted up and pushing baby strollers... and screaming to each other WAIT TIL YOU SEE THE POOL....

My hubby and myself both looked at each other and said OUT LOUD, we don't think we will be coming back here again ever to this location.

We came home and looked into selling  it all together, but then thought maybe we would try another location that Diamond Resorts has to offer before we do so..

So bottom line, if you have kids and love the pool and slides and pool some more.. this is for you.. If your looking for a weekend with the hubby or friends in Vegas to relax and to enjoy what Vegas is all about... this resort is not for you..

Bed Bugs!!!! I stayed here with my husband and 3 young children. I did not think to look for bed bugs. However on our second night my children were complaining that they were itchy. I figured it was the change in temperature. When I got home I noticed many bites on my children. When I called the hotel to complain, they told me that they would need to get someone to investigate. I sent pictures and filled out a report. A week later I called and was told their investigation showed no bed bugs. So basically they told me I was a liar. I sent an email to tell them how disappointed I was and have still not heard anything back. This was my 5th stay with Diamond Resort. I was hoping they would compensate me since my vacation left me and my kids stressed out. I will never stay at another diamond resort because they aren't willing to make the customer happy.

First time staying at this resort and I have to say I am very disappointed, comparing to all the other diamond resorts I've stayed at this is the oldest not upgraded at all, very small room for a two bedroom. Next time I will definitely stay at a local casino.

We come here every other year to this resort because my brother in law happens to have time share here.  They have update their kitchen and bath with fine amenities like Toto toilet and granite counter top.  The hallway is clean.  Lots of room for kids to play at the pool.  The slides to the pool were out because they were under remodeling.  I would come here again because it's very kid-friendly.

Beautiful resort, probably has the best pool for a family of any place I've been in awhile. Food from the cafe is alright, overpriced, but decent. Rooms are spacious, but if you get a parking lot view, you're missing out. However, the wifi always seems to be terrible here. I have had issues with it being EXTREMELY slow, to just flat out not working. I let the desk know and they told me that it would be fixed any minute, but 4 hours later it still isn't fixed. So if you're the type who needs wifi when you plan to relax at the hotel (like myself), I would not recommend this place.
We were finally reimbursed for the disaster. It took a while, but we are satisfied!

Going to make this brief:

Stayed here on the last day of my vegas trip for one night/day as it was a time share of someone I know.  Kitchen area, living area, dining area, two full and huge baths, balcony, and two rooms, one with a king bed and the other with two full beds.  Clean and simple with a major "vacation" feel with more of an island design.

Pool was massive allowing everyone to have their own personal space with their friends/family without it feeling overcrowded.

Located at the south end of the strip, it is a perfect location for any one, especially families looking for an off the strip hotel.  Quiet, but fun.

OVERALL:  Once again, a well-maintained hotel with room to spare.

Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

We were only here for one night. After a long day of traveling we checked in. Then we were escorted to the " concierge desk." It is a sales desk for time shares with high pressured sales people. We were happy to finally be rid of it and did not sign up. It put a " bad taste" in my mouth. I just wanted to get to the room that I had just paid for and relax. The bathroom shower did not drain and the faucets did not work. The outlet by the coffee machine did not work- I figured that out myself. They close one pool quite early and guests were complaining. I will not be back.

This place really isn't that bad. I can here with very low expectations from looking at previous reviews and I'm glad to say I'm impressed.

We took advantage of this place less so as a resort and more so as our living quarters/hotel for 7 days. When we went to checkin, the lobby smelled of yummy coconut which immediately brought me into vacation mode- i thought it was a very nice touch. We had a 2 room apartment- master bedroom with a queen bed and private bathroom, 2nd bedroom with 2 twins, pull out queen sized sofabed in the livin room, little kitchen, dining room, another bathroom, and every room has a balcony (either facing the pool or the street). The living room was a little cramped but we made do. They only clean rooms once a week.

The pool area is very nice- not the cleanest but not noticably dirty. There are hammocks for afternoon naps but they're usually taken.  The chichen itza replica makes for a wonderful backdrop. go up the stairs and you'll find waterslides! There are jacuzzis around the pool and one inside the chichen itza if you're looking to get away from the sun. 

There is a Food4Less (supermarket) right across Las Vegas Blvd, super convienient for grocery shopping. Since you're in the plaza already, check out the Jerky Outlet. their honey bbq beef jerky is so, so yum.
The outlet mall is not too far away along with many chain restuarants- buffalo wild wings, chipotle, dunkin donuts, burger king..

The strip is ~7 miles away which can be difficult if you're relying on taxis/shuttles. We rented a car so getting to and from the strip took around 10 mins. tip: Every casino on the strip has Free self parking.

Unless I get comped at a hotel on the strip, I'll probably stay at cancun resort on my next visit as well.
Great pool and water slides!  Rooms,  tvs,  furnishings are outdated,  but comfy bed.  Full mini kitchen!

Great experience. From the moment we arrive we received the best service. The staff was friendly and helpful. We of course expected the 90 min "tour" of the facility. The concierge Yvonne Kosko was so nice she set us up the appointment gave us vouchers for free drinks and breakfast. The sales person we were assigned to Linda Bell was such a sweetheart. She provided us with all the information of the resort for timeshare purchase we did not purchase anything however and receive $120 towards the resort credit which I used for the spa and room service it was a great stay. The room, pools, spas and restaurant were clean I will definitely return.
