The most PUSHY, RUDE, ARROGANT, non customer service friendly place I have ever been to in my life! First off when we arrived we checked in and we're told 4 times we HAVE to attend the stupid meeting. So fine we go because they said it's 55 mins and a 100.00 Visa card. Well they tried to keep us well past the hour. Completely rude when we said we had to go! Tried to hold us! Called princess and sweetheart by Nick O! I'm sorry if you tell me 55 mins is all the meeting is then don't start crying and acting like I'm a crazy mean lady because I want to leave. nick seriously had tears in his eyes and said he was getting agitated, he got a manager and finally we were able to leave! Omg that was the the worst thing I've ever seen in my life! Nick O you need to find a new job! And for this Timeshare business you absolutely suck the biggest you know what ever!! I would never give you a dime! And never refer you as well!

This time I was visiting LV with my mom. I thought why not try somewhere quiet so that we can relax and have quality mother and daughter time. 
Cab ride from LAS airport to the resort cost us about $20.
First impression of the resort was... its a very small, family friendly and cozy Resort.
We stayed in 1bed room condo which had full kitchen, 2 bathroom, and the living room was made so that you can divide it up to use it as a second room with pull out sofa bed. oh. and... I loved the jacuzzi bath. 
Swimming pool was huge compared to the size of the resort. it had 3 water slides but only one of them was open to ride. I liked that they had separate hot tub jaccuzi for adults and kids. (Had 3 in the pool area) + 1 adult one. Also loved the hammock!! 
It was pretty nice resort but..... because it is not really a high standard hotel like resort there are some flaws.
- if you call room service or maid service it takes forever for them to get the work done. 
- room service menu is very simple
- takes forever for the cab to get to the resort 
Oh. it costs about $25-30 from the resort to the strip.
So if you are staying at the resort for couple days it is better to rent a car. :)
And if you decide to bring your own car they have free parking too! 
If you want a relaxing quiet time at LV I think it is an okay place to stay. Especially if you have kids.

I had the worst experience at the Cancun Resort the last time I stayed there. First of all, I discovered a dried blood stain on one of the pillows they provided. That is extremely unsanitary and unsafe. Afterwards, I had trouble getting back into my room because they deactivated my card/key before my checkout date. It was a real inconvenience coming back to the resort with my arms full of groceries at midnight and not being able to get into my room because they didn't do their job right. When I told them about it, all they said was "okay, it's done!" I didn't even get an apology. I was really disappointed with my experience at the Cancun resort.
my family and i come here at least three times a year and we looooooooove the penthouse. the pool is great. the location is great too cause its not crowded with people and cars. love it.

We are Diamond Resort members.  Pool was nice and the kids loved it.  Unfortunately, Cancun staff does not enforce rules and we had to deal with several people smoking in the pool area with staff just looking at them and doing nothing.  Room was given to us with clogged toilet, hallways smelled like sewage.

Great place!! First time at the Cancun Resort and it did not fall short. We had a hookup on the price from a cousin who works for  Diamond Resorts but the accommodations were First Rate! 
We had a 2 room villa with a living room, dining room, kitchen and 2 bathrooms with huge whirlpool baths and double sinks. Both rooms had flat screen TVs, one with a king sized bed and attached bath and the other with a queen. Kitchen came with everything needed to make and have full meals including pots, pans, flatware, plates, bowls, glasses...everything! The whole place was tastefully furnished and decorated. We were very impressed. 
The hotel's ammenities were equally impressive. The pool area was amazing and my son and his friend had a great time hanging around down there. There was a lounge area down by the pool that offered drinks and food. Had a happy hour with specials. 
We were very busy visiting Vegas this time around but plan to come back with the whole family and have a more relaxing escape and use everything the Cancun has to offer.

This is a resort that is part of my families timeshare. We've stayed here many times and every time we do something in the room doesn't work. It's horrible. This past time we stayed in their penthouse suite and everything that makes that room special wasn't working. What a waste of points. Jacuzzi's lights on the balcony were broken. TV audio was out. And our coffee maker didn't work. When we asked for someone to fix the jacuzzi he came out and said he couldnt do anything and that we'll have to wait till Monday. Good thing this was Fri night and we were leaving Sun. Boo.

Awesome pool to hang out at if you have access here!!
Plenty of room, giant pool, sweet slides. They have a bar/grill too. Live steel drum music playing while we were there. Nice. The rooms are great here, huge suites with jacuzzi's on the balcony.

Time share concept, too far out from the Vegas spirit. The facilities didn't look great. Pool not big enough for the number of room/suites. We were looking for the 2nd pool ja ja ja! There is only one,  not 2nd pool.
Level of Noise pretty high and pushy sales people wanted to charge $99 as a downpayment for having a 3 hours sales even, we were with our 2 kids and they ask "did you bring babysitter?....really!!!! No, not for us. We stopped by looking for a more resort family oriented concept in Vegas but definitely not the idea we had in mind.
As we walk in we walked out.

Great place for the family... Cant complain, quiet, smoke free an nice..   Of course if you want the hustle an bustle of the strip not the place. Rooms are nice an adequite... Need some updating... Pool an slides are the highlight for sure...
We stayed  here on a time share. It's not like the Vegas hotels on the strip but its ok.

We recently stayed here for 2 nights, July 20-22.  This is yet another one of the Diamond Resorts that fail to deliver the "upscale" "4 star" experience that Diamond Resorts nationally advertises.

The pros...

Beau Bryant. Beau is a great property manager.  Not only did he greet my family as we arrived... (not knowing who he was) but was always polite and helpful throughout our stay helping with luggage carts and everything.  It seems like he was everywhere checking on things and always available to assist anyone.  But when I finally went to Management over the issues I was having, he was very accommodating and understanding, and honestly, Beau is probably the reason this resort can operate.

Sometimes a person can make a difference, and Beau is one of those people.

The cons...

The CEO goes on UnderCover Boss, CBS national primetime TV show to advertise to the world how wonderful Diamond Resorts are... what a scam.  these resorts are nothing close to the "4 star" quality at any of their competitors

Leaky toilets throughout the night, lights that don't work, dark shower, dust everywhere, a pile on the ceiling fan above the dining room table, dirty dishes, furniture from a Salvation Army that will break as they provide wobbly support.  You can not put your suitcase on the bench as it will most likely break.

I would be giving this resort a 2 star, but Beau has earned the other 2 stars.  Lucky for DRI.

Reminds me of an all inclusive Cancun resort. It's also a timeshare so lots of folks being pressured to 'invest'.
Fixtures are worse than hotel grade and really horrid.
Kids are everywhere; all ages and probably account for 70% of the guest population. Lots of little teeny boppers yelling and cutting up.
Restaurant menu straight out of a ballpark.
I bought my room on Hotel Tonight for $102. Thankfully, not subject to timeshare pitch. It was touted as Luxe and, to me, is far from it.
So, I'm probably most disappointed in myself for having too high expectations from Lost Wages.
Next time I'll stay at the Venetian, pay whatever, sing for my supper and get comp'd.

DO NOT STAY HERE... unless you love constant calls their their AUTOMATED ROBOCALLS!!!

We stayed here once and I have to say it wasn't bad. But they will forever hound you will robocalls asking you to visit their other facilities.  

Asking them to stop does not work.

I've contacted the FTC about them.

The update is is because their robo calling the crap out of me! They will never leave you alone once they have your info in their system! (NOTE: the place was still super cheap for the room you got, *maybe* still worth it)

STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE PEOPLE!!!!!!!!!!
This place was and is a total night mare.  Diamond resorts is a shady time share company.  Do not deal with them they lie about everything and will try to take your money in any desperate way they can.  They will brain wash you and promise you all kinds of stuff.  They claim they are giving you some type of gift that is just another lie. They want to take your hard earned money to benefit themselves.  They stole money from me.  They took hundreds of dollars from me for no reason at all.  I never bought time shares from them because of their dishonesty and shady tactics.  Unless you have extra money laying around and do not know what to do with it stay away from this place.  Terrible people just after your money and stealing from hard working people.  So many nice places in Vegas that won't ruin your vacation or steal from you in the end. I have been to Vegas over 10 times and never once had a problem until I went to cancun resorts and dealt with diamond resorts.  Stay away from cancun resorts stay away from their time shares you will be glad you did.  Just trying to share our experience so others don't get scammed like we did.

I was looking for a family friendly hotel 
stay in Vegas. So, I found this place listed top 10 from an article I read that fit that category.

Cancun resort is a mile south from the Vegas Strip. For a party of five we booked a two bedroom place. The room we stayed was okay but the kitchen is a plus. The bedrooms could've been bigger if it weren't for the wasted space from the bathroom. A minor flaw that I've found was that the balcony screen door bug seal was loose. Overall, the feel is kinda outdated. Nothing too special here but you do get the basics. 

The fun factor here is their Aztec pyramid water slides. Sliding down the water tubes  will get you that adrenaline rush. The pool area is clean and relaxing. They do have strict safety rules at the pool. 

Just for staying, we did get two buy one drink get a second drink free complimentary coupon to use at the Caribe Lounge, which they did make us some really good Michelada's. When I used our last complimentary coupon the lady working the bar didn't honor it. 

If you're looking for a family hotel without the Vegas craziness this place is it. If you're looking for a romantic getaway this place won't offer much and will not give you an authentic Cancun experience. 

FYI, when checking in and checking out they will try to sell you a timeshare for this  hotel.

I booked a weekend stay here on Groupon for a great price, but was pretty nervous based on the reviews I read here. Thankfully, I had a much better experience than some Yelpers and we had a great time! 

Our room was very spacious and clean! There was a bedroom with a super comfortable King sized bed and an attached bathroom that was very large. It even included a huge bathtub with jets!! (Very relaxing!) We also had a small kitchenette stocked with amenities that made our stay so convenient. The living area couch pulled out into a bed that was also fairly comfortable. We were very impressed with the room!! 

Other highlights: The pool area was great, with ample seating around. We were able to park underground right near the elevators...super convenient! The location was ideal for my family: off the strip and only a 15 min drive when we wanted to be touristy. The resort was also right across the street from a grocery store and CVS, which was nice. 

It is weird that you don't get housekeeping if you stay for less than 4 nights. You'd think in that case they would at least give you bigger trash cans! It was annoying to hunt for a place to empty out our trash as they don't tell you where. Also this place IS a timeshare and they will try to sell you but honestly just say No and they will leave you alone. I didn't find them overly aggressive.

All in all, the Cancun exceeded our expectations and in the future I can see us coming back!

I like the one and two bedrooms here. I love the deluxe 2 bedrooms even more! My last stay was a blast wirh my girls. Sucks that part of the pyramid area was closed and being repainted while we were there in May, but that's better than seeing the amenities run down.

I own a timeshare here. The place is great especially the pool being so classy with the mayan pyramid at the center. The furnitures are a little outdated and tacky which is my only complaint. One major plus with this timeshare is that its just across Food for Less (thats open till 2am!) making it a level more easier to buy and stock food if we are on a budget. Another plus is the roomy bathtub/jacuzzi in every room! This place is like home away from home!

I will give the Resort a five star we love staying at Cancun Resort never had issues the issues I have is a presentation that we went to I told the representative at the beginning that we were not going to buy because now was not the time. He said no worries he would go over the new things that diamond had to offer within 10 minutes of the presentation he started talking about the maintenance fees and how much they will be going up in the next 10 years and that we should start to buy now before we can't afford it. Again I told him that we did not want to buy he brought over another representative and he got upset because I told him we were not going to buy our Representatives name was Scott and his last name started with a P. Not too sure what it was At first he was very nice till again I kept telling him now was not the time he got very upset and I even confronted him and told him "see you're getting upset" words were spoken to each other and he made me sit down and said he will call security if I don't cooperate he said I was the worst person he ever dealt with I told him to kiss my ass which made him even more mad he was like a little kid that didn't get his way. He told me the next time someone asks to go to presentation just say no and I explain to them I do that plenty of times but they say it's just for updates and it turns out to be a horrible experience Scott made me cry I talked to another representative at the lobby and what do you know here comes Scott like a little kid to listen to what I was saying to her and then told the representative that he wants to talk to her after I talk to him I understand they do their job but we have paid a lot of money into this Resort and all we want to do is enjoy it and not buy more points I will never come to a presentation at Can Cun Resort again this man still has me upset and I will talk about this to everybody I know and share my experience because nobody should be treated this way Scott was an ass and he can still kiss mine

Very nice hotel. I stayed here back in April while myself and my girlfriends ran the Super Spartan. Our room was huge to be a one bedroom. There was a full kitchen, two bathrooms and even the pullout bed was comfy (per my friends) the master bathroom was AMAZING! I mean the tub itself gets 4 stars. Parking can be a little tricky if the place was full (which it was) but were lucky enough to score great parking while we were there. They do try to sell you a time-share presentation when you first check-in which I am not a fan of, but I do understand they have to do what they have to do. The bar/restaurant area was nice but the service was a little slow. All in all, if I am in need of a room not on the strip, I will definitely look into booking this room again. Oh and fyi, we were able to do our laundry for FREE after our race so we didn't have to take home wet clothes and they even provided laundry detergent. Double score!

I'm here spending time with my family that is visiting from the Bay.

First off, this place isn't the best. Today started off with breakfast, of course. They have a "buffet" that you have to pay $13 or so per head - kids under 8 are half the price. The buffet is a little bit less than half of what you would find at a Marriott or Hampton in. Food wasn't great; it was hard and almost like it's been sitting out for a while. They had only OJ and milk for drinks available, unless you want to get something to drink at the bar 9 in the morning.

So after breakfast, we went for a swim. The pool is nice. The water is kind of cloudy. The towel thing is confusing. You get 1 towel per towel card, and they take the card until you get the towel back. My sister is a lifeguard, and don't leave your kids alone here. She says they don't know what they are doing to the full extent. They're careless. I decided to sit out a little and went to the Starbucks they serve at the bar. This is where I get really disappointed here other than the fact that I am standing there for like 10 min not being acknowledged what so ever until the girl points at me to tell her co workers that I've been standing there. Like "hello?!" You seen me, but didn't say anything. I am a Barista at sbux and proud to be one, and this is the most saddest attempt at making a stirred caramel macchiato that I almost cried. I don't even get fresh espresso shots. What does he put? Frappaccino roast, and freaking hella pumps of caramel syrup. This is just - omg. I literally cannot.

The hotel room is just ew. Didn't even plan on sitting on the sofa cuz it has a tinge of grey from who the hell knows what. 

Parking is weird. They don't have a parking garage, and all the parking is in the dark when it's night.

We stayed here over this past weekend. Were in need of a quick getaway. My mom owns a timeshare and this is one of her properties, so we used some of her points and booked Saturday and Sunday night and headed out of town.  

When we pulled up, it felt like we were not even in Nevada anymore, let alone the Vegas area. Nevertheless, positive minded, we headed in to check in.

What a NIGHTMARE! We went to one line to be entered into the system then were sent to anther line to get our 'welcome packet'. The second line was simply a ploy. On the spot, we were being hard closed on timeshare packages.

I explained to them we were staying at a family owned timeshare, therefore had no need to purchase. Oh no, that wasn't good enough. They went on and on. Honestly, I still feel bad, but they pushed me so hard that I had to get downright nasty and rude to them to shut them up. It still didn't work!

What seemed like an eternity later, we finally had our room keys and towel keys (you need one to get a towel at the pool), and were off to our room.

We stayed in room 1460. It was a one bedroom with two bathrooms, a dining area, living room area and a decent kitchenette. It was cute, a bit dated and a highly tacky, but not too bad.

The kitchen had glasses, plates, forks, pots, pans, a blender, etc. we really had anything we could need including a dishwasher. Which, might I add, was running when we got there..?! Haha

We had to fix the balcony door, as it was kind of broken. However, we could actually go out onto the balcony and sit, which is rare in Vegas.

The key cards deactivate easily, so we had to keep them ways from our cell phones and other electronics.  They didn't work well either, which sucked since you had to use them access the elevator.

The elevator SUCKED. It took forever to come and go, which is funny because it's only a four story building. I felt like it was going to get stuck multiple times.  At one point the fire alarm went off wen we were on the elevator and I absolutely lost my mind.  I was so happy to be out.

Then pool area was really cool. It has four water slides. Two small, two tunnel style ones that really zip you! They were a lot of fun.

It wasn't crowded either time we went and the temperature in the water was pretty perfect.

There was no wait staff for drinks or snacks of any kind, but you can bring drinks down in plastic containers, which was pretty cool.

There was a cool waterfall and a few hot tubs as well, one behind the waterfall. 

Overall the pool area was great.

All in all, the facility was clean, the room was ok, the pool was nice, the overall experience was just ok though. The reason for three stars, really lies with the way we were treated and the overall feel that we just moved into a crappy little apartment. It didn't, at any point, feel like we were on vacation in Las Vegas.

We had the suite for a couple of days. My new husband and I were very pleased with the size of this room. There's a bar in the living room, dinning are, kitchen. The suite has two bedrooms with two full baths, each room came with a hot tub. The master bedroom was massive with a king size bed. The balcony had a jacuzzi also and the view from our balcony onto the pool area was beautiful. To be cont.

It was out first time there, but it's definitely not our last!  

We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo with a living room and kitchen. 1 room had a queen bed and the other a king bed, and the living room had a sofa bed. The bathrooms each had whirlpool tubs along with double sinks. All in all, clean, fresh, and amazing! 

The pools are to die for with the waterfall and water slides!  Both, my boys and I loved that the deepest part of the whole pool was 5 feet. My 11 year old easily swam everywhere, but it was extra nice that I could navigate all over with my 4 year old - he's swimming but still feels more secure when I'm around. There were at least 3 jacuzzis that I saw; couldn't get in now bc I'm 35 weeks pregnant, but I'm certainly looking forward to getting in on our next trip! Especially in the jacuzzi behind the waterfall! ;) 

I didn't get to try the food - but the little hut near the pool looked like a hit!  Especially with all the mixed drinks people kept walking out with, lol. 

Again, definitely looking forward to coming back!  Thank you for being amazeballs, Cancun Resort!

One star for the resort itself, however do not fall for the sales presentation. After the first night, I was really interested in learning more about their "time share"  it was to be a morning presentation with breakfast. However it was 3 hours long, and no breakfast. The sales manager was rude and aggressive. After we told him the package he offered us was out of our ballpark, (especially with a 19.9% interest rate on a 4500 down payment) he said, "well, I don't even know why I am here!"  At this rate, neither did we. Finally, after 3 hours we excused ourselves from the table, where we were told we just needed to take a quick survey. We sat down, only to be baggered again. Same thing, worded differently. We then said, we were not interested, and the lady said "well, be sure you never ever sign up for one of these again." Thank you lady and  diamond resorts for ensuring that we will never even entertain the thought of staying here again,  or purchasing from you EVER.

My two friends and I recently redeemed a Groupon for a weekend stay for $159. Best investment I've made in a while. It was perfect for people who weren't looking for the chaos of the strip. It was exactly what we wanted. Close enough for us to go to the strip the first night (we paid $30) one way for a taxi. Yet far enough to lay by the pool all day and forget that we were in Vegas. You have to pay for Wi-Fi per device, but we weren't looking to be plugged in that weekend. The tub, the beds, the mini kitchen were perfect. We forgot wine openers but have no fear it was already in a drawer! If this deal comes up again, I wouldn't hesitate to take advantage of it.

The pool is big and beautiful, the cafe offers fast service and low priced food, the staff is very helpful and friendly, the villas come equipped with a full kitchen and comfortable beds. The strip is about 3 miles away so taxi rides can add up. My experience was good for a first timer plus I'm a timeshare owner so I got a few perks, like $80 to spend on any amenities in the resort. I can't wait to check out their Cabo Azul resort because it is updated and remodeled plus it has a private beach :)
My favorite place this hotel is amazing from pool area to taking your own food to bbq the staff was amazing very nice and kind.

The hotel is a little worn. We rented the two bedroom and it was very spacious for 6. The kitchen was well appointed. No smoking facility. Great for kids. It is 6 miles from the strip (and a $30 cab ride). The restaurant food was not good but they had decent drink specials. Fun and fast water slide. The property is a time share so be prepared to be pestered from the time you make your reservation through when you leave.

Stayed 5 nights through DIamond Resorts, we have stayed here before . Pleasantly surprised,VIP check in was nice and our room had a great view. The  room was clean well maintained with a full kitchen and a spa on the balcony.. Pretty snazzy! 

Our kids loved the pools with the slides , the bar and happy hour was a hit with the adults.

We did not try the restaurant but I'm sure it was great too.

We had free Wifi too!

BTW... this is not a hotel. It's a timeshare property........... so if you're debating on how to use your "Monarch Timeshare Points", consider your Vegas options. You might want to find a strip hotel deal and use your points somewhere "more special?" 

As everyone says in their reviews, it's far from the strip and all that nervous action, which may be a good thing if "you're me." But if you thrive on that "Vegas Energy", and you're hosting people who've never done Vegas... then I'd find something closer to the epicenter of The Strip, with casinos, whistles, bells and AYCE buffets! If you have kids with, then Cancun is certainly going to be less hectic, easier to get from room to pool, etc. 

As Monarch owners, (this is a Monarch Grand Vacations Resort), we scoped out the three room options; the Penthouse, the Two-Bedroom and the One-Bedroom. The rooms are equivalent to most timeshare condo-apartments. Yes, they do have a large pool and obligatory excercise and recreational centers, but if you start comparing this to say, the "Cabo Azul" Monarch property in Cabo San Lucas, it certainly comes up short as a luxury resort. And it's not "Vegas Luxury" level, so don't expect to be knocked off your feet with glitz and glamour.

As a past resident of Vegas, and a regular business visitor, I have my short list of hotel properties that I frequent, and most are either timeshare resorts, or suite-hotels off the strip. And sometimes I'll stay in Henderson; anywhere that gets me away from the tourist traffic of Vegas Blvd. So only because Cancun is far from the maddening crowd, and offers timeshare condo style lodging, is it on my list.

Check-in was easy and the room was great.  It was a good amount of space for four people (2 bedroom/2 bath) and it was clean.  It was a very convenient location - just down from the strip and easy to pop on/off the freeway.  It was surprisingly quiet for the size of the place.  The water slides were fun.  Because we visited in early March, a large portion of the pool was closed so we couldn't experience the whole thing.  It was disappointing that the hot tub was only open until 10:00 p.m.  Overall it was a good experience and I would go back there again.

We had a great 4 days here.  I dont know why people are leaving such negative reviews. Our check in was about 10 minutes, no hassle.  The pools are great and spacious. The slides are super fun even for adults to get on and be a kid again. The bar has great 2 for 1 specials. The bartenders do need more training though.  Our room was clean and quiet and cold AC, Nice Kitchen too.  Employees were always helpful and welcoming.  I will def come back again.  Thank You all.

Been coming here for many years at least 8years this has been by far one of our worst experiences we booked 6 rooms for my sisters bachelorette including a penthouse, before booking they told me pool would close at 10pm in which during our 3day stay with a group of 27 people pool for the adults closed at 6pm come on really kid pool stayed open ?? If we would of known we could of booked elsewhere.. Seriously Who wants to swim with the kids when you came to have a getaway with adults. While during the tours some of my guest did do were also told hours of pool area in which were lied to. Went to talk to the front desk and their excuse was to not heat the pool to cut down on cost last time I check as a timeshare owner we pay maintenance fees. All they wanted to do is bring up a champagne bottle!!  The employees at the bar give the worst customer service not friendly and take so long to even take your order. On day 3 time of check out then get told once again pool will be open till 10pm  cancun resort needs to stop lying to their guest after being their guest for 8years we don't plan to take our business there any longer

Nice non-gaming resort just south of the strip.  The rooms are full one bedroom units and perfect for a family.  The beds have just been replaced and the new ones are absolutely wonderful.  The pool is huge and perfect for families.

If you don't want to fight the strip and seeking comfort that doesn't bust your wallet, this is the place to go.

This place was a disaster!!!! We were told we could check in at 4:00. We went right at 4:00 and our room was not ready. We finally got in to it after a long 45 minute wait with 3 very tired and anxious children. The water slides I had read so much about were closed. My children were very disappointed.

The fact that the big pool wasn't heated was a major con, there was also mold in the spa tub. That being said the pricing was fair, the accommodations were convenient and the service was acceptable. I didn't care for the food at their little restaurant. Would go back for a cheap vacation.

We just left after a 2 night stay, from entering the lobby the day of arrival I knew we would be enjoying our stay. The girls at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. We stayed with Family in the 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite it was spacious the bed was so comfortable, my husband and I slept great. The bathroom are big the whirlpool tub is awesome!! We needed a fan since there are no ceiling fans and housekeeping brought it up quickly.
 The pool area is gorgeous great for kids and adults.
The pool bar: Haley and the girl bartender are great and very friendly. They both know there drinks.. The food is really good. We will definitely be back

I stayed here on July 19th-23rd 2013. I did not like their service! They are not friendly at all. They told us our rooms would be ready by 11 am, but ended being ready by 3pm. We waited in the lobby that long! Plus their rooms aren't all that. I got a 2 bed villa and nothing is upgraded. I've stayed at Tahiti Village and that is so much nicer and cheaper too!!! I will never stay at CANCUN resort ever!

The Cancun Resort (LV) has changed quite a bit since the original owner. The Caribe Lounge had a poor selection of food/drink and the Restaurant was closed. 

Time restrictions on everything. Anyone have kids that want to play from noon to 5pm only? At least the summer hours are a little better. 

They can't seem to keep scheduled request timely, so follow up on the clean towel request, etc. 

They spend way too much time trying to sell you a timeshare that they themselves will not buy back. Who invest in timeshares with the expectation of a high return anyway?

Some person half your age disrespects you when you say no thank you to purchasing the timeshare. They say that you are stupid for not purchasing.

I would have a better investment if I got a group of friends together to buy real property. 

NON-OWNERS get a better rate at the same resort than an owner. 

The yearly maintenance fees alone can put you in a $200 Hotel room. Better to use the Internet. MORE competition, BETTER options, LESS money!

We stay there for a week.  The carpet at the door entrance and next to the bathroom have nails sticking out still.  Be careful not to step on it.  You'll get multiple calls from people working there trying to sell you timeshare or some sort.  Decline at all cost.   Your room and towels will not be clean daily.  I won't stay there again.  Swimming pool was okay.
Disgusting customer service attitude,attitude and attitude. There is a lot of hidden fees. Watch out

I normally don't write reviews. I'm more of a person that depends on others to see there review of places. But I've always wanted to check this place out after reading so many reviews from here on Yelp and from other sites. 

If you're in Vegas, and you're looking to definitely just relax and get away from the "sin city / gambling / smoking atmosphere" 10 minute drive away from the strip, 5 minutes from the shopping outlet and town square... this is a must. If you're going with kids, this place is thee place. The pools, water slides and jacuzzi's are to die for. And the entire atmosphere is so relaxing and exactly what I went out there for. 

[Chante] I believe that's her name, apologize if I'm wrong... From the moment I walked in to check in to my room, I was greeted kindly and she took the patience to figure out we're both from the islands, which was very welcoming. It's always nice to connect with people.  She definitely hooked me up with some great coupons to use and some good insight of places to eat. Mahalo for that! 

Some of the reviews on here about certain staff being rude, might be a little different. Along with Chante, the entire Cancun Staff were impeccably nice and respectful in my opinion... I mean, I'm the type who love saying hi or giving a little smirk to random people, so you get you give. 

I definitely love the respect and hospitality they gave from helping with what I needed and questions I had concerns about. 


Only thing I would like to see an improvement on, is more parking spaces. At night, it's tough finding parking and walking a distance to your room. 

I will definitely be coming back here when I can

We just returned from a 3 night stay at Cancun Resort. I was very leary after reading some of these Yelp Reviews...and honestly almost changed my mind...but my daughter was dead set on those waterslides. So very glad she made us go.
We arrived at 8:30am on Monday morning and expected to just spend the day at the pool until our room was ready. We were informed that a room was ready for us. There was plenty of parking to be had! We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite that had all the comforts of home. Everything was super clean, and the room exceeded our expectations (we had high expectations as we normally stay at Mandalay Bay or Wynn). We wandered out to the beautiful pool area and our Daughter enjoyed the 4 slides over and over again. We took advantage of the daily happy hour with 2 for 1 specialty drinks from 3-4pm. 
I would like to give a very special shout out to Isabel, the Manager of the Activities Center for kids. My Daughter participated in numerous events and crafts while we were there and she is already planning her next trip back. She made our Daughter feel so special creating a tie dyed shirt, bath bombs, glitter tattoo, and competing in all the competitions. Isabel truly made our trip amazing!
Highly recommend Cancun Resort for a family get away. It's exactly what our family needed!

Had a stay cation here with the kids , I must say we had a great time , place was clean this hotel has everything you need , the kids love the pool 
Will come back this summer

Always stayed at this resort for a week or two with family and I can say I love it and definitely deserves 5 stars!! The staff is so friendly and the rooms are very comfy .. even have huge bath tubs with water jets!! My stay this past summer was very relaxing .. and I would be glad to say they have an amazing restaurant and great drinks right by the pool

WORST RESORT EVER!  
Pros
1. Water slides
2. Nice pool
3. Plenty of parking 
4. Floaties are allowed in the pool 

Cons
1. No initial greetings
2. No housekeeping service 
3. Hotel towels do not get washed, the resort provides detergent and a washer/dryer to wash the resort towels 
4. Rooms not ready upon check in 
5. 25$ fee if you lose room key or pool towel key
6. No working ice machines
7. Discriminates against disabled people, no roll in showers (even if requested), no ramps for wheelchairs chairs,
8. Elevators take 10 minutes- not to mention only two elevators are in the building and only one was working 
9. Trash is not taken out
10. Clogged sinks/ bathtubs
11. Kitchen missing cabinets
12. Staff is extremely pushy and want guests to purchase their VIP and future stay packages even after you politely tell them "No thank you" 
13. No valet service
14. You must take your own luggage to your room and carts are not always available at a nearby area 
15. Faster to take 8 floors of stairs than waiting for elevator
16. Pools close early 
17. Pools have dangerous sharp objects at the bottom. Please be careful! 
18. Halls are filled with trashbags that guest leave out for "housekeeping" to throw away 


The list can go on. You are better off staying at a motel. I definitively do not recommend staying here, especially if you require handicapped services. The pool is great, the stay and service is absolutely terrible.

We visited recently and really can't say enough about how awesome the staff and facility were. Our suite was clean and spacious. The kids activities were awesome. And the women that ran the activities were really adept at working with every age range. Great crafts for low cost. The slides were under renovation which was a pretty big disappointment. But I guess they have to do that at some point. Great pool and very relaxing. Not a great bar but whatever. Overall, we had a great time.

I stayed because I got a deal from Groupon.  But when I got there the hotel had canceled my reservation but Albert the front desk mgr claims u can call Groupon and they will fax over the information so u can stay at the price u paid. So they where so kind and had the same room I paid 247 on Groupon for they would give it to me for 347 but Albert confirmed again that it should be fine after I talk to Groupon on monday.  So then I went to the concierge desk and he was very rude this was Sunday at 3pm and he wanted to sell me a time share.  So I called Groupon they said they don't fax info over so I got stuck paying 100 more for a room but it's a great scam by the hotel cancel your reservation then sell u the same room for more. Don't stay there if you stay two nights or less u do not get housekeeping either. And the pool with the slide closes at 6pm.

I love the rooms - they are big and clean.  The jacuzzi tub is nice and the apartment-like kitchen helps you save a lot of money.  It's like being at home on a vacation.  It's a little further down on the strip than I wish it was, but the water slides are cool.  The concierge is very helpful.  You are across the street from my favorite mall in LV and a grocery store.  There are also many dining options nearby - Del Taco, Panda, Chipotle, etc...  

On the property there is a very small bar with some slot machines and yummy chicken wings / happy hours.  You can borrow noodles and floating rafts for free for the pool.  There are activities for the kiddies - like a Wii - nothing huge, but cool.  There is a pool table and such.  They are remodeling soon, so it will only get better.

We stayed for 2 nights in a one bedroom. We had a one year old and a 3 year old. 

The Good: 
Separate living spaces for kids and adults
Jetted two-person tub 
Kitchen with full-sized appliances 
Parking is free and close to elevators
Plenty of luggage trolleys
Pool is heated
Staff is super friendly
Pack-n-Plays are provided free 

The Bad:
Rooms are small 
Plumbing is loud
Internet is terrible 

For the price, you can't beat it. We usually stay at The Signature but The Platinum and Cancun are both on our list of acceptable hotels in Las Vegas now. Rooms at Cancun during the week at $53 when you use your AAA discount. I'm not mad about we get for those $53.

Staying here for the fifth or sixth time. It's better and cleaner than the last time. We bought as owners of a timeshare here and that company went bankrupt. Found out today that we had an opportunity to convert to the new ownership but it would only cost a King's ransom. I've had the absolute worst and most time-consuming sales tactics ever used on me today.

We walked into the Circus Circus lobby directly from the airport and immediately was accosted by a woman trying to sell us something. However, she didn't directly say what it was. Instead, she called it a "vacation program", and used phrases like, "don't you enjoy traveling?"  It did sound appealing, but my boyfriend was not thrilled. But because we don't live together - and therefore don't share finances - I could attend on my own. Attend, that is, after giving the woman a $20 "deposit" which would be returned to me at the presentation.  My sweetie had already gotten disgusted, and was trying to free us of the grasp of this woman so we could check in to the hotel. 

The hotel was great, by the way - see my review of Circus Circus, which I posted earlier. But this is not about the hotel. 

I found myself the following morning waiting for a shuttle. There was about ten of us from the hotel, and eventually the shuttle arrived and we boarded, and after a couple other stops, made our way to Cancun Resort Las Vegas.  

On the way there, a woman gave a talk to us called Hidden Las Vegas, which I found quite interesting. She discussed the Mob Museum, which we went to, and a favorite local Italian restaurant, which was too far from our hotel, but maybe next time.  

Once we got to Cancun, we were led into a small theatre with a man doing this incredible presentation. Honestly, he should be on a stage there in Vegas, instead of selling timeshares - he would probably make more money. But he was so obviously into sales, and if he gets a percentage of all those who bought into this program on that day, then he is doing very well. But I'm getting ahead of myself.

After the theatre presentation, where he enthusiastically talked about how good a deal this was, how much money we would save, and so on, we broke up into groups with our own individual salesperson.  My guy was Robert.  Robert was very nice, not pushy, and directed me to his iPad to look at various properties that I might want to visit.  He said he was getting married in March, and so I asked him where he was getting married, and where was he going for his honeymoon.  In Tucson, he replied, and it turns out he wasn't using this program for his honeymoon.  That was telling.  He was trying to sell me something that he wasn't using himself. I was getting a little suspicious.

Next, Robert took me on a tour of the premises. It looked right out of a condo complex in West Los Angeles - you don't even think you're in Vegas at all. There was a gym, a pool, kids activities - but this is Vegas. I don't go to Vegas for a family vacation. I foist my child off to someone else for the weekend and go to Vegas sans child. If I wanted to stay in a place like this, I would go to Seattle - or Portland - or any number of other cities. 

Now I understand one can stay here without buying into the timeshare program, so that might be appealing to some families. 

But I digress. The real issue is the price.  After discussing all the options, I said that I really couldn't afford any of them.  And I understood that the money had to be directly withdrawn from my account. That increased my suspicion a little more.  But of course this way the company gets paid every month, and gets paid first. Although I probably could have put that on a credit card - and gotten even more in debt. 

Finally, the manager came over, and said that the lowest price point they had was $190 a month.  Manager Bob, we'll call him, pressed me for information, and found out that he and I had both attended UC Berkeley.  However, my education at Cal taught me to think critically - which included saying no to buying a timeshare. I added that I was in the process of refinancing my house, something that would take a few months. He replied, "Well, why don't you give me the numbers - I used to be a mortgage broker." "No thanks," I replied, "You're not my mortgage broker, and we're not in California."  With that I was, finally, free to leave.

The others in the group - about 25 or 30 people - all went back into the little theatre to celebrate buying something that they will probably regret.  And would have difficulty in selling even if they wanted to do so. A quick search online under "how to sell a timeshare" demonstrated this point very clearly.  Additionally, most timeshares are marketed to people who cannot afford them. Given the discussion in the theatre upon first arriving at Cancun, this was definitely the case. 

Besides, if I was paying $190 a month for something, I would much prefer to make a car payment. At least then I'd have something tangible to show for it. 

On the way out, I did get my $20 back, as well as my complimentary gift - $100 gift certificate for Top of the World restaurant at the Stratosphere. Where we went for brunch the following day - and that was fantastic. We might even go back without a gift certificate. But that's another review.

Very dissatisfied. There were three of us staying, for CES 2017, and had no wifi for the entire three night stay.  Contacted the manager on the first night re moving to another room the next day.  Called the front desk the next morning and was told the manager would call back, no response.  Called again that evening and still no call back.  Talked to the front desk the next morning who talked to the manager, Aaron, who again told me he would call back.  He finally did call back and left a very unsatisfactory message.  I called again when I was back in service and was kindly told he would call back, no call back. Also on the final morning the micro wave did not work. Bad experience.

It's always nice to stay here with the family. The resort has a great location and good for kids. Staff is nice and the pool is awesome. 

Towels are valuable here, so I would bring your own or don't lose your towel. $25 for every lost pol towel.... 

Everything else is a good time!

Room and everything was nice but the "pool view" was blocked by a tree and the manager was unwilling to help us in any way as well as a couple other people who complained as well. So be careful if you want a view.

We stayed at the cancun for 7 days total, as a gift for our honeymoon.

Pros:
Clean!! Large, spacious rooms. Even a one bedroom has a second bathroom. Plenty of toiletries. Large, fully furnished kitchen w/ cooking utensils. Laundry facilities on each floor. Huge, beautiful pool. Concierge will help you book show tickets.

Cons:
Upon checking in, it took a good 3 minutes for the front desk to acknowledge that we even walked in the building. We understand that it was 1am, and maybe they were tired, but we had been on the road for hours, and a simple "hello! we'll be right with you" would've made our initial impression much better. We were the only ones in line, nobody was around. They werent in the middle of a call or helping anyone in person. LOL! Not courteous at all.

Our tub was clogged (gross). And parts of our room was falling apart. A piece of window blinds was missing on our bedroom window (not good for a couple on their honeymoon, thank you-- peep show?), so we threw a towel to cover the open spot. And a huge piece of long wood was randomly leaning against the wall in the living room next to the sliding door.

However, we didn't "mind" these things because we didn't pay for it. I'm sure other customers will love the pros.
But I will NOT stay here again if it came out of my own pocket.

Our family stayed here while on vacation a couple of weeks ago and we had a great stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool area is beautiful (we couldn't keep our daughter out of it). The only thing that needs improvement is the food quality.

It is my first time coming to this resort. I'm with my family and many kids. Must I say it is very kid friendly. Many activities for the kids and the room are nice and clean. Staff is also very friendly. Specially actives. Britney from actives center made our stay extra special. We have a disable nephew in our group and she made a little basket of goodies for all to enjoy. I way taken by surprise of her kind gesture. Will definitely return here!

This was our first time here. We stayed for four nights. The staff was super friendly and extremely helpful. The room was perfect with two bedrooms and a full kitchen. Completely equipped to make our own meals. It's a perfect spot for kids. The pool and water slides are the best and kids love love love them. The also have many activities for kids in their recreation room and games outside. We will definitely return.

As an owner we got what we expected from previous trips here.  The kids love the pool, staff is helpful and friendly.  The only reason there is one star missing is because of the funky smell of the hallway, or at least that of the third floor.  Also the knobs on the sink and shower need adjusting in the master bathroom in room 1553.  The sink knobs are too far back and you have to hit the backsplash to turn off the water all the way or it leaks.  And the shower knob is too loose.  

Other than that, and our disdain for the sales pitch/owner updates, Cancun is a good place for families.

Kitchen is fully stocked. FULLY. The strip is about a mile off and it is so worth it to stay here as a mini vacation. 
However, the girl staff at check are pretty rude. The staff at the concierge, Giovanni, politest people/person ever.
As for the timeshare pressuring, just say no thanks and DONE!

Pros: 
-1-2-3 bedroom Villas
-not too far from the strip
-Good little family place/party hotel room - no complaints of being noisy in the rooms/party 
-fully stocked kitchen with utensils, etc. 
-Cool slides at the pool for kids and the DJ guy is very entertaining and has entertaining things to keep the kids busy! 
-Pool hours are a little longer than most pools on the strip
-Cool bathtubs in the rooms 
-Great view of strip if you get a room on the strip view side of the property 

Cons: 
-Kinda run down
-Rooms are ok - not as large as expected, especially the kitchen.  
-Kitchen is very small and everything was squeezed together.  We had to shift the cappuccino machine and appliances to make room for our food and such.  
-Room service does not come daily and you have to call and wait on something if you need something specific.  
-Have to pay for Wi-Fi 
-Bring your own towels!!!  Hard to get towels - they keep track and towels are in this store type of place - not convenient to get towels 
-Pool side can be too crowded with way too many kids - we didn't have kids with us and I wouldn't recommend this place unless you are coming as a "Family" - not that fun if you want to chill (not a chill place) or adult fun.  Some of the guests were rude at the pool cause lack of limited lounge chairs - gets crowded!  

Overall, I wouldn't pay more for this place than I did with my Groupon
I wouldn't get a timeshare here 

You kinda pay for what you get.  Don't expect this place to be a 4-5 star resort because it's by far not close to that!  As long as expectations of this place is not high, then you are good to go..

Time of Stay - July 2013

This is my 4th time at this resort over the last 8 years and I think it's my last.  The pool area is great but everything else really needs help.  For most of my stay, only one elevator worked and several times I had to wait as it was full when it stopped.  I think that since Diamond Resorts took it over, they don't pay as much attention to this resort as Grand Monarch had.  They used to have a shuttle that would take you to the strip and back and it seems that it's now gone.  When I got new towels mid-week, one of them had a blood stain on it...good thing there was another towel!   The iron we had hardly worked, we couldn't get the wrinkles out of our clothes.  There was a leak somewhere as the extra toilet paper was tainted blue from the packaging and the Kleenex was soaked.  It definitely feels like Diamond is doing a good job with their resorts but ignoring the ones they purchased from Grand Monarch, maybe next time I will try one of the other resorts they own in Vegas and find out.

Pretty awesome resort. The Mayan style feel gives a great atmosphere. The pool is pretty rad, check out the inside spa under the waterfall. 

$5 drink specials at the lounge. Close enough to south point & the silvertin if you're feeling lucky.

Huge suites, nice balocony & full kitchen. Will definately come back.

Stay away from this hotel by all means - clue number one no parking anywhere . Not well lit at night - elevator an underground extreme nastiness - carpet in hotel I would let a pet dog walk on it - my bed sunk in a very uncomfortable - the kitchen area was a complete match box - this timeshare by far has been the worst experience - FYI there is not even a bell man to assist with bags- cod webs were on the kitchen floor I can go on an on but the cherry on top was our view was food for less from the balcony haha this resort look nothing like the pictures #fail

I have a timeshare here and the rooms are wonderful. I always get the penthouse which is wonderful and fully equipped. We had a few issues with some maintenance stuff when we were there two weeks ago, but they handled it right away. If you are thinking about purchasing here I would work with Antonio...he is great!

Beautiful hotel, great pool area. Family friendly place. Concierge service was less than satisfactory. They were rude and unhelpful. Did not give late check out as promised. Cleaning services did not show up on scheduled day.

If you're NOT going to Vegas for the usual hustle and bustle, then here is where you want to be. And even if you are, here is still a great place to stay! 

I'm not a big fan of Vegas' busy strip traffic and this resort is perfectly located not too far from the strip, at the beginning of Las Vegas Blvd. The rooms are very clean and very roomy and very reasonably priced! Fully stocked kitchen which helps if you have kids or a big family as eating out can be very expensive. Room service and hotel staff are prompt. The main pool is closed during the winter but the back pool with the slides is pretty much open year round. 

Oh also, this is my 3rd stay here this year and each time its been great! This is my go to hotel in Vegas!

As a guest we loved our stay. Our kids enjoyed our stay there and don't want to go home. Friendly and fast service.  Comfortable beds,  huge bathrooms with jetted tub, kitchen was okay for a short stay,  nice balcony, nice living room with sofa bed, swimming was pretty. All in all we enjoyed our stay. It's a family friendly resort. 10 minutes away from the strip. The best part was doesn't smell cigarette at all. Furnitures were kinda old but it's okay. Don't expect a 5 star hotel look.

We stayed here for our family summer vacation great location excellent service, place very well kept and very clean. Pool area amazing lots of fun activities for family. Comfy beds. Loved our stay had an amazing time thank you Cancun resort , we will be back :)

Despite the elegant surroundings, customer service was deplorable.  During my stay,they insisted I take care of my bill during my stay, rather than after like every other hotel in Vegas. My card wasn't working so they wouldn't let me back into my room until I took care of the bill. Then, because I was upset, they had me stay in the security room where they made me feel like a total criminal, especially by one person in particular, Peter Hervoyavich. I had to call my friend, pull her away from her job, and bring here down to pay for a small tab, despite fact I'd been staying for over two weeks at that point and had no problems paying until then.

Finally, on check out as I was complaining to the staff about my treatment, the above mentioned security person came up and once more attempted to intimidate me. I waited outside while my friend paid my bill. When she complained to security how bad they were at deescalating the situation (she herself works security), Peter H. said I'd been like that my entire stay which was a blatant lie.  

WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!

Drinks from the bar were soo good! I recommend their sex on the beach. The pool is huge and heated. One of the jacuzzis is right under the water fall sort of underground and is open until 10pm. Super relaxing. The towel service is inconvenient especially since they close at 8 so you have to bring your own towel from your room. No valet, but overall I loved his hotel. I'd stay again! Oh and it's super far from the strip, seems short on the map but the drive takes like 10-15min.

First, the basics. I was specifically looking for a resort without a casino, and restrictive smoking rules, and the Cancun Resort fit the bill. Our 2-bedroom unit was spacious, comfortable, with plenty of closet/dresser space for our party of six. The location of the resort is within easy driving distance to the Strip. The full kitchen was well-stocked with all the essentials including Cuisinart coffeemaker, blender and toaster. The only thing "missing" was a rice cooker, which we brought along. The beds (including the sofa sleeper) were newer and quite comfortable. The bathrooms are gigantic, including whirlpool tubs.

The Cancun Resort complex in which the unit sits, was virtually smoke-free, which is great for people travelling with children. There is a monstrous swimming pool at the heart of the resort with 4 water slides and plenty of room to swim around without feeling cramped. There is also a large game room off the lobby with pool tables, ping pong  and foosball. There is plenty of parking around the complex, including a limited number of underground spots for those (like me) who detest leaving my car out in 110+ degree sunshine.

Yes, this is a timeshare resort. Yes, I was asked whether I wanted to take a 90-minute tour in exchange for discount show tickets or a $100 visa gift card. A firm "no thank you" did the trick and I was bothered no more during the entirety of my stay. I would definitely come back should my travels take me back to L.V.

Stayed here with a big group this weekend. I had reserved 5 rooms in total. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!!!!

First things first, as soon as you get off your car you are not greeted by any of their staff members. When you walk in the lobby the staff members all attack you to join their timeshare and do not even help you out to check in.

Second problem, we arrived to check in at 5pm and the rooms were still not ready for me to check in. Check in time is at 4pm how are the rooms not ready by this time???? 

Third problem was that I had reserved 5 rooms and wanted them to be charged to the same card. Apparently, the guy had to do 5 SEPERATE transactions because he could not do them all together, yes, my card was swiped 5 times! The worker (named Stormie according to his name tag)  said that I was making him work because I had booked 5 different rooms even though it was all one single reservation!. This made the process soooo much longer! I literally spent a whole hour and a half just to check in and the guy still did not offer to help me with my bags or show me where to park or give me any info about pools hours or anything. He just had TERRIBLE customer service skills! 

Fourth problem, only 2 elevators for the whole building. These elevators are soooo slow! And to make things worse, only 1 was working. It would take like 15mins just to get to your room or to the 1st floor because the lines were to long to get into the elevator. 

Fifth problem, I specifically had asked for a handicap accessible room with roll in shower. When I walk into my room what is the first thing I notice, no roll in shower!!! How is my guest supposed to shower if he CANT get into the HUGE/TALL bathtub???
I called the front desk to inform them about this problem and they told me that there was nothing they could do because I did not request a roll in shower! Also that they could not switch my room because everything was booked.! I was beyond pissed by now! And the door for that bathroom was stuck inside the wall so we could not close the door!!
This place is NOT wheelchair friendly! 

Oh the list of problems does not stop there and this is only within the first few hours that I have been at this place! 

Sixth problem, the next day both sinks in the restroom clogged up. The only positive note on this was that they solved the problem fast.

Seventh problem, as you may now by now, all room have a kitchen included, well we brought our own food and of course when you cook a meal, there is plenty of trash everywhere right? No cleaning staff member ever stopped by our room to clean and pickup the trash!!!. We called so that we can a set of clean towels, and so that they can come pick up the trash. Unfortunately, you have to wash your own towels in the laudry room!!! WTH! What kind of room service is that????!! I had never heard of having to wash my own towels at a RESORT! And they NEVER came to pick up the trash!!!

Eighth problem, the doors to the rooms do not close properly. At night you can see a huge gap on the door that you can see the people passing by!

Lastly, they tell you that wifi is free on the first 2 devices, yeah well thats not true! We were charged a fee for using it on 1 device!!!


This has been the worst resort I have ever stayed at!!! Never again will I stay here!

The only thing that is nice about this hotel are the pools and slides, even though they are not as clean as they should be. Even that does not make up for the TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! 
 
Dont stay here! 

Customer service is a key to keeping people happy! You should keep that in mind Cancun Resort!

At first glance this place seemed really nice. The people at the front lobby were really nice and helpful.  As far as the resort it self went I found several things I didn't like, specially for the price I paid a night.  

To begin with the check in, there's no valet and you bring your own stuff to the room.  I guess I've been spoiled by my usual place ( The Signature) I stay when visiting Las Vegas but to me it makes a difference.  The rooms seemed to have been remodeled but in a hurry or plainly just half assed. The door frame to my room was broken and I needed to lift the door to be able to close it. The water faucets leaked and the shower head in one of the bathrooms sprayed water all over the place when turned on.  The bathtub is really hard to get into because the tub is a jacuzzi and its deep and is really  high specially if you are of normal height (5'8) or have children. The parking to the rooms seems to be unguarded and it gives me the vibe of a run down motel. 

The resort is far from the strip but that isn't necessarily bad as long as you know this.  I think the worst thing about this place would be the slippery floor by the pool.  I know people might say this is exaggeration but it's not. I think the floor is so slippery to the point that it is unsafe and as a parent this is a complete deal breaker. As far as the pools go they are very nice but bring your own towels. The resort offers towels by the pool but you have to bring a towel card ( provided at check in) that you must turn in when getting a towel and return towel to get card back ($25 fee if card lost). So I. My experience I learned two things, one I'm never going to let anyone else book my rooms for me and two this place was simply just not for me.

I used Hotel Tonight to book this place for $101, not bad for last minute on a Saturday night but I soon found that this place was very shady. I was ushered to check in immediately upon entering the lobby at 1600, which is the weirdly late check in time. It took about 15 minutes to get me checked in and they put a hold of $100 for damages on my credit card in addition to the purchase price. They let me pick what view I wanted and let me know that check out is at 1000, really early! Also the pool is only open from 0900 to 1800, apparently they really don't want anyone using it.  

After getting my keys and other information I was given a strange paper that proclaimed me to have diamond points and was told to see the concierge to finish check in. I thought that was odd but went over anyway to see what was up. Once I realized that they were trying to sell me a timeshare and other nonsense I said that I did not want a welcome packet (waste of paper) and that I was all set. The concierge was aghast that I didn't want the packet which is supposedly full of discounts and other things. She tried to convince me to take the packet and hear the speech but I was firm with my no thank you and went on my way. I think that they are used to a captive audience since the front desk made it seem like I had to go through the process for check in, which is not true. 

I then had to go out the front doors, walk around the building and into the parking garage of my assigned tower. The elevators are accessed from the underground parking garage and they are very slow, which is unfortunate because I could not find the stairs anywhere and I searched for them for the 5+ minutes that it took the elevator to arrive. 

The room itself is OK. The fixtures are dated, there is quite a bit of road noise but it isn't unbearable. This would be a good place for families as there are two bathrooms, one attached to the master bedroom with a shower and tub, and one off of the living room with a shower. There is also a small but serviceable kitchen with full size appliances and a dining room. The couch in the living room is a fold out and there are sliding screens to close it off from the rest of the "villa".  Also they try to sell you on the upgraded WiFi - for only $2.95 a day! - it is unnecessary. My husband was uploading pictures while I surfed the web and the free internet was plenty fast.

Pros:
Large rooms
Full kitchen
Cheap
Oversize vehicle parking and parking garage

Cons:
Weird front desk greeting
Sales pitches
Only 3 hours to use the pool
Rooms are difficult to access

We already have had to move rooms three times first was a accessible room which of course had no tub and moved us to a room with a super old school tv and the tv in the living ro remotes don't works and has super old appliances we had to down grade so annoyed for a 4 star resort o and holes in the walls very classy

I think I better just list this one: 

Pluses: 
1) water slides are awesome.
2) rooms are good size. 
3) kitchen's in the room make for cheap eats. 
4) bar by the pool is "reasonable" I put that in quotes because it is Vegas.
5) Free pool towels (see minus below that goes with this) 
6) Hammocks in the shade. 

Minuses: 
1) Pool is NOT like the advertise on the website. There is no "adult" pool. There aren't any real separate pools, just the side with the water slides and the side with out the water slides. 

2) METAL POOL CHAIRS!? Seriously!? Pool chairs with metal frames in VEGAS. Talk about burning your skin. Or as my friend so dramatically put it while sitting up to go into the pool "Why does Cancun Resort hate me?"

3) Only 6 towels per room. Which would be fine if you had 3 people. You need 2 towels for the pool: 1 to lay out on and 1 to cover the metal pool chairs that conspire to burn off any bits of skin that may come into contact with them. We had 5 people, I had to argue for my extra towels. 

4) The "life guards" (aka high school kids on summer break) went around randomly closing umbrella's with no explanation. Hello? This is Vegas, I am pushing 30 give me some shade!!! Its like the drug companies paid them to force us all to have cancer. In the words of Stephanie Tanner "How Rude!"

5) No outside food or drink in the pool area, but you CAN purchase drinks from their bar. Ummm... NO! We brought our own stuff and no one said anything. So I guess this is a wash, but just the hypocrisy of the sign irritated me. 

6) The time share sales staff are the most unorganized, non-helpful bunch. We were committed to listening to an hour and a half speal about how great the resort was, when we tried to move the time the girl in the sales office was unhelpful and didn't change our time slot (luckily if you start complaining about all the things that need to be fixed your 1.5 hour tour turns into 5 minutes. SWEET!)

7) Location is meh if you want to go to the strip. They do have shuttles which are awesome and we never waited long for, but they stop running at midnight, which sucks in Vegas. It is a 20 dollar cab ride back from the strip. Plus, when you're that far away you have to plan going to the strip not just walk down stairs. Which is kind of a bummer. 

8) Holy Tattoo's! I am not one to be totally judgmental because I myself have a few strategically placed ink, but wow. I saw more ink and young people with babies here then anywhere else in my life. It is definitely a "different" crowed then you would find at the MGM, Planet Hollywood, or even say Hooters. If you have ink and lots of babies, awesome. It just wasn't the scene I was expecting. 

All and all, not a horrible experience, but I would never pay to stay here (this trip was free thankfully), if it were offered as a free trip again I think I would pass and pay to stay at Planet Hollywood, MGM, or even Hooters over this place. 

Thanks for the weekend Cancun, but no thanks.

I LOVE this place! The most comfortable bed and pillows, so relaxing. The bathroom is wonderful. I usually won't bathe in hotel tubs but this one is so luxurious I just couldn't resist! It's nice being away from the strip but still close enough to be convenient.  The balcony is great too, it's heavenly to sit out there in the morning, to have breakfast and enjoy a good book.
The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the check in process when we got here. Right after you check in they push you over to the concierge desk for you 'gift' which is actually a long sales spill to schedule you for a 120 minute presentation to buy into time share. When I just get off a plane and arrive at my hotel, I want to get up to my room, not  be pressured into scheduling another sales pitch.
Aside from check in though, this place us amazing!

AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!  I would NOT recommend the Cancun Resort / Diamond Resort Hotel and the issue is not the resort itself but the sales staff and their tactics.  When I am on vacation, the last thing I want to do is listen to a timeshare pitch camouflaged by such terms like "Welcome Packet, "Welcome Package", and "Departure Gift".  When you have to tell them that you are not interested multiple times, THAT is a problem.  ...there was even a guy at the front door that attempted to intercept my decline, "Hey, did you get your welcome packet and discount coupons?"  Then he followed that up with, "Oh, you like to pay full price?"  That was as tacky as it was comical and the fact is, I would much MUCH rather pay full price (on a meal, minus a coupon) than have to listen to a sales pitch when I am trying to enjoy myself.  As if they couldn't get any further from me returning to the Cancun Resort or purchasing anything from Diamond Resort International, we get a call on the last morning but AFTER I had already called the front desk and checked out over the phone... to be sure to pickup a "departure gift" while dropping off my keys at the front desk (which I had already made arrangements for).  Oh brother...  If you are anything like me, this kind of annoying persistence just doesn't work and frankly promotes opposite the desired result.  This process puts a dark shadow over and certainly takes away from what should be an enjoyable experience.  And so there isn't any confusion, I will not be returning.  The property would have fared much better simply speaking for itself.  In my opinion, they should try that.   

Now, the reason why I did not rate the Cancun Resort lower is because I was greeted by a most excellent (helpful, sincere) front desk person whom I would name but I think the Yelp review guidelines (Privacy section) discourage that.  And actually, the rest of the hotel staff that I interfaced with seemed pleasant.  With all due respect, the Villa / Room and the pool were nice so it is a shame that my experience with the sales staff will serve as a "deal breaker".

I will add that I booked directly on the Cancun Resort / Diamond Resort and Hotel site and did not receive any special pricing in lieu of a sales presentation.  It appears as if you are going to get the unfortunate sales pitch no matter how you book your stay, discount special or not.  If you go, expect to be targeted as soon as soon you walk in the door.  NOT WORTH IT TO ME.  I'll take my vacation elsewhere.

Where do I start? My husband and I are current owners for another resort and love it. We were offered a four day....three night stay with Diamond Resorts in order to preview their resort. Due to the holiday weekend we had to get managers approval in order to get a room at the Cancun Resort due to non-availability. I was impressed that they gave us the place that "owners" stay at. I figured it would be top notch since "typically only owners are allowed to stay here". I actually had came here for a tour when this resort was first built 14 years ago and owned by another company. 

When we first pulled up to the resort I was impressed from the outside appearance. I was baffled when I spoke with guest services because, the girl acted like she didn't know what I was saying when I asked for an adjoining room and that I was new and had never stayed here before. I am pretty sure I repeated myself a few times. This resort does not have adjoining rooms. Meaning that if you had another couple....several kids....etc....you would have to hope and pray that they could get something on the same floor, etc. 

The outside pool area is nice. The restaurant by the pool is small and has minimal seating. They do deliver to your room but, they do not have to go menus. Their prices are similar to Applebee's and their food selection is wide. Towels seem inconvenient since you have to have a towel card in order to get a towel from the gym located on the opposite side of the resort from where we are staying in building #2.

The internet is mind boggling. Our resort and many like it have unlimited wifi for multiple devices. Not this one though. The first two devices are free but, each additional one ranges from $2.95 and then $5.95 each per day for standard wifi.  Say what???!!! That means only two members of my four member family plus one friend staying with us can use the wifi or else have to pay use it. That equates to one laptop, one cell phone and nothing else. We paid the first $2.95 so that my son could play online too but, my tablet would cost an additional $5.95 for one day if usage. Ummmm.....no thank you. Not to mention the internet falls offline continuously.

What is that smell???!!! This building or at least the third floor smells like an ashtray that was once wet and allowed to dry for an extended period of time. We actually went to the store and bought some febreeze air freshener. My youngest said that it reminds him of the nasty peanut  butter sandwiches that his school serves. Sadly it's not just the hallway but, our room too that smells like this.

The ice machine on our floor does not work. The room only had ice trays. The elevator has no ventilation so it feels like a hot sauna during the daytime. Can it get worse?

They do have a free washer and dryer located by the broken ice machine. Nice to have yes but, it takes years to dry your clothes. Fortunately no one ran off with our clothes.

The pool is nice but it is frigid. My normal water babies only did 10 minutes in the pool and refused to go back because it was too cold. It is confusing since Vegas was almost 110 degrees during our visit. 

Since we were unable to get a secondary room for our friend....she brought a queen sized air mattress to sleep on. I called room service to bring a pillow, a sheet and two blankets. They said that it would be here within 20 minutes. 50 minutes later......Nothing. I called guest services and was told that my request was already delivered earlier. I asked which room because it wasn't this one. After getting up to make a 3rd call after another 30 minute wait, there was finally a knock at my door. Finally! We could all get some shut eye. 

My friend went to her car and watched one of the handymen pour a bucket of water on their hallway carpet and then proceed to buff the floor with a hard floor buffer. That could be why it smells so bad throughout the building. The carpet is old and tattered and now it seems to make sense of why. Bonus....He must have added Febreeze because the first floor now smells nice.....or least by the main entrance.

Ahhhh the whole point of our stay.......The sales pitch. Of course they showed us the "nice" rooms with the febreeze smelling hallways. Their hospitality quickly changed and I am sure horns appeared when we told them "We're not interested". Why? We love our current company. We didn't even get a good bye from them. Just a very quick escort to their incentives desk and not so much as a "Bye Felicia". The other ratings are correct folks. They treat you like poo when you refuse to come to their side.

We used to come here years ago with our kids.  It was great because it was on the strip but far enough so that our kids weren't really exposed to the more interesting side of Vegas at that time.  The key attraction of course is the pool and the slides.  We came back this time for a girls trip for my bday celebration.  We took advantage of the grills that are available towards the back of the pool, and let me say, my husband would be proud to grill on those grills!  They were clean and fired up great so our food was able to cook to perfection!  And they loan you set of grilling tongs & spatula so you're all set with no worries!  The room was spacious enough to accommodate the 5 of us and I always appreciate a full kitchen when traveling.  The staff is friendly and accommodating. I had to take away a star for the resort not having the shuttle service anymore like they used to and the hard sell of the sales team.  I understand it's their job, but sometimes, when people are on vacation, they just want to be on vacation!

We booked The Cancun via Expedia.  Don't believe the ratings on Expedia as I did and made reservations for my family.  I was deceived by Expedia's positive reviews.  The Cancun is a time share!  The room was dirty, dingy and requires repair and updates.  There were stains on the carpet, broken furniture (including missing handles on drawers, etc.).
