I found a used soap w/hair in the master bathroom!  My two young daughters found a wad of blonde hair when they picked up the hair dryer.  There was gum on the ceiling!  If you  and stains on the floor.  If you decide to stay at this hotel, make sure to bring your own toiletries; strangely enough, The Cancun provided two shower gels,  one conditioner and a lotion, but no shampoo.  (I thought perhaps the cleaning crew made a mistake and provided two shower gels and forgot the shampoo; but the other bathroom was the same way).  The pool had large groups of people - many were drinking alcohol and left bottles and plastic cups around the pool.  Beware if you have a family which utilizes electronic devices w/wifi- only two devices are allowed wifi for free and there is an additional charge for every device thereafter.  Also, there was limited parking near your room.  I would not recommend this hotel.  We didn't even stay the night.  I found another hotel and left.  I called Expedia to advise the situation, but they would only provide $50 of Expedia credit to use in the future.  I wouldn't recommend Expedia either.  We lost appx. $450 ($400 w/credit)  I don't normally write reviews, but didn't want another family to get "tricked" and lose money like we did. To top it off, after check in they send you over to the "Do you have time to listen to our presentation", they will try to sell you a timeshare!

A beautiful resort to be sure....gorgeous pool...nice rooms (villas )....but then there is the timeshare pitch at the "concierge".... the 4 pm check in time....the 10 AM....yes 10 AM check out time that turns a 3 day stay into 2 days.

We never had maid service the 3 nights we were there...but she knocked on the door at 10 am sharp on check out day and seemed perturbed that we weren't out yet...we were out at 1010 am.   There is a 10 dollar per night "resort fee" but a lot of vegas resorts are doing that crap too.   It's like a gas station charging $3.75/gallon and then a $5.00 gas station fee.   Or a restaurant adding a $15.00 kitchen fee.   

If you don't mind the timeshare crap, and the shortened stay....it's a pretty nice place....but remember they are time shares and as a result some fixtures and kitchen equipment can vary from unit to unit.
The fridge didn't close, few of electrical outlets worked, the knobs came off the kitchen cabinets, causing a hazard to my children.

The lady at the front desk was completely rude. They try and sell you on their timeshares by comping food. Well I told her no thank you and I was waiting for my boyfriend. Then she tells me "oh so you can't make a decision without your boyfriend. Like you can't think for yourself." I work in customer service and I understand everyone has a goal and quota they need to meet. However to completely go off on someone when they kindly declined is appalling. I'm not sure if I want to stay here or get another hotel. So rude.

My parents own timeshare here and so whenever we make a family trip to Vegas, we always stay here. It's a 10 minute drive from the strip (they offer a free shuttle) and it's located across from a grocery store, tons of restaurants, and a shopping mall. 

The rooms are very nice and spacious and the pool area with the Mexican themed central structure is very nice. There's also a dinky little workout room. 

You definitely need a car to stay here. I wouldn't recommend coming here if you're young and you want to have your crazy Vegas experience. Stay on the strip instead. But if you're here with family and you want to really relax, this may be a better option.

would have get a 5 star but too far from the strip

the place was cozy

wasnt that expensive since we split between 5 girls..it was memorial weekend

they need more spas though..

it was neat a food max ..its a good place for families to go to.

I want to preface this by saying that I have not actually stayed here. Now before Yelp decides to flag this, I want to explain why I am rating this place.  I actually attended a timeshare presentation and this was one of the resorts being pitched by the timeshare company. They pitched this one because I indicated I liked to go to Vegas. 
The timeshare company "Pacific Monarch" pitched this place as heaven on earth and would be worth paying like $30,000 so I could stay here and there other resorts. BS. Did some research on this place so I can make sure that no one else falls for this scam or worse actually books this place to stay off a site like Expedia or Hotwire, etc.
1.) This "resort" is 6 miles south of Mandalay Bay. You are farther away from the beginning of the strip than the Stratosphere is from Mandalay Bay. 
2.) There is no shuttle to take you to The Strip. Vegas taxis ain't cheap and do you really want to take the bus on your vacation?
3.) Was curious to see how prices stack up on an off-peak weekday. 
Was quoted $159 for a small outdated looking 1 bedroom "Villa" on Pacifc Monarch's site.  For $159 and less you could stay at the following Strip Resorts: 

Bellagio or Nobu ($159)
Palazzo or Venetian ($149)
Wynn ($139)
Encore ($132)
Aria ($114)
The Signature at MGM Grand or Vdara ($99)
Caesars Palace ($95)
Trump ($90)
The Hotel at Mandalay Bay ($85)
Tropicana ($71)
Mirage ($69)
Planet Hollywood ($67)
Mandalay Bay ($65)
TI ($62)
MGM and Paris ($60)

So same price or less for better accommodations, not having to spend money on transportation, and actually getting to be in Vegas not Vegas Adj. So please people do research, there are many, many better options on in Vegas than this.

Great place for a mini vacay with small kids, with the pool and slides they had enough entertainment. Great size rooms with everything you need. 
Down side how hard they push to attend the timeshare, of course we decline and no big deal but then again trying to check out the sales pitch is crazy to the point you kind of have to be rude for them to leave you alone.

Can't imagine a big hotel in Las Vegas like this. The first day, we came this hotel, we very tired, the carpet in the room so wet, we thought it came from the ceiling. Because, we very tired, we go to sleep with hoping the carpet will dry tomorrow. But it's worse on the second day . After that, I found out  much water from balcony, LOL it soak in the room. I called for help.  First time, they cleaned out side the balcony, at the end of the second day, they dried the carpet. We're so busy to wait to fix something.  After they left, we toke baths, my husband step on nails at the bathroom's door, and he warned everybody. My mom was a victim after that. We called them after that, and wait to the third day morning. They used hammer bang some times, and left. After that, I use the bathroom , and forgot dangerous zone, I stepped on nails again. Ouch . Ouch. We're very tired to called them to report, but we have to. We must use big towel to cover at the edge of the bathroom's door, but when we close the bathroom, the towel move out or in, and we stepped on nails again. Oh, we're very exhausted. Until my son 9 years old stepped on them, I called them again with hoping nobody will get hurt after that. Nobody. We spend the third day like this. The fourth day, we must wake up early to come back home. 
The hotel's rule, if you don't ask , they will clean up the room after 3 days, not every day as I thought. I have to put the trash's bag  out side the door on the hall.  Call to ask for pillows, it toke a half day to get them.  We're living in a hotel as nobody is care or notice about that , or short staff, we don't know.
The boring, terrible summer ever !!!!!!!!!! Thanks Las Vegas, First time and disappointed

I rented the penthouse villa, rooms are great and comfortable beds except i requested an early check in but they made me come back because rooms are not available and normal check in time is 4pm. I had to use a different facility for my kids as front desk told me to wait at the pool until check in time... Really? I had to stay in the heat with my two little kids for 4 hours just because your check in time is not until 4pm. Front desk also told me that they will call me as soon as my room is ready, its been 3:45 pm and i still have not get a call from front desk. I had to make a call myself to find out if my room is ready. There are no visible signs to each building entrance.

This place only gets 2 stars because of the nice suites. Everything else about this place sucks. It's a family place and we brought our relatives, but despite the spotty shuttle service that ends at 12:15am it's a good drive to the strip.

Everything at this hotel shuts down at 10pm. The expensive grill and bar shut down, the pool shuts down, you can't even use your room's whirlpool after 10pm because of the "noise". Another pet peeve I had is the $100 deposit you need before you can even check in. It's to be expected, but the gave us no warning and it caused some trouble when my family needed to check into their room.

Even if you're looking for a family friendly place, this place isn't the greatest choice amenity wise. Great rooms though!

At first glance everything seems great. Staff held the door open as we checked in, they offered the kids cookies and coloring books and we checked in pretty quickly... And then they led us to another counter to get our "welcome packet" a.k.a. signing up for a 90 minute tour that will hopefully get you to buy a timeshare. I said "no thanks" and told him I was there to relax and spend time with my kids. He said I could leave my kids at the pool during the tour since its for "couples only". Really? Leave my 8 and 10 year old alone by the pool? I politely declined about 6 more times before he finally let me get on with my vacation.  I entered my 1 bedroom room and was (at first glance) pleasantly surprised. Not bad for the price I paid. But for the three days I stayed they don't offer housekeeping services. So no clean towels or trash service. By the second day, I was annoyed. I noticed fruit flies everywhere in our room, showers leaked, the garbage disposal in the kitchen smelled horrendous, a toilet clogged and my son woke up with 6 bug bites on his legs (they slept on the pull out couch). We also got another sales pitch in the form of a phone call to our room. Again we said NO. And then another pitch in the form of a letter slipped under our door.  And then once more as we checked out. Sheeeesshh! I gave it two stars for the fabulous pool. The only thing we really enjoyed.... But it's not enough to ever make me want to come back. Or buy a timeshare from any diamond resort brand.

My friends and I decided we wanted to go to Vegas and one of them  informed us he had a timeshare we could stay in. He got us the "Penthouse".  We are 6 guys, our friend said that it can sleep that many comfortably.  We all agreed, it sounded great. A penthouse on Las Vegas Blvd with a free shuttle to the main part of the strip for only the cleaning fee! 

      Well as it turns out if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.  We arrived at Cancun to find out that the cleaning fee was $280!! WTF? We could have got a couple of rooms on the strip for that alone. I later learned that the room cost my friend a hundred and thirty points which are a couple bucks each! That is some BS! For someone who supposedly is an "owner" this room sure cost a hell of a lot! 

     Next on the long list of disappointments. We specified that we were six guys and were not interested in sharing beds. We wanted rooms with twin beds. When we arrived sure enough both bedrooms had kings and the only other bed was the fold away sofa. We asked and they do not offer roll away beds! 

     Next up NO MF'ing shuttle to the strip! Ok now seriously WTF? This complex is at least 5 miles from anywhere interesting. It's a $25 cab ride too and from anywhere on the strip. So every time you want to go anyplace you're looking at $50 out of pocket, unless you want to drive, but who the hell wants to drive in Vegas? I want to be able to have a couple of drinks and not worry about having to remember where I left my car the next day. This whole "resort" is BS!

Then there are the rooms. The "penthouse" was nicely appointed. It had a small kitchen a nice living room/dining room combo and the beds were comfortable and it appeared clean (better be for $280 F'ing dollars!). But the bathrooms are ridiculously STUPID! The bathroom off of my bedroom had no privacy door, just open straight to the room. In both bathrooms there were jacuzzi hot tub/shower combos. Sounds great right? WRONG! I don't know what kind of brain damage the designer of these shower/tub combos was afflicted with but someone should have pointed out that people don't want to have to shimmy over a 2ft high ledge 18" wide with no safety bars or handicap access to get into the shower. AND that the shower controls should be located somewhere near the shower head! Not 5ft away on the opposite wall! Also the shower head should not be pointed at the entrance/exit of the shower.  Oh the stupidity just keeps coming.

  Next up, during the winter months there is Nothing to do at this place! The pool is closed the only restaurant is the snack joint under the pyramid. Which was okay. There is no gaming, no entertainment of any kind. A couple of us went to the spa and had a relaxation massage which was nice, probably the highlight of our time at Cancun.


     I cannot stress this enough! Do yourself a favor DO NOT EVER BUY A TIMESHARE! They are the worst real estate investments you can possibly make.  If you've got one DUMP IT! Take the loss and get out! 

     Even the staff seems to know this place sucks! I think they wanted to help and were nice enough, but they knew there was nothing they could do. I could have overlooked just about everything if they just had a shuttle, after all it isn't my money that's being flushed down the drain every year, but come on! If you're going to build a place so far away from all the action in a city like Vegas have a quick and cheap way to get to the excitement.

At first glance, this place looks nice. The architecture is well done. The pool is beautiful and Id say this place is good for families.
But for anyone else - stay away. The house staff are useless. They try to sell you things you don't want, they never listen or respond to enquiries properly, the cleaning staff are rude and won't respect your privacy, in house communication is horrible and the place is kinda jenky.
The wifi is horrible too. You have to log in from your room every time and only have a max of 2 devices unless you want to pay more. How is it "free wifi" if you have to pay?

I definitely won't be returning to this place. It needs some serious management shuffling and training in people skills.

We recently stayed at this resort, and while the resort was a beautiful place they defiantly were not the 4 star resort as they claim to be. We woke up to spaghetti on our rental car so my husband went to the front desk and ask if he could get a bucket with some water to clean it off and was told that there was a car wash for a couple bucks down the road. They also talked us in to doing there presentation for their resort, however we did not have to buy anything just listen for an hour and a half or so and we would get a free show and dinner at their sister location. So we went at 11:30 am and at almost 2:30 we had told 5 people NO. "We are not here to sell you anything just listen and have fun" the last 4 people were very rude and would not take NO for an answer, we can't afford 357.00 a month for the next 10 years!!! Sorry some people cannot afford that, even after you talked us in to going and we spent almost 3 hours listening to you be rude to us!!! The wifi was HORRIBLE, when they cleaned our room we ask for more coffee and they left none,  so we ended up calling down to get more and was told we don't give more unless you ask!!!   The room was not vacuumed and on top of that the towel that my husband came up to the room and got to clean the spaghetti off the rental car was just folded to look like it was a clean one and left in our room. We did have a jacuzzi tub in our room so I filled it up and got in, about half way full I noticed soap scum floating all over in the water so I am going to assume that no one cleaned it before we rented the room. We have stayed in lots of hotels and resorts and found this to be one of the most unprofessional, unpleasant customer service places ever!!! 4 star it is not!!!! Most likely will not stay with your resort again. DO NOT DO THEIR PRESENTATION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The location is off of Blue Diamond, about 6 miles or so from the L.V. Strip. 
There is alot of parking, under the buildings, and all around the resort. 

The rooms are huge, have a kitchen, fridge, dining table, chairs, two showers, a large, separate room, with a gigantic tub/shower. Really comfy bed, that was super big and great to sleep in. 

Service: ummm, a bit of work is needed. The elevator in building 3 was stuck for 10 or more minutes in 100+ degree weather. The staff took their time responding, and even went to the wrong building. If someone had a health condition and needed rapid response, then it would not have been good. 

I will return to this resort, because of the many amenities, but some work needed on a few things.

While I think the pool is awesome because of its size and the slides, the rooms could use some MAJOR revamping. I was not impressed at all. If I were in charge of the revamp, those kitchens and dining area gotsta go! I feel like I'm in some janky studio apartment back home. Not literally, but close enough. The carpets look out of date, the decor on the walls...there was nothing cancun about the room in my opinion. 

BUT...if you aren't a timeshare owner and are staying here because it was the best deal for your budget and family then it isn't as bad as I started off.

Enjoy!

We were in town for a family wedding, so the kids were in tow. Since being on the strip wasn't our main goal, I was happy to be at a place that wasn't right in it. These are timeshares, but you don't have to go through the 90 min. sales pitch to stay there. The rooms are spacious, fitting our family of 4, as well as three others. The pool was wonderful, and the kids had a great time on the slides. I took advantage of the fitness center, which was small, but had top-notch equipment. Also- FREE WIFI. All over the resort. That's one big win in my book. There are grocery stores close by, and the outlet mall. If you have a car, it's very easy to get to the strip if you so choose. It really is as good as it gets for a place to stay in Vegas, if you find you need to go with kids. Without the kids would be good too, if being in the middle of the hustle and bustle isn't your main goal.

This was by far the best resort Ive been to yet. I loved it and was affordable. The food was great too at the restaurant's on site. All of the staff was fantastic too. I enjoyed the huge pool and hot tubs the water slide all of it. The room was gorgeous and romantic. Loved 2 bathrooms in one room and 2 tvs. The jet tub was great Ill be back for that.

Everything about this hotel I love! The service, the room, the food. Love love love definitely staying here again. It's about 15 mins away from the strip. $22.00 dollars fee distance from hotel to the strip when you take a cab. Isabelle decorated our room for our 20th anniversary. Did an amazing job. More than what I expected. She was so sweet! Excellent customer service. Absolutely loved our stay here. Rooms were beyond cleaned and such a great homie feeling.

Oh, Cancun....
What are we to do...?
We have stayed here twice so far and to be honest, I have no gripes with the facility or staff in general. Both visits have been pleasant and we have enjoyed them for the most part. The end of our last trip left a somewhat sour taste in my mouth and I'll explain why.
    Upon check-in, we were propositioned to sit through their time-share circus show. We initially declined, but the 'gifts' they dangled in front of us were just too enticing for us to pass up for a 90 minute session of me saying "No." Three days and two nights free, $125 gift card and a free breakfast for me and the wife? I'll take that deal. 
     Star swipe to the presentation, which was sales pitch to the EXTREME. It was like a scene out of Glengarry, Glenn Ross. Holy smokes! They herded us out of of there and handed us over to their sales people. We got some broad who was coming on way too strong for my taste. Told her from jump that we were NOT interested, but we didn't want to be rude and she could continue if she wanted. She did and here's how our conversation went down:

Me: Yeah, I got a buddy who is an owner here.
Her: "Oh, yeah? He must be a really smart guy. Is he smart?
Me: "Nah, not really. I mean, he bought a timeshare!" (ZING!) Pure comic GOLD!
She was NOT impressed (Subsequently, I have had several chuckles at that scenario).

      This lady then proceeds to pull out her phone, shuffle through the pictures of her cat to find last year's sales numbers, shows me that her name was on the top of the list and tells me how she is the best salesperson there and then tells me what she makes. Then she says that she will close 6 out of 10 people and the other 4 "Just can't afford it." After determining that I COULD afford it she hits me with this look like, "...Soooo... Why aren't you buying...?" My wife and I simultaneously said, "We just aren't." (JUST LIKE I TOLD YOU WHEN WE STARTED!!!) She promptly shakes our hands and leaves. Point- Sam. 
     We had us a good laugh as we collected our gifts and left. All in all- we like the place, but those sales people are... They're really something. I will omit the long conversation had in the hot tub with a Diamond "owner" who is extremely dissatisfied with her ownership.
     This being the case, we still like it here and will come back... Cuz it's FREEEEEEEEE!

We had a groupon and a good price.  We had a one bedroom villa.  It was on the first floor of the hotel and had a full kitchen and supplies, fridge, gas cooktop and stove - there is a food 4 less across the street so you could easily cook if you want to.  There are two large pools and hot tubs on the property.  By far the best feature was the in room jacuzzi bath tub.  Bed was nice and comfortable and there was even a separate living room with a futon and divider - could have easily slept two couples with a reasonable amount of privacy for both.  There is a second bathroom with shower too off of the living room. Lots of kids with families.  There is a small bar (closes at 10p) which made an acceptable burger.  Cab was easy to obtain to the strip for about $35 each way including the tip.  Plenty of free parking.  After you check in you will be encouraged to visit the "concierge desk" for some coupons, and of course they want you to go to their time share talk.  If you don't care about coupons (we didn't end up using them) I would recommend skipping that stop.  In all it this hotel is convenient to the strip and much nicer and less expensive than anything u will find on the strip.  I would seriously consider it if you are in town for a conference.  As a tip - if you are careful about how you approach the strip it's actually pretty easy to drive - one night we went to the hard rock casino.  They had a free parking garage so we saved ourselves the $60 fee.  Of course, someone in your party needs to volunteer to be the DD, and you don't want to avoid Las Vegas blvd in your car as much as possible.

I simply just love this place! My grandmother owns a timeshare here for many years now and I have to say we have enjoyed every single time we have stayed here from just a few days to staying here for a whole week. The staff always makes sure your comfortable with your stay & they even give you a morning call to see how you're doing. Wow!

No matter what time of year it is, it's always such a nice time to stay at this resort. Like there motto says, " Stay Vacationed. " Like really it's true to the letter. I can't wait till our next stay here!

Customer service????  Awful!!! When we arrived we waited 8 minutes for an elevator! I guess all were broken but one. Then we went to our room where the AC was broken and the room was like a sauna. I called it in and asked for a new room. They said they would have someone there in 20 minutes and they would fix it. Every minutes was painful to wait with 3 children. After 30 minutes I called back down and asked what was going on and the girls a few more minutes. I went into the hall and made an engineer come in and work on the room. Yes, I did interrupt him but my family was dying of heat. This is July in Vegas, we need air! He worked on it for about 30 min an d the air started to work. But the room did not get cold until about 3:30am. We all slept with a wet towel over us. When I called the front again around 10pm to let them know of the heat and see if we could move I was told no and if I wanted the engineer to come back. No, I wanted air for myself and kids!

The next day I spoke to the manager where he told me there was nothing else he could do, only give me a $50 food credit. 

I went to the pool to try to save my mini vacation only to be greeted by the most difficult time ordering food and again bad customer service! It took 30 minutes to order food and then 30 minutes to get it. I asked to have it delivered to the room. She told he she couldn't there was no room service at the hotel at this moment. What??? Then the price of the food was wrong. I was over charged. She was upset with me and told me she couldn't change the price. She told me she needed to call a manager. When she called manager she said she couldn't come because she was running the gift shop and could not get away. Just to give me a smoothie. So she offered me a smoothie I didn't want. I felt forced but I told  I still wanted my bill adjusted. She kinda chuckled.

I went back to my room after that on the extremely slow elevators! 
DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I had a Groupon and it was not worth it! Not even worth it with the discount!!

Stayed here a week ago... Checked in Friday July 10th and stayed until the 12th. The experience was horrible from the beginning. We booked there penthouse suite a month and a half in advance for a birthday party. The main reason we booked the room was because it had it's own private jacuzzi on the balcony. Well upon check in we realized our hot tub was no operable. I called and complained only to get that they would get back to me Saturday morning. Saturday morning came and went so I called again with no answer. Went to the front desk and spoke to the Director of Operations who sent someone to check it out. After having to be in my room for 2 hours while the rest of my party enjoyed the pool they finally tell me that the hot tub will need to be manually turned on and off by maintenance the rest of the weekend. So it wasn't a HUGE deal but I thought for the inconvenience they could at least comp back some money for the room and inconvenience. The Director of Operations only authorized at 40 dollar food and beverage credit which was baffling to say the least. She had the WORSE attitude ever basically saying that since we paid UPFRONT she wouldn't do anything to accommodate us. We had 6 people in our party how do we disperse 40 dollars to people who thought we would have a never closing private jacuzzi. Such a disappointment.. And by far THE WORSE customer service ever.. The DIRECTOR NEED TO BE FIRED!! and her counter part assistant manager can also take a hike as well. How about you find people who actually know how to satisfy there customers.. The elevator takes forever to come, They monitor your room calls and choose when they will or will not answer, They don't take any complaints seriously, and they think I HAVE TO STAY THERE AGAIN. I DONT and WONT! The parking is awful as well!!!! I could go on and on about how awful this place is and we're actual members of this time share. 

HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE place to stay... STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK...

Oh yeah.. the pool is lovely though.

We got our room on groupon awhile ago and then decided to stay here again for the week that nascar was in town. Right away we found hairs on our beds (we had a two bedroom suite) we asked to have the blankets changed out. The living room had can tabs on the floor, which made it very clear that no one vacuumed. We stayed for 3 nights and four days, they said there was no room service for guests not staying four nights. We had to constantly call for towels, trash bags, and pillows. Then we decided to go to the pool and they said the pool slides were being repaired, my kids were so bummed they were looking forward to that. The incident that took the cake, was the presentation that they offer as a "gift for you." It's to sell you time shares, they called up to see how the room was and if we wanted the gift. A $75 gift card and free three night stay in a hotel of our choice. My husband heard that and wanted to go right away. I didn't want to. My sister was in the next room and she said she wanted to go too. They said my husband had to bring his wife in order to get "the gift." They said it would only take 90 minutes, so along I went we left our older kids upstairs and took our youngest with us.  The man that took us back started off by showing pictures of his daughter and how buying a timeshare had afforded him a life for his daughter that he could not have done prior to buying the time share. We then went into a room with a man that was very funny and did make good points about timeshares but never really broke down the costs individually. He showed the properties that they had and how we could purchase condos in our timeshares. Then we went back to the original guy that showed us the pictures of his daughter. He would ask us questions about what we wanted to leave our children has an inheritance? He said this would be great to leave them. Ummm a time share that is an extra burden to them, not so much. He didn't like that I didn't agree with him. I'm sure my kids would like other things to inherit when I die, a time share is not my form of an inheritance. He then starting bickering with us about how we pay for our vacations. We are very frugal we save and my husband travels and saves points through his work and we purchase our tickets to travel through that program. He said that was impossible, we said it was possible. He asked us how we like to travel, we said usually with family and we visit family. Well those are little vacations. We have big beautiful hotels and condos that we can purchase. He then started breaking down the places we like to go to and asking us how much we spend on vacation. Whenever we would try and anticipate the costs of traveling to a certain place he would chuckle and say that's not possible. I began to get irritated with this guy and my kids were calling me and texting me and I was answering there calls and texting them back. He began to get irritated with me doing this. He would stop the presentation and then say I'm just waiting for you. I would say you're going to continue to wait they're my priority. Finally he got irritated because we weren't answering the questions the way he wanted. He wanted us to pay $416 a month to finance our future vacations. We laughed that was not even a choice for us. The answer was no and that was not something we would want to do. My husband said I wouldn't even pay half of that. He wanted to banter back and forth and we kept telling him to just finish the presentation so we could get the gift. That's the only reason we were there. He then said I can take as much time as I want, you signed something saying it would take up to 120 minutes to be here. My husband said we didn't sign anything, and went to the lady in the front who had got us to come. He said I'm going to get the manager, wait I am the manager you're going to wait. We had already been here for over an hour and a half and my kids had been waiting. To finish this long story we got the gift but it was not worth what that guy put us through. He had someone come get his things because he was too upset to come back. This was not what I expected and I was very annoyed with the way this guy presented this package.

The good:  The resort offers a lot of amenities.  A very nice pool, very pretty and water was sparkling clean.  Nice area with barbecues if you are so inclined.  Check in is 4 pm but they actually got us in a bit early, about 2:45 which was nice because we had just arrived from So Cal and had a wedding to attend at 4:30.  The suite was spacious.

The bad:  The bathrooms were not ADA compliant.  Not a problem for my husband and I but my father in law is elderly, very unstable and uses a cane.  No walk-in showers -- tubs with a super high side.  Definitely a fall risk.  Also, there was no hot water on either sink.  Another family member who was staying there with her elderly mother who uses a walker was told that there would be a walk-in shower and there was not so she was unable to bathe.

The signs on the fence outside the pool area indicate that hours are 8 am to 10 pm.  But when we were there we noticed there were signs placed around the pool indicating that the pool was closed.  Several people including those with children were waiting to use the pool but were told the reason the pool was closed was because there was no lifeguard on duty.  Again, not a problem for us but I can imagine parents with excited pool-bound children would be very unhappy.  Now we were there in February but it was unseasonably warm and sunbathers abounded.

The Ugly:  The stench in the hallway was so disgusting that we avoided it as much as possible.  Perhaps they had a leak and the carpeting had mildewed.  I don't know what it was but let me just say it was not just an odor but a stomach turning stench.  We were on the second floor but we also noticed it on the first floor, though it was not quite as strong.

The staff is clearly trying to encourage timeshare purchase so it would seem that these problems would be addressed.  My recommendation -- replace the carpet, don't just try to cover it up with fragrance.  That ship has sailed.  Install handicapped bars in the bathtubs.  A lawsuit would be much more costly.  Not doing so says you don't care about the well-being of your patrons.  While I also understand that maintenance must be done, it was unfortunate that the water slides were not open.  Also, two of the four spas were closed for maintenance.  Not impressive to a potential timeshare purchaser.  And spring for a lifeguard to be on duty from 8 am to 10 pm.  Probably not as costly as unhappy pool-goers.  

Bottom line:  This resort has potential, but trying to save a few bucks makes them look bad.  If I had been considering purchasing a timeshare this definitely would have deterred me.  If the resort isn't willing to spend the extra bucks to impress me enough to draw me in, how would they have made sure I was a happy resident once they got my money?  Too bad... I won't be back and certainly wouldn't recommend it to anyone else.

Stayed here for four nights. The room was clean and comfortable although some fixtures could have used a little updating. Very nice place with inviting pool, waterfalls, and water slides. The inside bar has some small platters of food. Light meals, not big. The food and drinks were okay but the prices were outrageous. Three margaritas and chips - $40+ tip. Needless to say, we only went there once. Go shopping across Las Vegas Blvd and bring back groceries.

Our room faced north and we were able to park outside,  mostly in the shade, four floors directly below our balcony. Facing north we could see all of the strip without any of the noise. Because you are so far away from the strip and downtown, you will have to drive, Uber/Lyft or taxi it to where you are going. Almost all of the strip hotels now charge for parking, so Lyft was our transportation of choice but that adds up also. Much of downtown is still free.

We were guests of friends who had a Diamond Resorts timeshare. We sat down for one meeting to get the "special", but didn't commit to anything. Of, course the pressure was on to sign on the dotted line, but it's just not our thing.

Stayed here this past weekend with some friends as one of them had a timeshare here. We got a pretty nice room with two bedrooms and jacuzzis in both bathrooms. I say jacuzzis, but these things were like two person hot tubs. They were big and deep. They had three TVs, full kitchen, etc. The balcony was huge and had a nice view of the strip even though we wanted a pool view room. In any case, the beds were queens, but we could have used more pillows. Since we did not notice this until about 4 am, we did not bother them with this request. 
     The pool area is beautiful. Although it was a little chilly when we were there, there are two big pools, one with a few large waterslides that looked really fun. I'm sure this is overrun by small children in the warmer seasons. There are five hot tubs including one underneath a waterfall. This is relaxing, but loud and not conducive to conversation. There are others with hammocks around them and what not. Very nice groups with a huge replica of a Mayan pyramid in the middle. No outside food or drink as I was told by my nervous 18 year old lifeguard, because you have to buy theirs from the cafe and/or bar. We just brought ours down anyway and poured it in cups. Everyone else did too, so stop cryin!
     The fitness center was more of a closet. Nevertheless, I managed to get a very good workout in with the equipment that they have. You just have to think outside the box a little. The thing that bother me though was that the circuit kept blowing for the treadmills, so we had to keep flipping the switch in the circuit box. This probably happened every five minutes when two of the three treadmills were being used simultaneously. 
     As for the location, it is about five miles from the heart of the strip. Not bad for a short drive. The shuttle stops at 12, which pretty much makes it useless as that is when people need a DD. But if you want to avoid the hassles of strip driving during the day then maybe it is worth it. There is not much around, but there is a 24 hour bar across the street if you came to Vegas for that. Not me, but if you are sick of the strip or don't like people, this might be your spot. There are some food options, a food 4 less, and CVS for your convenience. If you have no car, this place would be pretty difficult as I hear cab fares are expensive to the action.
     I heard that the timeshare people were pretty annoying, but I didn't see any. I guess most people that stay here already have them, but some told us that the people still  bothered them. Not sure how the price/experience would be if you didn't have a timeshare.

I was looking for a hotel that was reasonable in price and entertaining for the kids that are pre-teen and a teenager. I came across this resort and it seems to fit what I was looking for. I booked the one bedroom villa which was enough space for me and my 2 girls. The pool was amazing with the slides and 4 spas. The fitness room and activities they offer as well. It's plenty to do here even if you just want to relax out by the pool on the hammocks... I would definitely recommend this place.. I think the times for the pool should be extended especially in the summer. Night swimming is way better when trying to beat the heat.

A driving distance from the strip, however that may be the only downside. Well, depends on how you look at it. If you like to separate yourself from the chaos of the strip this place is perfect. Besides its location, the rooms are clean and comfortable, big and very tasteful. Pool is huge and relaxing. The resort also features a few pool table where I enjoyed a couple of games with my brother. This place is perfect for families and couples.

Strengths: Incredible pool area with water slides, a Mayan pyramid replica with the waterfall, jacuzzi's under the falls are great (for adults only :), nice, grassy areas by the pool with hammocks, an overall great place to come in the warmer (or hotter) months for a pool vacation.

Issues: The villas are too small, when compared to other timeshare resorts.  The kitchens are tiny (compared with Palm Canyon in Palm Springs).  Additionally, the decor is too dark.  I didn't like the wooden window shutters-blocked a lot of light.  The bedrooms were way smaller than comparable timeshares.  

Overall, the perfect place to bring a family for some pool and water slide adventures.  The rooms are functional, it would just be nice to have some more space.  We'll be staying again next time we're in Vegas, mostly for the water slides, though.

Beautiful resort. We have stayed there twice. The pool is amazing and the rooms are great. The DJ that played at the pool on Saturday was awesome...very engaging and our son loved him and his music. 
The general staff, however, is pretty lackluster. Also, the food & service at the pool restaurant are terrible. We tried three times at the restaurant, hoping for different outcomes with no luck. The bartender was incredibly slow, only able to handle one small task at a time. The rest of the staff around the resort doesn't really smile or go out of their way to greet/help guests. I had three maids walking in front of my car as I pulled into the parking lot and they continued their banter, and slow walking, in the middle of the road in front of me (thus blocking me).  Perhaps I am just accustomed to friendlier, more accommodating staff at resorts and hotels. The potential of this resort is not being met due to the staff and the onsite food.

This is quite the place. Room is like an apartment. Pool area is just b-utiful!!!!!
We have a lot of friends who have time-shares here. They all have great rooms every time.  None of us have ever had any problems when staying here. This is a Stay-cation for us. Love it here.

If you are thinking of buying here, or staying here as a family....don't! The pool is great, but you can not bring your own food. You have to buy their food and their drinks...which is expensive if you have a family!  The rooms are nice but small. Please shop around before you buy or stay here!

I'm still at a toss up at whether or not time shares are worth it. 

The Cancun Resort is like having a little taste of Mexico without having to cross the border. The pool is amazing. It's huge with built in water falls, water slides and a Mayan pyramid as a focal point. I don't recommend being adventurous and going down the slides when you don't know how to swim. I near died when i reached the bottom (it was like a re-birth of traveling through dark canals then being thrown into the wild. I needed a doctor to slap me silly). Yes, a baby can truly drown in just 2 inches of water. A kind life guard did give me a hand and I bounced back and continued to enjoy the pool. They give you foam noodles and floatable mats for you to lounge on. The pool boy will even give you suggestions on where to party. This pool is so vast you will never bump into anyone even though everyone's got some sort of floatation device. It's a good spot for families to relax.

The rooms are like little apartments with 2 bathrooms, one master suite, a room with two twin beds, a full kitchen, a dining room, living room with a pull out sofa, and a balcony. They're clean but really dark. This place could use more lamps and brighter light bulbs. The accomodations are pleasant enough.

My only real complaint is the location of the resort. It's so far off the strip a cab ride will cost you $20 and the free shuttle takes forever!!! What a waste of time and money. Sometimes the shuttle never even came back or showed up. I recommend renting a car to get to the strip if you plan on hanging out over there. BTW, who goes to Vegas to not hang out on the strip? I don't get it. I will say though in the day time, the shuttle driver was very nice. There is a shopping center (grocery store and Starbucks) across the street. The cross walk is inconveniently placed and running across the driving lanes dodging cars going 60mph is a bit like playing Frogger. The shuttle driver was generous enough to go off route and give us a ride across the street. 

Best errand run ever. Fill up on bagels, rotisserie chicken, and full size bottles of alk and you are good to go. Remember these rooms come with a full kitchen so make yourself at home before you head out to party (pre party. pre party). Oh there's also a gym here if sweating in the Vegas sun is not enough for you.

Ok, I probably had one of the most irritating experiences here this past weekend.  All started when I got my room and then they send me to the concierge to get my parking pass.  The dude then tries to make an appointment for me to come to they're "owners update meeting." If I go, then he'll throw out some Vegas shows and freebies at me.  It's the same spiel I get every time and the goodies have all become crap items now. So really, it's not worth me sitting in an hour presentation.  But, I figure if I have time I'll try to come by Sunday "if possible".  The dude then makes an appointment for me and gives me something to sign.  I notice at the bottom he writes $20 and I ask him about it.  

Concierge: Oh yes, you're required to pay $20 if I you don't show up.

Me: HELL NO!  You shoulda let me know about that beforehand instead of trying to make me sign it without telling me! 

Concierge: I'm sorry sir, don't worry about it, I'll wave the fee.

Me: Yeah, after I just caught you in the act!  If I didn't catch you, I'd be stuck going or have to pay!

He then rips the paper he wanted me to sign and says, "God Bless You."  Like I'm supposed to feel bad for him trying to swindle me.  Yeah, I caused a scene and I was pissed! I've been an owner with Monarch Grand Vacations for over 5 years now and not once had I experienced such shadyness. That's total bs!!!!  

Also, during our stay we had to wait over an hour and a half to get more towels.  I was about to go downstairs and get it myself since it'd be much faster.  Because of the delay we were unable to get ready in time for a show we wanted to see and ended up having dinner really late.  Plus, one day during our stay, we took out the Do Not Disturb sign to have our room cleaned and guess what???  It wasn't cleaned! AAARRGGH!!!

To top it all off, when I checked out of the room I had a stimulating conversation with the lady at the front desk.

Front Desk: So how was your stay, Sir?
Me: Not so good.
Front Desk: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.

That was it! WTF??  Why even ask, if you have no care as to why my stay was not so good. It's like they got robots at the counter! They even had a problem with their computers and they couldn't give me a receipt. The lady at the front desk wanted me to have a seat and wait. By that time, I'm fed up with this place and I just tell them to email it to me.(I'm still waiting on that email and will probably never get it!)

I can't believe this.  I've been hyping this place up to my family for months since it's the first time they'd be visiting.  I even told them how they could become owners.  But really, I couldn't justify recommending the place after the horrible experience I had.

I'm sending a letter to management about my experience but I'm afraid it may be handled by deaf ears.  We will see.  I'm still an owner and I like the place. The room is comfortable and the large pool is great. It's the people that need work.  I'll be back again and the service better have improved or I may seriously look into selling my timeshare.

Came here with my girls a few times ! Nice little get away from the strip , the water slide from the top of the pyramid is great for children but normally closes early . The rest of the pool stays open till a later time . 
Having to bring towels from your room is inconvenient for some people. Staff are beyond welcoming , and helpful ! It's a huge resort with a gaming area and a couple restaurants . Great place for a staycation and the suites have everything you need including a kitchen and dining room area . If you go out in your balcony bring your phone just in case someone slams the door by accident, be careful it will lock you out : )

While we enjoy most Diamond Resorts and rate them high, we were a little disappointed in the penthouse villa we were in this week at the Cancun Resort. The room is in much need of upgrading.  It was dark and needed much more lighting.  Definitely not happy with the roaches in the kitchen.  We happen to stay in an ADA room.  The shower in the master room was an oversized jacuzzi tub that was very difficult to get in and out.  We almost slipped a couple of times trying to get in.  We had to request a step stool.  The concern of any handicapped person, much less a normal person, trying to get in and out of this tub should be a priority of this resort.  Also, the activities center needs to ensure they are communicating to all guests.  Upon our check in, we were given an activities list by day.  My nieces missed the all the Christmas Day activities because the revised holiday list was not distributed to all guests after the changes had been made nor did they make any calls.  It is likely we would not be staying at this resort again in the future.

I love it here. The wifi is super spotty...and that kinda matters when you're marathoning shows on vaca...but everything else is great. The room service is good, the penthouse suite is awesome, the pools are a lot colder than I'm used to, but the pool grounds are impressive!

There are no words, NONE that can even explain the misery this place is but I will try.

The service, if you want to call it that is absolute CRAP.  Mia at the front desk is rude and should not deal with people.

Ian at the Concierge, if you want to call it that, doesn't care and couldn't help dry a wet rat.

People here are liars.  We were told they have internet, for free. Lies. When I called to complain, they told me to get over it and did not provide an alternate (AND I'M AN OWNER HERE).  

They don't care about you once you have purchased, they only want the new $$$.  

The location is also about a 20 minute or $25 cab ride to the trip.  They told us they had shuttle service, they  no longer do another thing they lied about.

They only have 1 restaurant on premises and its just bar food $10 for 6 chicken wings. No fries, no sides. nothing.

This place is the worst and I wish on everything holy I didn't own here.

Seriously, don't stay here. You are better off on the strip.

We have stayed there a couple times and the facilities were terrific the only issue was that our next door neighbors were really loud. We made a few reluctant complaints but to no prevail. I wish we could have had a better experience especially since all the other reviews are so amazing. Hopefully you have a better experience than us.

We had a very nice stay at Cancun Resort this weekend.  My dad is an owner so we used his points to stay there.  We stayed at Diamond Resorts other property, Polo Towers, last time we were in Vegas.  This time we wanted a hotel a little off the strip but still close enough that we could easily get to it.  Cancun Resort fit that bill.
The Good:
Very nice property.  The rooms are clean and nicely decorated.  Huge pool (we didn't get a chance to use it but I did dangle my feet in while having a drink and it is warmed to 80 degrees which was nice).  The bartenders, especially Caesar, were really nice at the restaurant/cantina.  We ate at the restaurant for dinner once and two times for breakfast, besides being served on plastic plates with plastic forks it was very well prepared and tasty.  
The rest of the staff was all very nice, we got free tickets to a comedy show from the concierge desk when we checked it which was really cool.  
The OK...(a little bad):
The hard sell.  The concierge offered us a $100 room credit to use toward amenities in the hotel if we we did a "tour" of the upgrades they are doing to this property since DR just acquired it in September.  It was only supposed to be a 90 min tour according to them so we were like for $100, sure!  Well, when we got there it was the hard sell for the time share and it was going to take over two hours!  I had already told the concierge that my parents have bought a lot of points on purpose so that my sister and I could use them anytime we wanted so I was defiantly NOT interested in buying.  When we got to the tour thing I told the same thing to the sales lady and she was basically like "WTH?  Why are you here wasting my time?".  She was super nice and and this is her job so I felt really, really bad.  We ended up leaving and put the things we had charged to the room on a credit card instead.  If we would have known that in advance we would a have A) never agreed to go and B) ate outside of the hotel to experience other food that was probably less expensive.  I felt really bad about being mislead into believing it was just a tour.
Over all it was a good experience however and a learning experience as well.  I would stay at Cancun again.

Love this place!!! Has all the amenities I need for my family vacation. The villas have a kitchen so you can save money and cook at home. My LO loves the activity center and outside activities . They have arts and crafts for the kids, most if not all you do have to pay for, but nothing too extravagant. There is a huge Mayan temple with pools on either side. On one side, they have 2 water slides that you ascend to by climbing the stairs up the temple. There is an optional time share meeting that they try to sell you if you choose to go to. In 5 years of coming here I have not yet gone to it so I can't tell you how that goes.

My partner & I stayed here for 5 weeks recently, everything was peachy. Until towards the end when the cleaning lady spilled some bath salts I had in the bathroom & didn't bother to clean up behind herself. On top of that I had a teddy bear from Harrods I had bought my deceased mother & after she cleaned it went missing! No one at the front desk or security knows where it is. So i'd never stay here again, 

I will admit the front desk staff & all receptionist are 
quite helpful. My partner & I called about my teddy bear & he even went in person & they tried to find it. 

My previous review was jumping to conclusions. 

So yes good place.

Great place.  Not on the strip but not far.  Rooms were bigger than some places I lived.  Suite nature is great with kitchen, dining room and living room.  Staff were really great and accomodating.  Place was really clean.  No casino, which makes it cleaner and quieter than other local places.  Great for business or family use.

Just watched a group of 10 wait for a gate to open and come right on in with outside food and beverages.  Also, people have been smoking here on the pool deck all day which is still against the rules, but apparently no longer enforced.  This goes on while I, an owner, get called a transient to my face by a customer service representative.  These properties have taken a serious dive since Diamond Resorts took over.  I guess thats the Diamond Standard though; buy companies out and treat their current owners like trash until you force them out due to constant disrespect and harassment.

My advice?  Save your money.  Or, if you really want in, please God buy my points and let me out of here!!  I've never been treated so horribly as I have in the past year since Diamond took over.

Why are we not able to post negative stars on this thing?

GREAT PLACE TO STAY quality of the rooms are fantastic. Currently leaving today. The front desk was awesome. They give you a parking pass that is also valid to park on the strip. The pyramid pool is the best attraction and Mayan theme is great. The kitchen is LITERALLY FULLY EQUIPPED! And you can even request a mixer, rice cooker or use their grills. Only given 4 stars because our room was never serviced during our 2 night stay which was their standard policy. I personally love a freshly made bed after a day on the strip. CUSTOMER SERVICE IS FANTASTIC. Due to availability we were able to get a late check out and when the smoke alarm kept going off, maintenance showed up 10min after a call from the front desk.

Pretty cool place. The Decore  is simple the couches need to be updated or refurbish. You can not use your jacuzzi at 10PM. The larger slide was not in operation. The bathtubs faucet didn't work and it took handy man over 35 min. to replace. This is the only reason the they are not getting a 5 stars.

Worst scam ever they claim a two hour "tour" of a hotel that is really an extremely high pressure timeshare sell. When you refuse to buy they refuse to give you the promised gifts don't waste your time run run the heck away from this scam . . .run

If I had the energy I'd write more but for now I say ditto to J.R. who truly captured our Cancun experience. 
I'm not sure why you'd bring kids to Las Vegas but if you do this we be a pretty decent spot for that purpose. The kitchenette would definitely help on cutting down on eating out and the water slides were fantabulous fun. I liked the waterfall except it attracted the young ones which was not what I was looking for in a Las Vegas getaway. I'm sure there might come a day for me. 
Thanks for the low cost vacation Cancun Resort. Sorry to the poor time share presentation guy who apparently could tell he wasn't making a sale with my friend and I (Long Islands and pool on a hot day, just hit the spot too well).

One star is too much. We had one night in Vegas to decompress after vacation in Utah and booked this hotel because of the water slides and pools for the kids.  Checked in at 5:30, the hallway to our room smelled like rotten fish,  room was fine. Changed into swimsuits went to the pool to find it closed.  6pm, closed.  Front desk said that was their winter hours,  even though it was spring break they closed the pool. They said it would be open at 8am, kids were disappointed of course.  So the next day go to the pool at 8:30 and it was still closed.  Ask front desk again,  they said oh it doesn't open until 10. But check out is at 10. After a lot of complaining they gave us a "late" check out of 11am. So the kids swam for about an hour.  Such a waste of money,  don't stay here.

Great hotel friendly staff. The hotel is kid friendly but was not a major downside even with our room being near the kids pool. The kitchen was equipped with everything we needed to make breakfast and lunch which increased our budget for dinner...major plus. Came here as a couple will be returning with the whole family soon

Possibly the worst vacation yet. They corral you into a high pressure sale and promise you a $100 gift card and  3 day hotel stay. After talking to 3 sales men for 2 and a half hours they said you need to talk to one more person to get your gift. At that point I said I'm done and will not recommend this place to anyone. Was a nice place to stay until Diamond Resorts took it over.  Talk about taking a good thing and driving into the ground

Pubic hair jn your sheets and pillows!! Thats how you know you should never stay here. urine stains? Dont they clean? Well every 4 days but who knows how well they clean. We ended cleaning the dirtyness ourselves we were too tired to carry luggage and groceries to another place. Management didnt offer to upgrade or refund anything and just offered to come and clean after we have done it ourselves. The worst part was the continued calling from salesmen to book timeshare tour. They say theres no pressure but they get mad in your face when you say no. Theres no non smoking rooms they are all non smoking. Theres signs that say smoking allowed in the patio but of course people wont reapect that so expect the smoke smell to linger your room. 

The pool is nice and pretty fun for kids and adults. But the condition of the room ruined the hotel stay. We never felt comfortable laying in bed or using the restroom. Patio is covered in bird poop kind of gross. 

And finally!!! The TV's. You get a 20 inch or so in the living room and 18 inch tube old tv(dont give me the its retro because this resort is not trying to go for that look its just cheap and antiquated) so there you go its up to you to decide if you wabt to stay but trust the reviews, this resort doesnt really care about quality. Otherwise there would be upgrades.

I like the place. But I'm currently dying from the heat.  Our A/C is still broken.  It's our last night here and can't wait to checkout and go home to some cold temperature.  I'm so disappointed.  We decided not to call anyone because the A/C randomly started working last night.. however,  fast forward to the next day and it's still hot

edit.  

The elevator is super slow.  I assume one was broken because we've only used 1 elevator since we checked in.

I don't get why this resort averages only 3 stars. I would rate it 4.5. I stayed here earlier this month for a weekend getaway with the wifey for her birthday. All of the hotels on the strip were $$$ including the crappy ones so I found this one on Trivago for only $129/night. The dcor is elegant and the ambience is bright and welcoming. The front desk workers were very professional and friendly and checked us in quickly. They have free parking(no valet) all around the resort. 

Our villa was large with a full size kitchen, living room and separate bedroom. They had 2 bathrooms. It was super clean and modern. They had a nice outdoor balcony. The bed was firm and comfortable. It was super quiet. The outdoor pool are is nice and serene. There is a large square pool with jacuzzis at the corners with hammocks.
Their gym is pretty tiny and has a few treadmills, machine weights and some dumbells. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here. The villa was impressive and comfortable(5 stars). Service was excellent(5 stars). Only minor complaints were $10 wifi charge per day and no shuttle service to the strip(5 miles away). The main demographics of people staying here are families and older couples. Don't expect house music playing by the pool! I would definitely stay here again.

Incredibly rude concierge. He rolled his eyes at us when we didn't have time to listen to the timeshare pitch- we were late for dinner reservations. He also made sarcastic comments to us and then to the other concierge after we turned around to catch our taxi.
Their shuttle only goes to a shopping center, not the Strip, and there is no transportation to the airport.
Save your money for another resort- luckily there are several better choices available.

Great customer service! Our room was great but our view was not so attractive looking into the parking lot, I mention it to the girl that originally checked us in and with no issue she changed our room at no extra charge, it was beautiful! Great room with a fabulous view looking at the pool. She made it all come complete for my family and I. The pool with the waterfall and slides are amazing my 9 and 5 year old really loved it, all they did was pool, eat, sleep and all over again x4 days!

Seriously, you get what you pay for, and in our case, we got a lot!  We got a really great deal on Groupon to stay here.  We were aware BEFOREHAND when we saw it was a Diamond Resorts property that there might be some timeshare spiel, but it's not forced on you...we can attest to that. 

The 2-bedroom villas are comfy & spacious.  Ours had a jetted tub in EACH of the 2 bathrooms and that alone was worth the price.  I'm not going to say it was an EXCEPTIONAL room...if you want that, go pay $300-up at the Bellagio, seriously.  The room had its flaws, but none that affected our stay or our comfort. We loved that it had a full kitchen, complete with full-sized fridge, full oven/range, microwave, AND DISHWASHER.  There are cooking utensils, dishware and pots & pans you can use, so you don't have to spend a lot on eating out-- especially since the grocery store is right across the street!  The resort is also close to shopping (the Premium Outlets are just a couple blocks away) and restaurants, but the best part is THERE IS NO CASINO ON THE GROUNDS.  Because there is no casino, it tends to be less smokey, so better for families.

The grounds are great and there is no bellhop service, so call me crazy, but I don't need someone waiting on me hand & foot and am capable of shuffling my own luggage, thank you very much!  They do have the big bell hop carts at your disposal, which was handy.  We didn't really need to rely on staff too much-- but they were very friendly when checking in and the couple time we had to call Front Desk, they were very friendly & patient.  I guess we're just low-maintenance vacationers!

The pool is nice, with little water slides, but the water was pretty cold, even while the weather was hot outside.  They have big hammocks around the pool area and it was really relaxing. It was no big deal for us with the towels, especially since brought our own-- and hey, the rules are simple. You can complain all you want about towel cards and this & that, but it's pretty basic- DON'T TRY TO TAKE THE TOWEL :P

All in all, we had a great stay.  I liked it better here than other cheaper places we have stayed.  We didn't order food here, but can't be any different than other hotel food, which can be pretty bleh to begin with.  For the price you pay when you get a good deal, you're not going to find similar accommodations.  We'll be back in December!

My family decided to take a vacation around Christmas time this year and we picked a Vegas destination. Being time share owners we took advantage of the Getaways offered by interval international and chose Cancun by Diamond Resorts for our seven day vacation. Check in was easy as we came in December 17 in the evening. I started to get really suspicious when the front counter pointed us to th VIP reception and the lady there pushed us to accept their welcome packet. When I questioned her weather this was another time share presentation she replied that it was just a way for the hotel to welcome their visitors. She offered a buffet ticket for four at the Stratosphere(more on that later) and a $25 Visa card. That on the condition that they hold $40 on our credit card as a deposit. THAT IS A DEAD GIVEAWAY FOR A TIME SHARE PRESENTATION SNARE SO BEWARE!

The room we chose was their smallest units. The kitchen was a little cramped as the refrigerator took a better part of the counter, but it was a full sized ref. They also had a full size gas stove, coffee maker and blender. Can't complain on that one since we would rather prepare our food than put up with over priced and unhealthy meals outside, and we did use the kitchen. The unit had one bedroom but it had two bathrooms. The sofa bed had good mattress support that gave us a good night sleep. The room also had two flat screen TVS (40" probably, Samsung brand) and a dining table for four. The bathrooms were clean and the whole unit was simply spic and span. As far as the room was we were completely satisfied. The only thing that did not work were their kitchen knives as they were extremely dull. If you regularly use time share properties you know what I mean, which is why we always bring our own kitchen knives.

It was when we went to pick up our welcome packet two days later that the experience hit a sour note. We found ourselves herded into this large parlor along with at least 40 people that we finally figured out what we were in for. That's right, it was a marathon time share presentation that lasted three whopping hours! I was hoping that they would cut it short for the sake of our five year old daughter, but no. By the time the whole affair concluded we all had dry eyes, my back was aching and we were all starving. The presenter was so busy talking about himself that he did not bother to ask us if we wanted to purchase. We already have two time shares and no longer needed any. That could have saved us 1.5 hours and could have earned Cancun 1.5 stars in this review.

At the end the only good thing was when we finally went to pick up our gifts and free our captive $40 they ran out of stratosphere buffet tickets each valued at $13 (as paid by the time share company to another time share company), and instead offered us three $25 coupon to the Top of the World restaurant along with the $25 visa gift card. There is another issue with these coupons that they issued but I will cover that on my review of Top Of The World restaurant.

If you are a time share owner (not Diamond Resort) and are going to use Cancun for your vacation, fight tooth and nail to reject their "free" gift offers or "welcome" offers. You will save yourself a whole half a day of grief unless you get a kick out of time share presentations.

Stayed for two nights July 15-17.
Check in was quick and easy. The person helping me was not very personable though. I asked about wi-fi service and was told that you could purchase the service(I had read online that it would be $10 a day) and the gentlemen explained it is $10 a day per device so I didn't get it.

My family and I stayed in the 2 bedroom villa and were suprised at how nice it was when we got to the room. The kitchennete was small but had everything we needed (pots, dishes, spoons, glasses, etc...) to cook several meals. The rooms were clean and had, flat screen T.V's, lots of space to store your belonging, and huge jaccuzzi tubs. I enjoyed my stay inside as much as I did outside.
 
On our first night there, my husband and I went to get a drink and walk around the pool. We walked up to the pyramid and had a really nice view of the pool area. The pool itself was lots of fun and had 4 slides. There were lots of spas and hammocs for people to use too.

I recently visited Cancun Resorts in Las Vegas and had the ultimate massage! If you are ever in Las Vegas you have to see Bruno! He is absolutely hands down the best masseuse there. You will leave feeling like a new person. I got a full body massage and a foot scrub while there. It lasted for about 60 minutes but felt longer. I absolutely loved it. Thank you again Bruno! See him ladies and gentlemen also...he is the best there!!

Although I thought the room was spacious, private and comfortable, I will not be returning to this resort. Before booking I read about sales tactics and "bait and switch" manipulating. I am glad I read those reviews, because sure enough, there was a salesman eagerly waiting to pitch me. He literally hovered behind me as I was checking in. Proceeded to try to bait me into a "tour" and free items, and would hardly take no for an answer! All the while, my arms are full and I'm exhausted from having travelled all day. Rude, and obvious. Also, bad security, as leaving a door hanger (asking me to go to front desk for complimentary gift, another sales pitch) on my room all day while I am gone, is the best way to let any crook know that the room was vacant and a good target if someone chose to break in! As a woman traveling alone I did not feel safe. I don't recommend this place, unless they change their sales tactics drastically. Stayed in January of 2017.

Stayed here during the summer for a little mini family vacation. They were in the middle of remodeling as they were changing to a diamond resort, the room I originally booked was nice but didn't have the walk in shower I had requested but after the first night they upgraded our room for free so I could take a shower and it came with an extra room. The pool area was great for the kids and the staff was great and very helpful. It's a great resort for families that don't want to deal with traffic and everything that comes with staying on the strip. We will definitely be back.

Nice place to stay if you have kids. They had lots of activities for my kids and they enjoyed the huge pool and the activity center. The rooms are decent and comfortable. Customer service was great. Overall its a nice place to stay.

I would like everyone to know that the Cancun Resort has a spa!  Infinity Spa is located in building 4.... Once you walk into the building turn left and they are located at the end of the hall on your right.  The website is www.infinityspalasvegas.com Great prices and locals are welcome!   The phone number is 702-614-6222
Stayed here because I have a timeshare but I like to be closer to the strip. I think they should have shuttles to the strip and to the airport but the last time I went they didn't offer it.

Had a great experience staying here. The pool area is amazing. It is very clean and is very practical. The water slide is fun and there is plenty of seating for everyone. The room is very spacious. It came fully equipped with dishes, silverware, cookware, cups and cooking utensils. The dining area is also very nice. It is about a 10 min drive from the strip but it is very worth it! I definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Vip check in/Front desk/ Maintanence:[4 star rating]
Upon arrival, we received prompt and friendly customer service during the VIP check in process. The room we checked into was decent but outdated and currently under renovation.For example, the stove is about 30 yrs old, the spa tub was old and inoperable and the undersink cabinet door was completely removed. I phoned the front desk to inform them, they were attentive and sent help immediately. Although the front desk operator present with courteous telephone etiquette and offered to switch rooms the following morning, the maintenance technician (also very pleasant) did not replace the door.

Security: [5 stars rating]
We attended a lounge last night and on the way back to the resort I had dropped my cell in the taxi cab and forgot to pick it up before getting out of taxi. So this morning when I awaken, I was so upset and frivolously calling all the taxi cab companies before calling down to Cancun security. I spoke with security personnel Josh. He was so helpful and went above and beyond by helping me investigate which cab company fits my description. He also spoke with his supervisor to request review of the security camera to help with identifying taxi company. Josh called back hours later to gather more information to help me find my cell. Fortunately, my cell was returned by the cab driver. I am so very appreciative of the service I received from Josh. Thank you Thank you Thank you!!!! [If you read any of my reviews you will see I don't tolerate poor service so the 4 stars I'm giving Cancun is SOLELY based on the customer serviced I received.

3 stars goes to their pool that's it... the pool closes late which is good latest pool is 9p and Jacuzzi is 10p. Love the slides! The room was ok not quite big it has a small kitchen and living room with 2 bathrooms. Easy check in no lines like the big hotels but their system sucks! And the annoying timeshare people! Oh they don't have a bell desk and the housekeeping will take forever if ever u need extra towels or pillows like for real I've asked towels and it came when all my visitors are gone. And the PARKING SUCKS my gawd super irritating and the place needs more signage directions to point where the building is and HOW TO GET THERE!!!! The maps is not enough if there's no sign arrows to point is the direction! I've had other tourist walking with me and was so irritated that has no signage! This place needs more upgrades to do! If I'm gonna buy a timeshare wouldn't be in a place that would just stress me out! So 3 stars is how the pool is the rest is 0-1 stars!

Very much enjoyed my stay at Cancun Resort. The room was nice and the  staff was great. Except for one thing. My family decided to enjoy the game room, except for my fifteen year old son, who wanted to do something else. We were alone in the game room and My son laid down on the couch.  An older male security guard came in and with an authority  type voice and told my son" sit up". Now I understand if there was some rule about laying on the couch but he could have had a little more guest service. A simple " I'm sorry young man but I need you to sit up in case another guest would like to use the couch".

We are staying in the penthouse which is HUGE- my husband and me along with our two year old boy and 4 month old baby girl. In the master bedroom, one of the paintings had become LOOSE on the wall, fell as I was clothing my daughter!! I sprung up and grabbed the painting a split second before it fell DIRECTLY on her head!! SOOOOOO FREAKED out, I refuse to sleep in the master bedroom anymore, in case it happens again. 

I called the front desk, and let's just say.... the woman was more sympathetic than the front desk manager, David. Not that I was expecting a hand out, but he said, "Because nothing ACTUALLY happened, I can't do anything for you. Perhaps breakfast?"  I won't even go into how bad our experience there was. 

We've been with Monarch for quite a bit, so trust me when I say.... this place is going down FAST!!!! Don't get sucked in and waste your money here. Everyone (except a few gems at the front desk) is over their job. Go to another timeshare, like the Westin!!

I'm a timeshare owner here, so it makes going to Vegas cheaper. It has a very nice pool area, and if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle. It's also nice because there is a full but small kitchen so you can save money that way too. What's also nice, is that a one bedroom has two full bathrooms. The master bathroom is huge and includes a jetted tub. Overall, a nice place to stay especially for families. The downside is there is no casino if you are wanting that availability at all times.

Nice resort.  Close enough to the strip but not too close.  The clientele varies from sophisticated to just rude.  So if you are lucky to enjoy this "in rehab" diamond resort and not run into any of the just rude guest then you will have a great vacation.

It was a solid place to stay: nothing fancy, but it got the job done...

But, dear Lord God Almighty, no matter what, don't sign up for the timeshare tour! Seriously, you're better off just paying full price for Penn and Teller: this is a part of your life you'll never be able to get back, and you'll have to say "no" 12,346 times just for the pleasure of returning to reality.

Given a choice between sticking my leg in a wood chipper and going through one of those "presentations" again, I'd seriously have to think about it...

I hadn't been here for some time.  But I was happy to be back.

This time, it was a quick weekender.  We came in late afternoon Friday and left Sunday morning.  

The staff was great.  They were very helpful and friendly.  Free upgrade? Free samples of shampoo/soap/lotion in addtion to the free crap in the room? Sure!

We had some issues during our weekend but the staff was more than accomodating.

It's a great timeshare.  All the bathrooms have jaccuzzi tubs and marble countertops.  All the units have full kitchens with full size fridge, dishwasher and stove with all the necessary kitchen - wares (pots, pans, plates, etc)  The units themselves are quite large.  I've been to other timeshares that are MUCH MUCH smaller.  So for what's being offered it's great.  There is a pool here that is quite awesome.  There is also a spa onsite.  

The are a few bad things - 10am checkout time and it's far from the strip.  I would avoid the free shuttles they offer since it can take a LONG time to utilize them.
