It worked for us since we drove from LA and we didn't mind being far from the Strip.  We were there to have a fun and food filled girlfriends getaway and that's exactly what we did.

The review is specifically for the bar/restaurant by the pool. Checked this area out with a friend who wanted to see what this place was like. We ordered buffalo wings, turkey wraps, hot dogs, and a 16' supreme pizza.

1. Wings were SOGGY. Obviously from a frozen bag and microwaved.
2. The pizza crust is also definitely frozen as it came out tasting like CARDBOARD but had fresh ingredients as toppings. Charging about $17 while cutting corners to create this pizza is definitely frustrating.
3. I loved the hot dog and I just see no real way (unless intentionally done) to go wrong.
4. Turkey wrap was just bland...

So seriously, food is not the highlight of this place but from what it looks like with all the slides at the pool and how spacious the rooms are, its a good place for families to go to who want to stay away from the usual Vegas crowd.

Stayed for 6 days and was digging the whole apartment feel. Stocked kitchen with utensils, silverware, place settings, tupperware, and pots and pans. You even get bakeware, blender, and a toaster. Pretty awesome. The bestie and I stocked up the fridge and saved some $$$ on dining. The cafe is actually pretty decently priced, we were able to get room service twice without breaking the bank. Pool area is great as well. Have to pay for wi-fi, $24 for a week.

I am an owner here and I must say that I was disappointed this year. This year they had me check in through VIP and that was a mess! We had 4 rooms and they were mixed up, cards on the wrong rooms and then these towel cards... they can be very stressful to keep track of especially when kids are taking other people's towels. I know they are trying something new but this is not the way. The wifi is horrible here. I ended up having to use my phone as a hotspot. Yes, the kids still had an awesome time but because I have been an owner here for so long, I have seen the changes and they are not for the positive.  Cancun usually sends out a "how was your stay" survey and I plan to share my disappointment with them. For as much as In pay in quarterly dues, I think something needs to be done and quick!
Had the penthouse for my sons graduation party. Everything was perfect. The pool was so relaxing with music playing in the background.

Cancun is not very close to the Strip, but it's surprisingly convenient for its far location. Chipotle, Food4Less, and other popular diners/cafes are located within walking distance. 

I have roomed here almost every time I visit Vegas. The rooms are extremely well-kept, with earthy furnishings and modern accents... I wouldn't call it anything like home, but why else am I on vacation? I don't want to feel as though I'm home!

I recall the pool was quite roomy; when I used to swim often, I loved that it wasn't a kiddie pool I could swim across in six seconds or so. The slide is definitely appropriate for older children, though. 

The "adults only" gameroom is open to children as long as they look somewhat responsible... I know I don't really pass for 18+ and neither does my friend, yet we always manage to play several rounds of pool. Nobody ever really checks.

Do try snagging the penthouse. It feels, at times, more luxurious than home.

WORST Customer Service I have EVER encountered! DO NOT STAY HERE!

My husband was heading to Vegas on a business trip and would be checking in on his birthday. Wanting to do something special I called three days ahead to work something out with the hotel. 

I didn't expect them to come up with a surprise for my husband, I simply wanted to know if they recommended companies or if there was a particular way I should handle what I had planned (simple cake and balloons). 

After speaking to the hotel manger, Vivian,  I was directed to speak to concierge. She assured me that if I had a cake and balloons delivered concierge would work with me to have them in his room when he checked in. I was connected to concierge - in a city "that doesn't sleep" at 12:55pm I was listening to a voice recording telling me to pick one of three concierges to leave a message for. I simply picked the first person whose name I heard, Terri. After not hearing back for 24 hours, I called back to speak to the manager, only to find out, Terri no longer worked for the company - are you serious!!! and transferred me to another concierge attendant. Again, I left a voicemail. I don't know about you, but concierge's job is to serve the hotel customer, to provide stellar customer service, and having to leave a message is ridiculous! I finally received a call back from a gentlemen in concierge who rudely told me they not only couldn't do anything, they wouldn't do anything. I re-explained that I simply wanted to have balloons and a cake delivered and was told by the hotel manager that concierge could help me get them into his room before he checked in at 7pm. Again, I was rudely told the manager was very wrong and they don't do that and wouldn't do that. 

Beyond frustrated I explained, if I had balloons and a cake delivered, after he'd checked in, how could I get them to him - leave at front desk, call him, etc. the gentlemen in concierge told me I was on my own. That even if I had them delivered to the front desk they would not contact my husband to tell him he had something waiting at the front desk. Are you kidding me?!!!

Three days later, the day my husband checked in, I called the front desk. The ONLY SHINING STAR at this ridiculous place was Dave. He was so kind and explained that the Mrs.Fields package I had ordered and sent to the hotel would be delivered to the front desk at which point they would notify my husband he had a package.

AGAIN they dropped the ball! At the end of the day my husband still had not received the package so I spoiled the surprise and told him. He called the front desk and was told he had no packages. After assuring them he did, two people put him on hold to go look for it. When he arrived at the front desk to pick it up not only was the box too large to "miss-place" it had only been delivered in the last hour or two. He questioned why he was not notified of receiving a package that his name was all over, to which he was told - "we don't always do that, the person sending it should've notified you so you would come ask for it".

BEYOND horrible service! Even my husband said his interaction with the staff throughout his stay was less than decent. Turns out this place is a time-share too, ha! Don't waste your money or your time! It's worth it to stay ANY WHERE else in Vegas but the Cancun resort!

I went to the cafe/bar at the pool. They charged me 5$ for 4 onion rings. When I went to tell the front desk how disappointed I was, they took no ownership and said that the cafe was owned by someone else.  This cafe is ripping their members off. In addition, there was construction around the pool and it smelled like sewerage. I am disappointed and won't stay here again let alone buy their time share.

Cancun Resorts is a great place for families, since they offer 1 & 2 BD/BA condos.  The bathrooms are HUGE and each have jetted tubs for those that like that sort of thing.

We had a 2BD/2BA unit on the 8th floor of Merida (room 3802).  Some buildings only go to 4 floors, so ask if you're not sure. Higher floors have better views, even when facing the parking lot, you don't see it when you're on the 8th floor.

They have a remodeled gym and a cafe onsite, but the gift shop was closed for remodeling, so there was no place to buy sundries and snacks.  However, there is a grocery store and shopping right down the street.

The pool area is beyond awesome!  5 hot tubs, 1 adult only, although the adult only is not adamantly enforced. 2 pools and 3-4 waterslides.  You and your kids will love it.

They offer free washer/dryers (no cost) on each floor and provide 2 boxes of laundry powder.  Fully appointed kitchen with coffeemaker, blender, toaster, microwave, full-size fridge, full-size oven/stove, flatware, knives, pans, pots, and dishes.  You can cook full meals to save money.

Also, they offer activities for the kids (not babysitting), my daughter got to paint some ceramics and they had other activities too, most for a small fee.  They game room has pool, ping pong, and TV.

CONS
Elevators are slow.

There is no shuttle to the strip, but the bus to take you there isn't far.  If you have a car you can drive to the mall to park and catch the strip bus from there OR just walk to the mall if the weather is right.

Cancun Resorts is a Diamond International timeshare, so avoid the concierge desk if you don't want the timeshare spiel.  They'll work hard at trying to sell you a 4 day/3 night vacation for $99 for listening to their presentation, just say "no" and politely walk away.  Don't ask them about tickets, etc.

Enjoyed our stay at this resort with nice grounds but rooms are dated

We enjoyed our fairly spontaneous trip to use up DRI pts. Booked a "Penthouse Villa" which was not worth the extra points. We were on the top (8th floor) but all those units face in towards the pool area so you can't see The Strip. It was a very large unit with a very small kitchen. A very strange, inefficient, poorly lit, massive bathroom design. I'm sure the place will be very nice after DRI does their upgrade, assuming they can allot more space to the kitchen. There's a restaurant on site, the Caribe Lounge, but it's really just a short-order cook place, however, it does have a bar and beer on tap! There were quite a few families there with kids enjoying the pools, spas and water slides. The convenience store is marginally stocked and the fitness center is fairly small. We went to see Cirque du Soleil Michael Jackson ONE as well as the Terry Fator show. Both were GREAT! Also, Cafe Berlin was excellent as was Island Flavor. Oh, and the wife was net-positive on the gambling front ;-)

My family stayed there from feb 27 til march 3.   The hotel is very clean and the swimming pool is so nice.  The staff are very friendly and they accommodate you whatever you need.  We will definitely stay there again when we go to Las Vegas. We love it there because it's away from strip and it's quiet and peaceful.

This the an awesome place to be with small kids. Different sizes of pools, beautiful scenic layout, water tubes/slides, and so on. The only thing you could ask for is for it to be on the strip. Found out today that you can use your pass from Cancun to park at polo towers. With all the casinos charging $$ after and hour of parking, I'm good.

Really awful experience. It started with the concierge. When you check in, you are told to go over to the concierge for your "free gifts" (coupons to local restaurants for buy one, get one free--they're not the greatest restaurants but if you're lazy and out of ideas, maybe try them). The worst part comes next--they try to sell you a timeshare by making you feel like an idiot: "Oh, it looks like you paid for your hotel stay." (you begin to think, wait, others don't?) Then: "well, you can have a free stay on us next." Here's how it works--you pay a deposit of $149, then they refund you the money when you stay the next time (apparently). But you are essentially signing up for a timeshare for a long period, and locked in. What was obnoxious though, after saying we were not interested, was the hard sell. Us: "we've had a really long day of travel, so we'd like to go and rest now." "Them: Oh, you can go, but at least listen to what I have to say. Don't walk away!" Then the very worst: at 10am on Sat morning (the next day), we get a call from the concierge with the same hard sell, and multiple questions: who did you speak to? Did they tell you you could have a complimentary stay next time? etc etc

Here's the thing: all I wanted was free wifi. I think that's pretty standard and not too much to ask for in a metropolitan city. However, we were charged the resort fee, on top of the cost of your stay (watch out for this extra fee!) and then charged wifi ($10 extra per day). Then we were promptly told the main pools would be closed for the REST OF THE WEEK. Um, so why did I just pay for the resort fee? What does the resort fee cover, if not basic amenities like wifi and use of the pools? 

Oh, and the decor looks like it last got updated in the 70s, there are scuff marks all over the doors, walls and furniture. It's so sad I didn't want to relax there after a long day out.

I' m a little late on this review so I do apologize.  This is going to be based off my stay which was April 30th -  May 5th.  The second time around was a charm.  Greeted by the staff here was so welcoming they were very imformative seems like every question we had they had the answer too.  Our room was clean, spacious, and comfortable beds and everything was great.  We had a family suite that had its own kitchen in it.  The only con with this place is that it is only driving distance way from the strip.  Other than that this is one of the hotels to stay in when you come to Vegas

We are owners at the Cancun, and have stayed here multiple times, both alone, and with our small children. It is a great place, as long as you remember where, and what, it is. It is a resort, not a hotel, not a casino. There are so many ammenities here that you won't find at just any hotel. They have scheduled activities for children, and adults alike, most for free. The rooms are fully equipped with living room, dining room, and full kitchen. No, there aren't many food options, no, it's not anywhere near the strip, no, you can't go downstairs to gamble or bar hop.But if you have a vehicle, you can get to anything pretty quickly since the freeway is close anyway. My sons love the water slides, I love the hammocks. We try to go during the week, and stay in the penthouse, and we never want to leave! I highly, highly suggest for people wanting a "family" vacation to stay here! To respond to some of the fomer complaints, yes, we have often had problems with the jacuzzi on the decks, but I pay quarterly maintenance fees, so I don't mind bugging the crap out of the staff to have it fixed. Also a big perk....TONS of luggage carts!!

This is a timeshare. That said, the accommodations were nice (1 bedroom condo with full kitchen and two bathrooms). Appreciated staying off strip for part of my LV trip this time around, but if you give this place a try make sure you rent a car... they have no shuttle anymore and it is really too far from anything besides strip malls to walk. On the plus side, there is a starbucks within walking distance haha. I spent around $20 one way on taxi service each time I went to my conference site on strip. 

On site at this resort you will find two pools (only one was in service during our visit), a spa (no nail service here), and a work out room that has a good amount of pretty updated equipment. A major downside for me as someone who was on a work trip was the wifi. The wifi did not work the entire time I was at the resort. I called the front desk and was told to contact AT&T directly- apparently that is their provider. That got me nowhere. In addition, I couldn't even plug in because there are no ethernet outlets in the spaces. Soooo free wifi here was useless. One of the pools has a cool slide, and overall the resort seems really family friendly. Final verdict is this is a good place to stay if you have kiddos, but if you plan on being on strip often, just stay on strip.

While we received excellent service and hospitality here, this resort is by no means a five-star and doesn't really live up to the Diamond Resorts quality that us owners are used to. We noticed immediately upon arrival that the hallway of the building we were in smelled like mildew. The kitchen in the villa was TINY. Barely fits one person in there, and it's difficult to cook or prepare food because of the lack of counter space. You can't even get to the cabinets next to the refrigerator, and I'm 5'8 with fairly lengthy arms! The sink in the kitchen leaked, the dishwasher top rack was broken, and the garbage disposal backed up into the master bathroom tub! We were on the first floor in the Tulum Building, and we arrived on a Friday night. Saturday and Sunday we wanted to rest, but the Cove Pool with the waterslides opens early on the weekends and we had to contend with the screaming of kids going down the waterslides. Not that much of an issue, really, but we found out later that the pool with the waterslides doesn't even open until mid-afternoon during the week, which wrecked our plans for using it, since we typically left the resort after lunch to sightsee and do other things around town. Also, the front desk needs to get their communication straight. We were told when we checked in that our maid service would be on Monday. When we called on Monday to find out why they hadn't come, they told us that we were slated for Tuesday. Okay, we were initially told Monday, which seemed strange to us since we had just checked in the previous Friday and wouldn't be checking out until the following Sunday. Odd. And when we called to ask about the Cove Pool hours, the front desk told us that it should already be open (at 11:00 a.m.) and then we were transferred to someone else who told us it wouldn't be open until 2:30 p.m. Communication, people! We didn't have an issue with the concierge or the owner's meeting as many of the other reviewers did, but the breakfast that they served us that morning was a joke. I couldn't even get two cups of coffee - they ran out! The eggs tasted like they were powdered, the bacon wasn't good, the sausage was okay, but the breakfast potatoes were awful! In general, it was a fairly comfortable stay - the beds were fine and the rest of the condo was nice, but it is badly in need of overhauling and the tiny kitchens just do not work for people staying more than a week! We stayed for nine days and we couldn't wait to get back home to our modest-sized apartment kitchen because it was bigger than the one we had in the condo! We are used to a LOT better, Diamond. This property isn't helping you maintain your stellar image.

I had a bad experience staying at the Cancun resort. 
I came with a group of eight we checked in to 2 rooms penthouse and a one bed room. 
My wife and I after checking in to the one bed room decided to see if we could upgrade to a 2 bed room. After a couple of hours by the pool we went to the front desk and they had a 2 bed room available. 

We packed up our stuff and moved to the 2 Bedroom. The next day my wife realizes that she left her engagement and wedding band rings in the bathroom of the one bed room.
We called security and met up with them in the room. We just missed house cleaning and the rings were gone. 

We filed a police report and the investigation is open....

On a different note the gym was awful with minimal equipment and tight space.
If you had three people running on the treadmills the power would trip in the room. 
One of the elliptical machines didn't work which was annoying.

Front Desk and Security were very helpful but I wish I never had to go to security in the first place.

The rooms were nice and clean and the penthouse room was large. 
Unfortunately they assign rooms first come first serve... That means if you are an owner in the time share you can get stuck with a bad view of the construction and a non-owner gets the amazing view you should get.

The gym was awful with minimal equipment and tight space.
If you had three people running on the treadmills the power would trip in the room. 
One of the elliptical machines didn't work which was annoying.

I will not be going back or recommend any of my friends to stay at the Cancun resort in Las Vegas.

This is a great family resort off of The Strip or for the vacationers that want some peace and quiet, plus the screaming kids. 

Cancun is a pretty nice timeshare vacation spot but I mainly go here for the pool. The pool is spectacular with several pools surrounding a massive Aztec pyramid, which has four slides within it. I really recommend the two on the top of the pyramid. 

The rooms are decent with a fully stocked kitchen with a Food $ Less grocery store across the street. So if you like cooking while on vacation to save some money, this is the place to go.

Good: Great pool with spacious rooms. 

Bad: Far from The Strip and the free shuttle can get very delayed.

Final: I usually go here when I want to save money and have a relaxing trip in Vegas.

The glory days of this resort are GONE!! It's decor is old, dark brown and antiquated. The carpet is stained and tattered. They provide no shuttle services to and from the strip. Because the hot tubs and pools are outside, their uses are limited upon the weather, as well as the time available to use them is very limited. 

The hot water wasn't so hot, making bathing a challenge. Toilet paper was rough and flimsy. Mattresses are old and lumpy. The mounted tv is slanted and crooked on the wall. The only reason I gave it one star is because the concierge was very nice and the unit was clean.

I don't know why this resort gets so many mixed reviews, I guess most people are just too picky and sweat the small stuff, but I LOVED my stay here this past weekend.  We came with friends and reserved 2 rooms.  When we checked in at 3, we asked for rooms beside eachother, and they accomodated our request with no problem and the girl at the front desk (her name was Quinn) was very informative with how the resort runs (housekeeping, pool hours, etc), and even called the second day to make sure we had everything we needed and that we were happy with everything.  There were no surprises.

The place was very nice, and very clean, we stayed in building 3 which I believe is from the newer development.  The jacuzzi bath tub was awesome, and I loved the dishwasher since we brought a lot of our own food to cook, making clean up a breeze!  One thing that was a little dissappointing was that the pans were small for cooking for a large group, and they were not non-stick which made cooking and cleanup more difficult, but no big deal, we know to bring our own pans next time!  The food 4 less right across the street also made it convenient to restock on the food items and alcohol we needed.

We loved the pool area, there were a lot of chairs to lay out, and relaxing hammocks and several jacuzzi areas in addition to the adult only jacuzzi underneath the waterfall.  I wish there were more hammocks though, there are only 5 and they get nabbed up really quick, so you have to get there super early.  The bathrooms beneath the pyramid were very clean too, and easily accessible.

One thing that isn't particularly bad, just was a little annoying for our group in particular, were that the lifeguards were really strict on swimming attire for us adults in the slide area. I can understand being strict for kids, but my friend was asked to remove her necklace, and they wouldn't let my fiance go down the slide or swim in the pool because they thought the material of his swim trunks didn't look suitable, even though it was made of polyester which is in most swimsuits, it just lacked the more recognizable nylon and lycra materials.  That was irritating being as though we weren't going to buy a whole new pair of swim trunks just for this resort!  But I do understand their concern for cotton materials clogging their filters.

I loved that the resort was far enough from the resort to be quiet and relaxing, but close enough to still enjoy the craziness when you wanted to.  The shuttle service to the strip was great, we called down to the concierge and asked the shuttle times, and right as we stepped out of the front enterance to the curb at that time, the shuttle pulled up as scheduled.  The drop off point at the Tropicana was also very convenient for us.  The last shuttle back to the resort was only at 12:15am though, so it would have been nice if it went to at least 1am or 2am...but the cab ride back to the resort (straight down Las Vegas Blvd from Luxor) was only $15, so it wasn't too big a deal!

Over all, this place was extremely relaxing and I wish we would have been able to stay longer!  Next time we are getting the penthouse for sure, that private jacuzzi on the patio sounds very nice! :)

Every single year, we have a family reunion. This happens to be the venue & I have nothing but fun memories & good times here. 

It's not just because I have family with me that makes this place likeable, but yes I would definitely come here with a group of friends who are like-minded. I do enjoy Vegas but I want to stay at a place where I can relax, tan, and lounge without being annoyed by the nipple baring attention whores. 

We occupy 2 penthouses as a family and this is what they offer in each one:
2 Bedrooms
2 Baths/Showers
2 Jacuzzis
1 Small kitchen
Living room with large TV
Couches with fold-out bed
Chairs
Round dining table
Lots of drawer space
Big closets with mirrors
Fluffy pillows w/ down comforters


I am always comfortable here, not to mention that a grocery store, liquor store, gas station, and smoke shop are only 1 mile away. 

Yes, you do need a car to function around this area. I forgot to mention the best part.. They have hammocks and palm trees in the swim area! Big pools and hammocks make for a happy veronica.

Last thing, they have an activity center where you can play pool, watch games, play foosball, and ping pong!

I've been going to Vegas for many years, stayed in almost every hotel, and this by far was the worst experience ever.  I chose this hotel as it was a "kids" friendly resort.  We checked into a two bedroom suite which was still dirty, hadn't been vacuumed or dusted.  We let them know, all they did was come up and vacuumed.  Later at night, my entire family was being bitten by some sort of bugs in the room.  We woke up and had bites everywhere.  The manager "Jason" said there were no other room or resorts they could transfer us to.  The room was infested with bugs.  We checked out and lost over $600 we had paid.  Do not stay here!

I love this place! The rooms are really nice and the amenities are awesome! They have game rooms for the kids and faults too. There's always something to do here! The pools are nice and the water slides are way fun! It's very family oriented. My only complaint is the food here. I wasn't impressed, but besides that's it's an awesome resort!

The location is perfect from the strip for families. Front desk staff and activities leads were great. Loved the pool. Nice sized rooms. Loved the family activities available on site. Loved the price.  Loved the new towels in the room.  Lifeguards are beginning their summer season and are already distracted by ea. other.  They need adult supervision for such an important role.  The rooms look like the pictures.... but could use some TLC.  The cleaning staff were there morning to evening so could be that they need more pay to do long hours.  I am sure that they are cleaning more rooms then physically possible.     Moldy showers, uncomfortable couch, dirty LR chair, inexpensive kitchen table that had lots of wear and tear, spray cleaned floors not mopped.   Cleanliness left me a little uncomfortable but I would give them a second chance.

Ours was a very mixed experience.

My brother owns a timeshare here, and he and his wife invited us to stay with them in one of the penthouses.

The bad news:  The internet connections are very spotty.  In our room, we could barely stay connected to get email.  Forget streaming anything or watching any Facebook or YouTube videos.  We were told that when the internet was put in a long time ago, they set it up for laptops, and that tablets have too small an antenna to get good service.  That didn't help the four of us, who only brought tablets.
The deferred maintenance was a real problem.  Two outlets in the kitchen didn't work; the light outside on our balcony buzzed and needed changing.  When we called it in, the ballast still wasn't changed after two days.  The shower was a very strange design in the penthouse (apparently not in the other rooms.) In our room, it was open, w/o a shower curtain, and kept getting water all over the bathroom.  The holes in the shower head were full of calcification, so the water pressure was a problem.  
The staff in the lounge didn't seem happy to be there - one complained that they weren't paid much and only got a 20% discount on the food, so they hadn't tried any of it, and couldn't make recommendations.  Another served food to the table while on her cell phone.  
We stayed there a week.  When they came in to clean, they didn't clean the bathroom at all until someone came in to check how the cleaning crew was.  One of the burners on the stove didn't work, and we weren't provided with a full set of utensils until we called and asked.  

The good news:  The view was stunning!  The place was spacious in the penthouse, with a jacuzzi on the balcony and in both bathrooms.  The entire customer service staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and very apologetic when we complained or requested something that should have been done better.  Most of the time, when we requested something from housekeeping (more dish soap, more hangers, more towels, more blankets, etc.) we would receive a call a while later to make sure we got what we wanted.  A very nice touch! 
 The food was pretty good for bar food.  When we told them about "the bad news", above, the front desk manager comped us a free meal there.  After our rooms were cleaned, the housekeeping manager came over to check to see if things were done right.  When we pointed out that they weren't, they apologized and immediately sent someone over to do it right.  We liked the full kitchen; the garbage disposal worked well, as did the appliances, except for the one burner.  
The beds were VERY comfortable!  One of the highlights.  

This resort is a little off the beaten path - both good and bad news.  Not as much traffic, but hard to get a cab sometimes.  No Uber or Lift in Nevada right now.  

Overall a pleasant exoerience, but they could do so much better with better maintenance, better cleaning, better internet, and checking the rooms better between visitors to make sure everything is operating properly, and all the components are there.

I owned a timeshare here for several years. Then they switched ownership. Since then coming here is a complete nightmare. I can no longer just check in at the front desk. They tell me "Oh! You get the VIP check in." Then they take me to a back room, offer me water and try to pitch me on purchasing more points. Are you kidding me?!? If I'm already a member I shouldn't continue to be sold too constantly.

Everything went down hill from there. The final straw was the towels though. They made me sign something that said if I don't bring back the towels I owe $25 for each towel. Seriously?!? So if some jerk steals my towel I have to either 1. Steal someone else's towel or 2. Pay $25.

The employees were very happy with the previous owners and now they are awful, probably because of the constant pressure to sell.

With the new management, the pools also started closing at 6 pm. What? Who comes to Vegas on vacation and wants to get out of the pool at 6?

Then there's the maintenance without warning. They ripped apart the pool bathroom, construction and dust everywhere. But no alternative for a bathroom. So you have to leave the pool (be sure to bring your towel so no one steals it or it's $25!), then go to either the lobby or your room to go to the bathroom, then go back to the pool.

The timeshare went so down hill that I couldn't stand it anymore and donated it and paid $2,000 out of my own pocket to get rid of it. I'll never go here again. Good riddance.

Arrived at 1030pm to start our girls weekend that my friend..a diamond owner..set up for us. At checkin everything seemed fine. We got to our room and right outside of our door was the worse stench...something this pregnant lady has a hard time handling! Once inside the room we realized that this wasn't the room requested...when my diamond owner friend called the front desk she was basically told..too bad..we are full and your guests can use our brand new comfortable tempra pedic sleeper sofa. After 20 minutes we relented. I offered to sleep on the sofa...I pulled it out and low and behold it is broken!!! After a 5hr drive all this pregnant lady wants to do is get some sleep. It's now 1241am  and they're bringing in a new sofa. The front desk staff and night manager were very rude and unaccomodating. This will definitely be our last trip to this resort!!

This place is NOT what it use to be.  We've been coming here the past 5 years and it use to be a place where only time share holders had access to it but now they posted it on Groupon and a bunch of ghetto people stay here. 
The hotel is completely lacking in service now.  This use to be a clean and nice environment but now the rooms have broken closet doors, The bed was cracked, The floor was ripped,  the screen to the outside was broken and didn't slide open. 

The pool use to be so clean but now since they let access to "the generic public" there's trash everywhere they don't pick up after themselves, they leave the silver carts throughout the halls. There were 9. 9!!!! Silver carts in our hallway!

This morning when I went ouside our room to get ice there were trash bags throughout the hallway.  Which made it look so dirty! These people are so lazy to even throw their own trash away! 

Oh yeah and the ice machine and washer machine on our floor have been broken for 3 days now. How pleasant. 

We happened to be getting back to our room when the lady that cleans the room was in there and a women in the room next to me asked for and i told her ill send her to her room when she was done in the restroom and whenitold her the lady next door just wanted an extra towel she rolled her eyes and told me she's not house keeping and the room next door isn't part of her schedule.  

So much for customer service. 
And the employees don't even smile or say hi anymore. 

I only give it 2 stars because of the pool area, the grills they added and the gym upgrade they made this past year,  you can actually breathe in there now.

When I stayed at the penthouse and it was very spacious. With 2 rooms, 2 restrooms, kitchen, and living area, it was perfect for me and my family. Although it was very cold to use the pool (considering we stayed over the winter season), we mostly used the lounge and the gym. The lounge was very spacious and perfect if you have teens! The gym was pretty small and when I went in, me and my cousins were only there. I guess it worked out since I wouldn't want anyone seeing me sweat buckets anyways. Overall, I would recommend this hotel!

This is a timeshare,the resorts is nice,but if you are going to a sales presentation,all they do is tell you lies
It will ruin you day and will cost you in headaches for the rest of your life.make sure you have transportation  because it is not close to anything but the dump.the elevators are unsafe beware.the people at the bar are nice because they want you to not remember  all the lies.if you want to enjoy like diamond says stay vacation go to some were else

Did this timeshare crap with Diamond Resorts International..At first it was all good and at the end when i decided that its not a good time to get it yet James Prues was such an a$$ and tried to make me feel so low. He doesn't even know the whole story. They say they wont push you but they do..

WARNING - COCKROACH INFESTED HOTEL!!There was a quarter size cockroach in the living room and another one on  my baby's bed, next to his head! 
When I told the front desk, the manager was not shocked and said she could only credit my account for another Diamond stay.  She continued to tell me "We've been treating for cockroaches for the last 2 months." OMG, anyone knowing putting their guest in INFESTED rooms to bring back to their own homes. DISGUSTING.

This place is really chill!! We came once before on an awesome deal my husband found on the internet! Then, we had a two bedroom and it was set up like an apartment!! We each had out own rooms and a living room (with pull out beds) and a full kitchen! Now we are in a one bedroom, and it still rocks!! Still have a kitchen, standard in every room!! So awesome!!
This time we bought all of our groceries and the girls are super excited to make our dinners!! Not to mention the pool...water slides, waterfalls & hot tubs oh my!!! Lol....large pools....tons of seating around pool, hot tubs all around pool and even under the waterfall (adult only hottub!!! Me likey). It's quiet compared to other hotels right on strip, no casino, so if you have kids and/or a gambling problem, no worries!! You don't have to fly through the floor with kids in tow!! Some casinos won't even allow your child to watch all those flashing lights...lol....that's like trying to keep a starving dog from eating the steak on the floor!!! Anyway, when we got here, we were greeted very nicely and taken care of as soon as possible!! It made my road trip so much more worth it!! (You try listening to "how many more spongebob episodes now, daddy!!" For 4 1/2 hours)...LMAO!!
Seriously best opening vacay Ever!!

If the Wi-Fi worked and if we hadn't been without hot water for a day, this would have been a full 5-star experience.  But I have to knock that 5th star off.  I'm not as concerned about the wi-fi (we're on vacation, dang it) but trying to take a shower after having been in the pool is not pleasant with cold water.

The one-bedroom villa was absolutely spectacular.  Full kitchen with stove, oven, fridge, microwave, toaster, blender, dishwasher, pots/pans, dishes, glasses, silverware, etc etc made for a very convenient stay.  We were able to pick up groceries and have fresher, healthier meals/snacks.  It was super nice.

Having a full two bathrooms was a bonus.  The master bathroom was huge with a giant whirlpool tub.  Only complaint is that the whirlpool tub was excessively loud and you could not use it after hours.

Grounds are absolutely gorgeous.  The pools (yes, plural) were very nice, very large, right temperature.  The seating was plentiful, but also spaced apart enough to feel like we weren't crowded.

Overall a great stay, and we'll certainly check Groupon again for a good deal!

I got a great deal on a one night stay here with my mother.  All I could think about this place is that it would be perfect for a big family.  We got a two room suite that had a fold out futon bed in one room and a large bed in the other.  The room came with a patio and a view of the pool area.  I found the pool area to be the most attractive feature of the resort but they also had a game room and they stocked your personal rooms with dishes and things you would need to make any kind of food you could want.  This definitely seemed like an extended stay type of place but I only stayed one night.  The bathroom was also very nice.  I did find that the bedroom was a lot more attractive than the room with the futon but the suite we had came with a dining table, a large patio, and two bathrooms and I could see that being a deal-maker with some large groups.

Check-in took a while and the guy behind the counter was a little impatient because they were supposedly busy (but there really weren't that many people checking in so I wasn't sure why there was stress).  There was also a concierge desk that basically existed to try and get you to spend more money and book more stays before you had even spent a moment outside of the lobby.  I always find that annoying.  If a place is good it can sell itself and you don't need salesmen there to try and pitch it.  That whole situation was off-putting.

But all the rooms were nice and the pool area was great!

I'm giving this place a four because of the concierge pitch and the general overbearingness of that situation.  How can anyone enjoy their stay if it takes more than a half hour to get to their room?  It should never take more than a half hour to get to your room.

All that being said, the room was very affordable and I would stay there again in a heartbeat if given the same deal.

If choosing between this place and the Green Valley Ranch, I would definitely choose the Green Valley Ranch.  The rooms were nicer in the Green Valley Ranch and it took less than ten minutes to check in.  Also, Green Valley Ranch has a casino inside and stores attached to the property and a movie theater.  I think the big difference is that the Green Valley Ranch is more of a hotel and Cancun Resort is more of a condo.  You stay at Cancun if you want to cook elaborate meals and spend all day at the pool.  

Cancun was lacking in a few areas when compared to similar resorts in Vegas like Green Valley Ranch and South Point.

Pros: Large rooms.  All have 2 bathrooms, even the 1-bedroom units.  Nice pool area with hot tubs and slides.  2 restaurants on-site.  Pretty clean overall.  

Cons.  4 miles south of the strip.  Cab ride will cost $25-30 each way.  No shuttle service.  Wait for a cab exceeded 30 minutes.   Diamond resorts just acquired this property so it is nowhere near the quality of a true diamond resort. 

Bottom line: Decent place to stay if you have a friend who owns a timeshare and invites you to stay here with them. You'll be happy with the size of the rooms/bathrooms And the staff was helpful and friendly.  Don't go here expecting it to be a high-end diamond resort.

here at the resort's pool. asked my kids to look where we can get towels for there are a lot of entrances. my feet were sore from all the walking so i just told the kids to look where they can get towels. didn't find it but a staff passed by and he told us where it was. kids went and came back empty handed. they were told that you have to be 14 or a parent to get towels! 

what??? 

is there a written rule that says that? i haven't read it yet, i think. does that mean that it's the same in all the resorts? as a new timeshare owner, i'm wondering what i got myself into. now i've got to read the contract that i signed...

this stay is a freebie for attending the presentation. we were told that  this was located passed mandalay hotel. yup, it is about 6 miles or so after mandalay bay. well beyond the strip. now i'm wondering if all the properties are this way. the properties are big and the rooms are big too. but it's just that it's in the middle of nowhere. i'm thinking that when you're in vegas, you have  to be where the action is, which is the strip. 

i just hope that the other properties they have will be different. oh well, as i've said, i'm wondering what i got myself into...

The room has kitchen, living room, separate bedroom, two bathrooms on the one bedroom suite. The master bathroom has a jacuzzi tub. The room was very comfortable I would stay here again if it were not that far away from the strip. Feels way longer than 4 miles from the strip.  Cab ride will approx $60 round trip.  No shuttle service.  Cab wait is about 30 minutes. If you are trying to save by choosing this hotel room you will be incurring the cost by getting a cab.

Stayed here for the New Years Eve Day weekend and enjoyed it. 

It is away from the strip (maybe 4/5 miles) but I think it was a nice resort away from the noise.

Rooms were nice, well kept & clean. Now the thing you must know is that there is NO Daily Cleanup unless you request it, on your check out they will clean your room not during your stay unless I believe if you stay for over 5 days to a week.

I never bothered to use the pools or lounge/bar but it seems nice to have those options of course, they were not my thing especially when in Vegas, I had a few things to attend. 

Grounds are nice and there is ample parking, now as far as parking goes it is a first come status, there is really no assigned parking (you figure since you are staying in a timeshare that there would be right?).

Staff is friendly and the concierge woman are beyond helpful, I needed to print some passes out and they were more then great to get me those passes printed, much appreciated ladies.

Check In & Check Out was smooth.

We did have room service for breakfast and the meals were good and at a affordable price.

The room I stayed in had it's own kitchen (which most rooms should have I believe) and there is a strip mall just across the street that can handle a lot of your needs, from CVS, restaurants, bank institutions and other little boutiques .

If I ever get the chance I might stay here again, but then again it was a last minute trip and for the price it was a good stay.

We came in late night  for check in and the front desk sent us to the"VIP" section.  The lady seems very nice at first until she brought up the breakfast meeting for the new owner which will last for 55 minutes.  I've been to this meeting before and in telling you this is not a 55 min mtg. The.last one lasted almost 4 hours of pressure. And they will hold your license in the beginning so you can't just leave!  So long story short, the lady in the VIP insisted that we attend and we said no even if she's  giving  away a visa card. But, like those crooks in the timeshare mtg before,  she also wouldn't release our room keys until we agree and got hold of a $40 deposit! First day in vegas and you already got people pressuring you to attend and would not give your keys or license!  This place should just let the owners rest and enjoy.  So ,I'm starting to hate this place because of these kind of people here!

Great Service. Always doing what they could to give us a better vacation. Food wasn't too great and the drinks weren't strong at all, but that pool doe  
Giovanni your the man.

BED BUGS!!!! Bed bugs!!! Bed bugs! My stay was an absolute nightmare- I took the bed bugs I had killed to the front desk- they gave me another room and offered no assistance in changing rooms. The "new" room has bed bugs too. Then they moved me to another building for my last nights stay. I spent over 12 hours disinfecting all of my belongings- had to purchase new luggage- absolutely no concessions were offered by the resort manager or its employees for my stay, prices incurred in damages, etc. at the very least they could've comp'd the $125 Resort fee I was charged. NEVER staying there again & I would recommend researching all of their reviews about this subject- I'm not the first guest to encounter this problem and this Resort.
Everyone is nice and helpful and so friendly until you decline to buy one their time shares. Then your pretty much treated like a  human feces.
My experience was excellent! They made me like home! Most important of all my wife loved it! Thanks Cancn staff! Great job!

I reserved 2 rooms for my family and called on morning of to ensure that they would be near each other, at least the same floor.  The women said "sure, no problem".  Flash forward to our check-in at 3:45pm and the rep (Christine)  said 'sorry, no availability".  I was shocked.  I asked if she could please double check and I was met with the harsh cold response "ma'am, there is nothing".  I didn't want to argue so i let it go.  Our room was not ready so she said come back in 45 min.  We came back and another women helped us, so I asked her to check for closer rooms.  Imagine my disbelief, when there were 2 rooms close to each other.  Some people just want to be mean and not helpful, please do not work in the service industry, if you do not want to pleasant.  All in all, it worked out but i did not like being far from the strip.  it was so hot and the pool umbrellas could not be moved around to provide shade.

The only nice thing about this resort is the pool, it's gorgeous. However, the service is terrible!! 

- Rooms were suppose to be ready at 4pm, yet we didn't get them until 6pm because they weren't ready
- No room service (we had to take the trash out ourselves) 
- We asked for towels and they told us we had to wash our own that there was detergent in the bathroom for us to use
- No bell service (They couldn't even get us a cart for our luggage, they sent us to go look for one ourselves)
- No valet parking
- When we came in they just attack you trying yo get you to go to a presentation. 
- Two of the bathroom sinks were clogged 
- One of the bathroom door wouldn't close
- When we checked in they said they could get us tickets for any show, when we came to buy them, they said we have to physically go purchase them ourselves! (then why did you offer?)
- The water slides are fun, but the smell was not very pleasant

Overall, I this place is nice looking, but the service killed it for us. We had 5 rooms and all families that came with us all said they will not come back due to the lack of service and rude staff.

By far the WORSE place EVER to stay. They have no customer service. Wasting a whole day trying to check in and switching rooms because their doors don't function. They love to WASTE people's time pretending they'll do something about it and don't do a damn thing. Management is truly PATHETIC to say the least. If you want a nice time with your family DON'T STAY HERE.

We will never be coming back here. Doesn't deserve a star but I'm forced to give one to post.
Clean big rooms, friendly staff, and off the strip (2 minutes away) what more can you ask for

We got our room at the Cancun Resort via a groupon, which have us a rate of about $75 per night for three nights. 

Our one bedroom suite included a separate living room with a sofa bed for our two boys; that part of the suite also included a half bathroom with shower, and a balcony that's big enough to sit out on. There's a kitchen with full-sized fridge, stove, microwave and even a dishwasher; it's also equipped with pots, pans, dishes and silverware. We didn't use any of that, but it's there. Add the dining area to that, and it's a nice public area to host friends. 

The bedroom has a king-sized bed and a bathroom larger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in, and has a jetted tub and two sinks. There are large televisions in both the bedroom and living area, equipped with DVD and blu-ray players. 

The pool area is extensive, with a large pool, several hot tubs, and four water slides and a waterfall that pour out of an Aztec-styled temple. There are plenty of pool chairs and a small bar and bistro in the pool area, and even with the area packed, it never felt crowded.

With all those positive things about the Cancun, you do need to be aware that it's really a time share resort, part of the Diamond Resorts chain. This means that even if you're just staying there with a groupon, you're literally taken by the elbow from the registration desk and over to the concierge, where they'll offer you all manner of benefits to sit through a 90 minute presentation, trying to get you to sign up. My wife and I are pretty good about sitting through high-pressure sales pitches, and we got a $75 visa gift card, $40 in restaurant gift cards, and an additional 3 night stay at another resort. Having been down this road before, I'm assuming only the visa will actually be redeemable, but hey. 75 bucks. 

In all, we've had a great time here. It's been fun for our family, a nice getaway for the four of us. There isn't a casino on site, which is why some of us come to Vegas in the first place; for this particular vacation, it was nice to be off the strip and away from the chaos. Next time, maybe we'll party it up.

I had a great experience here.  If anyone was to give a class on customer service, it should be the front desk clerk, Marc.  He went above and beyond to help us with the room reservation as we had an issue. He ensured we were taken care of and happy which is rare to find with Vegas customer service. 

The room was a great one bedroom that overlooked the pool. It had a full kitchen, a very welcoming living room, and super comfy bed.
The pool area has a water slide and like a million spas, a waterfall feature, and a restaurant. 

It is the perfect distance from the strip and has shopping and dining a plenty across the street with a huge outlet place.  I was asked if I wanted to take a time share tour thing which I politely turned down and they politely walked away.  Can't wait to be back and spend all day In the pool area and not leave until I look like "Tan Mom".

My family has owned this timeshare for years. The last time we visited (about 4 yrs ago) I would have given it 4 stars. First of all, they are no longer Monarch Resorts, they are Diamond Resorts (which they were very vague about this transition). We got there on a Friday around 12pm. They took us to the "VIP" check-in. The lady was really, really nice but I get the feeling the employees no longer have a clue what the hell is going on with this new ownership. Our check-in was supposed to be at 1pm so she said since we were early that she would go ahead and get us into a room right away. "A room with a nice view and a better room than the one that was reserved." We were like, "Woooow well thank you, we really are VIP." Pfff! We go up to the room and the following happened:
 As soon as we stepped out of the elevator, we noticed it was HOT and muggy. And *crickets*. I mean it's good that a place isn't packed but we thought it was odd that it was super quiet...ghost town. We go into the room and the place is a mess!! And I kid you not, looked like it was being used as storage (which I know realize it probably was). So we call right away and they tell us to come down to the front desk. coming to find out, that whole building was empty bc it was going through "renovations?" And guess what? The people that has reservations in that building were sent to other rooms...and guess what? Our room was taken by someone else! So we waited for over an hour to get a room. So for our "troubles" they give us 3 complimentary breakfasts for the 3 adults (as in, the 2 kids in your party don't get jack squat). So whatever, we go down to breakfast the next day and again we notice it's like ghost town. We go to the cafe on the voucher and it's closed! So we go to the building that has the bar and we go in there and after waiting for him (only guy working there) to get off the phone he says we can order breakfast there. Which I will say, was good. We end up paying $30 for drinks and the 2 extra breakfasts for the kids. Monday morning we have a meeting. This meeting consisted of them trying to convince us to buy directly from Diamond Resorts BUT you must continue to pay your Monarch Resort payment. Yes...2 payments. Well, at least we will use other Diamond Resort places but they def need to work on Cancun. It's such a beautiful place with horrible service! 

Extra star is for the convenience of the rooms (2 rooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen/dining room, living room, tv in each room, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, pots/pan, plates, cups, utensils).
 
PS- No more shuttle, pools were closed the whole time expect for one small area.

CONS: WiFi was "broken" the whole time we were there.  Check in is at 4 and our room wasn't ready and had  to wait 30 min after we got there til 5, not cool after a 5 hour drive. Couldn't even get a free drink comped for the trouble. And check out is at 10 am which I feel is a bit too early. Rooms are nice but the walls are paper thin and plumbing extremely loud so when our neighbor was taking a shower at 7am it sounded like Niagara falls was pounding on the wall. 

PROS: Like I mentioned rooms are relatively nice, ours was a 2 bedroom with a kitchen  and not too shabby, just the thin wall issue. The (heated) pool area is awesome with some killer water slides which is what I enjoyed the most. 
Definitely will try another hotel next time we visit Vegas.

UPDATE JUNE 2016

So we went this year again, HA! Great pool again, Wi-Fi was still wacky bit over all had a very good stay. It's away from the main strip so it's more family friendly and less Vegasy which is nice.

Golf courses, have you ever seen one that wasn't easy in the eyes?! Nope, I don't think any golf course could be considered unattractive.  
Eagle Crest is tucked away in an older community and is well manicured.  
A friend invited me along for a fundraiser for autism.  This was a night glow golf course!  Think large sized 'glow sticks' for the holes, luminares for the pathway for the golf carts.  
Didn't see any do a rollover in a gold cart- luckily;)  Yes, indeed the golf balls provided a glowing color.  Definitely a fun evening on the course, more of play versus any competitive playing.  Inside had a small bar and eatery.  Pleasant staff, pro shop on premises.

Little known and less appreciated gem of a golf course. I just finished playing this well groomed and beautiful course. For an executive course it offers a fun challenge for golfers of all skill levels. It's in better condition than most of the more expensive courses and offers just as much fun. There are several holes you can unleash your driver and challenge your short game. With an upgrade to the food and beverage area this would be a 5 star experience. Thanks to the staff for making my experience so enjoyable.
It's an Executive Course but it's in great shape ,,you can get a round done in under 3 hours ,,pace of play is just right and have great views will definitely be back..
Beautiful, small course, with friendly staff.  The course takes about 3 to 4 hours to complete.

Pro tip: Perfect for beginners or folks dusting the rust off of their iron game

Came here on a hot and sunny Saturday afternoon when it was 100+ outside.  I haven't played a round of golf in a few months, so playing a par 3 course was a nice way to sharpen my iron game.  Not having to hit driver on almost every hole really helps to conserve energy and help fight that heat exhaustion. 

The golf carts come with a cooler.  The course was nice enough to provide 2 bottles of water and ice in the cooler.  This is pretty standard for a Vegas course, but nonetheless the gesture is always appreciated.  

The course is nice.  The fairways and greens are well manicured.  Errant shots off of the fairways and greens will not hurt much since the rough isn't very long.   The views are spectacular.  You have a good view of the mountains, picturesque holes with a pond, and an awesome view of the strip.  

Our tee time was at 12:02, but when i checked in a little after 11, I was told I could go out whenever I was ready.  Given that this is an executive course and a hot summer day, there weren't too many people on the course.  There was no one in front of behind us to rush us at all.  We even took a 20 minute break at the turn to cool off.  Since there was no one on the course, we got to take a few mulligans without having to look over our shoulders and holding up traffic behind us.  We played at a very leisurely pace and had a lot of fun.  The holes are set up fairly and play nicely.  This is a great course to get a lot of practice and build some confidence.  Golf is not fun when you shoot a bad score and greens break 3 ways to tomorrow.  Play here and you'll have fun, not feel hurried, and be able to shoot a nice score.
Good course to practice irons, but that's it. The greens are beyond bad. Most are dirt

Good course.  No cart girls and a lot of retirees but nice staff and decent greens.  The tee time was a little $$ but unlike courses like Desert Willows, this course wasn't overbooked, so there was no one playing over top of us.  Would definitely go back here.

Great executive course.  You can use your driver on about 7 holes, the other 11 will be starting with an iron.  So, it is a standard par 60 executive course.  The fairway, green, and the tee were all perfect green grass even in the middle of winter.  The carts worked great.  We went on a friday morning and there were very few other golfers.  So we took our time and really enjoyed ourselves.  

The view of Las Vegas on the back nine of this course is breath taking.

Nice executive course.  Not over played or crowded.  Good value for money.  
Everything was in good condition.  The greens are very challenging.  The driving range is a little close to a couple of the holes but it's not too big of a deal.  The practice area includes a putting green, chipping green, a large sand trap and a grass driving range.  All very nice.

Their loyalty card is a great deal.  The card costs $10 and gives you $5 off on most tee times (if it's already only $15 dollars for a mid-day summer tee time you don't get it for $10).  You also get a small bucket of balls with every paid round, a $2 value.  So that's $7 bucks in value right there the day you buy it.  After 8 paid rounds you get a dozen free balls and a free round.

I LOVE golfing here. Let's start with the price.  If you're a resident of Sun City Summerlin like I am you can play 9 holes for $8 WITH A CART!!!  Beautiful greens.  Driving range and a  putting and sand trap area too.  The staff are all friendly and very helpful (some of us need a little more help then others).  There are also two other courses in Sun City but Eagle Crest by far is my favorite

I came here for a wedding and did not play golf. The facilities are a little dated and smell like an old folks home. But the view from the event room was impressive and the party went smooth. The staff for the event was okay. They were courteous but not overly helpful. Water glasses were cleared off the tables just as the dancing started. Not the most conscientious move in my opinion. My untouched dessert disappeared while I was visiting another table. When asked to replenish the butter dish at the buffet line, the woman disappeared for five minutes to return with small plastic tubs of butter. The food was standard chicken or fish- the kind of fare you'd expect from a modestly priced hotel function.

The space is well-maintained and the view was top notch. I just didn't love the food or the service. Still, I would consider this for an event. I'd just have to manage the expectations.

This is a great course for those beginning, getting back in, or just want to work on short game.  They have great local rates and the course is pretty nice.  Little issues with the greens and dont like the range to the right of the first hole.  I didn't go that direction but still, doesnt leave room for error. Anyway, it is a good course to practice!

Very nice executive golf course par 60. Beautiful views on almost every hole. Good hole placement and enjoyable course. We started his morning with a tee time at 6:02 am. I know it's early, but the things we do to have fun in Vegas are necessary to BEAT THE HEAT!!

There was a couple groups before us and we really didn't have to wait except for the first hole. As people say, a bad day on the golf course is better than a good day at work...I concur. I did hit my first Birdie ever, I have only played 5 courses to date now so I am still learning. 

An enjoyable time had by all in my group. And as I noted above, the views of Vegas from this Summerlin golf course are breathe taking.

So I just played all three of these courses, eagle crest, palm valley and highland falls and it couldn't have been a worst experience. Eagle Crest had no drinking water anywhere, slow greens, mediocre fairways and overall just a really short simple course. Worth 40 bucks? i think not. I stopped midway to get a quick bite to eat and asked for a cup of ice water. The lady served me a cup full with black dusty things in it. I told her and her response was "yes, that's from the ice, and we can't do anything about it unfortunately" ....seriously? what is this mexico? i may have expected this at some crummy run down course on the east side of vegas but i thought this was summerlin? WOW, how about not serve it if it is full of black things? So she takes the cup and refills it and tells me "there is less black stuff in this one"...i can't make this kind of shit up. She made sure to fill me up with 1$ bills after i paid to ensure herself a tip..it didn't work though. 
This is my review of Eagle Crest, my review of Highland falls is much worst. I am not some person who sits around complaining because i have enjoyed several courses in Vegas and would never complain about them. 
Would i ever play here again? hell no, and i would advise the same for everyone else.
Got a great deal to play here in the afternoon a couple weeks ago. Nice fun course. Greens were in ok shape. the course was in above average standard besides that. will for sure play there again

Small course.  Friendly people. (employees and golfers)  Went on a VERY windy day and it only got impossibly worse so had to call it quits before completing the course but it was pleasant while it lasted!

I really don't want to say much.

Don't waste your time and don't waste your money. This place is amongst the worst businesses I've ever been to let alone a golf course.

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(72/365) "The Divot Dude"

What a perfect day it was to do 18 holes of golf! Of course, we did it "our way"...;)
It was a beautiful course, and we all had a great time trying not to hold up the others behind us which happened a couple of times, but we just let them play through which they were cool with.

We all had our superstar moments with pretty good drives and great putts aside from getting caught in the bunkers and butchering the green with my countless divots-OOOPSY!  

Great course in the Summerlin area if you wanna whack some balls....ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu  3.75

* This ain't the beach, but wear sunscreen especially on a nice clear day!

Wonderful greens and an overview of the city! Beautiful mountain atmosphere. Can't say enough about the grounds crew and the pro shop experts. Wonderful food at the clubhouse. The trip north of the city is worth it! Fabulous time for 2 or a scramble!
Nice course with beautiful view of the strip. Not over booked like most courses in town. Played 18 holes in less then 3 hours.
Simple sweet little course. Expansive views of the LV Strip.

Had a really nice day at Eagle Crest  while vacationing in Vegas. We weren't really up to a long, hard course and this one more than met our expectations.  Beautifully kept greens, we will come back. Awesome price. No complaints! !

Very nice course even for the novice golfer. 
I will return to enjoy the well kept grounds and friendly staff.

Very nice executive course. My play date was April 17 and the conditions were great. I paid $15 through golfnow.com and it was a super great deal. The pro shop personnel were friendly. We started on time and finished in about 3 hours. Great views from some of the holes. Couldn't have asked for a better day golfing. This course is good for all levels of play. Great place to work on the short game.
A no frills but majestic executive course overlooking the city.  It's also a few temps cooler due to the higher elevation.

1. Lost our tee time along with a few others.
2. Workers were digging trenches in the middle of fairways.
3. Workers were running power equipment during your swing.
4. Cart almost died halfway through the round.

Awful.

Great executive course with beautiful views. I brought the boyfriend here this afternoon for his birthday, and it went very well. Booked a 12:30 tee time a few days in advance and the pro shop clerk let us go out half an hour early. 

My boyfriend said it was a great course, though the greens were slow due to recent overseeding and verti-cut. Playing time is fairly quick; he went through 18 holes in about two hours.

We had a fun, leisurely day together here for a price that was easy on the wallet. Eagle Crest is right down the street from our house, so we'll be back someday.

This review is for the practice facility only, I have never played the course. 

This is one of the best deals for a practice facility in town. $6 for a large bucket (roughly 75 balls) is tough to beat. Factor in that you can actually hit off of grass Monday-Wednesday and this is why I frequent this range. The mats (Thursday-Sunday) are better quality than what you get somewhere like Angel Park... and because it is not grass seven days a week you can usually get a station with good spots to hit from.... not just endless divots (looking at you Siena). 

A large practice green and a good size chipping green (with adjacent bunker) make this the best value spot for golf practice on the west side. 

Downsides: slow greens and wish it was grass 7 days per week

Tip: get the punch card. Saves you money if are going to frequent the range. Which you should.

Make the effort to trek to Vegas to find the "true" International Market.(on Decatur)  This one in Mesa was a huge disappointment.  No German, Polish, Ukrainian, Russian, French food or anything else other than Asian and Hispanic.  With a small (and I mean teeny) British assortment.  Not worth a visit unless you're cooking Asian or Hispanic....in that case, it might be okay.

Went to this place a couple of weeks ago. I like it, it's big and not so cramped like Mekong. It's also nice that they sell more household products. It really is like an Asian Walmart like how it was billed by somebody. Some of their products were cheaper than even Mekong, the company the owners of this place owns too. The place is clean, no clutter. Parking was nice. Probably because it was Sunday evening so it was less crowded. Though at Mekong, it's crowded regardless of what day it is. 

Anyhoo, what I don't like about it is how it was really hard to find products I'm looking for. I don't know. It's hard to explain it but at Mekong, and LeeLee's, everything is fairly easy to find. I think they need a better way of organizing their merchandise. Even with the veggies etc. I think I like how they are presented at Mekong much better. 

Definitely worth a visit to at least check the place out. Though personally, I think I like the Mekong plaza much better.

Spent the morning walking up and down the aisles! So fun! Lots of random kitchen utensils, cute dishes, great selection of seafood and new Korean makeup store with a knowledgeable sales person... for you Colombians out there: I found Arequipe, buuelos,milo, manzana and colombiana postobon as well as arepas in the fridge area:)
Several shops within.  Big like huge 99 cent store but much more item all over world.

Not coming here anymore. It's a huge waste of time when you come here for 3 things every week and you don't have one of those things this week, so now I can't use my card because my total was only $4.12. It is not my fault you have to pay a terminal fee and that you get the cheapest subscription and I have to pay the difference shame on you greedy people - you were perfectly fine letting me leaving with nothing. There are tons of other markets with the same produce I need at the same price, and honestly your quality has gone down since you opened,  this was just the closest. I'll be telling my friends too.. on my way to sprouts!

Additional thoughts as of 05/14/2016:

There is something that occurred to me as a potential to marketing.  I do not know how this could be monetized and encourage more sales within the store, but this will help with market differentiation.  

If you wish to cater to a broader group of people, not just Asians, you should setup a working kitchen demonstration area.  You then could have appropriate various people give cooking demonstrations using the products in store.  You could make the recipes available on flyers (English, Spanish, etc), and also indicate which aisles have the products.  Keep it short and simple.  Present it in a manner that grabs attention.  This is a way to increase marketing, and perhaps increase sales.  This would be a market differentiator.  Focus more on the fusion of culture.  Let the presenters innovate and present different things that are a mix of different cultures in the same dish.  Obviously, make sure it looks good.  This is my thought.  The presenters can be Asian, Mexican, whatever, as long as:

1) The budget is appropriate (people are cost conscious)
2) It is not complicated, and must be easy (people want simple)
3) It is not time consuming (people do not want to spend excessive time)
4) Products are available in store (delivery....people want to purchase it today).
5) It is healthy (people are health conscious)

Spend less time trying to be "WALMART", and more time differentiating yourself.  

---------------------
This place, while big, is totally in need of work.  Here are my exact thoughts:

1) There is no rhyme or reason to the way the store is laid out.  Nothing flows.  It is a total zoo on the shopping floor.  Get an Industrial Engineering consultant to help you with the floor layout!!!  It will be better then!!!!

2) This appears to be more of a market catering to those of Latino origin with Asian overtones.  I do not see it otherwise.  

3) There were many so-called "Asian" goods that were "missing" from the shelves.  There are much more varieties and available products elsewhere at other Asian markets nearby.  

4)  The owners of this store are the same as those that run The Mekong Marketplace just around the corner and up the road on Dobson.  If their intention was to keep both of them open, I do not see that.  One of the two (either this one or the Mekong) is going to close down ultimately.  Each of these will cannibalize the customers from the other.  It may end up that one or the other survives, or none survive.  

I have unfortunately seen this scenario here in the USA (not in Arizona).  One only needs to look at Nashville TN and the business of K&S Markets.  K&S Market had two locations.  One in East Nashville on Nolensville Pike, and one in South Nashville.  The East Nashville location was the older of the two markets.  What happened was the South Nashville location was open for a few years, and then closed for a lack of business.  People just reverted back to the noise and chaos of the East Nashville (the original) location, after seeing the disappointment and lack of products at the new location.

I see either The Mekong closing, or this place closing, after a few years.  If I gambled, and I do not gamble, I am going to say that The Mekong will whether the storm, and this place will probably close.  Sorry, but this is my thought.

The only way I would see the AZ International Marketplace stay open is by market distinction and doing something different then what The Mekong does.  Right now, it appears this is an "inferior" product compared to The Mekong.

Great New Find And Good Prices!

We were on our way to Mekong Market when we saw this HUGE new market!

Staff was friendly!

Manager girl was friendly!

Super clean and organized!

Good prices!

Nice Military Discount!

This is my new go to market!

Stop in and give them a try!

Went over here to shop around to try whats new. Tiles was a little bit old. I dont really recommend to buy meat or fish here maybe just go buy at there Mekong supermarket more better. But aside from that they have varieties of food. It's bigger than another supermarket.

Awesome store!!!! They have everything you could possibly imagine!!! Good customer service too. They have delicious fruit too. Whole fresh jack fruit, Rambutan is delicious hairy fruit that look like strawberry sand cactus mixed together.

Why does this place smell so horrible. How can so many cuisines  smell so badly?  This place is fairly new but seems dirty. The floors are already falling apart. Selection is great. Aesthetic is horrible.

This is going to be my new Asian food supermarket. Very clean & organized if you compare to Lee Lee or Megkong which have some weird smell. Less crowd and big inside . Price is cheaper or similar to those two grocery. I was in & out quick. Give them a shot !
Amazing prices! My most favorite place to go because they have groceries from different countries from Italy Asia India mexico. I love that they have daiso things too. Must come!

Really huge international marketplace that is reminiscent to giant international grocers like Zion in San Diego. With a plethora of international products, food to housewares and even a small food court AZ International has it all.

I appreciate the cleanliness and brightness of the store and how organized it is despite the massive amounts of items it holds. Walking down the aisles may be a bit confusing as housewares are located on the far right and left and produce located smack dab in the middle. Though, past the housewares are heavier, frozen or bulk items. Aisle signs are also a bit small to read.

However, pricing here looks pretty typical to any other ethnic grocer I've seen in the Greater Phoenix area though the vast variety here is one to commend.

I recently got to their their boba tea here and found for a small shop in a grocer to be quite good. I got a Wintermelon Green Tea with boba and really enjoyed it, very reminiscent to Gong Cha's except really on the sweet side. I would suggest ordering half sweet here at iSnow (from what I recall). The boba itself was very good, perfectly cooked, soft but chewy and tasted like brown sugar. Price was also very reasonable. Flavors remind me more of the legit milk tea/teas I'm used to and fond of. They also serve shaved ice and ice cream here as well.

Parking is easy here as the plaza it's located in is large with not many store fronts to compete with. Though I did find drivers here were particularly aggressive in getting the closest parking spot or driving a bit too fast. Sorry, I'm not going to delve into the Asian driver jokes here- the diversity of customers surpasses that of solely Asians O:-)

I don't understand how this place can be open for only a matter of DAYS and it now looks like a completely run down excuse of a grocery store?!?
The aisles are small and hard for multiple shoppers to get down. 
There is no rhyme or reason to the store layout. 
Some of the aisles don't even have signs saying what is down them. 
There were flies SWARMING the meat/seafood counters. 
The fresh "live" crabs and crawfish were anything but...they were just laying there in the box, none really moving, most of them already dead and stinking to high heaven. 
I watched a lady sit there in front of the peanut box located in the produce section grab a handful of peanuts, shell them in her mouth and place the empty shells BACK in the peanut box and dig back in for more peanuts. Maybe she was confusing this place for Texas Roadhouse or even Five Guys where they allow you to eat the peanuts for free. 
Over by the milk section, they had a HUGE palette of eggs sitting in the middle of the aisle...not refrigerated what so ever...correct me if I'm wrong, but can't that cause the eggs to go bad?
Don't even get me started on the restrooms. No toilet paper, no seat guards, bodily fluids and excrement all over the floors. Honestly, I'd rather take my chances with a portable toilet at a truck stop cause I bet it's cleaner than the toilets here.
Prices are also quite higher than average for your every day stuff. For example is everyone familiar with those large bag of Malt-o-Meal cereals you can get anywhere? Well normal prices for those bags are about $5 and some change. Here...they're almost $8.50 or more. Boxed cereal (smaller boxes) of name brand cereal like Frosted Flakes or Lucky Charms will run you $6 or more.
All in all I'm just not impressed and feel that they really just hyped up the opening and come to find out, it's all just one big disappointment.
