Big store but as for it being an international market,  I don't really see it.   99.95% of the store is Asian.
One aisle of Indian and one of Mexican and a few of mixed American/mexican/Chinese/Russian like you'd find at any supermarket.   If i go back, it will be for the Indian. 
I can get the Mexican and Asian that i will eat almost anywhere.
Once they start selling alcohol they will get 5 stars. The prices here for meats and seafood are unbeatable. Everything I have bought here has been very tasty and fresh.

This awesome marketplace is so much bigger than Mekong Supermarket - maybe three Mekong Supermarkets will fit in it. The aisles are wider and the merchandise is much more varied and arranged in a more organized manner. The variety of fresh produce is astounding; you can find cactus paddles (nopales), dried hibiscus (jamaica), jackfruit, bundles of cinnamon sticks, a large variety of fresh and dried peppers ... too many things to mention here. Mexican food, Mediterranean food, African food, Asian ingredients galore, fresh seafood, fresh meats, regular packaged grocery items, household cleaning materials, cosmetics, storage items, pet supplies, small appliances - the list goes on and on. Great prices too. Be prepared to spend a lot of time when you go shopping here;  you will most likely find all the things in your marketing list but because of the size of the marketplace, you may have to do quite a lot of footwork. The extremely large variety of goods may be intimidating, but it will really be worth taking time to browse at a leisurely pace - there are so many new, unusual, hard-to-find (in other stores) ingredients and items you will discover in the process.
The grocery is clean and have all kinds of things that normally can't be find at other asian grocery. Got 10% discount on every purchase.

This place is cool for browse through the isles for a 1/2 hour. A bunch of stuff you don't get to see at your local Fry's or Safeway. It's about 35% Asian and then about 35% Hispanic and then the rest is meat and produce. My daughter and I went up each isle and poked fun at some of the oddities they have there. 
A ton of fish and parts of an animal you don't see everyday. It's like you in your own Bizarre Foods episode. Personally I don't think I would shop here, but it was a fun 30-45 minutes to kill on a hot summer afternoon. They also have a small little food court with Asian and Mexican food.

Telling all my friends about this shopping center! I have been a longtime patron of Lee Lee Market, but I think I may have found a new favorite international market. I  was so surprised to find so many items that I have never seen at any other international market. Too many things to buy all at once, so I will have to come back!!  This place is huge! Not only that, but it has crazy awesome prices. I have never seen dragonfruit under $6 a pound. Here, they had it discounted more than half off the typical price. Needless to say, I will definitely be frequenting this grocery store in the future. Inside, they have additional eateries, nail salons and beauty stores with great prices! My plan is to come back and make a day out of it!!! Can't wait.

Before i get started, some things here are great. The Noodle selection, stocks, vinegars and base sauces. i came here last week and liked it, Didnt buy a lot, I just purchased the products to make Soba noodle soup. Noodles, pork belly, mushrooms, green onions, mire poix, the things to make a broth, It was delicious. This was of course after the large publicity about this market's grand opening just over a week before. 

i cook professionally, recreationally, and passionately. Nothing impacts my life more than the love of food. So nothing excites me more then more options in my area. i grew up on the ocean, with fresh fish. I work in Arizona restaurants that bring in fresh fish daily. It truly is good product. Coming from the coast, I think it is truly an amazing thing to be able to have good seafood in the hot desert. 

Unfortunately today, I literally felt my passion take a hit, not enough to stop me. What it did do though is make me lose faith in thinking that this city actually has a good enough food scene to support the Chef that I am becoming. The restaurant scene is great, but the market scene isnt the best. I was ready to go here and shop today. i was going to create a restaurant quality dish at home. I had brainstormed and only one thing was uncertain, what would I be able to work with that I could truly feel the love while cooking it. I just assumed i was coming to this place and they would have something good, other than the noodle soup i made last week. 

The fish on ice selection isnt bustling with top fishes that i'd want to cook. A couple options were decent, if it was fresh. The smell is way too fishy. i wouldnt serve it. If its not perfect, you should throw it out. The problem is that companies dont want to do that. i am pretty sure that some of that fish was way past "fresh" There was also crab and crawfish just sitting out nowhere near ice with flies lingering around it. This isnt as big of a deal to some people as it is to me, but that is because of my passion for food and lifestyle.

That is why we cant have a better food scene. There is only passion in the restaurant aspect of it, there needs to be passion throughout the city. 

This city needs at least one store, (not AJ's, or Albertsons) that can truly satisfy the need for an international market, that has a lot of options. With food that is fresh, and standards that are high.

This place is like the MECCA of supermarkets... and the best part, is they have EVERYTHING!!! Originally, I was pointed to this store when I wanted to make sushi and was looking for the specific ingredients. Not only did I find everything (including the dishes & cooking supplies) for a decent price, but I ended up having to go back just to check out the rest of the store & variety of products, because the store is HUGE and they have just about everything! 

The store is pretty well organized. There is a section for each country/cuisine. Literally every department of the store is HUGE, so there is no problem finding a variety & selection! Which made me absolutely love their FRESH meat department. Along with fresh, live seafood, they have such a variety of fresh meats, pre-seasoned, raw or ready to heat & eat. Their produce, some of it was a little weak, and I don't have a whole lot to say on the dairy department because there was not a whole lot to that area (cream cheese is pretty basic but was difficult to barely find) but they also have such a good variety of things you normally don't find at the regular supermarkets that it is totally worth sorting through. I was a little disappointed that one thing I absolutely could not find was smoked salmon... the only thing they had "close" to that was smoked mackerel in a very unappealing package of the entire fish, head & all. They definitely have fresh, RAW salmon, or any other fish you could want. 

In fact, they pretty much have everything when it comes to a variety of all sorts of cuisine culture. Loved finding fresh octopus, lumpia & my favorite basmati rice. Their prices are really decent when it comes to most items, and checkout was pleasantly quick. I even found some home-goods walking past that section for a steal. The store is so big you could easily get lost or spend hours browsing the HUGE selection... but it is well worth it. And it won't break the bank with the competitive prices comparing it to other local supermarkets where you won't find the variety, specialty items or huge selection of fresh meats. I shop here for many reasons, and recommend this place to anyone who loves international cuisine & cooking!

This place is solid.  There seem to be some complaints about bad service or long check-out lines. But I've only been on Saturday afternoon/evenings and I've somehow never experienced either!

In fact, on my last recent visit, I was helped by no less than 3 different employees who helped me find super random things (a large bag of brown sesame seeds, Chinese black vinegar, wonton wrappers, and guava juice).  Everyone seemed friendly and as happy to help as anyone working at Trader Joe's.

In general, ethnic products that are considered specialty in your standard grocery store are offered for a comparatively great price and usually with a few options among each type of item.  Produce is hit or miss (mostly, for me because some of it is semi-bulk packaged so I pass on things like ginger or some more unique fruits that I as a single person cannot consume before it spoils).

Bonus -- anything not on an advertised sale (or explicitly excluded) is 10% off! Every day! Woohoo!

The only miss is the boba/tea shop - I thought the thai tea was pretty awful.

I took a spin through here this afternoon.  It was really all I could handle because the store was a zoo.  I usually don't like to come to grand openings on a weekend because of the crowds, but I was tempted by the possibility of low prices and/or special grand opening discounts.  I didn't find any of that, at least on the items that I wanted to purchase.  With the addition of the crazy long lines, I just couldn't justify shopping here today.  

As someone who shops regularly at Mekong Plaza and Lee Lee Market, I felt like I was still shopping in those places, except this store is a bit bigger and the aisles wider.  Unfortunately bigger, wider aisles didn't really help much on a day as busy as this one.  Also, I was expecting the selection to be a little more "international" and not just mainly Asian, but I should've known better.

Pros:  Prince songs were playing inside the store, and they gave me a 20% off coupon, good for a trip to the market in May.  I'll use that opportunity to give this place another chance.

This place is so much fun.  So many items to see.  The aisles seem to go on and on forever - this building used to house a very large K-Mart store.  Love that there are smaller eateries inside - Asian food, Mexican food, and a Boba/Smoothie place.  Have been here twice so far and see us returning fairly often for certain items and, as always, walking the aisles in search of unique products to try.

I was excited to check this place out after hearing it was the largest international marketplace in AZ. However, I was pretty disappointed. A lot of the shelves were empty and there also wasn't an Asian bakery inside. They did sell some baked goods but it didn't look that great. I think Mekong is better in that aspect. They do have a pretty good selection in treats and things but I'll probably go to Mekong next time. Also, they don't accept cards for $10 or less.

Tons of stuff that you can't find any place else. Ignore the regular groceries, they're overpriced. But the exotic stuff is worth coming for. Grand Opening so it was crowded. I'll be back when it's more comfortable to shop.

It is huge, yes. But it takes awhile to get used to. The store is different from the other stores like Mekong or Lee Lee. This store does not categorize their isles by countries. They are categorized by each items like drinks, spices, etc. If you don't have time to find what you need, go to Mekong. I got so used to Mekong. Regardless of how much more this store sells, my time is much more valuable. I hope they change the concept, and I might keep coming back.

I was so looking forward to this market, but it was very disappointing when I finally went. Where are their foods from South America and the Middle East? I wanted to buy dulce de leche and other sweets from Argentina and chocolates/snacks from Israel. I was surprised that they didn't have Inca Kola from Peru (even Ranch Market sells it) or Garotos from Brazil. It was mostly Asian and Indian items, dollar store trinkets and regular supermarket groceries. They must carry food items from around the world to be truly international, if not, they should call the store an Asian market. Also, I was very annoyed that they have a $10 minimum for debit card purchases. Their lack of international foods made it difficult to reach that threshold.

I love this place!! Has all kinds of things I've never seen before and want to play with.  Great prices on a lot of things, you do have to pay attention though.  Produce is an excellent price though. I like the fact that there is a couple restaurants inside the store.  I've bought some fun snacks and some meat to try new recipes with! Even found some things I needed before but couldn't find anywhere.

Price is very good,
 sometimes 30% to 50% savings on vegetable items compare with other Asian store.
But you also need to be careful for bad items.
For example, i got Chaudoc coconut milk for .99. Great price but it smells stale,
i should have got clue when 2000 cans of coconut spread around the isle.

Less than 1 mile away Asian Market, they have good quality vegatalbles.
Korea Mart, new one, i heard their Daicon is better than AZ international.
Lee Lee is also a better store than AZ international, as far as balance quality and price.

This store bought quantity from supplier and pass along savings to customers.
Since i only get less than 10 different items when i shop any Asian stores.
i would not shop this store again.
Unless you are feeding an army,
Sometimes it is better to pay a little more for quality.
We bought a package of oysters and half of them were rotten. Never again. Some of the items are old and reprinted with new expiration dates as well. Beware because you get what you pay for.

This place is like a department store as it has lots of items other than food.  There is a great variety of foods including both produce and canned/packaged goods.  I found the prices in the produce department to be super cheap not to mention exotic.  I bought jackfruit which I had never tasted but was recommended by an asian customer.  It turned out to be really delicious; a flavor which is a mix of mango, pineapple, banana.  Try it.  Buy a small piece as I did since Jackfruit can easily weigh 20 lbs or more.  Paid 18 cents a pound for onions?  Did you read that?  18 cents.  The fish and meat department has everything you could think of. They have a frozen meat and fish coolers have a lot of exotic stuff.  Pork blood, anyone?  
You have to go here.  BTW, at the end of your checkout they give you 10% off most of the items.  You can't go wrong.

This place is better than Mekong market place because it has more foods and open walk way that you can push your shopping cards around the the aisle freely with any traffic with other shoppers. I am highly recommend international market place!

Large, huge selection, quick lines

Read about the opening of AZIM in the Phoenix Business Journal and had to make a visit. The descriptions are accurate: The place is huge (especially for an Asian grocery store), the selection runs the gamut, and they are still getting things down with the new store opening oddities.

Examples: 
1) The boba tea place in the front can't make shaved ice until next week and wasn't going to be ready with boba for the boba teas until about 11 AM.
2) Lines were super long when we arrived, but most had pared down by the time we were ready.
3) Some of the worse grocery carts! With how they wobble, squeak, and stick, I think they stole them from the homeless to have enough for the opening.   
4) Well-lit and organized store with a good number of people working to constantly re-stock things.
5) Some of the mini-stores in the AZIM aren't open or are still preparing to open.
6) No authentic Asian food place with some roast duck, roast pig, or other hanging? The Asian food place in there looks like something from the mall. 
7) The surrounding stores around the parking lot are still opening/renovating/preparing.
8) Cashier was a bit confused by me using a credit card instead of a debit card. Didn't take long, but was an odd thing. 
9) Prices are average to good for what we usually buy.

Good overall and with some practice and time, I'm sure it will be even better!

Poorly laid out, although they obviously have a lot of stuff. Poor signage. Many staff don't speak English, so simple questions like "do you sell ----" are met with blank stares. Not much in way of fresh herbs. American side groceries are pricey.

I really like this market. The vegetables and fish are awesome! Soo many choices. The prices are reasonable, especially so with 20% off for veterans. Wow!!! Our veterans are special and az has really stepped up.

First visit was on 6/5. The store was very large and it was fun exploring. There were many housewares like mentioned in other reviews. The parking lot is very large so it was very easy to find a spot and get in and out. The produce was extremely cheap! Orange bell peppers were 3lbs for $0.98, 4 bunches of green onions for $0.98, etc. They had Caf Du Monde Coffee on sale for $4.58, and 30 eggs for $1.78. I believe they also offer a 10% discount like Me Kong, but not for sale items (not 100% sure on that). Some of the items were overpriced but I feel like that is the case with most stores. Will definitely return to check out any new products and sales. 

*I am also on the hunt for my favorite candy. It is called Meiji APOLLO STRAWBERRY Chocolate Japanese Candy Cones. I purchased it at Me Kong a few years ago and fell in love with it. When I returned to order more I did not see it stocked on the shelves. I tried to find it at this market as well and did not see it. Does anyone know of anywhere local where it is currently for sale?

Az international true to it's name is the first of it's kind in the valley.
It's a five minute drive from Mekong supermarket which is a sister concern and my go-to Asian grocery store. 

First impressions
a) Hugeeee place, it takes a while to explore the aisles.
b) Neatly labelled and very organised.
c) Ample of parking space.
d) lot of 'hard to find' ingredients are available. 
e) They have a small section for Daiso products Score!
 (that alone is reason enough for me to go back)
f) Indian aisle is pretty decent

This place is less crowded compared to Mekong but the seafood section there has more variety in terms of shrimp, fish, crabs etc.

Note - $5 min to use credit/debit cards.

Cheers!

I have to agree with previous reviews, before to visit this morning, I checked Yelp and thought about giving this place a chance, thinking the reviews were not totally true, My MISTAKE!!! 
We just loose our time, crowded was expected due the opening weekend but yeah the place is missing totally organization and cleanliness.

Many people comment about how big the place is, true, however the number of shelves filled with products are much less than visiting Mekong.

Also they expanded the household items a lot!!! Maybe 25% of the place is dedicated to this, thing that I hate, this kind of markets usually sells low quality and overpriced household products that you can get at your regular grocery store.

The "international" market sense was not found anywhere, I can feel they reduced the amount of Asian products,  and somehow increased the Latino cheese and cream area. However even I'm Latino I can't feel important improvement, I think I can found still more Latino products at Mekong.

Produce was not fresh, found many of them rotten specially fruits!!! I wonder how come the want to sell them.
Bathrooms were super dirty 
Shopping carts are recycled from Mekong, noisy, old and dirty.
Cashiers are limited and even they have space to add more, or separate them more, they are crowded in a confined area.
Also the layout makes really hard to find products.
The illumination looks really bad, tried to make a bright place but the result is a dark shadow reflection from the lamps.
After more than 30 minutes of standstill line at cashier, having 15 others in front of us, we decided to leave our cart there and don't buy anything, like many others...we counted about 10 other carts also abandoned, I think this is the first time I don't regret to don't buy something, nothing memorable to get from there....

I have to admit...I was overjoyed when my friend told me about the opening of this supermarket. I was excited to check it out and see if I could find all kinds of goodies that I could only get in L.A. 

This supermarket is the size of a warehouse (Costco). Not only it is well organized, it truely is an international supermarket. Unlike Mekong or Lee Lee, it actually also sells American and Mexican food as well as lots of household appliances. They also sell lots of produce, marinated meats, fresh fish, deli....U name it. 

My biggest complain about this market is the prices on everything. Even regular sodas and eggs we're twice as expensive. I picked up a mango juice and it was almost $6. Ill come here to specialty authentic items that i couldnt find at Lee Lees or Asiana....but I probably will not do my regular grocery shopping here. If you haven't been here, it is worth checking it out.

What a big dirty disappointment. Food already spoiled, flies everywhere and high prices.  Won't be back and would suggest the health department might want to stop by and do an inspection before people become ill.

Don't expect to get great customer service here. Employees walk around, stare at you, and they don't say a thing. This place is huge and they sell a variety of items. (Hispanic and American products as well)

Prices though seem to be much higher then the other Asian markets that are around the area. I stood 5 minutes at the dairy counter even though there was an employee right in front of me and two which seemed to be managers, standing next to me talking. 

I got a stare and that was my que to tell him what I wanted. No "how can I help you?" Nada. I didn't even get a thank you. The cashier was no different. Rude.

Never coming back. This was my first and last time, byeeee.

Huge, huge international market. Everything you could hope for is here: produce, meat, seafood, spices, baking, noodles, frozen, dairy, beverages, candies, plus, they have all the personal care items and sundries you'd find in a bigger store.  (Small appliances too!)

This one is far bigger than all of the other Asian stores in the Valley.  I came on the grand opening weekend and saw the Chinese dragon dance.  My little daughter really loved seeing the dragons.

While I was there I took advantage of their phenomenal prices on produce and import goods.  I stocked up on produce, shrimp chips, bags of Nata de coco, and Jackfruit.  

Everything was great except (isn't there always a disclaimer?) there were really long lines to check out and apparently I didn't see the small sign above the register saying that I was in the express line, so once I'd unloaded all my items onto the register belt the cashier nastily snapped at me that I was in the wrong line. 0_o Honestly, her tone was so rude and caught me off guard so much, that I almost said "Whoa...forget it." and just left.  But no, I was nice and apologized, and moved my items back to my cart and stood in line, again, for another 30 minutes to check out in the correct line.

Our 1st time here. Holy Jebus!!! This market place is huge!

Plenty of spots for everyone to park their car. It's clean, and well lit.

The store is massive! It's clean. The aisles are well marked, and merchandise are well organised.

We appreciate the varieties of merchandise offerings.
They have walls of sauces, home goods, amazing meet selections, produce, cookwares, and they even offer vegetarian options along the frozen aisle.

They have plenty of registers or tills to assist you upon checkout. 

Overall, we are pleased with our initial shopping experience!

When this place first opened up I was a fan simply because of the size and how many more options they added on to this market compared to their sister one, Mekong. They have made some changes in the past few months that have made me not enjoy coming here as often.

First off, the store is huge! This has always been a plus because you have so many different types of food to choose from. I do think that a lot of the food has been sitting on the shelves for A LONG TIME because of the sheer amount they have compared to the amount of customers they get per day. The store is never really busy. This always makes me feel like the foods I buy aren't as fresh as they should be.

They use to have a very large chip/snack aisle that has disappeared in the past couple of months. Now I can barely find any of the Chinese chip options when they use to have a huge aisle that always had to be restocked because it was popular. 

Overall, this place has nice options and so many different types of foods, drinks, spices, and more. I just question the freshness of some of the foods.
Great prices and a great selection. The noodle and produce selection is incredible. Definitely worth the trip even if you're not in the neighborhood.

The goods are good but very poor customer service. People that works there are not very friendly. The cashiers don't have any emotions and so flat. The lady who's the manager of the cashiers I think has no people skills at all! Very disappointed on my trip there!

This is a neat store to get lost in....and I mean get lost because this place is huge! I bought a whole bunch of stuff while here....mostly produce and the prices were incredible! I think I got 8 limes for dollar.... A big bag of basil for 2.... Fabulous! This store is not convenient for me, but I would return regardless.

FYI!!!!!! 20% discount coupon is a ripoff, they dont do it on supersale items wich is 80% of everything they sell!! Also they ask for your drivers license and notated the # on the back of coupon(SCARY) 
BE CAREFUL and don't shop there!!!!

I went to this year's Lunar Food Truck Festival held in the AZ International Marketplace's parking lot. It was advertised as starting at 6 but I think it started a lot earlier because we got there right at 6 and it was a madhouse trying to find parking. We lucked out and got a spot in the marketplace parking lot but I saw other cars parking along the side streets and others circling around and around for an open spot. 

The festival is in an enclosed part of the parking lot but they had a good number of food trucks and booths. I also saw a climbing wall and a stage off to the side where they had someone singing when I was there. There was a sectioned off area with a good amount of seating for enjoying your food truck meal. There were a ton of people walking around so if you don't like hanging out in large crowds this isn't your place.

Some of the vendors I saw were The Lemongrass Shack, Flippin' Rice, Pho King, Happy Honu Shaved Ice, The Luau Hut, Fiiz Sodas, Beignet Babes, Later Tater, and Curbside Crepes. 

Their Facebook page noted that there wouldn't be any mooncakes for sale at the festival (Although they were available at the market if you wanted a box). Since it was advertised as a Lunar Festival it would have been nice to have a booth for people to purchase them. Maybe next year!

I loved how this was a dog friendly event too and there were so many cute pups walking around with their humans. 

I think it's great that AZ Marketplace hosted this event and there was so much representation of Asian food here. They seem to hold these food truck festivals here every few months so if you missed the Lunar festival one keep an eye out for another in the future.

I'll give it 4 stars.

It seems there's not really an Asian market to satisfy everyone, but this is probably the closest that it gets.  It's a huge store.  Large enough to find the little things that you might want, plus you can browse for something new to try.  They also have a section with traditional American grocery items if you need to pick up some Prego with your Pokki.  I'm a bit picky about my fresh meat and vegetables so I might stay with the other shops for those items.

Really convenient location, endless parking, clean store.
Was just at the international market for the 1st time 09/17 was a great place, the place is huge, put your walking shoes on.. Great prices on veggies and anything international you need is there.

Since their grand opening in late April, I kept seeing fellow Yelpers' check in one after another. I couldn't wait to come check it out this new store.

I walked every single aisle, up and down, checking everything out..  I must say many of the food I purchased on that day was cheaper than other Asian grocery store nearby. They have nice selections, if I am home more often, I would have purchased more food.  

They sell some bakery, I wish selection is larger but other than that, they had everything I could think of that I normally purchase from Asian grocery store.

They have cafeteria serving Chinese food and boba drink store inside. Boba I had was just standard, nothing special but price was very reasonable.  i like the fact they have herbal tea too.

Fresh vegetables and meats I purchased was pretty good, I already used everything within a few days after I purchased from this store last weekend.  I would definitely be back.

So I came to this giant supermarket that looked like what would happen if you took Lee Lee's and Food City and combined all their merchandise somewhat haphazardly into an old Kmart. Well, it's a bit better than that. And it's also a bit worse. Grand Opening was IMO complete chaos!! It's in a huge mall just east of the Dobson/Broadway intersection and the store itself faces Broadway. There are all sorts of businesses in this mall like Family Dollar, Koreatown and some other eateries that I couldn't tell if they were really open or not but this supermarket will definitely be the anchor. The Grand Opening was delayed because they needed more time and looks like it will be some time before the place is fully up and running. None of the internal businesses within International Marketplace seemed to be open yet. While I probably didn't make it along every possible pathway due to crowds and craziness I did notice a few things that caught my eye - they had a Burmese section - I don't remember seeing anything like that in Lee Lee's or Mekong or Asiana or any other Asian market in town. I winded up getting a bag of crunchy roasted lablab beans (Shwe Kyet) for novelty and curiosity's sake - ended up being a good beer snack. Unfortunately when I stood in line to pay for my haul that little bag didn't have a price tag and the girl who went looking for it took an eternity to find it. I'm sure the folks in line behind me were annoyed considering every line that day was a mile long. Just about the time I was about to tell the cashier to "forget it" so we could all just go home the girl came back with the price. This place could use better signs and considering how big it is it could definitely use a map with a "hey dummy - you are right HERE!!" red arrow in various parts of the store. One cool thing they had on Sunday was a wandering Mexican band playing music. The speakers were also blasting some kind of tribute to Prince so every so often you'd get a little combination of both. It would've actually been really cool if the Mexican band actually played Prince songs in Spanish with the trumpets standing in for the synth lines - that would have rocked my world like it was 1999.

I **SO** wanted to love this place.  What could be better than one-stop shopping for the items needed to make some of my family's favorite ethnic foods? 

First off: they should change the name. "International" implies multi-national.  There is Asian, and there is ONE aisle of Mexican, and half an aisle of Indian.  Their idea of Italian is the same jarred sauces that can be purchased at Fry's.  Nothing Greek, nothing Middle Eastern, nothing European, or Mediterranean. 

* This place STINKS. As soon as you walk in, you are hit with the completely overwhelming smell of fish. This place is LESS THAN ONE MONTH OLD.  In another month, you will probably be able to smell it from the parking lot! 

*Enormous produce department! Yay! Pretty decent prices, too! Yay, again!  

*very weird lighting in the meat cases (huge variety, though). Weird colored lighting makes me nervous.........what are you trying to cover up??

* Sooooo much prepackaged and frozen stuff. Eww. That's not what I think of when I think of either Asian or Mexican foods. 

* This place is a lot like Lee Lee, with a little bit of Los Altos Ranch Market (Stapley and Southern) mixed in, to appeal to the Hispanics in the area........but without the cool stuff that Ranch Market offers like fresh tortillas, the awesome carry-out counter, the panaderia with all of its incredible selections, fresh salsas, and Agua frescas.

This store is delightful to visit! I love the different foods they have made available, all different countries represented. There is food to eat inside at the restaurant, boba teas, and snacks galore!
I will be back often. 
Their service is also top notch.

Wow ... what a huge market indeed. This is the sister store to their smaller Mekong Market around the corner. It is definitely about 3-4 times bigger and has a larger selection as well. There's even have extra space to expand for more products in the future. Tractor supplies?

I've stopped in here a few times since they opened and this place just keeps getting better and better. The different ethnic sections are more organized and the Feng Shui flow of the store is starting to take shape.

Usually come here for Asian ingredients but this store has so much more. The place is basically split into two sections with the produce and fresh meat / fish sections positioned in the center. The Mexican / American side has all the items you need to make your favorite Mexican recipes as well as the typical American items that you would get at a regular grocery store.

The Asian side is packed with everything you need to create any type of authentic Eastern dish. All you need is a recipe and a good list of ingredient and you are ready to go. Not to mention some good appetites.

Stopped here last time to get stuff to make Vietnamese Lemongrass Street Tacos. This is a great fusion recipe that we found in the local AZ Republic newspaper and it has become a big hit at our house (see link). Tangy marinated Pork with a garlicky fish sauce cooked with lemongrass and topped with pickled cucumbers, carrots and all sorts of other goodies.

http://www.azcentral.com/story/life/food/recipes/2014/09/09/vietnamese-street-tacos-recipe/15300555/

What is nice about this store is that you can get everything you need without having to make multiple stops. Even my wife was excited to hear about that since she was doing the shopathon that day with me. YES!

Come on over and check these guys out. They have a couple different smaller restaurants inside if you decided you need to refuel before shopping. There are also bigger restaurants in the parking lot that you can enjoy as well. It's kinda like going on a vacation to a foreign land and not having to deal with the airport hassles.

See you there next time when we are trying out a new recipe at the house. It's always fun to cook with family and friends and what a better way to bring your favorite people together. HUNGRY!

3.75 STARS

I found this place accidently when I took a wrong turn.  Come to find out it is right around the corner from another Asian Market that I frequent, Mekong.  When my wife and I walked in the first thing you notice is that unmistakable smell of raw fish and something cooking.  It seems that almost all of the markets of this type have that aroma.  It's not bad but you definitely will not forget it when you smell it for the first time.  As we walked in I noticed that this place has a couple of eateries inside.  It wasn't lunch time or anything so they were not busy at all.  Something else that I noticed, comparing to the other markets, is the spacious aisles.  The aisles are wide enough that two carts can pass each other with relative comfort.  The floor was clean as was just about everything else in this store.  The produce section was amazing with a large variety of fresh fruit and veggies.  In the back of the store they have a meat department as well as another meat counter where you can purchase fresh Mexican cheeses, ceviche and different things.  As far as selection of canned goods and different varieties of food from different countries, they compare to both Mekong and Lee Lee's.
The ONLY complaint I have about this place is their selection of fresh fish and meat is a lot smaller than both of the other markets and they don't have the live tanks.  My solution: Go to AZIM for the produce and everything else then go a couple of blocks over to Mekong and get the live fish if you want it

Az International Marketplace is similar to Mekong supermarket and its is just 3' minute away. I usually go to Mekong because I get used to the way they set it up in places. 
The place is bigger and has more variety in Mexican food, home storage and alcohol beverages.
The price is similar but the food at Mekong is fresher.
The customer service is not that great. The female cashier overcharged me for avocados. When I figured that out (its $7 dollars different), not even a word "sorry" or "thank you" afterward. She was rude by throwing money on the counter instead of giving me by hand. Well,  what am I expecting? Whole Foods's customer service? lol, 
I guess she had a bad day. This is one of the reasons why Mekong is always busier.

I'ts been a year since our last visit.  At the time I noted numerous problems with this store compared to its sister store in the Mekong Plaza less than a mile north of there.  Visiting again I can say there has been much improvement.

The store aisles didn't have pallets of stuff making them almost impassible.  I still think they rely too much on pallets on the floor, but at least they weren't a major obstacle this time.  The organization seemed to make more sense now, so it was easier to shop.  The produce area is still large, and it seems to feature really fresh items (mostly Asian, but some Latino).

They seem to have everything old Mekong has, plus all the Latino stuff.  I have a feeling we will start coming here more than old Mekong.  Old Mekong may very well be on its way out now.

They have chicken at low prices, American foods, and most things you're looking for. I worked there for a little bit and it was so and so. The customer service manager made me dread going to work sometimes. She complains so much and makes it seem like your the cause of her misery. I looked over her schedule and I'm not surprised. Take a vacation woman. 

Most of the lady employees are impatient and want everything done pronto even though some things take longer to do than others. They're stressed out and will even make snide remarks now and then in Vietnamese. I understand some Vietnamese, so I can tell what's being said from time to time ;). 

On the plus side, they played great music that I liked to sing when I was on my shift, Jaliscience Mexican food  is awesome (I recommend it!), and I liked checking out all the smokin hot Asian babes ;)

The isles are wide and the produce is fresh.  The floors have been clean. I haven't had to wait in long lines, but I do tend to go during off hours. With a wheelchair it is the best international market NY far. All the others crowd their isles too much.
My wife had the chicken boxty and I had the Shepard's pie. Both were wonderful and we would come back again for sure.  Service was good but I could see it slowing as they got busier. We will be back!

My group, Arizona Caledonians, celebrated Robbie Burns Night there last month. It was brilliant. My friend, Irene loved the food, drink. The Binty was tasty, although too much broccoli. Broccoli should be optional. *LOL* We all had a lovely time. They need more selection in single malt scotches. Kilt lifter Ale was in abundance. I'd give the place 100 stars.

Tired is the best word to describe this place.  We've lived by it for a long time and thought we'd give it a try.  What a mistake!  No one greets you, no sign to tell you to sit wherever, and no waitress showing up to acknowledge you are there.  When she finally did, it was quite obvious she didn't want to be there.

Shepard's pie - made with hamburger instead of lamb.  I thought I'd try it anyway.  When I saw the presentation - I should have sent it back.  A big glob of a dish with everything spilling everywhere.  And a ton of cheese melted on top - not a normal ingredient in SP.  Plain, boring, no spice whatsoever.  Hubby's hamburger was a frozen patty - no creativity at all - yet it's called the "Dubliner".  

If you want a dive bar, go for it.  If you want real food, turn around and go somewhere else.

I think I just had the worst waitress I've ever had. I guess it's a milestone. She took a while to get to our table, no big deal. Told us they were out of the beer my boyfriend ordered, then remembered maybe they weren't. Brought me a dish that wasn't what I ordered. After my bf finished his meal I was brought salmon so overcooked it was hard, 'lemon caper sauce' that tasted like flour mixed in water, and boxed mashed potatoes. The mixed veggies were OK. My boyfriend ordered a refill on his all-you-can eat fish fry and another beer. She forgot it all and came back a while later to ask if he wanted more (!?). I tasted the fish fry. Flavorless cod, just like they rolled it in plain flour, with pre-packaged French fries. I'll never understand why a restaurant can't cut and fry a potato. The fish refill came without the sauce for which he'd asked. The waitress did offer a free Guinness, but I had to pay full price for the salmon dinner I didn't eat and complained about.  At least I was entertained by the band butchering some cover tunes. Doesn't make me want to rush to the Green Isle anytime soon.

Went Sunday for afternoon games for football. Packers bar (shocking! what bar in AZ isn't?) Place was pretty busy. Had two seats at the bar for us to sit. Bartender was nice and efficient, drinks were good. 

As for the food, small portions, not all that tasty. Ordered a caesar salad to share, wasn't large enough. For $9 (mind you, no meat, just lettuce, cheese, dressing and croutons) we thought we'd get a pretty good size salad. Had a baked potato and mashed potatoes/gravy for our "sides". Gravy wasn't cooked right, portion again, small. Took 45 mins to get the three items. Bartender claimed they only had two fryers, so the kitchen was behind. However, we didn't have fried food items. 

Overall, we will go back. Gal next to us ordered a reuben that looked life changing. So... until next time.

The highlight of this place is that they actually have Kilkenny on tap, one of my favorite beers. 

That's about it. The place is very dark, and most of the people that come here are trash. Washed out biker types and the local punks. 

They have darts which is a nice touch.

They loose points for having armed security walking about. It makes me really uncomfortable for these guys to be open carrying in a bar. There is absolutely no reason to have armed bouncers. If the place is that dangerous, they should have a uniformed officer stationed outside.

Truly kicking myself in the arse as I've been near this place for over a decade and just in the past year decided to stick my head in, the location/exterior just kept me away...    Food has been excellent.  Service has been great in my experience.  I believe I have ordered the daily special (either for lunch or dinner) that they advertise on a chalk board outside the door in every visit.  They make the best Chips!  The bar is cool the way it wraps around and divides the place into 2 distinct areas - they have darts, a couple decent TV's for the games, a small stage for live entertainment.  I just think the place is cool and I'm comfortable when I'm there - the food hooked me.

Normally we love the Dubliner, but I have to tell you Saturday night, it was awful. 
My husband got a bacon cheeseburger and was very disappointed. The burger was totally bland. No seasoning what so ever. 
I had the corned beef and cabbage and same thing. Very unseasoned. The potatoes were so awful and the cabbage was just boiled. Not with the corned beef and again, no seasoning. 
The our server was terrible. We waited forever for our drinks and had to flag down another server to get another beer. 
All in all, just not the same as we had come to expect.

Good traditional Irish bar food. Service staff flows well in chaotic situations. Roomy and has multiple bars.

Live entertainment and traditional Irish fare. If you are a good old Irish boy like me, hit this place Early before the wanna be Irish people start to flow in.
#vinosquared #vino2ultimate

The Wednesday night entertainment is AMAZING. Excellent musician and performer. Makes you laugh while enjoying great music. It can be hard to flag down the waitress, wish they had menus sitting at the table so you could flip through while you waited so you didn't have to wait to flag down the waitress to GET the menu and then wait to flag down the waitress to order. The fries are quite tasty but eat them up while they are warm. Prices are good. 
There are darts and a foosball table which are fun to do!

Always a good time at the Dubliner. We used to come here almost every Saturday night and while it is difficult to get a sitting or standing table, there is a lot of room to stand around, hehe. We usually end up playing darts or something. The staff is always polite and you can tell they like working there. That's always good. The beef stew is awesome. Bring on the fried pickles! The round ones are better, but they started doing spears, so hope that changes. Overall such a fun place!

The most unfriendly, bigoted, assh*les patrons I have ever been around in years. The servers were fine, but if you want to feel like you're in the south back in the 1800s, this is your place. F*ck this place. Hope it burns to the ground.

The Dubliner helped me celebrate my Birthday and I don't think I will ever forget it!  It was my 2nd stop that night and it was a blast--but I have to give that credit to my friend  I have only been there a couple of times but I do remember part of my birthday and know that I spent some time sharing my experience with the first stall of the Ladies restroom.  I also recall the waitress chasing me down in the parking lot to pay!?!?  I have eaten lunch there a couple of times as well but I don't have much of anything good to say about that!  I may have to give it another chance to prove itself!  We'll see!

I only recommend this place during the off hours if your here for food. In my case that was between 4 and 5. We got good service, but I could sense if this place was busy, service would be a problem. That would be for food, but just getting something to drink, come anytime.

We were not ignored, but I felt the waitress should of check up on how we were doing just one more time.(not spoiled ok). Me and the wife both got fish and chips, plus slaw. Not bad, we both agreed. I would come here again, but as I said, only on the slow, off hours. 

Bartender seemed to draw the crowd, as he was very charismatic as a whole. Majority of the crowd was between 45 and 65. Clean restrooms. Decor was average to slightly above average for a Irish pub. Don't let the outside look fool you. Lots of parking. Especially back further. Safe location.

This place looks small from the outside but don't let that fool you. It's so cool inside. First time here with a friend and it will be a favorite forever. Our server was Michelle, she was so kind & not the 'overly friendly' type that annoy me.  

The food is great & if you want to watch the game there are tv's everywhere!

Great live music! I used to go here a lot more but it still one my favorite bars. Saint Patty's day here is crazy!. Pretty good food and always decent drinks. Recommend it for getting a group of friends together and chillin

awe, the food was OK for bar food, it was a little too loud for me last night though!
Service was ok to good.
FANTASTIC, moist, tender corned beef year round! Honestly, this is a great bar with live music and a cheap enough bar tab, but the quality of the food exceeds expectations.

This is the Irish bar in its purest form. 

Plenty of dart boards line the walls and pitchers float around by the dozen. There are a few long drinking hall style tables which are always entertaining for big groups. The service staff is no-nonsense, but good. The crowd is my favorite aspect at the Dubliner. None of the typical Scottsdale attitudes and cheeziness will be found here . . . and if it is, it won't stay long. 

Good live music takes it up a notch and puts it into the top five of my favorite bars in town.

Wings and beer were great but a little disappointing that as I was getting into my vehicle the male bartender chased me out, yelled across the parking lot and wanted me to pay my bill.  Embarrassing to say the least, especially since I paid his bartending female partner 10 min earlier and left a $10 tip on a $14 bill.   Not fun having a dozen or so people outside smoking looking at you for no reason at all.  Thank you mr bartender for making me feel stupid for your lack of awareness at your bar.

Stopped in for a quick couple of beers after work.  Michelle the waitress was fun and had a great attitude. Been a while since I've been there for a rowdy time. I should return on a weekend and relive some of those moments.

Three of us came here on a Friday night at about 7:30. The waitress was too busy socializing with her friends at a nearby table to actually do much for us. She couldn't remember how much a pitcher of beer was. We found out at the end of the night that they are $17! A little pricey considering this is a dive bar with broke-looking customers such as ourselves! :-P The food was ok, once we got it. My booth seat was broken and it would fall inside of itself if I leaned on it wrong. That could be embarrassing if I wasn't careful! The main thing is the service was horrible. We left early and won't be going back.
Food is decent.  Service is above average.  Solid small draft beer selection. Good atmosphere.  Had music setting up.

I used to work here and the staff and locals are like family. If u are down to earth ~ I'm sure you'll love the dub! No pretentiousness here! There's good entertainment almost every night of the week. The band that plays Tuesday nights is the BEST! Weekend nights are pretty busy and crowed, but the drinks are priced right and the food is really good too! My faves are the ckn boxty, the Reuben & the Philly ~ but basically everything the menu is DELISH! If u wanna have some real Irish fun, visit the Dub!! It's the place to be on St. Patricks Day for sure!

My wife and I were in the Phoenix area, and wanted to find a good Irish Pub.  We luckily found the Dubliner.  Chris the bartender was great, along with all of the other bartenders (sorry didn't get their names).  The drinks are great, food is great, and the atmosphere is also great (not too many greats?).  Highly recommended for food, drink, music, atmosphere.  One of the best fish and chips that I have ever had, anywhere.  My wife loves the BLT's as well.

Figured I would give the place a try since I work just across the street. Worst service in my life!!!! Have sat for 20 minutes with out anyone coming around to take an order or even acknowledged. It wasn't busy at all!!!! Finally after waiting so long I got up and left. Won't be back if this is how the service is.

The Dubliner is not an authentic Irish Pub but it is one of my favorite bars to go to because the crowd is down to earth and drinks are CHEAP. Where else can you get a red bull vodka for $4? The crowd is a diverse mix of hipsters, hippies, skaters, and a few old weirdos here and there. If you went to high school in the area your bound to run into someone you haven't seen in years. I always have a great time when I go to the Dubliner because I meet such interesting people. You can find me here when I don't feel like dressing up for Scottsdale.

love the dubliner, nice local hangout. Last night we went to listen to open mic. The people who organize it are inconsiderate and rude. They were over 30 minutes late in starting. A friend of theirs, Dominick,  singing with an accompanist on the bass. Once they were done they sat at the bar with the organizers. Dominick even borrowed a man's guitar. Done of them  had to manners to sit in the area and  watch the players after them.  Extremely rude in my book. I will not go back to listen to the Open Mic at the  Dubliner.

This my favorite pub in Phoenix! Good beer selections. Good food (the shepard's pie is amaze-balls, the Irish nachos are epic, and the frickles are delish). They have good live music / entertainment during the evenings. This is a great place to go during the day to hang out with friends, watch a game, have a quiet beer, or have an awesome night out partying. The weekend nights are a raging blast! The staff does a great job handling it all!

A local favorite of mine.  Doesn't look like much on the outside, but a suprisingly decent menu and full bar.  Always live music, which is my favorite part.  All types are welcome here, but it can get busy at times and they never seem to be staffed for it, so don't be too upset it it takes a while for your drinks.  If you're tired of the crowds that frequent the clubs in Scottsdale, want some good food and live music, you will have a great time at the Dubliner.

Played trivia at the Dubliner last night.  Trivia was definitely the highlight.  Service was slow, semi-friendly, sporadic, and frustrating.  This may have been because it seemed there were only 2 servers. The beer was cold and chap- great combo when it comes to beer.  The boneless wings were decent, the carrots and celery were sub par (pretty hard to mess up those veggies), but the blue cheese was great- lots of blue cheese chunks.  The Shepards pie was hot and looked good, but was just average- adding Tabasco helped.
I had to remind my server we ordered food. Never came out. Enough said. When the check came out I asked if our food was forgotten about. I was told..... "Next time just give me a poke" really?

The Dubliner is close to my house and pours a damn good Guinness.  Food is mediocre at best.  You might wait awhile for your drinks, but it does take time to pour a good pint.  I do have to run screaming from the building when they have Irish music nights.  As much as I love my people,  that high pitched little Irish flute thing they play makes me wonder if there are dogs all over the neighborhood being terribly disturbed.  Great neighborhood bar, food meh.  You can't really go wrong with an order of potato skins when you're drunk though....so there's that.

Good bar vibe...Arizona civil war college football games were playing the night I was here so the crowd was great, and the elderly gentleman playing old Irish tunes on the stage up front added to the lively environment. Was in a strip mall setting and I was visiting from out of town so I would have not noticed it had my friend not taken me here. Still though, love my Irish pubs, whiskey,  and Guinness.

I love Irish bars, and I was happy to have found this one while my wife was shopping. The ambiance is authentic, the beer is cold and tasty (don't order American light beer, you would look like an idiot), the Guinness is on draft and perfectly pored and the waitress attentive. Sit at the bar and meet new people.

What Brad T. said.


done.


What? I have to write more?  OK, here's a little more:

-real people, not just a pretty crowd
-music can get really loud, but that's not necessarily a bad thing
-great prices on pitchers of beer
-kick back relaxed environment
-fun for people watching

They've expanded this place a bit since I was here last and it definitely moved it from a 2 1/2 to a solid 3 1/2 to 4 star kind of place.  In a strip mall (gee, who's surprised) in a North Phoenix suburb (Ok, now you can be surprised!), you wouldn't expect this place to be as cool as it is.  Food served all day, and everything we've tried is pretty good (Great looking fries!).  As great as it is to get Irish pub food all day long, it is great to watch the place transform from a sleepy lunch spot to a packed standing room only spot around the time the entertainment gets going at 9pm.  It's generally traditional Irish music, but the night we were there he also did a 50's song and we swear he was playing music from the Godfather as we moved on to our next destination.  

Lots of tables for big parties - which ours was (though the largest that night must have had 24 or more) and a great big wrap around the back bar.  The bar is one of their improvements - looks like they took over some extra space to expand since I'd been there years ago.  Several of us commented on how much bigger it looked and how much nicer it felt.  For some the downside is that this isn't a fancy "Scottsdale" bar, but on the upside - this is NOT some fancy schmancy "Scottsdale" bar.  You'll have folks of ALL ages there based on when you go.  And all shapes and sizes.  I kinda like that - you know, people looking like people.  Over the years we've been there, everyone seems to get along, just like the neighborhood pub it was meant to be.

Oh yea.  They have Guinness.  And Harp.  And Bass.  Beer and more beer.  That's not my thing so I can't really speak to it, but it is there in abundance.  Someone else will just have to stop by, have a pint and tell us all about it.

Shepards pie and taco Tuesday are definitely just a couple of various reasons to visit the dubliner. Live music on most days and for the most part, most of the individuals are friendly and have manners.

This is the neighborhood Irish pub of choice in the area. I've been coming here for 30 years ( sweet lord I am old) , since my father brought me here for Irish nachos. The Guinness is not too cold, the jukebox is not too loud, the Jameson is reasonably priced and THE WATERS PLAY HERE. Slinte! Also.  Devin maybe the best bartender in the world!

We were really looking forward to some good Irish grub, unfortunately, it didn't happen here. The Shepherd's Pie "gravy" was watery and tasteless, and there wasn't much meat. The irish stew was cold and and bland. The wait staff was nice, but service was lacking. Everything took a long time, and the most disappointing was dessert. Though the bread pudding was good, we asked for ice cream on it,  and the waitress waited too long to bring it to our table so the ice cream was almost completely melted. Won't be returning.
Jess rocks as a server and The Sullivan's kick butt! What a great band! Love their Irish music. But they can play anything!

Great wings.. Excellent personable bartenders.. Also I asked for " some extra celery and carrots " with my wings and assumed id get 2-3... They gave me a whole plate of it with extra ranch and BLEU CHEESE! .. The traditional Irish fare like the sheppards pie is absolutely terrific and the Irish soda bread was really delicious.. I been back 2 times and the food is great .. Every time

This place actually has pretty good bar food. I haven't had anything yet that wasn't good. The only problem is all the reviews that say the service stinks are absolutely true.

If the servers aren't outside smoking they are texting on their phones or standing around chatting among themselves and ignoring the customers. My advise would be to go there but go in with the opinion you need to be a jerk to the server and demand the service you are paying for. Skip the tip and keep doing it until they get it.

This place has been around forever and was a favorite when I lived in Phoenix in the 90s.  Reasonably priced drinks and good food and still that way today in 2014.  They have expanded the other side of the bar which is nice. 

I have to give a shout out to Vanessa who works the day shifts.  She is super friendly, great service and seems to know all the regulars by name. She made me feel right at home on Saturday.  I even went back again today.   The pulled pork sandwich was delicious.  I wanted something sweet today and she brought out this chocolate chip cookie that was still hot with vanilla ice cream melting over it.  It was wonderful.

If I can swing it I may come by a third time before I leave this is how fond I am of the place. They have live music some evenings I think.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it isnt in St Louis LOL

Seriously, stop by.  It is in a strip mall at Thunderbird and 40th on the SW corner two doors down from the dentist.

It has been awhile since I have visited the Dubliner. The only reason I haven't frequented the place lately is because I don't live near them anymore so I can't just either walk home or call a cab for 5 min ride. However there drinks are strong and cheap! Either that or the bartender was being very friendly on the few times I have visited :) The food is not to shabby either. I mean you can't possibly mess up fish and chips. Hmm fish and chips. So go, check it out, but remember if you have too many, call a cab. Did I mention that their drinks are strong and cheap! #winwin!

I love this place for what it is: a neighborhood Irish dive. You cannot rate this place on any other scale. Yes, the furniture is old and faded. The food is not made by a top chef. One does not visit the Dubliner for an amazing sit-down meal and 5-star service; you come for light beer and shots, the live music, and the neighborhood crowd.

If you are looking for tasty great food, this is the place!  If you are looking for FANCY it is not for you. Signs of wear in the seating area, but nothing but tasty on the menu. Corned beef sliders yummy, and the wings may be the best in town. Everything is priced just right. The servers  (we had Amanda) are attentive, and personable and the drinks are great. So if you are looking for down to earth great   Home cooking with an Irish flair, you just found it.

My friend has brought me here a couple times, only on Mondays for trivia. Team Trivia is quiet entertaining, I must say. It's free to play, which is a nice bonus. If you want a good laugh, each team makes their own name up, some inappropriate, but funny though. I have ordered food, it's not bad, for bar food.

I'm 31 yrs old and I've come to the Dub since I was an 18 yr old with a good fake ID. I actually havent lived in Az in over 10 yrs, but when ever I come back to visit friends and family this is our spot. My buddies have been the local crew at this bar for over a decade. The bartenders have all worked here for years as well, and even tho i may only come in a few times a year, the bartenders always remember my face. A fun atmoshphere, plenty of room, a non-stuffy, non-scottsdale type crowd. When I'm in Az, I always visit the Dub...
I love this place.  The staff are awesome, they have live music six nights a week, and the clientele are 99% douche free.  Never tried the food, but who the hell goes to a bar to eat, anyway?
Can't believe I'm going to say authentic & Irish in the same sentence as "located in a Phx plaza" but I will. One of the best, most Irish restaurants I've ever dined at. Great entertainment as well.

Oi! The Dubliner!

Love this place. Short walk from my house, which is good after about 26 kiltlifters....

Best freaking wings I think I have ever had... like seriously, they have a magician back there. 

Fun place, good people, good vibes. Never have seen any type of problems happen here which is rare for any bar in Phoenix. 

This place has a very interesting dynamic. There are old heads and regulars and then a younger crowd. Makes for great conversations and social interactions. Bartender is cool, Dave I think. 

Don't change your ways Dubliner...

Hands down the greatest bartenders in town. Dave, Eric, and Chris are salt of the earth. The owners, Pat and John are great fellas as well and always greet me warmly. The place has always felt like my second home and family. Hell, I met my wife there and many fine friends besides.  I always have a great evening any time I can make it out. Food and entertainment always satisfy. The crowd there is generally cool and low key, and I always find good conversation with random folks on nights I roll solo.

We visited again. Open mic night is actually Sunday, not Monday. This time we ordered food. I had a philly; it was unremarkable, but it was edible. The beer was still good. 

Unfortunately, the patronage left much to be desired. We initially sat at the bar. The big guy two seats over was loudly discussing his personal information with lots of graphic details and use of the eff bomb every three or four words. After about five minutes or so of this, we decided to move to another part of the bar. I know it's a bar and after a night of drinking, conversation flows, and it's not always nice. 

As we passed a large drunk man sitting alone at the end of the bar, he confronted my bf about "walking by without speaking.". Look. We are from Kansas and this is the second time we have been here ever. Why would we speak to this man?  My bf smiled and indicated we were just there to eat. The man then confronted ME and demanded to know if I was a girlfriend or a wife. When we moved a second time to escape, this goon followed us and put his hands on my bf. I thought it was all over. My bf minds his own business, but he does not take kindly to confrontational people. The bouncer was about six feet away, but apparently this dude is a regular, so he was allowed to harass us. Bouncer did eventually call a cab, but until it arrived, this man was allowed to teeter around the bar touching people and getting into their business. 

I have no desire to return to The Dubliner after this experience. It could be a cool place, but a couple of seedy characters and the staff's inattention to their incredibly offensive behavior have spoiled it for me.

Had a bad experience here a couple months ago with a bartender. We told the owner about her, and I haven't seen her around there since. Went back last night to see authority zero play and I had a great time! The bar was literally PACKED. Wall to wall. Found a small spot at the bar and was served my drinks super quick! Glad to see that things are getting better here.

Aw, I can't vote zero stars?  The service is the worst I've ever had EVER. I asked for menus ... apparently not.  Had to go physically get a menu from behind the bar.  Asked to order and the waitress said she'd be right back.  Spent the next half hour trying to get her attention - no such luck. When I finally got to order my food, it was another half hour before I got to eat it.  I'm sorry, but when I go somewhere to eat, I'm HUNGRY and I'm not happy when I'm hungry.  Waiting over an hour to eat is just bad.

Went for a late night dinner to see The Sea Merchants perform. Had never been here before and were amazed at how packed the place was! Service was cheerful and probably could have used a little more help - not sure they were expecting the crowd they got last night, but we were enjoying the music and not too concerned with how fast service was. Had the Guinness Chicken, sweet potato fries, the Irish soda bread and washed it all down with a couple of brews. All pretty good. I'd recommend the place for a good time with friends. Relaxed, casual and fun! And the Sea Merchants performance was a rockin' good time!
Was here tonight.  It is OK!  Not much Irish things on the menu, more of a bar food type joint.  Potatoe skins were meh.  The paddy o melt was meh too.  The live music was a plus.

This place is near my house. Haven't visited it until recently but it's a nice quiet place. Golden tee is probably the second best thing they have, the first being Guinness on draft. Would definitely recommend this place if you're interested in a quiet place with good service.

When the manager's away, the staff will do absolutely nothing but try to get laid and ignore paying customers. Really sad because we've been here a lot over the last few years, and always had a good experience. 

Last night, it was like everyone got stoned and forgot they were actually working. It wasn't even busy, and we repeatedly had to track down our server to ask for drinks, food, and the check. 

It was so bad, all of the tables around us cashed out, and started going to the bar for drinks... When we followed suit, we had to actually go track down the bartender (who was busy chatting with a young blonde at the of the bar) and tell him we wanted to order drinks. He took our order, but then wandered off to go talk to the blonde again! Really???!!!

No bar anywhere in this area comes as close to pulling everything off like the "Dub".  Beer Selection, Darts, TVS, lots of seating, events, great prices and a great mix of people.  The staff is always great, and ready to serve at all times.  Come here open minded, stay for a bit, watch the crowd pour in.  Always a good time.
My fiance and I go here weekly and the service and food are amazing. Great dive and highly recommended.
Went here the other night for a couple drinks, probably one of my favorite bars i've ever been to. Great irish pub atmosphere and music
Terrible service.  Waited 45 minutes from sandwich this place had 7 people in it unbelievable.  The sheriff spent more time complaining about not having enough help instead of servicing customers.

The " Dub" as my friends refer to it as is my local Pub that i roll when i just want to have a relaxed and fun  time.  Some of my favorite parts of the pub include the live music that is offerened almost 7 days a week and the nice variety of people who enter the establishment.  Friday and Saturday like most places is the Dubliner's busiest night when it is rather busy.  There are some things that could be improved on including better drink prices and more game options.  Overall this is a fun place but not the flashest or most hip.  The crowd is not always the most attractive either. but get a couple of Blue Moons in yah and even the 63 biker chick in the corner will start to look a little better

A dude playing irish music on a fiddle in a bar in North Phoenix?  Count me in.

This is a pretty good pub-y place with your traditional attempt at irishness (stew, shepherd's pie, bangers & mash) with a few irish beers (guinness, of course, harp & smithwick's) while also having your traditional bar food.

Nothing fancy, everything is pretty straightforward.  Probably really a 3 star place, but the live entertainment adds a bonus star.

We've  had drink here a few times in the last year or so and the guinness is always just right on and service is normally pretty good.

Last night we went to Friday Night Fish Fry..... and I'm sad to say it was horrible. 1st we waited nearly an hour to get our food. My boyfriend had the Fish Fry and I had the Chicken Boxty. 2nd when our food finally arrived the fish was more fish jerky than fish fry. My Chicken Boxty was just sad.... I was given a plate of chicken gravy with a plain breakfast pancake covering it. Not a potato pancake like your traditional boxty. I picked through the pancake trying to find some potato and couldn't find any.  Needless to say I more or less had side of broccoli for dinner.

Unfortunately it is unlikely we will return after this.

Went here on a Saturday night; the place was pretty busy. We ordered food around 9pm so the kitchen stays open late so that is a plus. We got a burger and sweet potato fries - both very good. Try the sweet pototo fries with the plum sauce - yummy!
Drinks were reasonably priced and the wait staff was friendly and prompt. No complaints from me. 
They had a bad playing too that was good, but it was rock. I sort of expected an irish type band to be playing especially on a weekend night. The band was still good though, don't get me wrong.
Great place to grab a beer and listen to some music. The prices are great and the staff is friendly. Low key and and relaxed environment.

Irish beef stew, shepherd pie, sausage rolls, and the bread pudding were all excellent and worth the price. Everyone in the group was very happy with their selection. It was lunchtime on NYE - there were plenty of people there to put up decorations for this evening, but they only had one person there working as a server (not sure how many were working the kitchen). It took quite a while for us to get our food, and even then, only two of the four of us got food at first, and then it took a while for the other two to receive their food. A drink that was ordered early on in the meal wasn't brought out until after the check had been paid. I believe our server was doing the best she could with the other tables she had but it is unfortunate that they weren't properly staffed to make it a 5 star experience for our first time dining at The Dubliner.

What a fun place to hang out! I was visiting my friend in the area and this was a fun place to go on Saint Patrick's day. There are specials were kind of pricey like $10 for a green tea shot which tasted just like a Tokyo Iced Tea and was too sweet.  I got a Moscow Mule in the copper mug and I thought it was adorable how my friend got a beer with a Guinness shot on the side in a little plastic shot glass that hung on it! They have Skee ball here and a Photo Booth! It's a very spacious area with a very fun crowd.

Hit or miss. Went in for drinks one Friday night, found 2 spots open at the bar, had great service, proper Guinness, and then enjoyed some fried pickles. The live music was great and the vibe was fun and vibrant  

Went in two weeks later with intent of eating dinner, found two seats at the bar, were ignored for nearly 7 minutes (the 7 minutes before happy hour ended) while the server seemed to pretend to count her drawer, then  had to ask if we could get an order in before happy hour ended. With a sigh, she said yes, we ordered two pints of Guinness, one Jameson and the fried pickles. 10 minutes later, we had nothing in front of us. I appreciate when a bar takes the proper time with guinness, but this was ridiculous. 

Usually the last few minutes before happy hour ends, the bartenders do a great job of making the rounds to make sure everyone is taken care of. Not the case at The Dubliner this night. No staff to be found anywhere. Although I could see our two pints of Guinness sitting there on the other side of the bar. Finished. Ready.  Wanting to be delivered. And when I asked the only staff in sight, she said oh yeah they're going to grab them now, I saw someone grab them, move them about two inches to the right and set them back down. Then everyone vanished again for about 4-5 more minutes. 

It wasn't just is, it was everyone at the bar who was sharing the feeling of being ignored. 

Finally, someone grabbed the pints and delivered then with the Jameson and dropped the fried pickles off soon after. Just in time, too, as we were just about to walk. 

Wish we had. The pickles were NOTHING like our previous visit, they were barely cooked and swimming in a pool of oil. Inedible. We mentioned it to the bartender, who didn't offer any apologies, all she said was that you never know what you're gonna get, it depends on who is working the fryer that night. Wow. 

With that, we gulped our drinks, paid the tab, and left. They clearly didn't want our business that night. 

Usually when I have a 50/50 experience somewhere, I'll go back for a tie breaker, but it may be a while before we make it back around to The Dubliner for the deciding vote.

This is a good home town watering hole. Great mellow/casual atmosphere to meet and hangout with friends. My friends and I have been going here as long as I can remember. The bar staff has largely remained the same for years; get to know em' and you'll know them for a long time. This is a pub of pubs. If you are looking for a "home" bar.. this is the place for you.
Dive bar, live music, friendly servers, lots of regulars. They have Irish bar food that's decent, but don't go in expecting a great meal.
Always awesome service always different people to chat with, always great food. Many of the staff have been here. Long time and they remember you, feels good to hang here.
Bobby is a very rude server. She has no personality considering she works at the bar. Food is very dry and takes a while.
Fogo the bartender here was very conversational and provided excellent service. Will definitely come here again!

Use to be awesome...male bartenders that change your juke box entries is bs.. Our server Crystal was awesome..food was okay minus the old grease. I use to come here all the time but stopped because of the smell and bad service from male bartenders. Miss the beautiful women that use to take care of us. Pretty sad being Irish and these young fockers mess it up. No wonder people complain about it. Unbelievable! Just because Chris doesn't like certain music doesn't give him the right to cancel customers music. Stay away! Bullshit!

This place is OK. I have never eaten there but have been to drink many times.  It's a pretty big place.  There's a good mix of people and age groups and seems like a lot of people take dates here.  The security staff here are kinda douche bags. 

The worst part about this bar though is the fights. There is always fighting here. A fight here and there can be entertaining but its old and annoying when there is a fight every single time I go.

I come here in the afternoon when there is not a crowd. A good friend lives close by and she loves the fried pickles (which are quite yummy), so it's our meeting place of choice. They have my favorite cheap Irish whiskey, tullemore dew. We can always get a booth. The wait staff is attentive. I'll come back!

Place is cool to come and relax and forget about the outside.. No rush just a nice chill atmosphere, kinda slow but the crowd and price are good. If you are in a rush I would suggest Taco Bell. Almost all nights here there is a large crowd and some decent dart players.

So normally I like this place and the corned beef and cabbage have been quite good... but, on this occasion, the chef was clearly not irish or familar with irish food & culture, because the dish was dreadful. How to you ruin corened beef a...nd cabbage?? The urge to tell them how to make it was a compelling one. 

I'll go back because it's been decent in the past, and the beer flows freely and good, usually with good company, but, I'm thinking it's a one more chance kind of thing. Sadly, there are few places in phoenix that claim to be 'irish' that serve authentic quality irish food. I think if your going to cook food of another culture, you should at least learn how it's properly prepared and served.

I have gone to this place two times now and have never had such bad service in any establishment. Worst place to come to and the music venue really sucks and doesn't match atmosphere. You are better off going to a chain restaurant than here. And on top of bad service, the food sucks.

Dropped in recently to grab a pint and try their bar food. I have to say that their wings were great. The bartender made me feel like I was a regular patron. The place was packed but the regulars made room at the bar for me to sit and engaged me in conversation. I felt really welcomed. It's a great pub.

I've never seen better service than what I was introduced with tonight. Busy, but my glass was never half full. Everyone so attentive. Kayla, Chris, and Krista the star of the show oh my goodness, were great in every aspect of the hospitality industry. Definitely making frequent visits!
